Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(1)(c): (1)(a); (b) file the documents described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(2): A life and accident and health insurer's RBC shall be determined in accordance with the formula set forth in the RBC instructions.  The formula shall take into account and may adjust for the covariance between:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(2)(a): the risk with respect to the insurer's assets;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(2)(b): the risk of adverse insurance experience with respect to the insurer's liabilities and obligations;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(2)(c): the interest rate risk with respect to the insurer's business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(2)(d): all other business risks and other relevant risks as set forth in the RBC instructions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(3): A property and casualty insurer's RBC shall be determined in accordance with the formula set forth in the RBC instructions.  The formula shall take the following into account and may adjust for the covariance between:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(3)(a): asset risk;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(3)(b): credit risk;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(3)(c): underwriting risk; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(3)(d): all other business risks and the other relevant risks as set forth in the RBC instructions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(4): A health organization's RBC shall be determined in accordance with the formula set forth in the RBC instructions.  The formula shall take the following into account and may adjust for the covariance between:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(4)(a): asset risk;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(4)(b): credit risk;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(4)(c): underwriting risk; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(4)(d): all other business risks and such other relevant risks as are set forth in the RBC instructions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-602(5)(a): If a domestic insurer files an RBC report that the commissioner determines is inaccurate, the commissioner shall adjust the RBC report to correct the inaccuracy and shall notify the insurer of the adjustment.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-608 Confidentiality -- Prohibition on announcements -- Prohibition on use in ratemaking.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-608(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-608(1)(a): The commissioner shall keep confidential to the extent that information in a report or plan is not required to be included in a publicly available annual statement schedule, any detail in an RBC report or RBC plan including the results or report of any examination or analysis of an insurer or health organization performed pursuant to this part, that is filed by a domestic or foreign insurer or health organization with the commissioner or any corrective order issued by the commissioner pursuant to examination or analysis.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-608(1)(b): (1)(a) Information kept confidential under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-608(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-608(2)(a): Except as otherwise required under this part, any insurer or health organization, producer, or other person engaged in any manner in the insurance business may not publish, disseminate, circulate or place before the public, or cause, directly or indirectly, the publishing, disseminating, circulating or placing before the public including, in a newspaper, magazine, other publication, a notice, circular, pamphlet, letter, or poster, or over any radio or television station, an advertisement, announcement, or statement containing an assertion, representation, or statement with regard to the RBC levels of any insurer or health organization, or of any component derived in the calculation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-608(2)(b): If any materially false statement with respect to the comparison regarding an insurer's or health organization's total adjusted capital to its RBC levels, or an inappropriate comparison of any other amount to the insurer's or health organization's RBC levels is published in any written publication and the insurer or health organization is able to demonstrate to the commissioner with substantial proof the falsity of the statement or the inappropriateness, the insurer or health organization may publish an announcement in a written publication if the sole purpose of the announcement is to rebut the materially false statement or inappropriate comparison.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-608(3): The commissioner may not use an RBC instruction, report, plan, or revised plan:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-608(3)(a): for ratemaking;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-608(3)(b): as evidence in any rate proceeding; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-608(3)(c): to calculate or derive any element of an appropriate premium level or rate of return for any line of insurance or coverage that an insurer or health organization or any affiliate is authorized to write or cover.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610 Foreign insurers or health organizations.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(1)(a): Any foreign insurer or health organization shall, upon the written request of the commissioner, submit to the commissioner an RBC report as of the end of the most recent calendar year by the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(1)(a)(i): the date an RBC report would be required to be filed by a domestic insurer or health organization under this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(1)(a)(ii): 15 days after the request is received by the foreign insurer or health organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(1)(b): Any foreign insurer or health organization shall, at the written request of the commissioner, promptly submit to the commissioner a copy of any RBC plan that is filed with the insurance commissioner of any other state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(2): 31A-17-603
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(2)(a): 31A-17-603 The commissioner may require a foreign insurer or health organization to file an RBC plan with the commissioner if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(2)(a)(i): there is a company action level event, regulatory action level event, or authorized control level event with respect to the foreign insurer or health organization as determined under:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(2)(a)(i)(A): the RBC statute applicable in the state of domicile of the insurer or health organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(2)(a)(i)(B): if no RBC statute is in force in that state, under this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(2)(a)(ii): 31A-17-603 the insurance commissioner of the state of domicile of the foreign insurer or health organization fails to require the foreign insurer or health organization to file an RBC plan in the manner specified under:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(2)(a)(ii)(A): that state's RBC statute; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(2)(a)(ii)(B): 31A-17-603 if no RBC statute is in force in that state, under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(2)(b): If the commissioner requires a foreign insurer or health organization to file an RBC plan, the failure of the foreign insurer or health organization to file the RBC plan with the commissioner is grounds to order the insurer or health organization to cease and desist from writing new insurance business in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(3): 31A-27a-901 The commissioner may petition a court as permitted under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-610(3)(a): a mandatory control level event occurs with respect to any foreign insurer or health organization; and

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-611 Immunity.
------------------------------------------
There may be no liability on the part of, and no cause of action may arise against, the commissioner or the insurance department or its employees or agents for any action taken by them in the performance of their powers and duties under this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-612 Severability clause.
-----------------------------------------------------
If any provision of this part, or the application of the part to any person or circumstance, is held invalid, the determination may not affect the provisions or applications of this part that can be given effect without the invalid provision or application, and to that end the provisions of this part are severable.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-613 Effective date of notice.
----------------------------------------------------------
A notice by the commissioner to an insurer or health organization that may result in regulatory action under this chapter is effective the sooner of:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-613(1): the date the insurer or health organization receives the notice; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-17-613(2): three days after mailing the notice.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-18-103 Protection against currency fluctuations.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any insurer whose business requires it to make payment in different currencies may have investments in securities in each of those currencies in an amount that, independently of all other investments, meets the requirements of the Insurance Code as applied separately to the insurer's obligations in each currency.   The commissioner may by order require an insurer, or by rule require a class of insurers, to maintain these separate currency investments if the obligations in other currencies are large enough to present a problem of financial stability if there are substantial fluctuations in relative currency values.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-18-110 Investment valuation reserves.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-18-110(1): The commissioner may by rule, applicable to all or any specified classes of insurers, provide for the establishment, in reasonable amounts, of investment valuation reserves that are necessary to lessen the impact on surplus of the fluctuation of the values of specific classes of assets.  In formulating these rules, the commissioner shall consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-18-110(1)(a): similar rules used in other states or recommended for use by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-18-110(1)(b): the propensities of the various types and classes of investments to fluctuate in value; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-18-110(1)(c): the present and anticipated investment climate, as measured by economic indicators such as interest rates, price-level changes, market volatility, and economic growth or decline.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-18-110(2): The commissioner may by order require an individual insurer to establish investment valuation reserves in addition to those required for other insurers of the class to which the insurer belongs, to the extent that the financial condition of the insurer and the nature of its assets and liabilities or business require that those reserves be established to adequately protect its insureds.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-101(3): It is the purpose of this chapter to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-101(3)(a): protect policyholders and the public against the adverse effects of excessive, inadequate, or unfairly discriminatory rates;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-101(3)(b): encourage independent action by and reasonable price competition among insurers so that rates are responsive to competitive market conditions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-101(3)(c): provide formal regulatory controls for use if independent action and price competition fail;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-101(3)(d): provide regulatory procedures for the maintenance of appropriate data reporting systems;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-101(3)(e): authorize cooperative action among insurers in the rate-making process, and regulate that cooperation to prevent practices that bring about a monopoly or lessen or destroy competition;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-101(3)(f): encourage the most efficient and economic marketing practices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-101(3)(g): regulate the business of insurance in a manner that, under the McCarran-Ferguson Act, 15 U.S.C. Secs. 1011 through 1015, will preclude application of federal antitrust laws.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-101(4): Rate filings made prior to July 1, 1986, under former


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(1): "Classification system" or "classification" means the process of grouping risks with similar risk characteristics so that differences in anticipated costs may be recognized.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(2)(a): "Developed losses" means losses adjusted using standard actuarial techniques to eliminate the effect of differences between:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(2)(a)(i): current payment or reserve estimates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(2)(a)(ii): payments or reserve estimates that are anticipated to provide actual ultimate loss payments.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(2)(b): (2)(a) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(3): "Dividend" means money paid to a policyholder from the remaining portion of the premium paid for a policy:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(3)(a): based on the participating class of business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(3)(b): after the insurer has made deductions for:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(3)(b)(i): losses;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(3)(b)(ii): expenses;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(3)(b)(iii): additions to reserves; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(3)(b)(iv): profit and contingencies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(4): "Expenses" means that portion of a rate attributable to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(4)(a): acquisition;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(4)(b): field supervision;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(4)(c): collection expenses;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(4)(d): general expenses;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(4)(e): taxes;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(4)(f): licenses; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(4)(g): fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(5): "Experience rating" means a rating procedure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(5)(a): uses the past insurance experience of an individual policyholder to forecast the future losses of the policyholder by measuring the policyholder's loss experience against the loss experience of policyholders in the same classification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(5)(b): produces a prospective premium credit, debit, or unity modification.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(6): "Joint underwriting" means a voluntary arrangement established to provide insurance coverage for a risk pursuant to which two or more insurers jointly contract with the insured at a price and under policy terms agreed upon between the insurers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(7): "Loss adjustment expense" means the expenses incurred by the insurer in the course of settling claims.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(8)(a): "Market" means the interaction between buyers and sellers consisting of a:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(8)(a)(i): product component; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(8)(a)(ii): geographic component.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(8)(b): A product component consists of identical or readily substitutable products if the products are compared as to factors including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(8)(b)(i): coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(8)(b)(ii): policy terms;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(8)(b)(iii): rate classifications; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(8)(b)(iv): underwriting.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(8)(c): A geographic component is a geographical area in which buyers seek access to the insurance product through sales outlets and other distribution mechanisms or patterns.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(9): (8)(a)(i); (ii) "Mass marketed plan" means a method of selling insurance when:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(9)(a): (8)(a)(i); (ii) the insurance is offered to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(9)(a)(i): employees of a particular employer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(9)(a)(ii): members of a particular association or organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(9)(a)(iii): (8)(a)(i); (ii) persons grouped in a manner other than described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(9)(b): the employer, association, or other organization, if any, has agreed to, or otherwise affiliated itself with, the sale of insurance to its employees or members.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(10): "Prospective loss costs" means the same as pure premium rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(11): "Pure premium rate" means that portion of a rate that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(11)(a): does not include provisions for profit or expenses, other than loss adjustment expenses; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(11)(b): is based on historical aggregate losses and loss adjustment expenses that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(11)(b)(i): adjusted through development to their ultimate value; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(11)(b)(ii): projected through trending to a future point in time.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(12): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(12)(a): "Rate" means that cost of insurance per exposure unit either expressed as:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(12)(a)(i): a single number; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(12)(a)(ii): as a pure premium rate, adjusted before any application of individual risk variations, based on loss or expense considerations to account for the treatment of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(12)(a)(ii)(A): expenses;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(12)(a)(ii)(B): profit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(12)(a)(ii)(C): individual insurer variation in loss experience.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(12)(b): "Rate" does not include a minimum premium.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(13): "Rating tiers" means an underwriting and rating plan designed to categorize insurance risks that have common characteristics related to potential insurance loss into broad groups for the purpose of establishing a set of rating levels that reflect definable levels of potential hazard or risk.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(14): "Riskiness" means the variability of results around the average expected result.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(15): "Supplementary rate information" includes one or more of the following needed to determine the applicable rate in effect or to be in effect:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(15)(a): a manual or plan of rates;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(15)(b): a statistical plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(15)(c): a classification;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(15)(d): a rating schedule;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(15)(e): a minimum premium;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(15)(f): a policy fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(15)(g): a rating rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(15)(h): a rate-related underwriting rule;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(15)(i): a rate modification plan; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(15)(j): any other similar information prescribed by rule of the commissioner as supplementary rate information.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(16): "Supporting information" includes one or more of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(16)(a): data demonstrating actuarial justification for the basic rate factors, classifications, expenses, and profit factors used by the filer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(16)(b): the experience and judgment of the filer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(16)(c): the experience or data of other insurers or rate service organizations relied upon by the filer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(16)(d): the interpretation of any other data relied upon by the filer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(16)(e): descriptions of methods used in making the rates; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(16)(f): any other information defined by rule as supporting information that is required to be filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(17): "Trending" means any procedure for projecting, for the period during which the policies are to be effective:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(17)(a): losses to the average date of loss; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-102(17)(b): premiums or exposures to the average date of writing.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201 Rate standards.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(1): Rates may not be excessive, inadequate, or unfairly discriminatory.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(a): Rates are not excessive if a reasonable degree of price competition exists at the consumer level with respect to the class of business to which they apply.  In determining whether a reasonable degree of price competition exists, the commissioner shall consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(a)(i): relevant tests of workable competition pertaining to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(a)(i)(A): market structure;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(a)(i)(B): market performance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(a)(i)(C): market conduct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(a)(ii): the practical opportunities  available to consumers in the market to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(a)(ii)(A): acquire pricing and other consumer information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(a)(ii)(B): compare and obtain insurance from competing insurers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(b): (2)(a) The tests described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(b)(i): the size and number of insurers actively engaged in the market and class of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(b)(ii): the market shares of insurers actively engaged in the market and changes in market shares;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(b)(iii): the existence of rate differentials in that class of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(b)(iv): ease of entry and latent competition of insurers capable of easy entry;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(b)(v): availability of consumer information concerning the product and sales outlets or other sales mechanisms; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(b)(vi): efforts of insurers to provide consumer information.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(c): If reasonable price competition does not exist, rates are excessive if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(c)(i): rates are likely to produce a long-term profit that is unreasonably high in relation to the riskiness of the class of business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(2)(c)(ii): expenses are unreasonably high in relation to the services rendered.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(3): Rates are inadequate if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(3)(a): they are clearly insufficient, when combined with the investment income attributable to them, to sustain the projected losses and expenses in the class of business to which they apply; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(3)(b): the use of such rates has or, if continued, will have:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(3)(b)(i): the effect of substantially lessening competition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(3)(b)(ii): the tendency to create a monopoly in any market.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(4)(a): A rate is unfairly discriminatory if price differentials fail to equitably reflect the differences in expected losses and expenses after allowing for practical limitations.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(4)(b): A rate is not unfairly discriminatory if it is averaged broadly among persons insured under a:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(4)(b)(i): group, franchise, or blanket policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-201(4)(b)(ii): mass marketed plan.

-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(1): 31A-19a-201; (2); (3); (4); (5) To determine whether rates comply with the standards under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(1)(a): (2) criteria listed in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(1)(c): (4) expenses described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(2): In determining rates the commissioner shall consider within and outside of Utah:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(2)(a): past and prospective loss experience;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(2)(b): catastrophe hazards;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(2)(c): trends;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(2)(d): loadings for leveling premium rates over time;

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(2)(f): dividends, savings, or unabsorbed premium deposits allowed or returned by insurers to their policyholders; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(2)(g): other relevant factors.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(3): (3)(b)(i); (3)(b)

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(3)(b): (3)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(3)(b)(i): A classification rate may be modified to produce rates for individual risks in accordance with rating plans or schedules that establish reasonable standards for measuring probable variations in hazards or expense provisions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(i) The standards described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(3)(c): (3)(b) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(4): The expense provisions included in the rates to be used by an insurer shall reflect:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(4)(a): the operating methods of the insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(4)(b): its anticipated expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-202(5): The rates may contain provision for contingencies and an allowance permitting a profit that is not unreasonable in relation to the riskiness of the class of business.  In determining the reasonableness of the profit, consideration may be given to investment income.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203 Rate filings.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1): 31A-19a-301; 31A-19a-205; 31A-19a-205; 31A-19a-405; 31A-19a-406

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(a)(ii): all supplementary information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(a)(iii): all changes and amendments to rates and supplementary information.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(b): 31A-19a-205 An insurer shall file its rates by filing:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(b)(i): its final rates; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(b)(ii): 31A-19a-205 either of the following to be applied to pure premium rates that have been filed by a rate service organization on behalf of the insurer as permitted by Section

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(b)(ii)(B): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(b)(ii)(B)(I): a multiplier; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(b)(ii)(B)(II): an expense constant adjustment.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(c): Every filing under this Subsection (1) shall state:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(c)(i): the effective date of the rates; and

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(e): A rate filing is considered filed when it has been received pursuant to procedures established by the commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(1)(f): The commissioner may by rule prescribe procedures for submitting rate filings by electronic means.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(2): 31A-19a-201
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(2)(a): 31A-19a-201 To show compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(2)(b): If the rate filing provides for a modification or revision of a previously filed rate, the insurer is required to file only the supporting information that supports the modification or revision.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(2)(c): If the commissioner determines that the insurer did not file sufficient supporting information, the commissioner shall inform the insurer in writing of the lack of sufficient supporting information.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(2)(d): If the insurer does not provide the necessary supporting information within 45 calendar days of the date on which the commissioner mailed notice under Subsection (2)(c), the rate filing may be:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(2)(d)(i): considered incomplete and unfiled; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(2)(d)(ii): returned to the insurer as:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(2)(d)(ii)(A): not filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(2)(d)(ii)(B): not available for use.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(2)(e): Notwithstanding Subsection (2)(d), the commissioner may extend the time period for filing supporting information.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(2)(f): If a rate filing is returned to an insurer as not filed and not available for use under Subsection (2)(d), the insurer may not use the rate filing for any policy issued or renewed on or after 60 calendar days from the date the rate filing was returned.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(3): At the request of the commissioner, an insurer using the services of a rate service organization shall provide a description of the rationale for using the services of the rate service organization, including the insurer's:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(3)(a): own information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(3)(b): method of use of the rate service organization's information.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(4)(a): An insurer may not make or issue a contract or policy except in accordance with the rate filings that are in effect for the insurer as provided in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(4)(b): Subsection (4)(a) does not apply to contracts or policies for inland marine risks for which filings are not required.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(5): Subsection (1) does not apply to inland marine risks, which, by general custom, are not written according to standardized manual rules or rating plans.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(6)(a): The insurer may file a written application, stating the insurer's reasons for using a higher rate than that otherwise applicable to a specific risk.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(6)(b): If the application described in Subsection (6)(a) is filed with and not disapproved by the commissioner within 10 days after filing, the higher rate may be applied to the specific risk.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(6)(c): The rate described in this Subsection (6) may be disapproved without a hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(6)(d): If disapproved, the rate otherwise applicable applies from the effective date of the policy, but the insurer may cancel the policy pro rata on 10 days' notice to the policyholder.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-203(6)(e): If the insurer does not cancel the policy under Subsection (6)(d), the insurer shall refund any excess premium from the effective date of the policy.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-214 Rating tiers.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-214(1): An insurer may file with the commissioner a rate filing that provides for a program with more than one rate level in the same company or group of companies if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-214(1)(a): the program is based, to the extent feasible, upon mutually exclusive underwriting rules per tier;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-214(1)(b): the underwriting rules are based on clear, objective criteria that would lead to a logical distinguishing of potential risk; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-214(1)(c): in filing to establish tiers, the insurer provides supporting information that evidences a clear distinction between the expected losses and expenses for each tier.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-214(2): A rating tier may not be continued if premium, loss, and expense data fail to show a continued clear distinction between the tiers.

------------------------------------------------------------------
A person or organization may not:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-215(1): willfully withhold from the commissioner, any rate service organization, or any insurer information that will affect the rates or premiums chargeable under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-215(2): knowingly give false or misleading information to the commissioner, any rate service organization, or any insurer.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-401 Scope of part.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-401(1): This part applies to workers' compensation insurance and employers' liability insurance written in connection with workers' compensation insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-401(2): An insurer writing workers' compensation coverage is subject to this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-402 Purpose.
------------------------------------------
It is the purpose of this part to:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-402(1): Part 2, General Rate Regulation establish specific provisions for the filing of workers' compensation rates in addition to those provided in
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-402(2): provide for review by the department of workers' compensation rate-making and the results of it; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-402(3): provide for a designated rate service organization to perform certain functions on behalf of the commissioner.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-403 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-403(1): 31A-19a-102 "Uniform classification plan," in addition to the definition of "classification system" in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-403(1)(a): that is consistent between all insurers of classification codes and descriptions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-403(1)(b): by which like workers' compensation exposures are grouped for the purposes of underwriting, rating, and statistical reporting.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-403(2): "Uniform experience rating plan" means a plan that is consistent between all insurers for experience rating entities insured for workers' compensation insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-19a-403(3): "Uniform statistical plan" means a plan that is consistent between all insurers that is used for the reporting of workers' compensation insurance statistical data.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-101 Underwriting limitations.
----------------------------------------------------------
No insurer may insure or attempt to insure against:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-101(1): a wager or gaming risk;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-101(2): loss of an election;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-101(3): the penal consequences of a crime; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-101(4): punitive damages.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-104 Combinations of policies.
----------------------------------------------------------
Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, the commissioner may by rule establish standards for the combination of different coverages in policies and may specify whether premiums shall be separately stated for each.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-106 Variable contracts.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-106(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-106(1)(a): An insurer may not deliver or issue for delivery within this state an insurance policy that provides a life or annuity benefit in a variable amount until the insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-106(1)(a)(i): is licensed to do a life insurance or annuity business in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-106(1)(a)(ii): satisfies the commissioner that the insurer's condition and methods of operation in connection with those types of insurance policies do not render the insurer's operation hazardous to the public or its policyholders in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-106(1)(b): Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the commissioner has sole authority to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-106(1)(b)(i): regulate the issuance and sale of a variable contract; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-106(1)(b)(ii): make rules necessary and appropriate to carry out this chapter in relation to a variable contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-106(2): (1) In determining the qualification of an insurer requesting authority to deliver an insurance policy described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-106(2)(a): the history and financial condition of the insurer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-106(2)(b): the character, responsibility, and general fitness of the insurer's officers and directors; and

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-109 Single risk limitation for title insurance.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-109(1)(a): 31A-17-404 "Net retained liability" means the total potential liability retained by a title insurer for a single risk, after deducting liability reinsured for which credit may be taken under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-109(2): The net retained liability of a title insurer for a single risk, whether assumed directly or as reinsurance, may not exceed 50% of the capital and surplus of the insurer.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-110 Underwriting rules for title insurance.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-110(1): A title insurance policy may not be written until the title insurer or its individual title insurance producer or agency title insurance producer has conducted a reasonable examination of the title and has made a determination of insurability of title under sound underwriting principles.  Evidence of this examination and reasonable determination shall be retained in the files of the title insurer or its individual title insurance producer or agency title insurance producer for not less than 15 years after the policy has been issued, either in its original form or as recorded by any process which can accurately and reliably reproduce the original.  This section does not apply to a company assuming liability through a contract of reinsurance, or to a company acting as coinsurer, if another coinsuring company has complied with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-110(2): 31A-23a-105 A title insurance policy may not be issued except by a title insurer, an individual title insurance producer who is appointed by an insurer, or agency title insurance producer licensed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-20-110(3): This section is enforceable only by the commissioner.  It does not create, eliminate, or modify any private cause of action or remedy.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-102 Oral contracts of insurance and binders.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-102(1): "Binder" means a writing which describes the subject and amount of insurance and temporarily binds insurance coverage pending the issuance of an insurance policy.  "Binder" does not include conditional receipts by life insurance companies under which issuance of the policy or coverage under the policy is contingent upon the acceptability of the risk to the insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-102(2): Binding oral contracts of insurance may only be made as to casualty insurance, liability insurance, property insurance, vehicle liability insurance, workers' compensation insurance, and as to combinations of these coverages.  The insurer shall issue a policy or binder as soon as reasonably possible after negotiation of any oral contract under this subsection.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-102(3): No binder is valid beyond the issuance of the policy as to which the binder was given, or beyond 150 days from the binder's effective date, whichever occurs first.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-102(4): If a policy has not been issued as to a binder, the binder may be extended or renewed beyond 150 days, but only upon the commissioner's written approval, or under rules adopted by the commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-102(5): 31A-21-303 A binder may be cancelled by the insurer prior to its expiration date only in the same manner as and subject to the same restrictions that apply to insurance policies under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-105 Representations, warranties, and conditions.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-105(1): (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-105(1)(a): No statement, representation, or warranty made by any person representing the insurer in the negotiation for an individual or franchise insurance contract affects the insurer's obligations under the policy unless it is stated in the policy or in a written application signed by the applicant.  No person, except the applicant or another by his written consent, may alter the application, except for administrative purposes in a way which is clearly not ascribable to the applicant.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-105(1)(b): No statement, representation, or warranty made by or on behalf of a particular certificate holder under a group policy affects the insurer's obligations under the certificate unless it is stated in the certificate or in a written document signed by the certificate holder, and a copy of it is supplied to the certificate holder.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-105(1)(c): (1)(b) The policyholder, his assignee, the loss payee or mortgagee or lienholder under property insurance, and any person whose life or health is insured under a policy may request, in writing, from the company a copy of the application, if he did not receive the policy or a copy of it, or if the policy has been reinstated or renewed without the attachment of a copy of the original application.  If the insurer does not deliver or mail a copy as requested within 30 days after receipt of the request by the insurer or its agent, or in the case of a group policy certificate holder, does not inform that person within the same period how he may inspect the policy or a copy of it and application or enrollment card or a copy of it during normal business hours at a place reasonably convenient to the certificate holder, nothing in the application or enrollment card affects the insurer's obligations under the policy to the person making the request.  Each person whose life or health is insured under a group policy has the same right to request a copy of any document under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-105(2)(b): the fact misrepresented or falsely warranted contributes to the loss.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-105(3): (3) No failure of a condition prior to the loss and no breach of a promissory warranty affects the insurer's obligations under the policy unless it exists at the time of the loss and either increases the risk at the time of the loss or contributes to the loss.  This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-105(4): Nondisclosure of information not requested by the insurer is not a defense to an action against the insurer.  Failure to correct within a reasonable time any representation that becomes incorrect because of changes in circumstances is misrepresentation, not nondisclosure.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-105(5): (5) If after issuance of a policy the insurer acquires knowledge of sufficient facts to constitute a general defense to all claims under the policy, the defense is only available if the insurer notifies the insured within 60 days after acquiring the knowledge of its intention to defend against a claim if one should arise, or within 120 days if the insurer considers it necessary to secure additional medical information and is actively seeking the information at the end of the 60 days. The insurer and insured may mutually agree to a policy rider in order to continue the policy in force with exceptions or modifications.  For purposes of this Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-107 Contract rights under noncomplying policies.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-107(1): Except as otherwise specifically provided by this title, a policy is enforceable against the insurer according to its terms, even if it exceeds the authority of the insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-107(2): Any insurance policy, rider, or endorsement issued after July 1, 1986, and which is otherwise valid, which contains any condition or provision not in compliance with the requirements of this title, is not rendered invalid by this title.   However, those conditions and provisions shall be construed and applied as if the policy, rider, or endorsement was in full compliance with this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-107(3): 31A-21-102 Upon written request of the policyholder or an insured whose rights under the policy are continuing and not transitory, an insurer shall reform and reissue or amend by a clearly stated rider its written policy to comply with the requirements of the law existing at the date of issuance of the policy.  Subject to this section and Section


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-108 Subrogation actions.
-----------------------------------------------------
Subrogation actions may be brought by the insurer in the name of its insured.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-109(1)(b)(ii): fortuitous condition such as sickness.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-111 Insurers to follow terms of policy.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless otherwise provided by this title, an insurer shall follow the terms of an insurance policy issued or assumed by the insurer.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-112 Language other than English.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-112(1): An insurer may conduct a transaction in a language other than English through an employee or agent acting as interpreter or through an interpreter provided by the customer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-112(2): An insurer may provide a customer an insurance policy, endorsement, rider, or explanatory or advertising material in a language other than English.  If there is a dispute or complaint regarding the insurance policy, endorsement, rider, or explanatory or advertising material, the English language version of the insurance coverage shall control the resolution of the dispute or complaint.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-112(3): A non-English language policy delivered or issued for delivery in this state is considered to be in compliance with this title if the insurer certifies that the policy is translated from an English language policy that complies with this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-112(4): If an insurance policy, endorsement, or rider is provided in a language other than English, it shall be accompanied by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-112(4)(a): the corresponding English language version; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-112(4)(b): a disclaimer in both English and the other language that states that the foreign language version is provided only as an accommodation or courtesy to the customer and the English language version shall control the resolution of any dispute or complaint.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-203 Authorized clauses for insurance forms.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-203(1): The commissioner may not adopt mandatory uniform clauses. However, the commissioner may adopt authorized clauses by rule upon a finding that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-203(1)(a): price or coverage competition is ineffective because diversity in language or content makes comparison difficult;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-203(1)(b): provision of language, content, or form of specific clauses is necessary to provide certainty of meaning to those clauses;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-203(1)(c): regulation of policy forms would be more effective or litigation would be substantially reduced if there were increased standardization of certain clauses; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-203(1)(d): reasonable minimum standards of insurance protection are needed for policies to serve a useful purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-203(2): 31A-21-201; 31A-21-201 Any rule creating an authorized clause may prescribe that to be treated as an authorized clause there shall be verbatim or substantial adherence to prescribed language, that certain standards or criteria shall be met, or that certain drafting principles shall be followed.  The rules may also permit liberalization of prescribed language.  A rule may prescribe verbatim adherence only after the commissioner has made a finding that substantial adherence to the prescribed language is not sufficient and that liberalization of prescribed language will frustrate the purposes of the prescription.  If an insurer uses authorized clauses as part of filed forms, the commissioner may only disapprove those clauses under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-302 Premiums.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-302(1): 31A-21-310; 31A-21-106(1); (1) Subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-302(2): Chapter 23a, Insurance Marketing - Licensing Producers, Consultants, and Reinsurance Intermediaries; (1) Except as provided in
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-302(3): No person may knowingly collect any excessive amount as a premium or any amount for insurance which is not in the course of processing.  Any amount unknowingly collected shall be returned immediately on learning of the mistake.  Prepayment of premiums pursuant to the policy is not an excessive collection.  Insurance is in the course of processing if an application has been made for it which is being considered by the insurer, even though it has not yet been accepted or rejected.

-----------------------------------------------------------------
Whether or not SectionUtah Code Annotated § 31A-21-304(1): 31A-21-305 Section

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-305 Cancellation upon request of a premium finance company.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-305(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-305(1)(a): "Insurance premium finance company" means a person engaged in the business of entering into premium finance agreements.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-305(1)(b): "Premium finance agreement" means an agreement by which an insured or prospective insured promises to pay to an insurance premium finance company the amount advanced or to be advanced under the agreement to an insurer or to an insurance producer in payment of premiums on an insurance policy, together with a service charge, an interest charge, or both.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-305(2): When a premium finance agreement contains a power of attorney or other authority enabling the insurance premium finance company to cancel any insurance policy listed in the agreement, the following applies:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-305(2)(a): Not less than 10 days' written notice of the intent of the insurance premium finance company to order cancellation of the insurance policy, unless the policyholder's default is cured prior to the date stated in the notice, shall be delivered or mailed first-class to the policyholder.  The insurance producer indicated on the premium finance agreement shall also be given the same notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-305(2)(b): Pursuant to the power of attorney or other authority, evidence of which is delivered to the insurer, the insurance premium finance company may order cancellation on behalf of the insured.  This cancellation shall be effected by mailing to the insurer a written notice stating when the cancellation is effective.  The insurance policy shall be cancelled as if the notice of cancellation had been given by the insured, but without requiring the return of the insurance policy.  The insurance premium finance company shall also send a copy of the same notice to the insured at his last known address and to the insurance producer indicated on the premium finance agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-305(2)(c): Where statutory, rule, or contractual restrictions provide that the insurance policy may not be cancelled unless notice is given to a governmental agency, mortgagee, or other third party, the insurer shall give the prescribed notice on behalf of itself or the insured to that governmental agency, mortgagee, or other third party within a reasonable time after the day it receives the notice of cancellation from the premium finance company.  When any statutory, rule, or contractual restrictions require the continuation of insurance beyond the effective date of cancellation specified by the premium finance company, the insurance is limited to the coverage required by those restrictions and to the persons those restrictions are designed to protect.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-305(2)(d): Whenever a financed insurance policy is cancelled, the insurer shall return any unearned premiums due under the insurance policy to the insurance premium finance company for the account of the insured, and this action by the insurer satisfies the insurer's obligations under the insurance policy which relate to the return of unearned premiums. If the crediting of return premiums to the account of the insured results in a surplus over the amount due from the insured, the premium finance company shall refund that excess to the insured if it exceeds $5.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-305(3): No filing of the premium finance agreement or recording of a premium finance transaction is necessary to perfect the validity of the agreement as a secured transaction as against creditors, subsequent purchasers, pledgees, encumbrancers, successors, or assigns.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-306 Policies or surety bonds jointly issued.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Two or more insurers may together issue a policy or surety bond.  Their liability shall be joint and several with respect to the policy or bond.  The policy or bond shall state the proportion or amount of premium to be paid to each insurer and, as between the issuing insurers, the type and the proportion or amount of liability each insurer assumes.  Service of process on any of the insurers is service on all of them.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-307 Other insurance.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-307(1): When two or more policies promise to indemnify an insured against the same loss without intending cumulative coverage, no "other insurance" provisions of the policies may reduce the aggregate protection of the insured below the lesser of the actual insured loss suffered by the insured and the maximum indemnification promised by any policy without regard to any "other insurance" provision.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-307(2): (1) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-307(3): 31A-22-619 This section does not apply to accident and health insurance policies.  Refer to Section


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-308 Limitations on loss to be borne by insurer.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-308(1): An insurance policy indemnifying an insured against loss may by clear language limit the part of the loss to be paid by the insurer to a specified or determinable maximum amount, to loss in excess of a specified or determinable amount, to a specified proportion of the loss which may vary with the amount of the loss, or to any combination of these methods.  If the policy covers various risks, different limitations may be provided separately for each risk, if the policy clearly states that.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-308(2): A policy indemnifying an insured against loss of or damage to property may limit the part of the loss to be paid by the insurer to a percentage of the total loss that corresponds to the ratio of the insured sum to a specified percentage of the value of the insured property.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-309 Nonwaiver clause.
--------------------------------------------------
An insurer may insert a provision in any insurance policy that no change in the policy is valid unless approved by an executive officer of the insurer, or unless the approval is endorsed on the policy or attached to it, or both, and that no agent has authority to change the policy or waive any of its provisions.  This does not preclude a person claiming a right under the policy from relying on waiver or estoppel in an appropriate case.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-310 Dividends on policies.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-310(1): 31A-22-418 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-310(2): Any insurer may distribute a portion of surplus attributable to policies other than life insurance or annuities, in amounts and with classifications the board of directors determines to be fair and reasonable.  This distribution may not be contingent on the renewal of any policy or of premium payments unless the policy stated that limitation when it was written.  A schedule explaining the basis for the distribution shall be filed with the commissioner prior to the distribution.  The schedule shall be kept confidential by the commissioner unless he finds that the interests of insureds and the public require that it be made public.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-310(3): (2) Any insurer may distribute surplus to any class of policyholder, even if their policies do not provide for it.  A schedule explaining the basis for the distribution shall be filed with the commissioner under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-310(4): It is permissible to provide an indivisible dividend to classes of policyholders having more than one type of policy, including a combination of life or annuities with other types of insurance.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314 Prohibited provisions.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(1)(a): "Reserving discretionary authority" means a policy provision that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(1)(a)(i): has the effect of conferring discretion on an insurer, or other claim administrator, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(1)(a)(i)(A): determine eligibility for benefits; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(1)(a)(i)(B): interpret the terms or provisions of the policy, contract, certificate, or agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(1)(a)(ii): could lead to a deferential standard of review by a reviewing court.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(1)(b): "Reserving discretionary authority" does not include a policy provision that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(1)(b)(i): informs an insured that, as part of the insurer's routine operations, the insurer applies the terms of the contract for:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(1)(b)(i)(A): making a decision, including making a determination regarding eligibility, or receipt of benefits or claims; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(1)(b)(i)(B): explaining the insurer's policies and procedures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(1)(b)(ii): does not give rise to a deferential standard of review by a reviewing court.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(2): An insurance policy subject to this chapter may not contain a provision:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(2)(a): requiring the insurance policy to be construed according to the laws of another jurisdiction except as necessary to meet the requirements of compulsory insurance laws of other jurisdictions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(2)(b): depriving Utah courts of jurisdiction over an action against the insurer, except as provided in permissible arbitration provisions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(2)(c): limiting the right of action against the insurer to less than three years from the date the cause of action accrues; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-314(2)(d): for life insurance or accident and health insurance, reserving discretionary authority.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-315 Refund of canceled health insurance premiums and Medicare supplement insurance premiums.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-315(1): As used in this section, "unearned amount of the collected premium" means the amount of the collected premium applicable to the unexpired portion of the time period to which the policy or certificate relates.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-315(2): If a health insurance policy or a Medicare supplement policy is cancelled for a reason other than a material misrepresentation, the insurer shall refund the unearned amount of the collected premium.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-315(3): If an insurer cancels a health insurance policy or a Medicare supplement policy because of a material misrepresentation on the application, the insurer shall refund all premiums collected minus claims that have been paid.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316 Electronic notices and documents.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(1)(a): "Delivered by electronic means" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(1)(a)(i): delivery to an electronic mail address at which a party has consented to receive a notice or document; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(1)(a)(ii): posting on an electronic network or site accessible by way of the Internet, a mobile application, a computer, a mobile device, a tablet, or any other electronic device, together with separate notice of the posting that is provided by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(1)(a)(ii)(A): electronic mail to the address at which the party has consented to receive notice; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(1)(a)(ii)(B): any other delivery method that has been consented to by the party.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(1)(b)(i): "Party" means a recipient of a notice or document required as part of an insurance transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(1)(b)(ii): "Party" includes an applicant, an insured, or a policyholder.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(1)(c): "Policy document" means a policy, certificate, amendment, or endorsement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(2): Subject to Subsections (4) and (5), a notice to a party or another document required under applicable law in an insurance transaction or that serves as evidence of insurance coverage may be delivered, stored, and presented by electronic means if it meets the requirements of Title 46, Chapter 4, Uniform Electronic Transactions Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(3): Delivery of a notice or document in accordance with this section is considered equivalent to any delivery method required under applicable law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4): A notice or document may be delivered by electronic means by an insurer to a party under this section if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(a): the party has affirmatively consented to that method of delivery and has not withdrawn the consent;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(b): the party, before giving consent, is provided with a clear and conspicuous statement informing the party of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(b)(i): any right or option of the party to have the notice or document provided or made available in paper or another nonelectronic form;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(b)(ii): the right of the party to withdraw consent to have a notice or document delivered by electronic means, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(b)(ii)(A): a condition or consequence imposed if consent is withdrawn;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(b)(ii)(B): when the insurer will make the party's withdrawal effective, during or at the conclusion of the policy term; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(b)(ii)(C): the procedure a party is to follow to withdraw consent to have a notice or document delivered by electronic means;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(b)(iii): whether the party's consent applies:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(b)(iii)(A): only to the particular transaction as to which the notice or document must be given; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(b)(iii)(B): to identified categories of notices or documents that may be delivered by electronic means during the course of the party's relationship with the insured; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(b)(iv): the means, after consent is given, by which a party may obtain a paper copy of a notice or document delivered by electronic means; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(c): the party:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(c)(i): before giving consent, is provided with a statement of the electronic delivery and retrieval method requirements for access to and retention of a notice or document delivered by electronic means;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(c)(ii): consents electronically, or confirms consent electronically, in a manner that reasonably demonstrates that the party can access information in the electronic form that will be used for a notice or document delivered by electronic means as to which the party has given consent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(c)(iii): is provided a process to update information needed to contact the party electronically;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(d): after consent of the party is given and if a change in the electronic delivery or retrieval methods creates a substantial risk that the party will not be able to access or retain a subsequent notice or document to which the consent applies, the insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(d)(i): provides the party with a statement of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(d)(i)(A): the revised electronic delivery or retrieval methods; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(d)(i)(B): the right of the party to withdraw consent without the imposition of any condition or consequence that was not disclosed under Subsection (4)(b)(ii);
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(d)(ii): complies with Subsection (4)(b); and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(e): an insurer files with the department the consent statement described under Subsection (4)(b), which includes conditions or consequences for a party to revoke the party's consent to conduct an insurance transaction, electronically.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(e)(i): An insurer shall file the consent statement described in Subsection (4)(b) before the insurer uses the consent statement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(4)(e)(ii): The insurer shall communicate to the party in accordance with Subsection (4)(b) the conditions or consequences for a party to revoke the party's consent.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5)(a): An insurer may deliver a policy document to a party, by electronic means and without the party's consent to receive the policy document by electronic means, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5)(a)(i): the party has not withdrawn the consent described in this Subsection (5);
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5)(a)(ii): the insurer provides a clear and conspicuous statement in paper form, to the party, informing the party of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5)(a)(ii)(A): the party's right or option to have the policy document provided or made available in paper or another nonelectronic form;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5)(a)(ii)(B): the party's right to withdraw consent to the electronic delivery of a policy document, including the procedure a party must follow to withdraw consent to electronic delivery of a policy document;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5)(a)(ii)(C): policy documents that the insurer may deliver electronically;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5)(a)(ii)(D): the means by which a party may obtain a paper copy of a policy document that the insurer delivered electronically;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5)(a)(ii)(E): the electronic delivery and retrieval method requirements for access to and retention of a policy document delivered electronically; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5)(a)(ii)(F): the process to update the party's electronic contact information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5)(a)(iii): the party demonstrates the ability to electronically access the information contained in the policy document.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(5)(b): This Subsection (5) does not apply to a life insurance policy document.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(6): A withdrawal of consent by a party does not affect the legal effectiveness, validity, or enforceability of a notice or document delivered by electronic means to the party before the withdrawal of consent is effective.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(7): This section does not affect requirements related to content or timing of any notice or document required under applicable law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(8): If a provision of this title or applicable law requiring a notice or document to be provided to a party expressly requires verification or acknowledgment of receipt of the notice or document, the notice or document may be delivered by electronic means only if the method used provides for verification or acknowledgment of receipt.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(9): The legal effectiveness, validity, or enforceability of a contract or policy of insurance executed by a party may not be denied solely because of the failure to obtain electronic consent or confirmation of consent of the party in accordance with Subsection (4)(c)(ii).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(10): This section does not apply to or affect a notice or document delivered by an insurer in an electronic form before July 1, 2014, to a party who, before July 1, 2014, has consented to receive the notice or document in an electronic form otherwise allowed by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(11): If the consent of a party to receive certain notices or documents in an electronic form is on file with an insurer before July 1, 2014, and pursuant to this section, an insurer intends to deliver an additional notice or document to the party in an electronic form, then before delivering the additional notices or documents electronically, the insurer shall notify the party of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(11)(a): the notices or documents that may be delivered by electronic means under this section that were not previously delivered electronically; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(11)(b): the party's right to withdraw consent to have notices or documents delivered by electronic means.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(12): 31A-21-102
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(12)(a): 31A-21-102 Except as otherwise provided by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(12)(b): If a provision of this title or applicable law requires a signature, notice, or document to be notarized, acknowledged, verified, or made under oath, the requirement is satisfied if the electronic signature of the party authorized to perform those acts, together with all other information required to be included by the provision, is attached to or logically associated with the signature, notice, or document.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(13): For purposes of this section, an insurer's failure to comply with Subsection (4) or (5) constitutes a withdrawal of the party's consent.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(14): A party is presumed to have withdrawn consent under this section if the email address the party provides to receive a policy document returns a message stating that the message is undeliverable each time the insurer attempts electronic delivery over a period of up to two business days.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-316(15): This section may not be construed to modify, limit, or supersede the federal Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act, P. Law 106-229, as amended.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-401 Scope and construction of part.
----------------------------------------------------------------
This part applies to all mass marketed life or accident and health insurance, notwithstanding Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-402 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part, "mass marketed life or accident and health insurance" means the insurance under any individual, franchise, group, or blanket insurance policy offering life or accident and health insurance:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-402(1): that is offered by means of direct response solicitation through:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-402(1)(a): a sponsoring organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-402(1)(b): the mails or other mass communications media; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-402(2): under which the person insured pays all or substantially all of the cost of the person's insurance.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-403 Orders terminating effectiveness of policies.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Upon the commissioner's order, no mass marketed life or accident and health insurance issued by an insurer may continue to be effected on persons in this state.  The commissioner may issue an order under this section only if the commissioner finds, after a hearing, that the total charges for the insurance to the persons insured are unreasonable in relation to the benefits provided.  The commissioner's findings under this section shall be in writing.  Orders under this section may direct the insurer to cease effecting the insurance until the total charges for the insurance are found by the commissioner to be reasonable in relation to the benefits provided.

-------------------------------------------------------
Notwithstanding SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 31A-21-404(1): 31A-23a-402; 31A-23a-402.5; 31A-23a-403; Chapter 26, Part 3, Claim Practices comply with:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-404(1)(b): Chapter 26, Part 3, Claim Practices
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-404(2): upon the commissioner's request, deliver to the commissioner a copy of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-404(2)(a): any mass marketed life or accident and health insurance policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-404(2)(b): a certificate issued under a mass marketed life or accident and health insurance policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-404(2)(c): an application for a mass marketed life or accident and health insurance policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-404(2)(d): an enrollment form for a mass marketed life or accident and health insurance policy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-404(2)(e): advertising material used in this state in connection with a mass marketed life or accident and health insurance policy.
