Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-505 Limit on liability.
----------------------------------------------------
An insurer that issues a life or accident and health insurance policy to an individual who is the subject of domestic abuse is not liable civilly or criminally for the death of or any injuries to the insured as a result of domestic violence or child abuse beyond the obligations of the insurer under:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-505(1): the insurance policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-505(2): this title.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-506 Enforcement -- Private rights.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-506(1): An insurer that violates this part is subject to any penalty permitted under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-506(2): This part does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-506(2)(a): create a private right of action for a violation of this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-21-506(2)(b): limit or impair the right of an individual to sue and recover damages from the insurer in a civil action for a cause of action that is not based on a violation of this part.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 22 - Contracts in Specific Lines
**************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-101 Scope of part.
-----------------------------------------------
This

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-102 Bonds need not be under seal.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Under this code, no suretyship obligation is required to be under seal.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-103 Validity of surety bonds.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-103(1): An undertaking to stand as surety which is issued by an insurer authorized to do a surety business in this state is complete compliance with any qualification requirement in Utah law respecting surety bonds.  This undertaking is acceptable to any state official or court-appointed fiduciary authorized to receive or empowered to require the undertaking.  A copy of a surety's certificate of authority, certified by the commissioner, is prima facie evidence that a surety was authorized to do business in this state on the date of the certificate.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-103(2): No instrument executed by an insurer authorized to do a surety business is ineffective because of the insurer's failure to attach a copy of its certificate of authority to do business in this state.  However, a public official or court-appointed fiduciary may, by prior written request, require that a copy of the insurer's certificate of authority, certified by the commissioner, be delivered.  The insurer's failure to deliver a certified copy of the surety's certificate of authority within 10 days of receipt of the request is adequate grounds for refusing to accept the suretyship instrument.  Failure to request a copy of the certificate of authority prior to accepting the surety instrument is a waiver of the right to request the certificate.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-103(3): After executing an obligation of suretyship, no insurer may deny its corporate power to execute that type of instrument or to incur that type of liability in any proceeding against the insurer upon that instrument.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-104 Indemnity agreements and security for benefit of surety.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-104(1): Any insurer authorized to do a surety business may contract with any person, including a principal debtor under a suretyship obligation, for indemnity or security to protect the surety against losses.   No indemnity agreement or provision of security by the principal debtor releases from or changes the liability of the principal debtor or of the sureties from the terms established in the bond.  No surety may be indemnified through funds held by the principal debtor in a fiduciary capacity.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-104(2): Security may be in any of the following forms:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-104(2)(a): deposits of money or other property of the principal debtor which can be held by a responsible financial institution authorized by law to do that type of business, in a manner that prevents withdrawal or alienation of the money or other property without the written consent of the sureties or an order of a court of competent jurisdiction made after notice is given to the sureties and a hearing is held as directed by the court; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-104(2)(b): security interests in real or personal property perfected under the laws of Utah.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-104(3): This section does not affect a surety's common-law right to reimbursement, subrogation, or exoneration.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-105 Common control of fiduciary funds permissible.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any fiduciary from whom a bond, undertaking, or other obligation is required may agree and arrange with his sureties for the deposit for safekeeping of any and all assets for which he is responsible with a depository institution authorized by law to hold the assets, in a manner which prevents the withdrawal or alienation of any part of the property without the written consent of the sureties, or an order of the court made after notice is given to the sureties and a hearing is held as directed by the court.  This deposit agreement does not release or change the fiduciary responsibility of the principal, or the liability of the principal or sureties as established under the bond.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-106 Petition of fiduciary's surety to be relieved from liability.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any surety securing others against losses caused by breach of duty by a fiduciary, herein called "principal," may petition the court where the surety's obligation is filed or which has jurisdiction over the principal, for an order relieving the surety from further liability for the acts or omissions of the principal.  This order may be issued only after the court is satisfied that the principal has accounted to the petitioner and has obtained a new surety.  The surety relieved from liability shall refund any unearned part of the premium paid which the surety held as consideration for its promise to be surety. To relieve a surety from liability, the court may order the principal to account, to obtain a new surety, or to refrain from acting except to preserve property held in a fiduciary capacity.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-107 Bond premium allowable expense of fiduciary.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any fiduciary required by law, or the court in providing a surety to secure the fiduciary's performance, may include as part of the expense of executing the fiduciary responsibility a reasonable premium paid to a surety for becoming the fiduciary's surety.  However, the court may not allow an expense allowance greater than the larger of 1% of the surety's maximum obligation or $25.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-201 Required provisions of liability insurance policies.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Every liability insurance policy shall provide that the bankruptcy or insolvency of the insured may not diminish any liability of the insurer to third parties, and that if execution against the insured is returned unsatisfied, an action may be maintained against the insurer to the extent that the liability is covered by the policy.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-202 Protection of third-party claimants.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-202(1): An insurance contract insuring against loss or damage through legal liability for the bodily injury or death by accident of any person, or for damage to the property of any person, may not be retroactively abrogated to the detriment of any third-party claimant by any agreement between the insurer and insured after the occurrence of any injury, death, or damage for which the insured may be liable.  This attempted abrogation is void.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-202(2): A motor vehicle liability policy may be rescinded or cancelled as to an insured for fraud, material misrepresentation, or any reason allowable under the law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-202(3): 31A-22-304 A motor vehicle liability policy may not be rescinded for fraud or material misrepresentation, as to minimum liability coverage limits under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-203 Notice and proof of loss.
----------------------------------------------------------
Section

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-204 Restriction on limitation of coverage.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
No insurer may limit coverage under a policy insuring against legal liability to claims that are first made against the insured while the policy is in force, unless the policy contains on the cover page, a conspicuous statement that the coverage of the policy is limited in that way.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-205 Applicability of restatement of law.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-205(1): A restatement of the law of liability insurance is not the law or public policy of this state if the statement of law is inconsistent or in conflict with:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-205(1)(a): the Constitution of the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-205(1)(b): the Utah Constitution;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-205(1)(c): a state statute;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-205(1)(d): state case law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-205(1)(e): state-adopted common law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-205(2): Nothing in this section precludes a court from referencing or considering a restatement or other legal treatise.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305 Uninsured motorist coverage.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(1): As used in this section, "covered persons" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(1)(a): the named insured;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(1)(b): for a claim arising on or after May 13, 2014, the named insured's dependent minor children;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(1)(c): persons related to the named insured by blood, marriage, adoption, or guardianship, who are residents of the named insured's household, including those who usually make their home in the same household but temporarily live elsewhere;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(1)(d): any person occupying or using a motor vehicle:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(1)(d)(i): referred to in the policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(1)(d)(ii): owned by a self-insured; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(1)(e): any person who is entitled to recover damages against the owner or operator of the uninsured or underinsured motor vehicle because of bodily injury to or death of persons under Subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), or (d).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(2): 31A-22-304 As used in this section, "uninsured motor vehicle" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(2)(a): 31A-22-304
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(2)(a)(i): a motor vehicle, the operation, maintenance, or use of which is not covered under a liability policy at the time of an injury-causing occurrence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(2)(a)(ii): 31A-22-304
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(2)(a)(ii)(A): 31A-22-304 a motor vehicle covered with lower liability limits than required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(2)(a)(ii)(B): the motor vehicle described in Subsection (2)(a)(ii)(A) is uninsured to the extent of the deficiency;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(2)(b): an unidentified motor vehicle that left the scene of an accident proximately caused by the motor vehicle operator;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(2)(c): a motor vehicle covered by a liability policy, but coverage for an accident is disputed by the liability insurer for more than 60 days or continues to be disputed for more than 60 days; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(2)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(2)(d)(i): an insured motor vehicle if, before or after the accident, the liability insurer of the motor vehicle is declared insolvent by a court of competent jurisdiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(2)(d)(ii): the motor vehicle described in Subsection (2)(d)(i) is uninsured only to the extent that the claim against the insolvent insurer is not paid by a guaranty association or fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(3): 31A-22-302 Uninsured motorist coverage under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4): 31A-22-304
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(a): For new policies written on or after January 1, 2001, the limits of uninsured motorist coverage shall be equal to the lesser of the limits of the named insured's motor vehicle liability coverage or the maximum uninsured motorist coverage limits available by the insurer under the named insured's motor vehicle policy, unless a named insured rejects or purchases coverage in a lesser amount by signing an acknowledgment form that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(a)(i): is filed with the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(a)(ii): is provided by the insurer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(a)(iii): waives the higher coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(a)(iv): need only state in this or similar language that uninsured motorist coverage provides benefits or protection to you and other covered persons for bodily injury resulting from an accident caused by the fault of another party where the other party has no liability insurance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(a)(v): discloses the additional premiums required to purchase uninsured motorist coverage with limits equal to the lesser of the limits of the named insured's motor vehicle liability coverage or the maximum uninsured motorist coverage limits available by the insurer under the named insured's motor vehicle policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(b): Any selection or rejection under this Subsection (4) continues for that issuer of the liability coverage until the insured requests, in writing, a change of uninsured motorist coverage from that liability insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(c)(i): Subsections (4)(a) and (b) apply retroactively to any claim arising on or after January 1, 2001, for which, as of May 14, 2013, an insured has not made a written demand for arbitration or filed a complaint in a court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(c)(ii): The Legislature finds that the retroactive application of Subsections (4)(a) and (b) clarifies legislative intent and does not enlarge, eliminate, or destroy vested rights.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(d): For purposes of this Subsection (4), "new policy" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(d)(i): any policy that is issued which does not include a renewal or reinstatement of an existing policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(d)(ii): a change to an existing policy that results in:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(d)(ii)(A): a named insured being added to or deleted from the policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(d)(ii)(B): a change in the limits of the named insured's motor vehicle liability coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(e)(i): As used in this Subsection (4)(e), "additional motor vehicle" means a change that increases the total number of vehicles insured by the policy, and does not include replacement, substitute, or temporary vehicles.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(e)(ii): The adding of an additional motor vehicle to an existing personal lines or commercial lines policy does not constitute a new policy for purposes of Subsection (4)(d).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(e)(iii): If an additional motor vehicle is added to a personal lines policy where uninsured motorist coverage has been rejected, or where uninsured motorist limits are lower than the named insured's motor vehicle liability limits, the insurer shall provide a notice to a named insured within 30 days that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(e)(iii)(A): in the same manner as described in Subsection (4)(a)(iv), explains the purpose of uninsured motorist coverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(e)(iii)(B): encourages the named insured to contact the insurance company or insurance producer for quotes as to the additional premiums required to purchase uninsured motorist coverage with limits equal to the lesser of the limits of the named insured's motor vehicle liability coverage or the maximum uninsured motorist coverage limits available by the insurer under the named insured's motor vehicle policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(f): A change in policy number resulting from any policy change not identified under Subsection (4)(d)(ii) does not constitute a new policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(g): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(g)(i): Subsection (4)(d) applies retroactively to any claim arising on or after January 1, 2001, for which, as of May 1, 2012, an insured has not made a written demand for arbitration or filed a complaint in a court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(g)(ii): The Legislature finds that the retroactive application of Subsection (4):
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(g)(ii)(A): does not enlarge, eliminate, or destroy vested rights; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(g)(ii)(B): clarifies legislative intent.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(4)(h): A self-insured, including a governmental entity, may elect to provide uninsured motorist coverage in an amount that is less than its maximum self-insured retention under Subsections (4)(a) and (5)(a) by issuing a declaratory memorandum or policy statement from the chief financial officer or chief risk officer that declares the:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(6): When a covered person alleges that an uninsured motor vehicle under Subsection (2)(b) proximately caused an accident without touching the covered person or the motor vehicle occupied by the covered person, the covered person shall show the existence of the uninsured motor vehicle by clear and convincing evidence consisting of more than the covered person's testimony.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(7)(a): The limit of liability for uninsured motorist coverage for two or more motor vehicles may not be added together, combined, or stacked to determine the limit of insurance coverage available to an injured person for any one accident.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(7)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(7)(b)(i): Subsection (7)(a) applies to all persons except a covered person as defined under Subsection (8)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(7)(b)(ii): A covered person as defined under Subsection (8)(b)(ii) is entitled to the highest limits of uninsured motorist coverage afforded for any one motor vehicle that the covered person is the named insured or an insured family member.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(7)(b)(iii): This coverage shall be in addition to the coverage on the motor vehicle the covered person is occupying.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(7)(b)(iv): Neither the primary nor the secondary coverage may be set off against the other.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(7)(c): Coverage on a motor vehicle occupied at the time of an accident shall be primary coverage, and the coverage elected by a person described under Subsections (1)(a) through (c) shall be secondary coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(a): Uninsured motorist coverage under this section applies to bodily injury, sickness, disease, or death of covered persons while occupying or using a motor vehicle only if the motor vehicle is described in the policy under which a claim is made, or if the motor vehicle is a newly acquired or replacement motor vehicle covered under the terms of the policy.  Except as provided in Subsection (7) or this Subsection (8), a covered person injured in a motor vehicle described in a policy that includes uninsured motorist benefits may not elect to collect uninsured motorist coverage benefits from any other motor vehicle insurance policy under which the person is a covered person.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(b): Each of the following persons may also recover uninsured motorist benefits under any one other policy in which they are described as a "covered person" as defined in Subsection (1):
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(b)(i): a covered person injured as a pedestrian by an uninsured motor vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(b)(ii): except as provided in Subsection (8)(c), a covered person injured while occupying or using a motor vehicle that is not owned, leased, or furnished:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(b)(ii)(A): to the covered person;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(b)(ii)(B): to the covered person's spouse; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(b)(ii)(C): to the covered person's resident parent or resident sibling.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(c)(i): A covered person may recover benefits from no more than two additional policies, one additional policy from each parent's household if the covered person is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(c)(i)(A): a dependent minor of parents who reside in separate households; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(c)(i)(B): injured while occupying or using a motor vehicle that is not owned, leased, or furnished:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(c)(i)(B)(I): to the covered person;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(c)(i)(B)(II): to the covered person's resident parent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(c)(i)(B)(III): to the covered person's resident sibling.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(c)(ii): Each parent's policy under this Subsection (8)(c) is liable only for the percentage of the damages that the limit of liability of each parent's policy of uninsured motorist coverage bears to the total of both parents' uninsured coverage applicable to the accident.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(d): A covered person's recovery under any available policies may not exceed the full amount of damages.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(e): A covered person in Subsection (8)(b) is not barred against making subsequent elections if recovery is unavailable under previous elections.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(f): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(f)(i): As used in this section, "interpolicy stacking" means recovering benefits for a single incident of loss under more than one insurance policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(8)(f)(ii): Except to the extent permitted by Subsection (7) and this Subsection (8), interpolicy stacking is prohibited for uninsured motorist coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; 78B-5-825
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(a): When a claim is brought by a named insured or a person described in Subsection (1) and is asserted against the covered person's uninsured motorist carrier, the claimant may elect to resolve the claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(a)(i): by submitting the claim to binding arbitration; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(a)(ii): through litigation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(b): Unless otherwise provided in the policy under which uninsured benefits are claimed, the election provided in Subsection (9)(a) is available to the claimant only, except that if the policy under which insured benefits are claimed provides that either an insured or the insurer may elect arbitration, the insured or the insurer may elect arbitration and that election to arbitrate shall stay the litigation of the claim under Subsection (9)(a)(ii).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(c): Once the claimant has elected to commence litigation under Subsection (9)(a)(ii), the claimant may not elect to resolve the claim through binding arbitration under this section without the written consent of the uninsured motorist carrier.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(d): For purposes of the statute of limitations applicable to a claim described in Subsection (9)(a), if the claimant does not elect to resolve the claim through litigation, the claim is considered filed when the claimant submits the claim to binding arbitration in accordance with this Subsection (9).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(e)(i): Unless otherwise agreed to in writing by the parties, a claim that is submitted to binding arbitration under Subsection (9)(a)(i) shall be resolved by a single arbitrator.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(e)(ii): All parties shall agree on the single arbitrator selected under Subsection (9)(e)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(e)(iii): If the parties are unable to agree on a single arbitrator as required under Subsection (9)(e)(ii), the parties shall select a panel of three arbitrators.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(f): If the parties select a panel of three arbitrators under Subsection (9)(e)(iii):
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(f)(i): each side shall select one arbitrator; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(f)(ii): the arbitrators appointed under Subsection (9)(f)(i) shall select one additional arbitrator to be included in the panel.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(g): Unless otherwise agreed to in writing:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(g)(i): each party shall pay an equal share of the fees and costs of the arbitrator selected under Subsection (9)(e)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(g)(ii): if an arbitration panel is selected under Subsection (9)(e)(iii):
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(g)(ii)(A): each party shall pay the fees and costs of the arbitrator selected by that party; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(g)(ii)(B): each party shall pay an equal share of the fees and costs of the arbitrator selected under Subsection (9)(f)(ii).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(h): Except as otherwise provided in this section or unless otherwise agreed to in writing by the parties, an arbitration proceeding conducted under this section shall be governed by Title 78B, Chapter 11, Utah Uniform Arbitration Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(i)(i): The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with Rules 26(a)(4) through (f), 27 through 37, 54, and 68 of the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure, once the requirements of Subsections (10)(a) through (c) are satisfied.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(i)(ii): The specified tier as defined by Rule 26(c)(3) of the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure shall be determined based on the claimant's specific monetary amount in the written demand for payment of uninsured motorist coverage benefits as required in Subsection (10)(a)(i)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(i)(iii): Rules 26.1 and 26.2 of the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure do not apply to arbitration claims under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(j): All issues of discovery shall be resolved by the arbitrator or the arbitration panel.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(k): A written decision by a single arbitrator or by a majority of the arbitration panel shall constitute a final decision.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(l): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(l)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (10), the amount of an arbitration award may not exceed the uninsured motorist policy limits of all applicable uninsured motorist policies, including applicable uninsured motorist umbrella policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(l)(ii): If the initial arbitration award exceeds the uninsured motorist policy limits of all applicable uninsured motorist policies, the arbitration award shall be reduced to an amount equal to the combined uninsured motorist policy limits of all applicable uninsured motorist policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(m): The arbitrator or arbitration panel may not decide the issues of coverage or extra-contractual damages, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(m)(i): whether the claimant is a covered person;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(m)(ii): whether the policy extends coverage to the loss; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(m)(iii): any allegations or claims asserting consequential damages or bad faith liability.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(n): The arbitrator or arbitration panel may not conduct arbitration on a class-wide or class-representative basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(o): If the arbitrator or arbitration panel finds that the action was not brought, pursued, or defended in good faith, the arbitrator or arbitration panel may award reasonable attorney fees and costs against the party that failed to bring, pursue, or defend the claim in good faith.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(p): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration An arbitration award issued under this section shall be the final resolution of all claims not excluded by Subsection (9)(m) between the parties unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(p)(i): the award was procured by corruption, fraud, or other undue means; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(p)(ii): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration within 20 days after service of the arbitration award, a party:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(p)(ii)(A): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration files a complaint requesting a trial de novo in a court with jurisdiction under
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(p)(ii)(B): serves the nonmoving party with a copy of the complaint requesting a trial de novo under Subsection (9)(p)(ii)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(q): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(q)(i): Upon filing a complaint for a trial de novo under Subsection (9)(p), the claim shall proceed through litigation in accordance with the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure and Utah Rules of Evidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(q)(ii): In accordance with Rule 38, Utah Rules of Civil Procedure, a party may request a jury trial with a complaint requesting a trial de novo under Subsection (9)(p)(ii)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(r): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(r)(i): If the claimant, as the moving party in a trial de novo requested under Subsection (9)(p), does not obtain a verdict that is at least $5,000 and is at least 20% greater than the arbitration award, the claimant is responsible for all of the nonmoving party's costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(r)(ii): If the uninsured motorist carrier, as the moving party in a trial de novo requested under Subsection (9)(p), does not obtain a verdict that is at least 20% less than the arbitration award, the uninsured motorist carrier is responsible for all of the nonmoving party's costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(r)(iii): Except as provided in Subsection (9)(r)(iv), the costs under this Subsection (9)(r) shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(r)(iii)(A): any costs set forth in Rule 54(d), Utah Rules of Civil Procedure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(r)(iii)(B): the costs of expert witnesses and depositions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(r)(iv): An award of costs under this Subsection (9)(r) may not exceed $2,500 unless Subsection (10)(h)(iii) applies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(s): For purposes of determining whether a party's verdict is greater or less than the arbitration award under Subsection (9)(r), a court may not consider any recovery or other relief granted on a claim for damages if the claim for damages:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(s)(i): was not fully disclosed in writing prior to the arbitration proceeding; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(s)(ii): was not disclosed in response to discovery contrary to the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(t): 78B-5-825 If a court determines, upon a motion of the nonmoving party, that the moving party's use of the trial de novo process was filed in bad faith in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(u): Nothing in this section is intended to limit any claim under any other portion of an applicable insurance policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(9)(v): If there are multiple uninsured motorist policies, as set forth in Subsection (8), the claimant may elect to arbitrate in one hearing the claims against all the uninsured motorist carriers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a): Within 30 days after a covered person elects to submit a claim for uninsured motorist benefits to binding arbitration or files litigation, the covered person shall provide to the uninsured motorist carrier:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(i): a written demand for payment of uninsured motorist coverage benefits, setting forth:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(i)(A): subject to Subsection (10)(l), the specific monetary amount of the demand, including a computation of the covered person's claimed past medical expenses, claimed past lost wages, and the other claimed past economic damages; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(i)(B): the factual and legal basis and any supporting documentation for the demand;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(ii): a written statement under oath disclosing:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(ii)(A): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(ii)(A)(I): the names and last known addresses of all health care providers who have rendered health care services to the covered person that are material to the claims for which uninsured motorist benefits are sought for a period of five years preceding the date of the event giving rise to the claim for uninsured motorist benefits up to the time the election for arbitration or litigation has been exercised; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(ii)(A)(II): the names and last known addresses of the health care providers who have rendered health care services to the covered person, which the covered person claims are immaterial to the claims for which uninsured motorist benefits are sought, for a period of five years preceding the date of the event giving rise to the claim for uninsured motorist benefits up to the time the election for arbitration or litigation has been exercised that have not been disclosed under Subsection (10)(a)(ii)(A)(I);
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(ii)(B): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(ii)(B)(I): the names and last known addresses of all health insurers or other entities to whom the covered person has submitted claims for health care services or benefits material to the claims for which uninsured motorist benefits are sought, for a period of five years preceding the date of the event giving rise to the claim for uninsured motorist benefits up to the time the election for arbitration or litigation has been exercised; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(ii)(B)(II): the names and last known addresses of the health insurers or other entities to whom the covered person has submitted claims for health care services or benefits, which the covered person claims are immaterial to the claims for which uninsured motorist benefits are sought, for a period of five years preceding the date of the event giving rise to the claim for uninsured motorist benefits up to the time the election for arbitration or litigation have not been disclosed;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(ii)(C): if lost wages, diminished earning capacity, or similar damages are claimed, all employers of the covered person for a period of five years preceding the date of the event giving rise to the claim for uninsured motorist benefits up to the time the election for arbitration or litigation has been exercised;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(ii)(D): other documents to reasonably support the claims being asserted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(ii)(E): all state and federal statutory lienholders including a statement as to whether the covered person is a recipient of Medicare or Medicaid benefits or Utah Children's Health Insurance Program benefits under Title 26B, Chapter 3, Part 9, Utah Children's Health Insurance Program, or if the claim is subject to any other state or federal statutory liens; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(a)(iii): signed authorizations to allow the uninsured motorist carrier to only obtain records and billings from the individuals or entities disclosed under Subsections (10)(a)(ii)(A)(I), (B)(I), and (C).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(b)(i): If the uninsured motorist carrier determines that the disclosure of undisclosed health care providers or health care insurers under Subsection (10)(a)(ii) is reasonably necessary, the uninsured motorist carrier may:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(b)(i)(A): make a request for the disclosure of the identity of the health care providers or health care insurers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(b)(i)(B): make a request for authorizations to allow the uninsured motorist carrier to only obtain records and billings from the individuals or entities not disclosed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(b)(ii): If the covered person does not provide the requested information within 10 days:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(b)(ii)(A): the covered person shall disclose, in writing, the legal or factual basis for the failure to disclose the health care providers or health care insurers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(b)(ii)(B): either the covered person or the uninsured motorist carrier may request the arbitrator or arbitration panel to resolve the issue of whether the identities or records are to be provided if the covered person has elected arbitration.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(b)(iii): The time periods imposed by Subsection (10)(c)(i) are tolled pending resolution of the dispute concerning the disclosure and production of records of the health care providers or health care insurers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(c)(i): An uninsured motorist carrier that receives an election for arbitration or a notice of filing litigation and the demand for payment of uninsured motorist benefits under Subsection (10)(a)(i) shall have a reasonable time, not to exceed 60 days from the date of the demand and receipt of the items specified in Subsections (10)(a)(i) through (iii), to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(c)(i)(A): provide a written response to the written demand for payment provided for in Subsection (10)(a)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(c)(i)(B): except as provided in Subsection (10)(c)(i)(C), tender the amount, if any, of the uninsured motorist carrier's determination of the amount owed to the covered person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(c)(i)(C): if the covered person is a recipient of Medicare or Medicaid benefits or Utah Children's Health Insurance Program benefits under Title 26B, Chapter 3, Part 9, Utah Children's Health Insurance Program, or if the claim is subject to any other state or federal statutory liens, tender the amount, if any, of the uninsured motorist carrier's determination of the amount owed to the covered person less:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(c)(i)(C)(I): if the amount of the state or federal statutory lien is established, the amount of the lien; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(c)(i)(C)(II): if the amount of the state or federal statutory lien is not established, two times the amount of the medical expenses subject to the state or federal statutory lien until such time as the amount of the state or federal statutory lien is established.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(c)(ii): If the amount tendered by the uninsured motorist carrier under Subsection (10)(c)(i) is the total amount of the uninsured motorist policy limits, the tendered amount shall be accepted by the covered person.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(d): A covered person who receives a written response from an uninsured motorist carrier as provided for in Subsection (10)(c)(i), may:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(d)(i): elect to accept the amount tendered in Subsection (10)(c)(i) as payment in full of all uninsured motorist claims; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(d)(ii): elect to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(d)(ii)(A): accept the amount tendered in Subsection (10)(c)(i) as partial payment of all uninsured motorist claims; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(d)(ii)(B): continue to litigate or arbitrate the remaining claim in accordance with the election made under Subsections (9)(a) through (c).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(e): If a covered person elects to accept the amount tendered under Subsection (10)(c)(i) as partial payment of all uninsured motorist claims, the final award obtained through arbitration, litigation, or later settlement shall be reduced by any payment made by the uninsured motorist carrier under Subsection (10)(c)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(f): In an arbitration proceeding on the remaining uninsured claims:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(f)(i): the parties may not disclose to the arbitrator or arbitration panel the amount paid under Subsection (10)(c)(i) until after the arbitration award has been rendered; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(f)(ii): the parties may not disclose the amount of the limits of uninsured motorist benefits provided by the policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(g): If the final award obtained through arbitration or litigation is greater than the average of the covered person's initial written demand for payment provided for in Subsection (10)(a)(i) and the uninsured motorist carrier's initial written response provided for in Subsection (10)(c)(i), the uninsured motorist carrier shall pay:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(g)(i): the final award obtained through arbitration or litigation, except that if the award exceeds the policy limits of the subject uninsured motorist policy by more than $15,000, the amount shall be reduced to an amount equal to the policy limits plus $15,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(g)(ii): any of the following applicable costs:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(g)(ii)(A): any costs as set forth in Rule 54(d), Utah Rules of Civil Procedure;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(g)(ii)(B): the arbitrator or arbitration panel's fee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(g)(ii)(C): the reasonable costs of expert witnesses and depositions used in the presentation of evidence during arbitration or litigation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(h): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(h)(i): The covered person shall provide an affidavit of costs within five days of an arbitration award.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(h)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(h)(ii)(A): Objection to the affidavit of costs shall specify with particularity the costs to which the uninsured motorist carrier objects.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(h)(ii)(B): The objection shall be resolved by the arbitrator or arbitration panel.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(h)(iii): The award of costs by the arbitrator or arbitration panel under Subsection (10)(g)(ii) may not exceed $5,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(i)(i): A covered person shall disclose all material information, other than rebuttal evidence, within 30 days after a covered person elects to submit a claim for uninsured motorist coverage benefits to binding arbitration or files litigation as specified in Subsection (10)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(i)(ii): If the information under Subsection (10)(i)(i) is not disclosed, the covered person may not recover costs or any amounts in excess of the policy under Subsection (10)(g).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(j): This Subsection (10) does not limit any other cause of action that arose or may arise against the uninsured motorist carrier from the same dispute.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(k): The provisions of this Subsection (10) only apply to motor vehicle accidents that occur on or after March 30, 2010.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(l): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(l)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(10)(l)(i)(A): The written demand requirement in Subsection (10)(a)(i)(A) does not affect the covered person's requirement to provide a computation of any other economic damages claimed, and the one or more respondents shall have a reasonable time after the receipt of the computation of any other economic damages claimed to conduct fact and expert discovery as to any additional damages claimed.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(11): 31A-21-313
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305(11)(a): A person shall commence an action on a written policy or contract for uninsured motorist coverage within four years after the inception of loss.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3 Underinsured motorist coverage.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(1): 31A-22-305; 31A-22-305 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(1)(a): 31A-22-305 "Covered person" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(1)(b): 31A-22-305
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(1)(b)(i): "Underinsured motor vehicle" includes a motor vehicle, the operation, maintenance, or use of which is covered under a liability policy at the time of an injury-causing occurrence, but which has insufficient liability coverage to compensate fully the injured party for all special and general damages.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(1)(b)(ii): 31A-22-305 The term "underinsured motor vehicle" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(1)(b)(ii)(A): a motor vehicle that is covered under the liability coverage of the same policy that also contains the underinsured motorist coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(1)(b)(ii)(B): 31A-22-305 an uninsured motor vehicle as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(1)(b)(ii)(C): a motor vehicle owned or leased by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(1)(b)(ii)(C)(I): a named insured;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(1)(b)(ii)(C)(II): a named insured's spouse; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(1)(b)(ii)(C)(III): a dependent of a named insured.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(2): 31A-22-302
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(2)(a): 31A-22-302 Underinsured motorist coverage under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(2)(b): A covered person occupying or using a motor vehicle owned, leased, or furnished to the covered person, the covered person's spouse, or covered person's resident relative may recover underinsured benefits only if the motor vehicle is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(2)(b)(i): described in the policy under which a claim is made; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(2)(b)(ii): a newly acquired or replacement motor vehicle covered under the terms of the policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(a): For purposes of this Subsection (3), "new policy" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(a)(i): any policy that is issued that does not include a renewal or reinstatement of an existing policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(a)(ii): a change to an existing policy that results in:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(a)(ii)(A): a named insured being added to or deleted from the policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(a)(ii)(B): a change in the limits of the named insured's motor vehicle liability coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(b): For new policies written on or after January 1, 2001, the limits of underinsured motorist coverage shall be equal to the lesser of the limits of the named insured's motor vehicle liability coverage or the maximum underinsured motorist coverage limits available by the insurer under the named insured's motor vehicle policy, unless a named insured rejects or purchases coverage in a lesser amount by signing an acknowledgment form that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(b)(i): is filed with the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(b)(ii): is provided by the insurer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(b)(iii): waives the higher coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(b)(iv): need only state in this or similar language that "underinsured motorist coverage provides benefits or protection to you and other covered persons for bodily injury resulting from an accident caused by the fault of another party where the other party has insufficient liability insurance"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(b)(v): discloses the additional premiums required to purchase underinsured motorist coverage with limits equal to the lesser of the limits of the named insured's motor vehicle liability coverage or the maximum underinsured motorist coverage limits available by the insurer under the named insured's motor vehicle policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(c): Any selection or rejection under Subsection (3)(b) continues for that issuer of the liability coverage until the insured requests, in writing, a change of underinsured motorist coverage from that liability insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(d)(i): Subsections (3)(b) and (c) apply retroactively to any claim arising on or after January 1, 2001, for which, as of May 14, 2013, an insured has not made a written demand for arbitration or filed a complaint in a court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(d)(ii): The Legislature finds that the retroactive application of Subsections (3)(b) and (c) clarifies legislative intent and does not enlarge, eliminate, or destroy vested rights.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(e)(i): As used in this Subsection (3)(e), "additional motor vehicle" means a change that increases the total number of vehicles insured by the policy, and does not include replacement, substitute, or temporary vehicles.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(e)(ii): The adding of an additional motor vehicle to an existing personal lines or commercial lines policy does not constitute a new policy for purposes of Subsection (3)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(e)(iii): If an additional motor vehicle is added to a personal lines policy where underinsured motorist coverage has been rejected, or where underinsured motorist limits are lower than the named insured's motor vehicle liability limits, the insurer shall provide a notice to a named insured within 30 days that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(e)(iii)(A): in the same manner described in Subsection (3)(b)(iv), explains the purpose of underinsured motorist coverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(e)(iii)(B): encourages the named insured to contact the insurance company or insurance producer for quotes as to the additional premiums required to purchase underinsured motorist coverage with limits equal to the lesser of the limits of the named insured's motor vehicle liability coverage or the maximum underinsured motorist coverage limits available by the insurer under the named insured's motor vehicle policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(f): A change in policy number resulting from any policy change not identified under Subsection (3)(a)(ii) does not constitute a new policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(g): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(g)(i): Subsection (3)(a) applies retroactively to any claim arising on or after January 1, 2001 for which, as of May 1, 2012, an insured has not made a written demand for arbitration or filed a complaint in a court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(g)(ii): The Legislature finds that the retroactive application of Subsection (3)(a):
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(g)(ii)(A): does not enlarge, eliminate, or destroy vested rights; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(g)(ii)(B): clarifies legislative intent.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(h): A self-insured, including a governmental entity, may elect to provide underinsured motorist coverage in an amount that is less than its maximum self-insured retention under Subsections (3)(b) and (l) by issuing a declaratory memorandum or policy statement from the chief financial officer or chief risk officer that declares the:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(h)(i): self-insured entity's coverage level; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(h)(ii): process for filing an underinsured motorist claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(i): Underinsured motorist coverage may not be sold with limits that are less than:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(i)(i): $10,000 for one person in any one accident; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(i)(ii): at least $20,000 for two or more persons in any one accident.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(j): An acknowledgment under Subsection (3)(b) continues for that issuer of the underinsured motorist coverage until the named insured, in writing, requests different underinsured motorist coverage from the insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(k): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(k)(i): The named insured's underinsured motorist coverage, as described in Subsection (2), is secondary to the liability coverage of an owner or operator of an underinsured motor vehicle, as described in Subsection (1).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(k)(ii): Underinsured motorist coverage may not be set off against the liability coverage of the owner or operator of an underinsured motor vehicle, but shall be added to, combined with, or stacked upon the liability coverage of the owner or operator of the underinsured motor vehicle to determine the limit of coverage available to the injured person.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(l): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(l)(i): In conjunction with the first two renewal notices sent after January 1, 2001, for policies existing on that date, the insurer shall disclose in the same medium as the premium renewal notice, an explanation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(l)(i)(A): the purpose of underinsured motorist coverage in the same manner as described in Subsection (3)(b)(iv); and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(l)(i)(B): a disclosure of the additional premiums required to purchase underinsured motorist coverage with limits equal to the lesser of the limits of the named insured's motor vehicle liability coverage or the maximum underinsured motorist coverage limits available by the insurer under the named insured's motor vehicle policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(l)(ii): The disclosure required under this Subsection (3)(l) shall be sent to all named insureds that carry underinsured motorist coverage limits in an amount less than the named insured's motor vehicle liability policy limits or the maximum underinsured motorist coverage limits available by the insurer under the named insured's motor vehicle policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(3)(m): For purposes of this Subsection (3), a notice or disclosure sent to a named insured in a household constitutes notice or disclosure to all insureds within the household.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8): 31A-22-305; Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; 78B-5-825
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(a): 31A-22-305 When a claim is brought by a named insured or a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(a)(i): by submitting the claim to binding arbitration; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(a)(ii): through litigation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(b): Unless otherwise provided in the policy under which underinsured benefits are claimed, the election provided in Subsection (8)(a) is available to the claimant only, except that if the policy under which insured benefits are claimed provides that either an insured or the insurer may elect arbitration, the insured or the insurer may elect arbitration and that election to arbitrate shall stay the litigation of the claim under Subsection (8)(a)(ii).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(c): Once a claimant elects to commence litigation under Subsection (8)(a)(ii), the claimant may not elect to resolve the claim through binding arbitration under this section without the written consent of the underinsured motorist coverage carrier.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(d): For purposes of the statute of limitations applicable to a claim described in Subsection (8)(a), if the claimant does not elect to resolve the claim through litigation, the claim is considered filed when the claimant submits the claim to binding arbitration in accordance with this Subsection (8).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(e)(i): Unless otherwise agreed to in writing by the parties, a claim that is submitted to binding arbitration under Subsection (8)(a)(i) shall be resolved by a single arbitrator.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(e)(ii): All parties shall agree on the single arbitrator selected under Subsection (8)(e)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(e)(iii): If the parties are unable to agree on a single arbitrator as required under Subsection (8)(e)(ii), the parties shall select a panel of three arbitrators.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(f): If the parties select a panel of three arbitrators under Subsection (8)(e)(iii):
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(f)(i): each side shall select one arbitrator; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(f)(ii): the arbitrators appointed under Subsection (8)(f)(i) shall select one additional arbitrator to be included in the panel.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(g): Unless otherwise agreed to in writing:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(g)(i): each party shall pay an equal share of the fees and costs of the arbitrator selected under Subsection (8)(e)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(g)(ii): if an arbitration panel is selected under Subsection (8)(e)(iii):
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(g)(ii)(A): each party shall pay the fees and costs of the arbitrator selected by that party; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(g)(ii)(B): each party shall pay an equal share of the fees and costs of the arbitrator selected under Subsection (8)(f)(ii).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(h): Except as otherwise provided in this section or unless otherwise agreed to in writing by the parties, an arbitration proceeding conducted under this section is governed by Title 78B, Chapter 11, Utah Uniform Arbitration Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(i)(i): The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with Rules 26(a)(4) through (f), 27 through 37, 54, and 68 of the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure, once the requirements of Subsections (9)(a) through (c) are satisfied.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(i)(ii): The specified tier as defined by Rule 26(c)(3) of the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure shall be determined based on the claimant's specific monetary amount in the written demand for payment of uninsured motorist coverage benefits as required in Subsection (9)(a)(i)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(i)(iii): Rules 26.1 and 26.2 of the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure do not apply to arbitration claims under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(j): An issue of discovery shall be resolved by the arbitrator or the arbitration panel.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(k): A written decision by a single arbitrator or by a majority of the arbitration panel constitutes a final decision.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(l): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(l)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (9), the amount of an arbitration award may not exceed the underinsured motorist policy limits of all applicable underinsured motorist policies, including applicable underinsured motorist umbrella policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(l)(ii): If the initial arbitration award exceeds the underinsured motorist policy limits of all applicable underinsured motorist policies, the arbitration award shall be reduced to an amount equal to the combined underinsured motorist policy limits of all applicable underinsured motorist policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(m): The arbitrator or arbitration panel may not decide an issue of coverage or extra-contractual damages, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(m)(i): whether the claimant is a covered person;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(m)(ii): whether the policy extends coverage to the loss; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(m)(iii): an allegation or claim asserting consequential damages or bad faith liability.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(n): The arbitrator or arbitration panel may not conduct arbitration on a class-wide or class-representative basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(o): If the arbitrator or arbitration panel finds that the arbitration is not brought, pursued, or defended in good faith, the arbitrator or arbitration panel may award reasonable attorney fees and costs against the party that failed to bring, pursue, or defend the arbitration in good faith.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(p)(i): the award is procured by corruption, fraud, or other undue means; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(p)(ii): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration either party, within 20 days after service of the arbitration award:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(p)(ii)(A): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration files a complaint requesting a trial de novo in the a court with jurisdiction under
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(p)(ii)(B): serves the nonmoving party with a copy of the complaint requesting a trial de novo under Subsection (8)(p)(ii)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(q): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(q)(i): Upon filing a complaint for a trial de novo under Subsection (8)(p), a claim shall proceed through litigation in accordance with the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure and Utah Rules of Evidence.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(q)(ii): In accordance with Rule 38, Utah Rules of Civil Procedure, either party may request a jury trial with a complaint requesting a trial de novo under Subsection (8)(p)(ii)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(r): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(r)(i): If the claimant, as the moving party in a trial de novo requested under Subsection (8)(p), does not obtain a verdict that is at least $5,000 and is at least 20% greater than the arbitration award, the claimant is responsible for all of the nonmoving party's costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(r)(ii): If the underinsured motorist carrier, as the moving party in a trial de novo requested under Subsection (8)(p), does not obtain a verdict that is at least 20% less than the arbitration award, the underinsured motorist carrier is responsible for all of the nonmoving party's costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(r)(iii): Except as provided in Subsection (8)(r)(iv), the costs under this Subsection (8)(r) shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(r)(iii)(A): any costs set forth in Rule 54(d), Utah Rules of Civil Procedure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(r)(iii)(B): the costs of expert witnesses and depositions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(r)(iv): An award of costs under this Subsection (8)(r) may not exceed $2,500 unless Subsection (9)(h)(iii) applies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(8)(s): For purposes of determining whether a party's verdict is greater or less than the arbitration award under Subsection (8)(r), a court may not consider any recovery or other relief granted on a claim for damages if the claim for damages:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9):

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(b)(i): If the underinsured motorist carrier determines that the disclosure of undisclosed health care providers or health care insurers under Subsection (9)(a)(ii) is reasonably necessary, the underinsured motorist carrier may:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(c)(i): An underinsured motorist carrier that receives an election for arbitration or a notice of filing litigation and the demand for payment of underinsured motorist benefits under Subsection (9)(a)(i) shall have a reasonable time, not to exceed 60 days from the date of the demand and receipt of the items specified in Subsections (9)(a)(i) through (iii), to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(c)(i)(A): provide a written response to the written demand for payment provided for in Subsection (9)(a)(i);
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(c)(i)(B): except as provided in Subsection (9)(c)(i)(C), tender the amount, if any, of the underinsured motorist carrier's determination of the amount owed to the covered person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(c)(i)(C): if the covered person is a recipient of Medicare or Medicaid benefits or Utah Children's Health Insurance Program benefits under Title 26B, Chapter 3, Part 9, Utah Children's Health Insurance Program, or if the claim is subject to any other state or federal statutory liens, tender the amount, if any, of the underinsured motorist carrier's determination of the amount owed to the covered person less:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(c)(i)(C)(I): if the amount of the state or federal statutory lien is established, the amount of the lien; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(c)(i)(C)(II): if the amount of the state or federal statutory lien is not established, two times the amount of the medical expenses subject to the state or federal statutory lien until such time as the amount of the state or federal statutory lien is established.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(c)(ii): If the amount tendered by the underinsured motorist carrier under Subsection (9)(c)(i) is the total amount of the underinsured motorist policy limits, the tendered amount shall be accepted by the covered person.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(d): A covered person who receives a written response from an underinsured motorist carrier as provided for in Subsection (9)(c)(i), may:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(d)(i): elect to accept the amount tendered in Subsection (9)(c)(i) as payment in full of all underinsured motorist claims; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(d)(ii): elect to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(d)(ii)(A): accept the amount tendered in Subsection (9)(c)(i) as partial payment of all underinsured motorist claims; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(d)(ii)(B): continue to litigate or arbitrate the remaining claim in accordance with the election made under Subsections (8)(a) through (c).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(e): If a covered person elects to accept the amount tendered under Subsection (9)(c)(i) as partial payment of all underinsured motorist claims, the final award obtained through arbitration, litigation, or later settlement shall be reduced by any payment made by the underinsured motorist carrier under Subsection (9)(c)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(f): In an arbitration proceeding on the remaining underinsured claims:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(f)(i): the parties may not disclose to the arbitrator or arbitration panel the amount paid under Subsection (9)(c)(i) until after the arbitration award has been rendered; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(f)(ii): the parties may not disclose the amount of the limits of underinsured motorist benefits provided by the policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(g): If the final award obtained through arbitration or litigation is greater than the average of the covered person's initial written demand for payment provided for in Subsection (9)(a)(i) and the underinsured motorist carrier's initial written response provided for in Subsection (9)(c)(i), the underinsured motorist carrier shall pay:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(g)(i): the final award obtained through arbitration or litigation, except that if the award exceeds the policy limits of the subject underinsured motorist policy by more than $15,000, the amount shall be reduced to an amount equal to the policy limits plus $15,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(g)(ii): any of the following applicable costs:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(g)(ii)(A): any costs as set forth in Rule 54(d), Utah Rules of Civil Procedure;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(g)(ii)(B): the arbitrator or arbitration panel's fee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(g)(ii)(C): the reasonable costs of expert witnesses and depositions used in the presentation of evidence during arbitration or litigation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(h): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(h)(i): The covered person shall provide an affidavit of costs within five days of an arbitration award.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(h)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(h)(ii)(A): Objection to the affidavit of costs shall specify with particularity the costs to which the underinsured motorist carrier objects.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(h)(ii)(B): The objection shall be resolved by the arbitrator or arbitration panel.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(h)(iii): The award of costs by the arbitrator or arbitration panel under Subsection (9)(g)(ii) may not exceed $5,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(i)(i): A covered person shall disclose all material information, other than rebuttal evidence, within 30 days after a covered person elects to submit a claim for underinsured motorist coverage benefits to binding arbitration or files litigation as specified in Subsection (9)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(i)(ii): If the information under Subsection (9)(i)(i) is not disclosed, the covered person may not recover costs or any amounts in excess of the policy under Subsection (9)(g).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(j): This Subsection (9) does not limit any other cause of action that arose or may arise against the underinsured motorist carrier from the same dispute.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(k): The provisions of this Subsection (9) only apply to motor vehicle accidents that occur on or after March 30, 2010.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(l): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-305.3(9)(l)(i): The written demand requirement in Subsection (9)(a)(i)(A) does not affect the covered person's requirement to provide a computation of any other economic damages claimed, and the one or more respondents shall have a reasonable time after the receipt of the computation of any other economic damages claimed to conduct fact and expert discovery as to any additional damages claimed.  The changes made by Laws of Utah 2014, Chapter 290, Section 11, and Chapter 300, Section 11, to this Subsection (9)(l) and Subsection (9)(a)(i)(A) apply to a claim submitted to binding arbitration or through litigation on or after May 13, 2014.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307 Personal injury protection coverages and benefits.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1): Personal injury protection coverages and benefits include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(a): up to the minimum amount required coverage of not less than $3,000 per person, the reasonable value of all expenses for necessary:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(a)(i): medical services;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(a)(ii): surgical services;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(a)(iii): X-ray services;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(a)(iv): dental services;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(a)(v): rehabilitation services, including prosthetic devices;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(a)(vi): ambulance services;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(a)(vii): hospital services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(a)(viii): nursing services;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(b)(i): the lesser of $250 per week or 85% of any loss of gross income and loss of earning capacity per person from inability to work, for a maximum of 52 consecutive weeks after the loss, except that this benefit need not be paid for the first three days of disability, unless the disability continues for longer than two consecutive weeks after the date of injury; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(b)(ii): a special damage allowance not exceeding $20 per day for a maximum of 365 days, for services actually rendered or expenses reasonably incurred for services that, but for the injury, the injured person would have performed for the injured person's household, except that this benefit need not be paid for the first three days after the date of injury unless the person's inability to perform these services continues for more than two consecutive weeks;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(c): funeral, burial, or cremation benefits not to exceed a total of $1,500 per person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(1)(d): compensation on account of death of a person, payable to the person's heirs, in the total of $3,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(2): (1); 31A-22-309(1)(a)(vi); 59-9-105; (2); (2); (2)(e)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(2)(a): (1); 31A-22-309(1)(a)(vi); 59-9-105

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(2)(a)(v): Upon completion of the relative value study, the department shall prepare and publish a relative value study which sets forth the unit value and the 75th percentile charge assigned to each type of service and accommodation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(2)(b)(i): The reasonable value of any service or accommodation is determined by applying the unit value and the 75th percentile charge assigned to the service or accommodation under the relative value study.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-307(2)(b)(ii): If a service or accommodation is not assigned a unit value or the 75th percentile charge under the relative value study, the value of the service or accommodation shall equal the reasonable cost of the same or similar service or accommodation in the most populous county of this state.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-308 Persons covered by personal injury protection.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The following may receive benefits under personal injury protection coverage:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-308(1): the named insured, when injured in an accident involving any motor vehicle, regardless of whether the accident occurs in this state, the United States, its territories or possessions, or Canada, except where the injury is the result of the use or operation of the named insured's own motor vehicle not actually insured under the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-308(2): (1) persons related to the insured by blood, marriage, adoption, or guardianship who are residents of the insured's household, including those who usually make their home in the same household but temporarily live elsewhere under the circumstances described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-308(3): any other natural person whose injuries arise out of an automobile accident occurring while the person occupies a motor vehicle described in the policy with the express or implied consent of the named insured or while a pedestrian if he is injured in an accident occurring in Utah involving the described motor vehicle.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309 Limitations, exclusions, and conditions to personal injury protection.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(1)(a): A person who has or is required to have direct benefit coverage under a policy which includes personal injury protection may not maintain a cause of action for general damages arising out of personal injuries alleged to have been caused by an automobile accident, except where the person has sustained one or more of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(1)(a)(i): death;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(1)(a)(ii): dismemberment;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(1)(a)(iii): permanent disability or permanent impairment based upon objective findings;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(1)(a)(iv): permanent disfigurement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(1)(a)(v): a bone fracture; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(1)(a)(vi): medical expenses to a person in excess of $3,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(1)(b): (1)(a) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(2): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(2)(a): Any insurer issuing personal injury protection coverage under this part may only exclude from this coverage benefits:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(2)(a)(i): for any injury sustained by the insured while occupying another motor vehicle owned by or furnished for the regular use of the insured or a resident family member of the insured and not insured under the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(2)(a)(ii): for any injury sustained by any person while operating the insured motor vehicle without the express or implied consent of the insured or while not in lawful possession of the insured motor vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(2)(a)(iii): to any injured person, if the person's conduct contributed to the person's injury:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(2)(a)(iii)(A): by intentionally causing injury to the person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(2)(a)(iii)(B): while committing a felony;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(2)(a)(iv): for any injury sustained by any person arising out of the use of any motor vehicle while located for use as a residence or premises;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(2)(a)(v): for any injury due to war, whether or not declared, civil war, insurrection, rebellion or revolution, or to any act or condition incident to any of the foregoing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(2)(a)(vi): for any injury resulting from the radioactive, toxic, explosive, or other hazardous properties of nuclear materials.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-309(3)(b): any amounts which that person receives or is entitled to receive from the United States or any of its agencies because that person is on active duty in the military service.
