Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-619 Coordination of benefits.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-619(1): The commissioner shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-619(1)(a): adopt rules concerning the coordination of benefits between accident and health insurance policies;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-619(1)(b): publish a coordination of benefits guide;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-619(1)(c): post the coordination of benefits guide on the state insurance exchange; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-619(1)(d): work with the Health Data Authority, health care provider groups, and with state and national organizations that are developing uniform standards for the electronic exchange of health insurance claims to develop standardized language regarding coordination of benefits for the purpose of including the standardized language in an insurer's explanation of benefits.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-619(2): (1) Rules adopted by the commissioner under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-619(2)(a): may not prohibit coordination of benefits with individual accident and health insurance policies;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-619(2)(b): shall apply equally to all accident and health insurance policies without regard to whether the policies are group or individual policies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-619(2)(c): shall include standardized language regarding the coordination of benefits process that shall be included in each insurer's accident and health insurance policy.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620 Medicare Supplement Insurance Minimum Standards Act.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(1)(a): "Applicant" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(1)(a)(i): in the case of an individual Medicare supplement insurance policy, the person who seeks to contract for insurance benefits; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(1)(a)(ii): in the case of a group Medicare supplement insurance policy, the proposed certificate holder.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(1)(b): "Certificate" means any certificate delivered or issued for delivery in this state under a group Medicare supplement insurance policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(1)(c): "Certificate form" means the form on which the certificate is delivered or issued for delivery by the issuer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(1)(d): "Issuer" includes insurance companies, fraternal benefit societies, health care service plans, health maintenance organizations, and any other entity delivering, or issuing for delivery in this state, Medicare supplement insurance policies or certificates.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(1)(e): "Policy form" means the form on which the policy is delivered or issued for delivery by the issuer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(2)(a): Except as otherwise specifically provided, this section applies to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(2)(a)(i): all Medicare supplement insurance policies delivered or issued for delivery in this state on or after the effective date of this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(2)(a)(ii): all certificates issued under group Medicare supplement insurance policies, that have been delivered or issued for delivery in this state on or after the effective date of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(2)(a)(iii): policies or certificates that were in force prior to the effective date of this section, with respect to requirements for benefits, claims payment, and policy reporting practice under Subsection (3)(d), and loss ratios under Subsection (4).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(2)(b): This section does not apply to a policy of one or more employers or labor organizations, or of the trustees of a fund established by one or more employers or labor organizations, or a combination of employers and labor unions, for employees or former employees or a combination of employees and former employees, or for members or former members of the labor organizations, or a combination of members and former members of labor organizations.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(2)(c): This section does not prohibit, nor does it apply to insurance policies or health care benefit plans, including group conversion policies, provided to Medicare eligible persons that are not marketed or held out to be Medicare supplement insurance policies or benefit plans.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(a): A Medicare supplement insurance policy or certificate in force in the state may not contain benefits that duplicate benefits provided by Medicare.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(b): Notwithstanding any other provision of law of this state, a Medicare supplement policy or certificate may not exclude or limit benefits for loss incurred more than six months from the effective date of coverage because it involved a preexisting condition.  The policy or certificate may not define a preexisting condition more restrictively than: "A condition for which medical advice was given or treatment was recommended by or received from a physician within six months before the effective date of coverage."
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(c): The commissioner shall adopt rules to establish specific standards for policy provisions of Medicare supplement insurance policies and certificates.  The standards adopted shall be in addition to and in accordance with applicable laws of this state.  A requirement of this title relating to minimum required policy benefits, other than the minimum standards contained in this section, may not apply to Medicare supplement insurance policies and certificates.  The standards may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(c)(i): terms of renewability;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(c)(ii): initial and subsequent conditions of eligibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(c)(iii): nonduplication of coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(c)(iv): probationary periods;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(c)(v): benefit limitations, exceptions, and reductions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(c)(vi): elimination periods;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(c)(vii): requirements for replacement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(c)(viii): recurrent conditions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(c)(ix): definitions of terms.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(d): The commissioner shall adopt rules establishing minimum standards for benefits, claims payment, marketing practices, compensation arrangements, and reporting practices for Medicare supplement insurance policies and certificates.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(e): The commissioner may adopt rules to conform Medicare supplement insurance policies and certificates to the requirements of federal law and regulations, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(e)(i): requiring refunds or credits if the policies do not meet loss ratio requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(e)(ii): establishing a uniform methodology for calculating and reporting loss ratios;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(e)(iii): assuring public access to policies, premiums, and loss ratio information of issuers of Medicare supplement insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(e)(iv): establishing a process for approving or disapproving policy forms and certificate forms and proposed premium increases;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(e)(v): establishing a policy for holding public hearings prior to approval of premium increases;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(e)(vi): establishing standards for Medicare select policies and certificates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(e)(vii): nondiscrimination for genetic testing or genetic information.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(3)(f): The commissioner may adopt rules that prohibit policy provisions not otherwise specifically authorized by statute that, in the opinion of the commissioner, are unjust, unfair, or unfairly discriminatory to any person insured or proposed to be insured under a Medicare supplement insurance policy or certificate.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(4): Medicare supplement insurance policies shall return to policyholders benefits that are reasonable in relation to the premium charged.  The commissioner shall make rules to establish minimum standards for loss ratios of Medicare supplement insurance policies on the basis of incurred claims experience, or incurred health care expenses where coverage is provided by a health maintenance organization on a service basis rather than on a reimbursement basis, and earned premiums in accordance with accepted actuarial principles and practices.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(a): To provide for full and fair disclosure in the sale of Medicare supplement insurance, a Medicare supplement insurance policy or certificate may not be delivered in this state unless an outline of coverage is delivered to the applicant at the time application is made.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(b): The commissioner shall prescribe the format and content of the outline of coverage required by Subsection (5)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(c): For purposes of this section, "format" means style arrangements and overall appearance, including such items as the size, color, and prominence of type and arrangement of text and captions.  The outline of coverage shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(c)(i): a description of the principal benefits and coverage provided in the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(c)(ii): a statement of the renewal provisions, including any reservation by the issuer of a right to change premiums; and disclosure of the existence of any automatic renewal premium increases based on the policyholder's age; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(c)(iii): a statement that the outline of coverage is a summary of the policy issued or applied for and that the policy should be consulted to determine governing contractual provisions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(d): The commissioner may make rules for captions or notice if the commissioner finds that the rules are:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(d)(i): in the public interest; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(d)(ii): designed to inform prospective insureds that particular insurance coverages are not Medicare supplement coverages, for all accident and health insurance policies sold to persons eligible for Medicare, other than:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(d)(ii)(A): a Medicare supplement insurance policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(d)(ii)(B): a disability income policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(e): The commissioner may prescribe by rule a standard form and the contents of an informational brochure for persons eligible for Medicare, that is intended to improve the buyer's ability to select the most appropriate coverage and improve the buyer's understanding of Medicare.  Except in the case of direct response insurance policies, the commissioner may require by rule that the informational brochure be provided concurrently with delivery of the outline of coverage to any prospective insureds eligible for Medicare.  With respect to direct response insurance policies, the commissioner may require by rule that the prescribed brochure be provided upon request to any prospective insureds eligible for Medicare, but in no event later than the time of policy delivery.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(5)(f): The commissioner may adopt reasonable rules to govern the full and fair disclosure of the information in connection with the replacement of accident and health policies, subscriber contracts, or certificates by persons eligible for Medicare.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(6): Notwithstanding Subsection (1), Medicare supplement insurance policies and certificates shall have a notice prominently printed on the first page of the policy or certificate, or attached to the front page, stating in substance that the applicant has the right to return the policy or certificate within 30 days of its delivery and to have the premium refunded if, after examination of the policy or certificate, the applicant is not satisfied for any reason.  Any refund made pursuant to this section shall be paid directly to the applicant by the issuer in a timely manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(7): Every issuer of Medicare supplement insurance policies or certificates in this state shall provide a copy of any Medicare supplement insurance advertisement intended for use in this state, whether through written or broadcast medium, to the commissioner for review.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-620(8): The commissioner may adopt rules to conform Medicare and Medicare supplement insurance policies and certificates to the marketing requirements of federal law and regulation.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-623 Coverage of inborn metabolic errors.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-623(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-623(1)(a): "Dietary products" means medical food or a low protein modified food product that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-623(1)(a)(i): is specifically formulated to treat inborn errors of amino acid or urea cycle metabolism;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-623(1)(a)(ii): is not a natural food that is naturally low in protein; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-623(1)(a)(iii): is used under the direction of a physician.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-623(1)(b): "Inborn errors of amino acid or urea cycle metabolism" means a disease caused by an inherited abnormality of body chemistry which is treatable by the dietary restriction of one or more amino acid.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-623(2): The commissioner shall establish, by rule, minimum standards of coverage for dietary products used for the treatment of inborn errors of amino acid or urea cycle metabolism at levels consistent with the major medical benefit provided under an accident and health insurance policy.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625 Catastrophic coverage of mental health conditions.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(a)(i): "Catastrophic mental health coverage" means coverage in a health benefit plan that does not impose a lifetime limit, annual payment limit, episodic limit, inpatient or outpatient service limit, or maximum out-of-pocket limit that places a greater financial burden on an insured for the evaluation and treatment of a mental health condition than for the evaluation and treatment of a physical health condition.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(a)(ii): "Catastrophic mental health coverage" may include a restriction on cost sharing factors, such as deductibles, copayments, or coinsurance, before reaching a maximum out-of-pocket limit.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(a)(iii): "Catastrophic mental health coverage" may include one maximum out-of-pocket limit for physical health conditions and another maximum out-of-pocket limit for mental health conditions, except that if separate out-of-pocket limits are established, the out-of-pocket limit for mental health conditions may not exceed the out-of-pocket limit for physical health conditions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(b)(i): "50/50 mental health coverage" means coverage in a health benefit plan that pays for at least 50% of covered services for the diagnosis and treatment of mental health conditions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(b)(ii): "50/50 mental health coverage" may include a restriction on:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(b)(ii)(A): episodic limits;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(b)(ii)(B): inpatient or outpatient service limits; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(b)(ii)(C): maximum out-of-pocket limits.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(c): "Large employer" is as defined in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 300gg-91.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d)(i): "Mental health condition" means a condition or disorder involving mental illness that falls under a diagnostic category listed in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual, as periodically revised.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d)(ii): "Mental health condition" does not include the following when diagnosed as the primary or substantial reason or need for treatment:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d)(ii)(A): a marital or family problem;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d)(ii)(B): a social, occupational, religious, or other social maladjustment;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d)(ii)(C): a conduct disorder;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d)(ii)(D): a chronic adjustment disorder;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d)(ii)(E): a psychosexual disorder;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d)(ii)(F): a chronic organic brain syndrome;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d)(ii)(G): a personality disorder;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d)(ii)(H): a specific developmental disorder or learning disability; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(d)(ii)(I): an intellectual disability.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-625(1)(e): "Small employer" is as defined in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 300gg-91.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626 Coverage of diabetes.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(1)(a): "Diabetes" includes individuals with:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(1)(a)(i): complete insulin deficiency or type 1 diabetes;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(1)(a)(ii): insulin resistant with partial insulin deficiency or type 2 diabetes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(1)(a)(iii): elevated blood glucose levels induced by pregnancy or gestational diabetes.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(1)(b): "High deductible health plan" means the same as that term is defined in Section 223(c)(2), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(1)(c): "Lowest tier" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(1)(c)(i): the lowest cost tier of a health benefit plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(1)(c)(ii): the lowest cost-sharing level of a high deductible health plan that preserves the enrollee's ability to claim tax exempt contributions from the enrollee's health savings account under federal laws and regulations; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(1)(c)(iii): a discount or other cost-savings program that has the effect of equating cost-sharing of insulin to the health plan's lowest-cost tier.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(1)(d): "Therapy category" means a type of insulin that is distinct from other types of insulin due to a difference in onset, peak time, or duration.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(2): The commissioner shall establish, by rule, minimum standards of coverage for diabetes for accident and health insurance policies that provide a health insurance benefit before July 1, 2000.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3): (2) In making rules under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(a): with durational limits, amount limits, deductibles, and coinsurance for the treatment of diabetes equitable or identical to coverage provided for the treatment of other illnesses or diseases; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b): that provide coverage for:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(i): diabetes self-management training and patient management, including medical nutrition therapy as defined by rule, provided by an accredited or certified program and referred by an attending physician within the plan and consistent with the health plan provisions for self-management education:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(i)(A): recognized by the federal Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(i)(B): certified by the Department of Health; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(ii): the following equipment, supplies, and appliances to treat diabetes when medically necessary:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(ii)(A): blood glucose monitors, including those for the legally blind;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(ii)(B): test strips for blood glucose monitors;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(ii)(C): visual reading urine and ketone strips;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(ii)(D): lancets and lancet devices;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(ii)(E): insulin;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(ii)(F): injection aides, including those adaptable to meet the needs of the legally blind, and infusion delivery systems;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(ii)(G): syringes;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(ii)(H): prescriptive oral agents for controlling blood glucose levels; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(3)(b)(ii)(I): glucagon kits.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(4): If a health benefit plan entered into or renewed on or after January 1, 2021, provides coverage for insulin for diabetes, the health benefit plan shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(4)(a): cap the total amount that an insured is required to pay for at least one insulin in each therapy category at an amount not to exceed $30 per prescription of a 30-day supply of insulin for the treatment of diabetes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-626(4)(b): apply the cap to an insured regardless of whether the insured has met the plan's deductible.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627 Coverage of emergency medical services.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(1): A health insurance policy or managed care organization contract:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(1)(a): shall provide coverage of emergency services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(1)(b): may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(1)(b)(i): require any form of preauthorization for treatment of an emergency medical condition until after the insured's condition has been stabilized;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(1)(b)(ii): deny a claim for any covered evaluation, covered diagnostic test, or other covered treatment considered medically necessary to stabilize the emergency medical condition of an insured; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(1)(b)(iii): impose any cost-sharing requirement for out-of-network that exceeds the cost-sharing requirement imposed for in-network.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(2)(a): A health insurance policy or managed care organization contract may require authorization for the continued treatment of an emergency medical condition after the insured's condition has been stabilized.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(2)(b): (2)(a) If authorization described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(3): For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(3)(a): "Hospital emergency department" means that area of a hospital in which emergency services are provided on a 24-hour-a-day basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(3)(b): "Stabilize" means the same as that term is defined in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1395dd(e)(3).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(4): Nothing in this section may be construed as:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(4)(a): altering the level or type of benefits that are provided under the terms of a contract or policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(4)(b): restricting a policy or contract from providing enhanced benefits for certain emergency medical conditions that are identified in the policy or contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(5): 31A-2-308 Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(5)(a): work with the insurer to improve the insurer's compliance with this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(5)(b): impose the following fines:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(5)(b)(i): not more than $5,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-627(5)(b)(ii): twice the amount of any profit gained from violations of this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-628 Standing referral to a specialist.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-628(1): With respect to a health insurance policy or managed care organization contract that does not allow an insured to have direct access to a health care specialist, the insurer shall establish and implement a procedure by which an insured may obtain a standing referral to a health care specialist.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-628(2): (1) The procedure established under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-628(2)(a): shall provide for a standing referral to a specialist if the insured's primary care provider determines, in consultation with the specialist, that the insured needs continuing care from the specialist; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-628(2)(b): may require the insurer's approval of a treatment plan designed by the specialist, in consultation with the primary care provider and the insured, which may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-628(2)(b)(i): a limit on the number of visits to the specialist;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-628(2)(b)(ii): a time limit on the duration of the referral; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-628(2)(b)(iii): mandatory updates on the insured's condition.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629 Adverse benefit determination review process.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1): (6); 31A-1-301; 31A-1-301 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(i): "Adverse benefit determination" means the:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(i)(A): denial of a benefit;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(i)(B): reduction of a benefit;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(i)(C): termination of a benefit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(i)(D): failure to provide or make payment, in whole or in part, for a benefit.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(ii): "Adverse benefit determination" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(ii)(A): denial, reduction, termination, or failure to provide or make payment that is based on a determination of an insured's or a beneficiary's eligibility to participate in a plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(ii)(B): denial, reduction, or termination of, or a failure to provide or make payment, in whole or in part, for, a benefit resulting from the application of a utilization review; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(ii)(C): failure to cover an item or service for which benefits are otherwise provided because it is determined to be:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(ii)(C)(I): experimental;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(ii)(C)(II): investigational; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(a)(ii)(C)(III): not medically necessary or appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(b): "Independent review" means a process that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(b)(i): is a voluntary option for the resolution of an adverse benefit determination;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(b)(ii): is conducted at the discretion of the claimant;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(b)(iii): is conducted by an independent review organization designated by the commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(b)(iv): renders an independent and impartial decision on an adverse benefit determination submitted by an insured; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(b)(v): may not require the insured to pay a fee for requesting the independent review.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(c): (6) "Independent review organization" means a person, subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(d): 31A-1-301 "Insured" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(e): 31A-1-301 "Insurer" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(e)(i): a health maintenance organization; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(e)(ii): a third party administrator that offers, sells, manages, or administers a health insurance policy or health maintenance organization contract that is subject to this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(1)(f): "Internal review" means the process an insurer uses to review an insured's adverse benefit determination before the adverse benefit determination is submitted for independent review.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(2): This section applies generally to health insurance policies, health maintenance organization contracts, and income replacement or disability income policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(3)(a): An insured may submit an adverse benefit determination to the insurer.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-629(3)(c)(i): payment of a claim regarding medical necessity; or

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-630 Mastectomy coverage.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-630(1): If an insured has coverage that provides medical and surgical benefits with respect to a mastectomy, it shall provide coverage, with consultation of the attending physician and the patient, for:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-630(1)(a): reconstruction of the breast on which the mastectomy has been performed;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-630(1)(b): surgery and reconstruction of the breast on which the mastectomy was not performed to produce symmetrical appearance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-630(1)(c): prostheses and physical complications with regards to all stages of mastectomy, including lymphedemas.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-630(2): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-630(2)(a): This section does not prevent an accident and health insurer from imposing cost-sharing measures for health benefits relating to this coverage, if cost-sharing measures are not greater than those imposed on any other medical condition.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-630(2)(b): (2) For purposes of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-630(3): (1) Written notice of the availability of the coverage described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-630(3)(a): upon enrollment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-630(3)(b): annually after the enrollment.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643 Prescription synchronization -- Copay and dispensing fee restrictions.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(1): 31A-22-634(1); 58-17b-102 For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(1)(a): "Copay" means the copay normally charged for a prescription drug.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(1)(b): 31A-22-634(1) "Health insurer" means an insurer, as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(1)(c): "Network pharmacy" means a pharmacy included in a health insurance plan's network of pharmacy providers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(1)(d): 58-17b-102 "Prescription drug" means a prescription drug, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(2): A health insurance plan may not charge an amount in excess of the copay for the dispensing of a prescription drug in a quantity less than the prescribed amount if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(2)(a): the pharmacy dispenses the prescription drug in accordance with the health insurer's synchronization policy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(2)(b): the prescription drug is dispensed by a network pharmacy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(3): A health insurance plan that includes a prescription drug benefit:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(3)(a): shall implement a synchronization policy for the dispensing of prescription drugs to the plan's enrollees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(3)(b): may not base the dispensing fee for an individual prescription on the quantity of the prescription drug dispensed to fill or refill the prescription unless otherwise agreed to by the plan and the contracted pharmacy at the time the individual requests synchronization.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-643(4): This section applies to health benefit plans renewed or entered into on or after January 1, 2015.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-644 Denial of coverage under a health benefit plan because of life expectancy or terminal condition.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-644(1)(b)(i): caused by disease, illness, or injury; and

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-644(1)(b)(ii)(B): the application of life-sustaining treatment only prolongs the process of dying.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646(1)(a)(ii): is not merely nominal, for the purpose of avoiding the requirements of this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646(2)(a): This section applies to:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646(2)(a)(ii): an administrator providing third-party administration services or a provider network for a dental plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646(2)(b): This section does not apply to a self-insured dental plan that is regulated by federal law.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646(3)(b): prohibit a dentist from offering or providing noncovered dental services to a covered individual at a fee determined by the dentist and the individual who will receive the noncovered services.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1): 31A-22-646 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(a): "Contracting entity" means a person that enters into a direct contract with a provider for the delivery of dental services in the ordinary course of business, including a third party administrator or a dental carrier.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(d)(i): "Dental services" means services for the diagnosis, prevention, treatment, or cure of a dental condition, illness, injury, or disease.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(d)(ii): "Dental services" does not include services that a provider delivers and bills as medical expenses under a health benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(e)(i): "Dental service contractor" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(e)(i)(A): accepts prepayment for dental services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(e)(i)(B): for the benefit of another individual, accepts payment for providing to the individual the opportunity to receive dental services in the future.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(e)(ii): "Dental service contractor" does not include a provider or professional dental corporation that accepts prepayment on a fee-for-service basis for providing specific dental services to individual patients for whom the services have been pre-diagnosed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(f): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(f)(i): "Provider" means a person who, acting within the scope of licensure or certification, provides dental services or supplies defined by the dental plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(f)(ii): "Provider" does not include a physician organization or physician hospital organization that leases or rents the physician organization's or physician hospital organization's network to a third party.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(g): "Provider network contract" means a contract between a contracting entity and a provider that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(g)(i): specifies the rights and responsibilities of the contracting entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(g)(ii): provides for the delivery and payment of dental services to an enrollee.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(h)(i): "Third party" means a person that enters into a contract with a contracting entity or with another third party to gain access to the dental services or contractual discounts of a provider network contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-646.1(1)(h)(ii): "Third party" does not include an employer or other group for whom the dental carrier or contracting entity provides administrative services.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-655 Living organ donor coverage.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-655(1): For the purposes of this section, "living organ donor" means an individual who has donated all or part of an organ and is not deceased.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-655(2): An insurer may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-655(2)(a): deny eligibility for coverage or limit coverage of a individual under an accident and health insurance policy or contract solely due to the status of the individual as a living organ donor;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-655(2)(b): preclude an individual from donating all or part of an organ as a condition of receiving or continuing to receive coverage under an accident and health insurance policy or contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-655(2)(c): discriminate in the offering, issuance, cancellation, amount of coverage, price, or any other condition of an accident and health insurance policy or contract for an individual based upon the status of the individual as a living organ donor without any additional actuarial risk.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-655(3): The commissioner shall make educational materials available to insurers and the public on the access of living organ donors to insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-655(4): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The commissioner may make rules in accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-660 Definitions -- Prohibitions concerning organ harvesting -- Severability.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-660(1): As used in this section, "forced organ harvesting" means the removal of one or more organs from a living individual, or from an individual killed for the purpose of removal of one or more of the individual's organs, by means of coercion, abduction, deception, fraud, or abuse of power or a position of vulnerability.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-660(2): An issuer of accident and health insurance may not cover a human organ transplant or post-transplant care if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-660(2)(a): the human organ transplant operation is performed in the People's Republic of China or any other country known to have participated in forced organ harvesting, as designated pursuant to Subsection (3); or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-660(2)(b): the human organ to be transplanted was procured by sale or donation originating in the People's Republic of China or any other country known to have participated in forced organ harvesting, as designated pursuant to Subsection (3).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-660(3): 26B-1-203
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-660(3)(a): 26B-1-203 The deputy director of the Department of Health and Human Services described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-660(3)(b): If the deputy director designates an additional country under Subsection (3)(a), the deputy director shall provide written notice to the executive director of the Department of Health and Human Services and the insurance commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-660(4): 31A-22-661 If any provision of this section or the application of any provision of this section to any person or circumstance is held to be invalid, the remainder of this section shall be given effect without the invalid provision or application. Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-661 Health benefit plan procedures related to prescription drugs.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-661(1): As used in this section, "long-term drug" means an enrollee's prescription drug where the prescription has been active for at least 180 days with the health benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-661(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-661(2)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (2)(b), before a health benefit plan requires an enrollee to change from a prescribed long-term drug to another drug, the health benefit plan shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-661(2)(a)(i): at least 30 days before the day on which the health benefit plan will require the enrollee to change from the long-term drug to another drug, provide notice that the health benefit plan will require the individual to change to another drug; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-661(2)(a)(ii): provide a justification for the change upon request.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-661(2)(b): Subsection (2)(a) does not apply if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-661(2)(b)(i): the change requires the individual to try a generic or a biosimilar of the long-term drug; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-661(2)(b)(ii): the long-term drug is not on the health benefit plan's formulary.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-661(3): A health benefit plan shall provide an enrollee a justification as to why an enrollee must try a certain drug before a health benefit plan will cover a different prescribed drug.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-661(4): This section does not apply to a drug that is provided under the health benefit plan's medical benefit.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701 Groups eligible for group or blanket insurance.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1): 31A-22-502; 31A-22-503; 31A-22-504; 31A-22-505; 31A-22-506; 31A-22-507 A group insurance policy offering accident and health insurance may be issued to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(a): 31A-22-502; 31A-22-503; 31A-22-504; 31A-22-505; 31A-22-506; 31A-22-507 a group:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(a)(i): 31A-22-502; 31A-22-503; 31A-22-504; 31A-22-505; 31A-22-506; 31A-22-507 to which a group life insurance policy may be issued under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(a)(ii): that is formed and maintained in good faith for a purpose other than obtaining insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(b): a group specifically authorized by the commissioner, upon a finding that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(b)(i): authorization is not contrary to the public interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(b)(ii): the group is actuarially sound;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(b)(iii): formation of the proposed group may result in economies of scale in acquisition, administrative, marketing, and brokerage costs;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(b)(iv): the insurance policy, insurance certificate, or other indicia of coverage that will be offered to the proposed group is substantially equivalent to insurance policies that are otherwise available to similar groups;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(b)(v): the group would not present hazards of adverse selection;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(b)(vi): the premiums for the insurance policy and any contributions by or on behalf of the insured persons are reasonable in relation to the benefits provided; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(b)(vii): the group is formed and maintained in good faith for a purpose other than obtaining insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(c): a postsecondary educational institution covering students, upon a finding that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(c)(i): the policy provides standards for financial soundness;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(c)(ii): the policy protects the students covered;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(c)(iii): the policy provides for the establishment of a financially viable alternative to traditional health care plans;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(c)(iv): authorization is not contrary to the public interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(c)(v): the policy would not present hazards of adverse selection; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(1)(c)(vi): the premiums for the policy and any contributions by or on behalf of the insured persons are reasonable in relation to the benefits provided.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2): A blanket insurance policy offering accident and health insurance:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(a): covers a defined class of persons;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(b): may not be offered or underwritten on an individual basis;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(c): shall cover only a group that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(c)(i): actuarially sound; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(c)(ii): formed and maintained in good faith for a purpose other than obtaining insurance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(d): may be issued only to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(d)(i): a common carrier or an operator, owner, or lessee of a means of transportation, as policyholder, covering persons who may become passengers as defined by reference to the person's travel status;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(d)(ii): an employer, as policyholder, covering any group of employees, dependents, or guests, as defined by reference to specified hazards incident to any activities of the policyholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(d)(iii): an institution of learning, including a school district, a school jurisdictional unit, or the head, principal, or governing board of a school jurisdictional unit, as policyholder, covering students, teachers, or employees;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(d)(iv): a religious, charitable, recreational, educational, or civic organization, or branch of one of those organizations, as policyholder, covering a group of members or participants as defined by reference to specified hazards incident to the activities sponsored or supervised by the policyholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(d)(v): a sports team, camp, or sponsor of a sports team or camp, as policyholder, covering members, campers, employees, officials, or supervisors;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(d)(vi): a volunteer fire department, first aid, civil defense, or other similar volunteer organization, as policyholder, covering a group of members or participants as defined by reference to specified hazards incident to activities sponsored, supervised, or participated in by the policyholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(d)(vii): a newspaper or other publisher, as policyholder, covering its carriers;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(d)(viii): a labor union, as a policyholder, covering a group of members or participants as defined by reference to specified hazards incident to the activities or operations sponsored or supervised by the policyholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(d)(ix): an association that has a constitution and bylaws covering a group of members or participants as defined by reference to specified hazards incident to the activities or operations sponsored or supervised by the policyholder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-701(2)(d)(x): any other class of risks that, in the judgment of the commissioner, may be properly eligible for a blanket insurance policy offering accident and health insurance.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-702 Adjustment of premium rate and application of dividends or rate reductions.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any group accident and health insurance policy may provide for the adjustment of the rate of premium based upon the experience under the contract.  If a policy dividend is declared or a reduction in rate is made or continued for the first or any subsequent year of insurance under any policy of group accident and health insurance, the excess, if any, of the aggregate dividends or rate reductions under the policy and all other group insurance policies of the policyholder over the aggregate expenditure for insurance under those policies made from funds contributed by the policyholder, including expenditures made in connection with the administration of the policies, shall be applied by the policyholder for the sole benefit of insured employees or members unless the insured employee or member explicitly elects otherwise.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-716 Required provision for notice of termination.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-716(1): A group insurance policy offering accident and health insurance or a blanket insurance policy offering accident and health insurance shall include a provision that obligates the policyholder:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-716(1)(a): to give written notice of termination to each employee or group member 30 days before the day on which the policy terminates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-716(1)(b): to notify each employee or group member of the employee's or group member's rights to continue coverage upon termination.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-716(2): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-716(2)(a): (1) An insurer's monthly notice to the policyholder of premium payments due shall include a statement of the policyholder's obligations as set forth in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-716(2)(b): Insurers shall provide a sample notice to the policyholder at least once a year.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-717 Provisions pertaining to service members and their families affected by mobilization into the armed forces.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
For a group insurance policy offering accident and health insurance or a blanket insurance policy offering accident and health insurance, an insurer:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-717(1): may not refuse to reinstate an insured or the insured's family whose coverage lapsed due to the insured's mobilization into the United States armed forces provided application is made within 180 days after the day on which the insured is released from active duty;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-717(2): shall reinstate an insured in full upon payment of the first premium without the requirement of a waiting period or exclusion for preexisting conditions or any other underwriting requirements that were covered previously; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-717(3): may not increase the insured's premium in excess of what the premium would have been increased to in the normal course of time had the insured not been mobilized into the United States armed forces.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-726 Abortion coverage restriction in health benefit plan and on health insurance exchange.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-726(1): 76-5-402; 76-5-402.1; 76-5-406(2)(j); 76-7-102 As used in this section, "permitted abortion coverage" means coverage for abortion:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-726(1)(a): that is necessary to avert:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-726(1)(a)(i): the death of the woman on whom the abortion is performed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-726(1)(a)(ii): a serious risk of substantial and irreversible impairment of a major bodily function of the woman on whom the abortion is performed;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-726(1)(b): of a fetus that has a defect that is documented by a physician or physicians to be uniformly diagnosable and uniformly lethal; or

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-801 Scope of part.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-801(1): (2) Except as provided under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-801(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-801(2)(a): Insurance written in connection with a credit transaction is not subject to this part, but is subject to other provisions of this title, if the credit transaction is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-801(2)(a)(i): secured by a first mortgage or deed of trust; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-801(2)(a)(ii): made to finance the purchase of real property or the construction of a dwelling thereon, or to refinance a prior credit transaction made for such a purpose.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-802 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-802(1): "Credit transaction" means any transaction under which the payment for money loaned or for goods, services, or properties sold or leased is to be made on future dates.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-802(2): "Creditor" means the lender of money or the vendor or lessor of goods, services, or property, for which payment is arranged through a credit transaction, or any successor to the right, title, or interest of any lender or vendor.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-802(3): "Debtor" means a borrower of money or a purchaser, including a lessee under a lease intended as security, of goods, services, or property, for which payment is arranged through a credit transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-802(4): "Indebtedness" means the total amount payable by a debtor to a creditor in connection with a credit transaction, including principal finance charges and interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-802(5): "Net indebtedness" means the total amount required to liquidate the indebtedness, exclusive of any unearned interest, any insurance on the monthly outstanding balance coverage, or any finance charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-802(6): "Net written premiums" means gross written premiums minus refunds on termination.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-803 Forms of insurance permitted.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Credit life insurance and credit accident and health insurance may be issued only in the following forms:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-803(1): individual policies of term life insurance issued to debtors;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-803(2): individual policies of term accident and health insurance issued to debtors, or accident and health benefit provisions in individual policies of credit life insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-803(3): group policies of term life insurance issued to creditors, providing insurance upon the lives of debtors;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-803(4): group policies of term accident and health insurance issued to creditors insuring debtors, or accident and health benefit provisions in group credit life insurance policies.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-809 Right of debtor to choose insurer.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
When credit life insurance or credit accident and health insurance is required as security for any indebtedness, the creditor shall inform the debtor of the debtor's option to furnish the required insurance through existing policies of insurance owned or controlled by the debtor or to procure and furnish the required coverage through any insurer authorized to transact life or accident and health insurance in Utah.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1002 Duration of coverage.
-------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1002(1)(a): by agreement between the Division of Industrial Accidents in the Labor Commission, the insurer, and the employer; or

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1003 Comprehensive coverage.
---------------------------------------------------------
Every insurance policy covering the liability of an employer under

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1004 Direct enforcement by employees.
------------------------------------------------------------------
All workers' compensation insurance policies shall contain a provision that employees may enforce, in their own names, the liability of the insurer.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1005 Payment as bar to recovery.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Payment of compensation under a workers' compensation insurance policy, whether in whole or in part, by either the employer or the insurer, bars recovery by the employee or his dependents to the extent of the payment.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1006 Insurer's constructive knowledge.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Every workers' compensation policy or contract shall contain a provision that, as between the employee and the insurer, notice to or knowledge of the occurrence of the injury on the part of the employer is considered to be notice or knowledge to the insurer.  This provision shall also state that the insurer is bound by and subject to the orders, findings, decisions, and awards rendered against the employer for the payment of compensation on account of compensable accidental injuries or occupational disease disability.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1007 Employer's insolvency.
--------------------------------------------------------
Every workers' compensation policy or contract shall contain a provision that the insolvency of the employer and his discharge does not relieve the insurer from the payment of compensation for injuries or death sustained by an employee during the life of that policy or contract.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1008 Employer's breach of safety rules.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
No condition in a workers' compensation policy requiring the insured employer to comply with certain safety rules may excuse the workers' compensation insurer from paying the required benefits to an employee injured as a result of the employer's breach of a safety rule that is a condition to the workers' compensation policy.   However, the insurer may bring a claim against the insured employer for breach of the policy condition.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1009 Other applicable provisions.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Workers' compensation insurance contracts are subject to any applicable requirements of

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1010(1): An insurer authorized to transact the business of workers' compensation in this state may issue a workers' compensation insurance policy that provides for the insured to participate in the payment of the insurance claims and losses covered by the policy in accordance with rules made by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1010(2): (1); Title 34A, Chapter 2, Workers' Compensation Act; Chapter 3, Utah Occupational Disease Act Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1010(2)(a): Title 34A, Chapter 2, Workers' Compensation Act; Chapter 3, Utah Occupational Disease Act shall assume responsibility to pay all claims and losses under a workers' compensation insurance policy in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1010(2)(b): may not permit the insured to participate in the payment of the insurance claims and losses by any means except reimbursement of the insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1010(2)(c): may not permit an employee to participate in the payment of claims or losses.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1101 Combination of lines.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1101(1): Legal expense insurance may be transacted alone or together with life insurance, accident and health insurance, or casualty insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1101(2): (3) An insurer may not transact liability insurance and also issue legal expense insurance policies providing coverage for the expense of enforcing claims against third persons, unless the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1101(3): Adequate precautions shall be taken to make sure that the handling of an insured's claim for legal assistance in enforcing a claim against a third person is not affected by the insurer's actual or potential obligation as a liability insurer to pay the claim for the third person. These precautions may include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1101(3)(a): a provision in the policy that claims against third persons shall be handled exclusively by attorneys selected by the insureds themselves rather than by the insurer, that no information about the case other than the name of the defendant and the nature of the claim may be made available to the insurer, and that the insurer may not interfere with the handling of the case; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1101(3)(b): organizational separation between the legal expense and the liability insurance departments with respect to management, accounting, record keeping, and claims handling, with appropriate rules and procedures, satisfactory to the commissioner, to prevent the exchange of information between the two departments about details of cases.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102 Policy and certificate forms.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(1): Legal expense insurance may be written as individual, group, blanket, or franchise insurance.  Each contractual obligation for legal expense insurance shall be evidenced by a policy.  Each person insured under a group policy shall be issued a certificate of coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(2): 31A-21-201 Policies and certificates of legal expense insurance are subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(3): The commissioner may not approve any form that does not meet all of the following requirements:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(3)(a): Policies shall contain a list and description of the legal services promised or the legal matters for which expenses are to be reimbursed, and any limits on the amounts to be reimbursed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(3)(b): Certificates issued under group policies shall contain a full statement of the benefits provided, but may summarize the other terms of the master policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(3)(c): Policies promising legal services to be provided by a limited number of attorneys who have concluded provider contracts with the insurer, whether the attorney in an individual case is to be selected by the insured or by the insurer, shall provide for alternative benefits in case the insured is unable to find a participating attorney willing to perform the promised services or the attorney selected by the insurer is disqualified or otherwise unable to perform the promised services.  The alternative benefit may consist of furnishing the services of an attorney selected and paid by the insurer or paying the fee of an attorney selected by the insured.  The policy shall also provide a procedure that includes impartial review for settling disagreements about the grounds for demanding an alternative benefit.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(3)(d): No policy, except one issued by a mutual insurance company, may provide for assessments on policyholders or for reductions of benefits to maintain the insurer's solvency.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(4): The commissioner may disapprove a policy or certificate form if he finds that it:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(4)(a): is unfair, unfairly discriminatory, misleading, or encourages misrepresentation or misunderstanding of the contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(4)(b): provides coverage or benefits or contains other provisions that would endanger the solidity of the insurer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(4)(c): is contrary to law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1102(5): The commissioner may require the submission of relevant information he considers to be reasonably necessary in determining whether to approve or disapprove a filing.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1203 Right of reinsurer to defend claim.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
A reinsurance contract may provide that the receiver of a ceding insurer shall, within a specified or reasonable time after the claim is filed in court or in the receivership, give written notice to an assuming reinsurer of all or part of the claim against the ceding insurer.  During the pendency of the claim, any assuming reinsurer may investigate the claim and unless forbidden to do so by the reinsurance agreement, may intervene in the proceeding in which the claim is pending and interpose any defenses it considers available which have not been raised by the ceding insurer or its receiver.  The expenses incurred by the assuming reinsurer in this type of action are payable up to the amount of the expenses or the amount of the benefit produced, whichever is less, as expenses of the receivership.  If two or more assuming reinsurers have potential liability because of the same claim, the expenses shall be apportioned among them in proportion to the benefit received.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1204 Approval required for bulk insurance.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Reinsurance credit is not allowed to a domestic insurer for reinsurance ceded when such reinsurance constitutes all or substantially all of the insurance in force of the domestic insurer, unless the agreement purporting to transfer the reinsurance is in writing and:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1204(1): approved by the commissioner prior to execution of the agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1204(2): provides that the agreement is subject to the approval of the commissioner.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1300 Aircraft public liability insurance.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Policies containing aircraft public liability insurance coverage for an aircraft shall include minimum coverage of:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1300(1): $50,000 per person for bodily injury or death in any one accident;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1300(2): $50,000 for property damage in any one accident; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1300(3): $100,000 in any one accident, whether for property damage, or bodily injury or death.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1401 Application.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1401(1): The requirements of this part apply to individual policies and to group policies and certificates marketed in this state on or after July 1, 2001.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1401(2): Entities subject to this part shall comply with other applicable insurance laws and rules unless they are in conflict with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1401(3): The laws, regulations, and rules designed and intended to apply to Medicare supplement insurance policies may not be applied to long-term care insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1401(4): Any policy or rider advertised, marketed, or offered as long-term care or nursing home insurance shall comply with the provisions of this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1405 Restrictions on terms of coverage.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
No long-term care insurance policy may:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1405(1): be canceled, nonrenewed, or otherwise terminated on the grounds of the age or the deterioration of the mental or physical health of the insured individual or certificate holder;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1405(2): contain a provision establishing a new waiting period in the event existing coverage is converted to or replaced by a new or other form within the same company, except with respect to an increase in benefits voluntarily selected by the insured individual or group policyholder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1405(3): provide coverage for skilled nursing care only or provide significantly more coverage for skilled care in a facility than coverage for lower levels of care.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1406 Preexisting conditions.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1406(1): A long-term care insurance policy or certificate may not use a definition of a preexisting condition which is more restrictive than the following: "Preexisting condition means a condition for which medical advice or treatment was recommended by or received from a provider of health care services, within six months preceding the effective date of coverage of an insured person."
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1406(2): A long-term care insurance policy or certificate may not exclude coverage for a loss or confinement which is the result of a preexisting condition unless such loss or confinement begins within six months following the effective date of coverage of an insured person.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1406(3): (1); (2) The commissioner may extend the preexisting condition periods provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1406(4): (2); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1406(4)(a): The definition of preexisting condition does not prohibit an insurer from using an application form designed to elicit the complete health history of an applicant and from underwriting in accordance with that insurer's established underwriting standards on the basis of the answers on that application.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1406(4)(b): (2) Unless otherwise provided in the policy or certificate, a preexisting condition, regardless of whether it is disclosed on the application, need not be covered until the waiting period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1406(4)(c): (2) A long-term care insurance policy or certificate may not exclude or use waivers or riders of any kind to exclude, limit, or reduce coverage or benefits for specifically named or described preexisting diseases or physical condition beyond the waiting period described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1407 Restricted conditional terms.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1407(1): A long-term care insurance policy may not contain a provision that conditions eligibility:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1407(1)(a): for any benefits on a prior hospitalization requirement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1407(1)(b): for benefits provided in an institutional care setting on the receipt of a higher level of institutional care; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1407(1)(c): for any benefits on a prior institutionalization requirement except for eligibility for:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1407(1)(c)(i): waiver of premium;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1407(1)(c)(ii): post confinement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1407(1)(c)(iii): post-acute care; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1407(1)(c)(iv): recuperative benefits.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1407(2): A long-term care insurance policy containing post confinement, post-acute care, or recuperative benefits shall clearly label the limitations or conditions, including any required number of days of confinement in a separate paragraph of the policy or certificate that is entitled "Limitations or Conditions on Eligibility for Benefits."
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1407(3): A long-term care insurance policy or rider that conditions eligibility of noninstitutional benefits on the prior receipt of institutional care may not require a prior institutional stay of more than 30 days.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1408 Right of return -- Notice.
------------------------------------------------------------
Individual long-term care insurance policyholders and certificate holders other than employee and labor union certificate holders have the right to return the policy within 30 days of its delivery and to have the premium refunded if the policyholder is not satisfied for any reason after examination of the policy.  Individual long-term care insurance policies shall have a notice prominently printed on the first page of the policy or attached to the policy stating in substance that the policyholder has the right to return the policy within 30 days of its delivery and to have the premium refunded if the policyholder is not satisfied for any reason after examination of the policy.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409 Statements of coverage.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(1): An outline of coverage shall be delivered to a prospective applicant for long-term care insurance at the time of initial solicitation through means which prominently direct the attention of the applicant to the document and its purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(2): The commissioner may prescribe a standard format of an outline of coverage, including style, arrangement, and overall appearance, and the content.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(3): In the case of agent solicitations an agent shall deliver the outline of coverage prior to the presentation of any application or enrollment form.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(4): In the case of direct response solicitations, the outline of coverage shall be presented in conjunction with any application or enrollment form.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(5): An outline of coverage under this section shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(5)(a): a description of the principal benefits and coverage provided in the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(5)(b): a statement of the principal exclusions, reductions, and limitations contained in the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(5)(c): a statement of the terms under which the policy or certificate, or both, may be continued in force or discontinued, including any reservation in the policy of a right to change premium;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(5)(d): a specific description of continuation or conversion provisions of group coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(5)(e): a statement that the outline of coverage is not a contract of insurance but a summary only and that the policy or group master policy contains governing contractual provisions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(5)(f): a description of the terms under which the policy or certificate may be returned and premium refunded;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(5)(g): a brief description of the relationship of cost of care and benefits; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(5)(h): a statement that discloses to the policyholder or certificate holder whether the policy is intended to be a federally tax-qualified, long-term care insurance contract under Section 7702B(b), Internal Revenue Code.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(6): A certificate issued pursuant to a group long-term care insurance policy, which policy is delivered or issued for delivery in this state, shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(6)(a): a description of the principal benefits and coverage provided in the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(6)(b): a statement of the principal exclusions, reductions, and limitations contained in the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(6)(c): a statement that the group master policy determines governing contractual provisions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(6)(d): a statement that any long-term care inflation protection option required by rule is not available under the policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(7): If an application for a long-term care contract or certificate is approved, the issuer shall deliver the contract or certificate of insurance to the applicant no later than 30 days after the date of approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(8): At the time of policy delivery, a policy summary shall be delivered for an individual life insurance policy which provides long-term care benefits within the policy or by rider.  In the case of direct response solicitations, the insurer shall deliver the policy summary upon the applicant's request.  However, the insurer shall deliver the summary to the applicant no later than at the time of policy delivery regardless of request.  In addition to complying with all applicable requirements, the summary shall also include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(8)(a): an explanation of how the long-term care benefit interacts with other components of the policy, including deductions from death benefits;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(8)(b): an illustration for each covered person of the amount of benefits, the length of benefit, and the guaranteed lifetime benefits if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(8)(c): any exclusions, reductions, and limitations on benefits of long-term care; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(8)(d): if applicable to the policy type, the summary shall also include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(8)(d)(i): a disclosure of the effects of exercising other rights under the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(8)(d)(ii): a disclosure of guarantees related to long-term care costs of insurance charges; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(8)(d)(iii): current and projected maximum lifetime benefits.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(9): (8) The provisions of the policy summary required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(9)(a): a basic illustration; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1409(9)(b): the life insurance policy summary required to be delivered in accordance with rule.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1410 Report to policyholder.
---------------------------------------------------------
A monthly report shall be provided to the policyholder any time a long-term care benefit funded through a life insurance vehicle by the acceleration of the death benefit is in benefit payment status.  The report shall include:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1410(1): any long-term care benefits paid out during the month;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1410(2): an explanation of any changes in the policy due to long-term care benefits being paid out such as death benefits or cash values; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1410(3): the amount of long-term care benefits existing or remaining.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1411 Incontestability period.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1411(1): For a policy or certificate that has been in force for less than six months, an insurer may rescind a long-term care insurance policy or certificate upon a showing of misrepresentation that is material to the acceptance for coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1411(2): For a policy or certificate that has been in force for at least six months but less than two years, an insurer may rescind a long-term care insurance policy or certificate upon a showing of misrepresentation that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1411(2)(a): is material to the acceptance for coverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1411(2)(b): pertains to the condition for which benefits are sought.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1413 Claim information.
----------------------------------------------------
If a claim under a long-term care insurance contract is denied, within 60 days of the date a written request by the policyholder or a representative of a policyholder is filed with the insurer, the insurer shall:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1413(1): provide a written explanation of the reason for the denial; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1413(2): make available all information directly related to the denial.

--------------------------------------------
A policy or rider shall comply with this part if it is advertised, marketed, or offered as:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1414(1): long-term care insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1414(2): nursing home insurance.
