Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1503(1)(c): in the amount of $15,000 because of liability for injury to, or destruction of, property of others arising out of the use of a motorboat in any one accident; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1503(2): $65,000 in any one accident whether arising from bodily injury to or the death of others, or from destruction of, or damage to, the property of others.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1704 Scope of certificate of insurance.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1704(1): A certificate of insurance is not an insurance policy and does not affirmatively or negatively amend, extend, or alter the coverage afforded by an insurance policy to which a certificate of insurance refers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1704(2): A certificate of insurance may not confer to a certificate holder a right that is not provided by an insurance policy to which the certificate of insurance refers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1704(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1704(3)(a): A certificate of insurance may not refer to a contract that is not an insurance policy, including a construction or service contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1704(3)(b): Notwithstanding any requirement, term, or condition of a document with respect to which a certificate of insurance may be issued or may pertain, the insurance coverage afforded by a referenced insurance policy is subject to the terms, exclusions, and conditions of the insurance policy itself.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1705 False or misleading practices.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1705(1): A person may not knowingly request or require the issuance of a certificate of insurance from an insurer, insurance producer, or policyholder that contains false or misleading information concerning an insurance policy to which the certificate of insurance refers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1705(2): A person may not knowingly prepare or issue a certificate of insurance that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1705(2)(a): contains false or misleading information; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1705(2)(b): purports to affirmatively or negatively alter, amend, or extend the coverage provided by an insurance policy to which the certificate of insurance refers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1705(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1705(3)(a): A person may not prepare, issue, or request an opinion letter or other document, either in addition to or in lieu of a certificate of insurance that is inconsistent with this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1705(3)(b): An insurer or insurance producer may prepare or issue an addendum to a certificate of insurance that clarifies or explains the coverage provided by an insurance policy if the addendum complies with this part.

----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(1): "Customer" means a person who purchases portable electronics.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(2): "Enrolled customer" means a customer who elects coverage under a portable electronics insurance policy issued to a vendor of portable electronics.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(3): "Location" means a physical location in the state or a website, call center site, or similar location directed to residents of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(4): "Portable electronics" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(4)(a): an electronic device that is portable in nature; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(4)(b): an accessory or service related to the use of the portable electronic device.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(a): "Portable electronics insurance" means insurance providing coverage for the repair or replacement of portable electronics that provides coverage for portable electronics against any one or more of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(a)(i): loss;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(a)(ii): theft;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(a)(iii): inoperability due to mechanical failure;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(a)(iv): malfunction;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(a)(v): damage; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(a)(vi): other similar cause of loss.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(b): "Portable electronics insurance" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(b)(i): a manufacturer's or vendor's warranty;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(b)(ii): a service contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(b)(iii): a policy of insurance covering a vendor's or manufacturer's obligations under a warranty; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(5)(b)(iv): a homeowner's, renter's, private passenger motor vehicle, commercial multi-peril, or similar policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(6): "Portable electronics transaction" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(6)(a): the sale or lease of portable electronics by a vendor to a customer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(6)(b): the sale by a vendor to a customer of an accessory or a service related to the use of portable electronics.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(7): "Service contract" means a contract or agreement for the repair or maintenance of goods or property, for their operational or structural failure due to a defect in materials, workmanship, or normal wear and tear, with or without additional provisions for incidental payment of indemnity under limited circumstances.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(8): "Supervising entity" mean a business entity that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(8)(a): a licensed insurer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(8)(b): an insurance producer that is appointed by an insurer to supervise the administration of a portable electronics insurance program.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(9): "Vendor" means a person in the business of engaging in portable electronics transactions directly or indirectly.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1802(10): "Warranty" means a promise made solely by the manufacturer, importer, seller, or lessor of property or services without consideration, that is not negotiated or separated from the sale of the product and is incidental to the sale of the product, that guarantees indemnity for defective parts, mechanical or electrical breakdown, labor, or other remedial measures, such as repair or replacement of the property or repetition of services.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1803(1): 31A-22-1804(2); 31A-23a-103 Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1803(2): A portable electronics limited lines license issued under this section authorizes an employee or authorized representative of the vendor to sell or offer coverage under a portable electronics insurance policy to a customer at each location at which the vendor who holds the limited lines license engages in portable electronics transactions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1803(3): Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a limited lines license issued under this section authorizes the licensee and the licensee's employees or authorized representatives to engage in those activities that are permitted by this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1803(4): A supervising entity shall maintain a registry of vendor locations at which the vendor is authorized to sell or offer portable electronics insurance coverage in this state.  Upon request by the commissioner and with three business days notice to the supervising entity, the supervising entity shall make the registry open to inspection and examination by the commissioner during regular business hours of the supervising entity.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1809 Billing.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1809(1): A vendor may bill and collect the premium for portable electronics insurance coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1809(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1809(2)(a): Any charge to an enrolled customer for portable electronics insurance coverage that is not included in the cost associated with the purchase or lease of portable electronics or related services shall be separately itemized on the enrolled customer's bill.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1809(2)(b): If the portable electronics insurance coverage is included with the purchase or lease of portable electronics or related services, the vendor shall clearly and conspicuously disclose to the enrolled customer that the portable electronics insurance coverage is included with the portable electronics or related services.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1809(3): A vendor who bills and collects the premium for the portable electronics insurance may not be required to maintain the money in a segregated account if the vendor is authorized by the insurer to hold the money in an alternative manner and remits the money to the supervising entity within 60 days of receipt.  Money received by a vendor from an enrolled customer for the sale of portable electronics insurance is considered money held in trust by the vendor in a fiduciary capacity for the benefit of the insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1809(4): A vendor may receive compensation for billing and collection services.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1810 Applicability.
------------------------------------------------
This part is not applicable to a loan or lease originated by a federally insured depository institution, or a subsidiary or affiliate of a federally insured depository institution, or originated by any other entity as part of a plan to sell or assign an interest in the loan or lease to a federally insured depository institution, or a subsidiary or affiliate of a federally insured depository institution.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1901 Title.
----------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Unclaimed Life Insurance and Annuity Benefits Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(1): 67-4a-102 "Administrator" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(2): "Asymmetric conduct" means an insurer's use of the death master file or other similar database before July 1, 2015, in connection with searching for information regarding whether annuitants under the insurer's annuities might be deceased, but not in connection with whether the insureds under the insurer's policies might be deceased.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(3)(a): "Contract" means an annuity contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(3)(b): "Contract" does not include an annuity used to fund an employment-based retirement plan or program when:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(3)(b)(i): the insurer does not perform the record keeping services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(3)(b)(ii): the insurer is not committed by terms of the annuity contract to pay death benefits to the beneficiaries of specific plan participants.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(4): "Death master file" means the United States Social Security Administration's Death Master File or another database or service that is at least as comprehensive as the United States Social Security Administration's Death Master File for determining that a person has reportedly died.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(5): "Death master file match" means a search of a death master file that results in a match of the Social Security number, or the name and date of birth of an insured, annuity owner, or retained asset account holder.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(6)(a): "Policy" means a policy or certificate of life insurance that provides a death benefit.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(6)(b): "Policy" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(6)(b)(i): a policy or certificate of life insurance that provides a death benefit under an employee benefit plan:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(6)(b)(i)(A): subject to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, 29 U.S.C. Sec. 1002, as periodically amended; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(6)(b)(i)(B): under a federal employee benefit program;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(6)(b)(ii): a policy or certificate of life insurance that is used to fund a preneed funeral contract or prearrangement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(6)(b)(iii): a policy or certificate of credit life or accidental death insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(6)(b)(iv): a policy issued to a group master policyholder for which the insurer does not provide record keeping services.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(7): "Record keeping services" means those circumstances under which the insurer agrees with a group policy or contract customer to be responsible for obtaining, maintaining, and administering, in its own or its agents' systems, information about each individual insured under an insured's group insurance contract, or a line of coverage under the group insurance contract, at least the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(7)(a): social security number, or name and date of birth;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(7)(b): beneficiary designation information;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(7)(c): coverage eligibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(7)(d): benefit amount; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(7)(e): premium payment status.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1902(8): "Retained asset account" means a mechanism whereby the settlement of proceeds payable under a policy or contract is accomplished by the insurer or an entity acting on behalf of the insurer by depositing the proceeds into an account with check or draft writing privileges, where those proceeds are retained by the insurer or its agent, pursuant to a supplementary contract not involving annuity benefits other than death benefits.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903 Insurer conduct.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1): An insurer shall perform a comparison of its insureds' in-force policies, contracts, and retained asset accounts against a death master file, on at least a semi-annual basis, by using the full death master file once and thereafter using the death master file update files for future comparisons to identify potential matches of its insureds.  For those potential matches identified as a result of a death master file match:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(a): The insurer shall within 90 days of a death master file match:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(a)(i): complete a good faith effort, that the insurer documents, to confirm the death of the insured or retained asset account holder against other available records and information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(a)(ii): determine whether benefits are due in accordance with the applicable policy or contract, and if benefits are due in accordance with the applicable policy or contract:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(a)(ii)(A): use good faith efforts, that the insurer documents, to locate the beneficiary or beneficiaries; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(a)(ii)(B): provide the appropriate claims forms or instructions to the beneficiary or beneficiaries to make a claim including the need to provide an official death certificate, if applicable under the policy or contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(b): With respect to group life insurance, an insurer shall confirm the possible death of an insured when the insurer maintains at least the following information of those covered under a policy or certificate:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(b)(i): social security number, or name and date of birth;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(b)(ii): beneficiary designation information;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(b)(iii): coverage eligibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(b)(iv): benefit amount; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(b)(v): premium payment status.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(c): An insurer shall implement procedures to account for:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(c)(i): initials used in lieu of a first or middle name, use of a middle name, compound first and middle names, and interchanged first and middle names;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(c)(ii): compound last names, hyphens, and blank spaces or apostrophes in last names; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(c)(iii): transposition of the "month" and "date" portions of the date of birth.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(1)(d): To the extent permitted by law, the insurer may disclose minimum necessary personal information about the insured or beneficiary to a person who the insurer reasonably believes may be able to assist the insurer locate the beneficiary or a person otherwise entitled to payment of the claims proceeds.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(2)(a): An insurer that has not engaged in asymmetric conduct before July 1, 2015, is not required to comply with the requirements of this section with respect to a policy, annuity, or retained asset account issued or delivered before July 1, 2015.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(2)(b): (2)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(3): An insurer or the insurer's service provider may not charge a beneficiary or other authorized representative for fees or costs associated with a death master file search or verification of a death master file match conducted pursuant to this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(4): 67-4a-201(8); 31A-22-428; 67-4a-201(8) The benefits from a policy, contract, or retained asset account, plus any applicable accrued contractual interest shall first be payable to the designated beneficiaries or owners and in the event said beneficiaries or owners can not be found, shall be transferred to the state as unclaimed property pursuant to  Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(5): 67-4a-201(8); (1) An insurer shall notify the administrator upon the expiration of the statutory holding period under  Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(5)(a): a policy, contract beneficiary, or retained asset account holder has not submitted a claim with the insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-1903(5)(b): (1) the insurer has complied with Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2001 Title.
----------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Limited Long-Term Care Insurance Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(1): "Applicant" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(1)(a): when referring to an individual limited long-term care insurance policy, the person who seeks to contract for benefits; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(1)(b): when referring to a group limited long-term care insurance policy, the proposed certificate holder.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(2): "Elimination period" means the length of time between meeting the eligibility for benefit payment and receiving benefit payments from an insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(3): 31A-22-701 "Group limited long-term care insurance" means a limited long-term care insurance policy that is delivered or issued for delivery:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(3)(a): in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(3)(b): 31A-22-701 to an eligible group, as described under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(a): "Limited long-term care insurance" means an insurance policy, endorsement, or rider that is advertised, marketed, offered, or designed to provide coverage:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(a)(i): for less than 12 consecutive months for each covered person;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(a)(ii): on an expense-incurred, indemnity, prepaid or other basis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(a)(iii): for one or more necessary or medically necessary diagnostic, preventative, therapeutic, rehabilitative, maintenance, or personal care services that is provided in a setting other than an acute care unit of a hospital.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(b): "Limited long-term care insurance" includes a policy or rider described in Subsection (4)(a) that provides for payment of benefits based on cognitive impairment or the loss of functional capacity.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(c): "Limited long-term care insurance" does not include an insurance policy that is offered primarily to provide:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(c)(i): basic Medicare supplement insurance coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(c)(ii): basic hospital expense coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(c)(iii): basic medical-surgical expense coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(c)(iv): hospital confinement indemnity coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(c)(v): major medical expense coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(c)(vi): disability income or related asset-protection coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(c)(vii): accidental only coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(c)(viii): specified disease or specified accident coverage; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(4)(c)(ix): limited benefit health coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(5): "Preexisting condition" means a condition for which medical advice or treatment is recommended:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(5)(a): by, or received from, a provider of health care services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(5)(b): within six months before the day on which the coverage of an insured person becomes effective.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2002(6): "Waiting period" means the time an insured waits before some or all of the insured's coverage becomes effective.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2003 Scope.
----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2003(1): The requirements of this part apply to limited long-term care insurance policies and certificates marketed, delivered, or issued for delivery in this state on or after July 1, 2020.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2003(2): Laws and regulations designed or intended to apply to Medicare supplement insurance policies may not be applied to limited long-term care insurance.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004 Disclosure and performance standards for limited long-term care insurance.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(1): A limited long-term care insurance policy may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(1)(a): be cancelled, nonrenewed, or otherwise terminated because of the age, gender, or the deterioration of the mental or physical health of the insured individual or certificate holder;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(1)(b): contain a provision establishing a new waiting period if existing coverage is converted to or replaced by a new or other form within the same insurer, or the insurer's affiliates, except with respect to an increase in benefits voluntarily selected by the insured individual or group policyholder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(1)(c): provide coverage for skilled nursing care only or provide significantly more coverage for skilled care in a facility than coverage for lower levels of care.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2): (2)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2)(a): A limited long-term care insurance policy or certificate may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2)(a)(i): use a definition of "preexisting condition" that is more restrictive than the definition under this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2)(a)(ii): exclude coverage for a loss or confinement that is the result of a preexisting condition, unless the loss or confinement begins within six months after the day on which the coverage of the insured person becomes effective.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2)(b): (2)(b)(i) A preexisting condition does not prohibit an insurer from:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2)(b)(i): using an application form designed to elicit the complete health history of an applicant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2)(b)(ii): (2)(b)(i) on the basis of the answers on the application described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2)(c)(i): Unless otherwise provided in the policy or certificate, an insurer may exclude coverage of a preexisting condition:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2)(c)(i)(A): for a time period of six months, beginning the day on which the coverage of the insured person becomes effective; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2)(c)(i)(B): regardless of whether the preexisting condition is disclosed on the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(2)(c)(ii): A limited long-term care insurance policy or certificate may not exclude or use waivers or riders of any kind to exclude, limit, or reduce coverage or benefits for specifically named or described preexisting diseases or physical conditions for more than a time period of six months, beginning the day on which the coverage of the insured person becomes effective.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(3)(a): An insurer may not deliver or issue for delivery a limited long-term care insurance policy that conditions eligibility for any benefits:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(3)(a)(i): on a prior hospitalization requirement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(3)(a)(ii): provided in an institutional care setting, on the receipt of a higher level of institutional care; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(3)(a)(iii): other than waiver of premium, post-confinement, post-acute care, or recuperative benefits, on a prior institutionalization requirement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(3)(b): A limited long-term care insurance policy or rider may not condition eligibility for noninstitutional benefits on the prior or continuing receipt of skilled care services.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(4): (4)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(4)(a): If, after examination of a policy, certificate, or rider, a limited long-term care insurance applicant is not satisfied for any reason, the applicant has the right to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(4)(a)(i): within 30 days after the day on which the applicant receives the policy, certificate, endorsement, or rider, return the policy, certificate, endorsement, or rider to the company or a producer of the company; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(4)(a)(ii): have the premium refunded.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(4)(b): (4)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(4)(b)(i): Each limited long-term care insurance policy, certificate, endorsement, and rider shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(4)(b)(i)(A): have a notice prominently printed on the first page or attached thereto detailing specific instructions to accomplish a return; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(4)(b)(i)(B): include the following free-look statement or language substantially similar: "You have 30 days from the day on which you receive this policy certificate, endorsement, or rider to review it and return it to the company if you decide not to keep it. You do not have to tell the company why you are returning it. If you decide not to keep it, simply return it to the company at its administrative office. Or you may return it to the producer that you bought it from. You must return it within 30 days of the day you first received it. The company will refund the full amount of any premium paid within 30 days after it receives the returned policy, certificate, or rider. The premium refund will be sent directly to the person who paid it. The policy certificate or rider will be void as if it had never been issued."
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(4)(b)(ii): (4)(b)(i) The requirements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5): (5)(b)(i); (iii); (5)(a)(iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(a): (5)(b)(i); (iii); (5)(a)(iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(a)(i): An insurer shall deliver an outline of coverage to a prospective applicant for limited long-term care insurance at the time of initial solicitation through means that prominently direct the attention of the recipient to the document and the document's purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(a)(ii): In the case of an agent solicitation, the agent shall deliver the outline of coverage before the presentation of an application or enrollment form.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(a)(iii): In the case of a direct response solicitation, the outline of coverage shall be presented in conjunction with any application or enrollment form.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(a)(iv): (5)(b)(i); (iii); (5)(a)(iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(a)(iv)(A): (5)(b)(i); (iii) In the case of a policy issued to a group, the outline of coverage is not required to be delivered if the information described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(a)(iv)(B): (5)(a)(iv) Upon request, an insurer shall make the other materials described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(b): An outline of coverage shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(b)(i): a description of the principal benefits and coverage provided in the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(b)(ii): a description of the eligibility triggers for benefits and how the eligibility triggers are met;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(b)(iii): a statement of the principal exclusions, reductions, and limitations contained in the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(b)(iv): a statement of the terms under which the policy or certificate, or both, may be continued in force or discontinued, including any reservation in the policy of a right to change premium.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(b)(v): a specific description of each continuation or conversion provision of group coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(b)(vi): a statement that the outline of coverage is a summary only, not a contract of insurance, and that the policy or group master policy contains governing contractual provisions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(b)(vii): a description of the terms under which a person may return the policy or certificate and have the premium refunded;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(b)(viii): a brief description of the relationship of cost of care and benefits; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(5)(b)(ix): a statement that discloses to the policyholder or certificate holder that the policy is not long-term care insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(6): A certificate pursuant to a group limited long-term care insurance policy that is delivered or issued for delivery in this state shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(6)(a): a description of the principal benefits and coverage provided in the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(6)(b): a statement of the principal exclusions, reductions, and limitations contained in the policy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(6)(c): a statement that the group master policy determines governing contractual provisions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2004(7): If an application for a limited long-term care insurance contract or certificate is approved, the issuer shall deliver the contract or certificate of insurance to the applicant no later that 30 days after the day on which the application is approved.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2005 Nonforfeiture benefits.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2005(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2005(1)(a): A limited long-term care insurance policy may offer the option of purchasing a policy or certificate including a nonforfeiture benefit.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2005(1)(b): The offer of a nonforfeiture benefit may be in the form of a rider that is attached to the policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2005(1)(c): In the event the policy holder or certificate holder does not purchase a nonforfeiture benefit, the insurer shall provide a contingent benefit upon lapse that shall be available for a specified period of time following a substantial increase in premium rates.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2005(2): If an insurer issues a group limited long-term care insurance policy, the insurer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2005(2)(a): make any offer of a nonforfeiture benefit to the group policyholder; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2005(2)(b): make any offer to each proposed certificate holder.

---------------------------------------------
In accordance withUtah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2006(1): 31A-22-2004(5)(b); 31A-22-2005(1) shall makes rules:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2006(1)(a): in the event of a substantial rate increase, promoting premium adequacy and protecting the policy holder;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2006(1)(b): establishing minimum standards for limited long-term care insurance marketing practices, producer compensation, producer testing, independent review of benefit determinations, penalties, and reporting practices;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2006(1)(c): prescribing a standard format, including style, arrangement, and overall appearance of an outline of coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2006(1)(d): 31A-22-2004(5)(b) prescribing the content of an outline of coverage, in accordance with the requirements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2006(1)(e): specifying the type of nonforfeiture benefits offered as part of a limited long-term care insurance policy or certificate;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2006(1)(f): establishing the standards of nonforfeiture benefits; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2006(1)(g): 31A-22-2005(1) establishing the rules regarding contingent benefits upon lapse, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2006(1)(g)(i): a determination of the specified period of time during which a contingent benefit upon lapse will be available; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-22-2006(1)(g)(ii): 31A-22-2005(1) the substantial premium rate increase that triggers a contingent benefit upon lapse as described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 23a - Insurance Marketing - Licensing Producers, Consultants, and Reinsurance Intermediaries
**************************************************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-101 Purposes.
-------------------------------------------
The purposes of this chapter include:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-101(1): promoting the professional competence of insurance producers, surplus lines producers, limited line producers, consultants, managing general agents, and reinsurance intermediaries;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-101(2): providing maximum freedom of marketing methods for insurance, consistent with the interests of the Utah public;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-101(3): preserving and encouraging competition at the consumer level;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-101(4): regulating insurance marketing practices in conformity with the general purposes of this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-101(5): governing the qualifications and procedures for the licensing of insurance producers, surplus lines producers, limited line producers, consultants, managing general agents, and reinsurance intermediaries; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-101(6): promoting uniform licensing requirements between the several states.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-103 Requirement of license.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-103(1): 31A-23a-201; 31A-23a-207

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-103(1)(c): A person may not utilize the services of another as a producer, surplus lines producer, limited line producer, consultant, managing general agent, or reinsurance intermediary if that person knows or should know that the other does not have a license as required by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-103(2): This part may not be construed to require an insurer to obtain an insurance producer license.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-103(3): An insurance contract is not invalid as a result of a violation of this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-107 Character requirements.
---------------------------------------------------------
An applicant for a license under this chapter shall show to the commissioner that:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-107(1): the applicant has the intent in good faith, to engage in the type of business that the license applied for would permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-107(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-107(2)(a): if a natural person, the applicant is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-107(2)(a)(i): competent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-107(2)(a)(ii): trustworthy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-107(2)(b): if the applicant is an agency:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-107(2)(b)(i): the partners, directors, or principal officers or persons having comparable powers are trustworthy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-107(2)(b)(ii): that it will transact business in such a way that the acts that may only be performed by a licensed producer, surplus lines producer, limited line producer, consultant, managing general agent, or reinsurance intermediary are performed exclusively by natural persons who are licensed under this chapter to transact that type of business and designated on the agency's license;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-107(3): 31A-23a-502 the applicant intends to comply with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-107(4): if a natural person, the applicant is at least 18 years of age.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-115.5 Use of customer service representative.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
A producer, surplus lines producer, or consultant who employs a customer service representative is responsible for the duties performed by the customer service representative.  A customer service representative:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-115.5(1): may not maintain an office independent of the customer service representative's licensed producer, surplus lines producer, or consultant employer for the purpose of conducting insurance activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-115.5(2): (3) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-115.5(3): may provide a customer a quote on behalf of the customer service representative's licensed producer, surplus lines producer, or consultant employer.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119 Special requirements for agency title insurance producers.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(a): "Applicable percentage" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(a)(i): on February 1, 2024, through January 31, 2025, 2.5%;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(a)(ii): on February 1, 2025, through January 31, 2026, 3%;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(a)(iii): on February 1, 2026, through January 31, 2027, 3.5%;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(a)(iv): on February 1, 2027, through January 31, 2028, 4%; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(a)(v): on February 1, 2028, through January 31, 2029, 4.5%.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(b): "Sufficient capital and net worth" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(b)(i): for a new title entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(b)(i)(A): $100,000 for the first five years after becoming a new agency title insurance producer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(b)(i)(B): after the first five years after becoming a new agency title insurance producer, the greater of $50,000, or on February 1 of each year, an amount equal to 5% of the title entity's average annual gross revenue over the preceding two calendar years, up to $150,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(b)(ii): for a title entity licensed before May 14, 2019:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(b)(ii)(A): for the time period beginning on February 1, 2020, and ending on January 31, 2029, the lesser of an amount equal to the applicable percentage of the title entity's average annual gross revenue over the two calendar years immediately preceding the February 1 on which the applicable percentage applies or $150,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(1)(b)(ii)(B): beginning on February 1, 2029, the greater of $50,000 or an amount equal to 5% of the title entity's average annual gross revenue over the preceding two calendar years, up to $150,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-119(2): Before May 1 of each year, each agency title insurance producer shall submit a report to the commissioner containing proof satisfactory to the commissioner that the agency title insurance producer had sufficient capital and net worth for the preceding calendar year.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-208 Producer and agency authority in health insurance exchange.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A producer or agency licensed under this chapter, with a line of authority that permits the producer or agency to sell, negotiate, or solicit accident and health insurance, is authorized to sell, negotiate, or solicit qualified health plans offered on a health insurance exchange.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-401(1)(b)(i)(A): the producer for the insured's or consultant's interest as a producer for the insurer, or the relationship to an insurer or other producer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-401(1)(b)(i)(B): that as a result of those interests, the producer for the insured's or the consultant's recommendations should be given appropriate scrutiny.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-401(1)(b)(ii): (1)(b)(i) The producer for the insured's or consultant's fee shall be agreed upon, in writing, after the disclosure required under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-401(2): A licensee under this chapter may not act as to the same client as both a producer for the insurer and a producer for the insured without the client's prior written consent based on full disclosure.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-401(3): Whenever a person applies for insurance coverage through a producer for the insured, the producer for the insured shall disclose to the applicant, in writing, that the producer for the insured is not the producer for the insurer or the potential insurer.  This disclosure shall also inform the applicant that the applicant likely does not have the benefit of an insurer being financially responsible for the conduct of the producer for the insured.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-403 Inherent unsuitability.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-403(1): If the commissioner finds after a hearing that a certain type of accident and health insurance, life insurance, or annuity product is inherently unsuitable for persons of certain ages or in certain conditions of health, the commissioner shall make a rule declaring the accident and health insurance, life insurance, or annuity product as inherently unsuitable for persons of certain ages or in certain conditions of health.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-403(2): An accident and health insurance, life insurance, or annuity product that is subject to the rule may not be sold to a person for whom the product has been determined as inherently unsuitable unless that person purchasing the product signs a receipt acknowledging having received a statement that expresses that the product has been determined by the commissioner to be inherently unsuitable for persons of certain ages or in certain conditions of health.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-403(3): (1) Unless the insurer or its appointed licensee establishes that its sale of coverage is inconsistent with the rule made under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-405 Insurer liability.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-405(1): 31A-35-102 As used in this section, "insurer" includes bail bond surety companies as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-405(2): (2) There is a rebuttable presumption that every insurer is bound by any act of its appointed licensee performed in this state that is within the scope of the appointed licensee's actual (express or implied) or apparent authority, until the insurer has canceled the appointed licensee's appointment  and has made reasonable efforts to recover from the appointed licensee its policy forms and other indicia of agency.  Reasonable efforts include a formal demand in writing for return of the indicia, and notice to the commissioner if the appointed licensee does not promptly comply with the demand.  This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-405(3): When a licensee under this chapter with authority to bind more than one insurer on a particular risk agrees to bind coverage on a particular risk, but fails to outwardly indicate the insurer with which the risk is placed, and before the risk is placed with a particular insurer a loss occurs, if there is no conclusive admissible evidence indicating the insurer with which the licensee exercised his binding authority, a court may equitably apportion the loss among all insurers with which the licensee had binding authority as to the particular type of risk.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-407 Liability for acts of title insurance producers.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-407(1): Subject to the other provisions in this section, a title insurer that has a contract with or appoints an individual title insurance producer or an agency title insurance producer is liable to  a buyer, seller, borrower, lender, or third party that deposits money with the individual title insurance  producer or agency title insurance producer for the receipt and disbursement of money deposited with the individual title insurance producer or agency title insurance producer for a transaction when a commitment for a policy of title insurance of that title insurer is ordered, issued, or distributed or a title insurance policy of that title insurer is issued, except that once a title insurer is named in an issued commitment only that title insurer is liable as a title insurer under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-407(2): (1); (1) The liability of a title insurer under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-407(3): (1) The liability described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-407(4): The liability of a title insurer with respect to the condition of title to the real property that is the subject of a title insurance policy or a title insurance commitment for a title insurance policy is limited to the terms, conditions, and stipulations contained in the title insurance policy or title commitment.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-408 Representations of agency.
------------------------------------------------------------
A person may not represent that the person is acting in behalf of an insurer unless a written agency contract is in effect giving the person authority from the insurer and the insurer appoints that person to act in behalf of the insurer.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-413 Title insurance producer's annual report.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
An agency title insurance producer shall annually file with the commissioner, by a date and in a form the commissioner specifies by rule, a verified statement of the agency title insurance producer's financial condition, transactions, and affairs as of the end of the preceding calendar year.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-417 Financial services insurance activities regulation.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-417(1): It is the intent of the Legislature that the regulation of insurance activities of any person in this state be based on functional regulation principles established in the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act of 1999, Pub. L. No. 106-102.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-417(4): The commissioner shall consult and coordinate with the commissioner of the Department of Financial Institutions and the director of the Division of Securities for the purpose of assuring, to the extent possible, that the rules prescribed by the department are consistent and comparable with federal regulations governing the insurance, banking, and securities industries.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-502 Controlled business, except as to title insurance.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-502(1): As used in this section, "controlled business" means insurance procured by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-502(1)(a): an insurance producer who is a natural person upon the life, person, or property of himself, his relative within the second degree by blood or marriage, his employer, employees, or organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-502(1)(b): an insurance producer that is an organization upon its own property or upon the life, person, or property of its partners, shareholders, directors, or employees, or their relatives within the second degree by blood or marriage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-502(2): No producer may receive any compensation from an insurer for effecting insurance upon controlled business unless during the preceding 12 months the producer had effected other insurance with aggregate premiums exceeding the premiums on the controlled business.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-502(3): This section does not apply to title insurance.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-505 Benefit plans for producers.
--------------------------------------------------------------
An authorized insurer may establish retirement, insurance, and other benefit plans for producers on a basis approved by the commissioner.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-601 Licensure.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-601(1): A person, firm, association, or corporation may not act in the capacity of managing general agent with respect to risks located in this state for an insurer licensed in this state unless the person is a licensed producer in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-601(2): A person, firm, association, or corporation may not act in the capacity of a managing general agent representing an insurer domiciled in this state with respect to risks located outside this state unless the person is licensed as a producer in this state pursuant to this chapter. The license may be a nonresident license.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-601(3): The commissioner may require a bond in an amount he finds acceptable for the protection of each insurer represented.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-601(4): The commissioner may require the managing general agent to maintain an errors and omissions policy or other security acceptable to the commissioner.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602 Required contract provisions.
---------------------------------------------------------------
A person, firm, association, or corporation acting in the capacity of a managing general agent may not place business with an insurer unless there is in force a written contract between the parties which sets forth the responsibilities of each party, and where both parties share responsibility for a particular function, the contract specifies the division of shared responsibilities.  The written contract shall contain the following minimum provisions:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(1): The insurer may terminate the contract for cause upon written notice to the managing general agent.  The insurer may suspend the underwriting authority of the managing general agent during the pendency of any dispute regarding the cause for termination.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(2): The managing general agent will render accounts to the insurer detailing all transactions and remit all funds due under the contract to the insurer at least monthly.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(3): All funds collected for the account of an insurer will be held by the managing general agent in a fiduciary capacity in a bank which is insured by the FDIC.  This account shall be used for all payments on behalf of the insurer.  The managing general agent may retain no more than three months estimated claims payments and allocated loss adjustment expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(4): 31A-23a-412 Separate records of business written by the managing general agent shall be maintained.  The insurer shall have access and the right to copy all accounts and records related to its business and shall have access to all books, bank accounts, and records of the managing general agent.  The records shall be retained according to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(5): The contract may not be assigned in whole or part by the managing general agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(6): The insurer shall have the right to cancel or nonrenew any policy of insurance subject to the applicable laws and rules.  The contract shall contain appropriate underwriting guidelines including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(6)(a): the maximum annual premium volume;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(6)(b): the basis of the rates to be charged;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(6)(c): the types of risks which may be written;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(6)(d): maximum limits of liability;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(6)(e): applicable exclusions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(6)(f): territorial limitations;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(6)(g): policy cancellation provisions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(6)(h): the maximum policy period.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(7): If the contract permits the managing general agent to settle claims on behalf of the insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(7)(a): All claims shall be reported to the company in a timely manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(7)(b): A copy of the claim file shall be sent to the insurer at its request, or as soon as it becomes known that the claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(7)(b)(i): has the potential to exceed the lesser of an amount determined by the commissioner or the limit set by the company;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(7)(b)(ii): involves a coverage dispute;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(7)(b)(iii): may exceed the managing general agent's claims settlement authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(7)(b)(iv): is open for more than six months; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(7)(b)(v): is closed by payment the lesser of an amount set by the commissioner or an amount set by the company.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(7)(c): All claim files will be the joint property of the insurer and managing general agent.  However, upon an order of liquidation of the insurer, the files become the sole property of the insurer or its estate.  The managing general agent shall have reasonable access to and the right to copy the files on a timely basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(7)(d): Any settlement authority granted to the managing general agent may be terminated for cause upon the insurer's written notice to the managing general agent or upon the termination of the contract.  The insurer may suspend the settlement authority during the pendency of any dispute regarding the cause for termination.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(8): Where electronic claims files are in existence, the contract shall address the timely transmission of the data.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(9): 31A-23a-603 If the contract provides for a sharing of interim profits by the managing general agent, and the managing general agent has the authority to determine the amount of the interim profits by establishing loss reserves, controlling claim payments, or in any other manner, interim profits may not be paid to the managing general agent until one year after they are earned for property insurance business, and five years after they are earned on casualty business, but not until the profits have been verified by a review conducted pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(10): The managing general agent may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(10)(a): bind reinsurance or retrocessions on behalf of the insurer, except that the managing general agent may bind facultative reinsurance contracts pursuant to obligatory facultative agreements if the contract with the insurer contains reinsurance underwriting guidelines including, for both reinsurance assumed and ceded, a list of reinsurers with which the automatic agreements are in effect, the coverages and amounts or percentages that may be reinsured, and commission schedules;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(10)(b): commit the insurer to participate in insurance or reinsurance syndicates;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(10)(c): appoint any producer without assuring that the producer is lawfully licensed to transact the type of insurance for which the producer is appointed;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(10)(d): without prior approval of the insurer, pay or commit the insurer to pay a claim over a specified amount, net of reinsurance, which may not exceed 1% of the insurer's policyholder's surplus as of December 31 of the last completed calendar year;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-602(10)(e): collect any payment from a reinsurer or commit the insurer to any claim settlement with a reinsurer without prior approval of the insurer; if prior approval is given, a report shall be promptly forwarded to the insurer;

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-603(3): The insurer shall at least semiannually conduct an on-site review of the underwriting and claims processing operations of the managing general agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-603(4): Binding authority for all reinsurance contracts or participation in insurance or reinsurance syndicates shall rest with an officer of the insurer, who may not be affiliated with the managing general agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-603(5):

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-604 Examination authority.
--------------------------------------------------------
The acts of the managing general agent are considered to be the acts of the insurer on whose behalf it is acting.  A managing general agent may be examined as if it were the insurer.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-605 Penalties and liabilities.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-605(1): If the commissioner finds after a hearing that any person has violated any provision of this part, the commissioner may order:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-605(1)(a): for each separate violation, a penalty in an amount of $5,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-605(1)(b): revocation or suspension of the producer's license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-605(1)(c): the managing general agent to reimburse the insurer, the rehabilitator, or liquidator of the insurer for any losses incurred by the insurer caused by the managing general agent's violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-605(2): Nothing contained in this section affects the right of the commissioner to impose any other penalties provided for in this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-605(3): Nothing contained in this part is intended to, or in any manner limits or restricts the rights of policyholders, claimants, and auditors.
