Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702 Minimum standards.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(1): This section applies if, in any calendar year, the aggregate amount of gross written premium on business placed with a controlled insurer by a controlling producer is equal to or greater than 5% of the admitted assets of the controlled insurer, as reported in the controlled insurer's quarterly statement filed as of September 30 of the prior year.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(2): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(2)(a): the controlling producer places insurance only with the controlled insurer, or only with the controlled insurer and members of the controlled insurer's holding company system, or with the controlled insurer's parent, affiliate, or subsidiary and receives no compensation based upon the amount of premiums written in connection with the insurance placed;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(2)(b): the controlling producer accepts insurance placements only from nonaffiliated producers who are not controlling producers, and not directly from insureds; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(2)(c): the controlled insurer, except for insurance business written through a residual market facility, accepts insurance business only from a controlling producer, a producer controlled by the controlled insurer, or a producer that is a subsidiary of the controlled insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3): (3)(g); (h); (5) A controlled insurer may not accept business from a controlling producer and a controlling producer may not place business with a controlled insurer unless there is a written contract between the controlling producer and the insurer that specifies the responsibilities of each party and that has been approved by the board of directors of the insurer.  The contract shall contain the following minimum provisions:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3)(a): The controlled insurer may terminate the contract for cause, upon written notice to the controlling producer.  The controlled insurer shall suspend the authority of the controlling producer to write business during the pendency of any dispute regarding the cause for the termination.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3)(b): The controlling producer shall render accounts to the controlled insurer detailing all material transactions, including information necessary to support all commissions, charges, and other fees received by, or owing to, the controlling producer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3)(c): The controlling producer shall remit all funds due under the terms of the contract to the controlled insurer at least monthly.  The due date shall be fixed so that premiums or premium installments collected shall be remitted no later than 90 days after the effective date of any policy placed with the controlled insurer under the contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3)(d): All funds collected for the controlled insurer's account shall be held by the controlling producer in a fiduciary capacity, in one or more appropriately identified bank accounts in banks that are members of the Federal Reserve System FDIC, in accordance with applicable provisions of this title.  However, funds of a controlling producer not required to be licensed in this state shall be maintained in compliance with the requirements of the controlling producer's domiciliary jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3)(e): The controlling producer shall maintain separately identifiable records of business written for the controlled insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3)(f): The contract may not be assigned in whole or in part by the controlling producer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3)(g): The controlled insurer shall provide the controlling producer with its underwriting standards, rules, procedures, and manuals setting forth the rates to be charged, and the conditions for the acceptance or rejection of risks.  The controlling producer shall adhere to the standards, rules, procedures, rates, and conditions.  The standards, rules, procedures, rates, and conditions shall be the same as those applicable to comparable business placed with the controlled insurer by a producer other than the controlling producer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3)(h): (3)(g); (h) The contract shall state the rates and terms of the controlling producer's commissions, charges, or other fees and the purposes for those charges or fees.  The rates of the commissions, charges, and other fees may not be greater than those applicable to comparable business and services placed with the controlled insurer by producers other than controlling producers.  For purposes of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3)(i): (5) If the contract provides that the controlling producer, on insurance business placed with the insurer, is to be compensated contingent upon the insurer's profits on that business, then the compensation may not be determined and paid until at least five years after the premiums on liability insurance are earned, and at least one year after the premiums are earned on any other insurance.  In no event may the commissions be paid until the adequacy of the controlled insurer's reserves on remaining claims has been independently verified pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3)(j): The contract shall include a limit on the controlling producer's writings in relation to the controlled insurer's surplus and total writings.  The insurer may establish a different limit to each line or subline of business.  The controlled insurer shall notify the controlling producer when the applicable limit is approached and may not accept business from the controlling producer if the limit is reached.  The controlling producer may not place business with the controlled insurer if it has been notified by the controlled insurer that the limit has been reached.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(3)(k): The controlling producer may negotiate but may not bind reinsurance on behalf of the controlled insurer on business the controlling producer places with the controlled insurer.  However, the controlling producer may bind facultative reinsurance contracts pursuant to obligatory facultative agreements if the contract with the controlled insurer contains underwriting guidelines including, for both reinsurance assumed and ceded, a list of reinsurers with which the automatic agreements are in effect, the coverages and amounts or percentages that may be reinsured, and commission schedules.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(4): Each controlled insurer shall have an audit committee of the board of directors.  The audit committee shall annually meet to review the adequacy of the insurer's loss reserves.  The committee shall meet with management, the insurer's independent certified public accountants, and an independent casualty actuary or any other independent loss reserve specialists acceptable to the commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(5)(a): In addition to any other required loss reserve certification, the controlled insurer shall file with the commissioner on April 1 of each year an opinion of an independent casualty actuary, or any other independent loss reserve specialist acceptable to the commissioner.  The opinion shall report loss ratios for each line of business written and shall attest to the adequacy of loss reserves established for losses incurred and outstanding as of year-end on business placed by the producer including losses incurred but not reported.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-702(5)(b): The controlled insurer shall annually report to the commissioner the amount of commissions paid to the producer, the percentage that amount represents of the net premiums written, and comparable amounts and percentage paid to noncontrolling producers for placements of the same kinds of insurance.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-703 Disclosure.
---------------------------------------------
The producer, prior to the effective date of the policy, shall deliver written notice to the prospective insured disclosing the relationship between the producer and the controlled insurer.  However, if the business is placed through a producer who is not a controlling producer, the controlling producer shall retain in his records a signed commitment from the noncontrolling producer that the noncontrolling producer is aware of the relationship between the insurer and the producer and that the noncontrolling producer has, or will, notify the insured.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-704 Penalties.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-704(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-704(1)(a): If, after notice and opportunity to be heard, the commissioner finds that the controlling producer or any other person has not materially complied with this part, or any rule made or order issued under the part, the commissioner may order the controlling producer to cease placing business with the controlled insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-704(1)(b): If the commissioner finds that because of the material noncompliance that the controlled insurer or any policyholder of the controlled insurer has suffered any loss or damage, the commissioner may maintain a civil action or may intervene in an action brought by or on behalf of the insurer or policyholder for recovery of compensatory damages for the benefit of the insurer or policyholder or the commissioner may seek other appropriate relief.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-704(2): Chapter 27a, Insurer Receivership Act If an order for liquidation or rehabilitation of the controlled insurer has been entered pursuant to
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-704(3): Nothing in this section affects the right of the commissioner to impose any other penalties provided for in this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-704(4): Nothing contained in this section is intended to or shall in any manner alter or affect the rights of policyholders, claimants, creditors, or other third parties.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801 Licensure.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(1): A person, firm, association, or corporation may not act as a reinsurance intermediary-broker in this state if the reinsurance intermediary-broker maintains an office either directly or as a member or employee of a firm or association, or an officer, director, or employee of a corporation unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(1)(a): in this state, the reinsurance intermediary-broker is a licensed producer in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(1)(b): in another state, the reinsurance intermediary-broker is a licensed producer in this state or another state having a licensing law substantially similar to this part, or the reinsurance intermediary-broker is licensed in this state as a nonresident reinsurance intermediary.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(2): A person, firm, association, or corporation may not act as a reinsurance intermediary-manager:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(2)(a): for a reinsurer domiciled in this state, unless the reinsurance intermediary-manager is a licensed producer in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(2)(b): in this state, if the reinsurance intermediary-manager maintains an office either directly or as a member or employee of a firm or association, or as an officer, director, or employee of a corporation in this state, unless the reinsurance intermediary-manager is a licensed producer in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(2)(c): in another state for a nondomestic insurer, unless the reinsurance intermediary-manager is a licensed producer in this state or another state having a licensing law substantially similar to this chapter, or the person is licensed in this state as a nonresident reinsurance intermediary.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(3): The commissioner may require a bond in an amount he finds acceptable for the protection of each reinsurer represented.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(4)(a): The commissioner may issue a reinsurance intermediary license to any person, firm, association, or corporation which has complied with the requirements of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(4)(a)(i): Any license issued to a firm or association will authorize all the members of the firm or association, and any designated employees, to act as reinsurance intermediaries under the license.  Each member, employee, or similar person shall be named in the application and any supplements to the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(4)(a)(ii): Any license issued to a corporation shall authorize all of the officers, directors, and any designated employees to act as reinsurance intermediaries on behalf of the corporation, and all authorized persons shall be named in the application and any supplements to the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(4)(b): If the applicant for a reinsurance intermediary license is a nonresident, the applicant, as a condition precedent to receiving or holding a license, shall designate the commissioner as agent for service of process in the manner, and with the same legal effect, provided for by this title for designation of service of process upon unauthorized insurers.  The applicant also shall furnish the commissioner with the name and address of a resident of this state upon whom notices or orders of the commissioner or process affecting the nonresident reinsurance intermediary may be served.  The licensee shall promptly notify the commissioner in writing of every change in its designated agent for service of process, and the change does not become effective until acknowledged by the commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(5): The commissioner may refuse to issue a reinsurance intermediary license if he determines that the applicant, any one named on the application, or any member, principal, officer, or director of the applicant, is not trustworthy, or that any controlling person of the applicant is not trustworthy to act as a reinsurance intermediary, or that any of the persons named has given cause for revocation or suspension of the license, or has failed to comply with any prerequisite for the issuance of the license.  Upon written request the commissioner will furnish a summary of the basis for his refusal to issue a license. The summary document shall be confidential.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-801(6): Licensed attorneys-at-law of this state when acting in their professional capacity as attorneys are exempt from this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-802 Required contract provisions -- Reinsurance intermediary-broker.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Transactions between a reinsurance intermediary-broker and the insurer it represents in that capacity may only be entered into pursuant to a written authorization, which specifies the responsibilities of each party.  The authorization shall, at a minimum, provide that the reinsurance intermediary-broker:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-802(1): may have his authority terminated by the insurer at any time;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-802(2): will render accounts to the insurer accurately detailing all material transactions, including information necessary to support all commissions, charges and other fees received by, or owing to the reinsurance intermediary-broker, and that he will remit all funds due to the insurer within 30 days of receipt;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-802(3): shall hold, in a fiduciary capacity, all funds collected for the insurer's account in a financial institution, which is a qualified United States financial institution;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-802(4): 31A-23a-803 will comply with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-802(5): will comply with the written standards established by the insurer for the cession or retrocession of all risks; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-802(6): will disclose to the insurer any relationship with any reinsurer to which business will be ceded or retroceded.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803 Books and records -- Reinsurance intermediary-broker.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1): For at least 10 years after expiration of each contract of reinsurance transacted by the reinsurance intermediary-broker, he will keep a complete record for each transaction showing:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(a): the type of contract, limits, underwriting restrictions, classes or risks, and territory;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(b): the period of coverage, including the effective and expiration dates, cancellation provisions, and notice required of cancellation;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(c): reporting and settlement requirements of balances;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(d): the rate used to compute the reinsurance premium;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(e): the names and addresses of assuming reinsurers;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(f): the rates of all reinsurance commissions, including the commissions on any retrocessions handled by the reinsurance intermediary-broker;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(g): related correspondence and memoranda;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(h): proof of placement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(i): details regarding retrocessions handled by the reinsurance intermediary-broker, including the identity of retrocessionaires and percentage of each contract assumed or ceded;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(j): financial records including premium and loss accounts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(k): when the reinsurance intermediary-broker procures a reinsurance contract on behalf of a licensed ceding insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(k)(i): directly from any assuming reinsurer, written evidence that the assuming reinsurer has agreed to assume the risk; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(1)(k)(ii): if placed through a representative of the assuming reinsurer, other than an employee, written evidence that the reinsurer has delegated binding authority to the representative.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-803(2): The insurer will have access and the right to copy and audit all accounts and records maintained by the reinsurance intermediary-broker related to its business in a form usable by the insurer.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-804 Duties of insurers utilizing the services of a reinsurance intermediary-broker.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-804(1): 31A-23a-801(1) An insurer may not engage the services of any person, firm, association, or corporation to act as a reinsurance intermediary-broker on its behalf unless the person is licensed as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-804(2): Title 31A, Chapter 16, Insurance Holding Companies An insurer may not employ an individual who is employed by a reinsurance intermediary-broker with which it transacts business, unless the reinsurance intermediary-broker is under common control with the insurer and subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-804(3): The insurer shall annually obtain a copy of statements of the financial condition of each reinsurance intermediary-broker with which it transacts business.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805 Required contract provisions -- Reinsurance intermediary-manager.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Transactions between a reinsurance intermediary-manager and the reinsurer it represents in that capacity may only be entered into pursuant to a written contract, which specifies the responsibilities of each party, and which shall be approved by the reinsurer's board of directors.  At least 30 days before the reinsurer assumes or cedes business through the producer, a true copy of the approved contract shall be filed with the commissioner for approval.  The contract shall, at a minimum, provide or require the following:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(1): The reinsurer may terminate the contract for cause upon written notice to the reinsurance intermediary-manager.  The reinsurer may immediately suspend the authority of the reinsurance intermediary-manager to assume or cede business during the pendency of any dispute regarding the cause for termination.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(2): The reinsurance intermediary-manager will render accounts to the reinsurer accurately detailing all material transactions, including information necessary to support all commissions, charges, and other fees received by, or owing to the reinsurance intermediary-manager, and he shall remit all funds due under the contract to the reinsurer at least monthly.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(3): All funds collected for the reinsurer's account will be held by the reinsurance intermediary-manager in a fiduciary capacity in a financial institution which is a qualified United States financial institution.  The reinsurance intermediary-manager may retain no more than three months estimated claims payments and allocated loss adjustment expenses.  The reinsurance intermediary-manager shall maintain a separate account for each reinsurer that it represents.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4): 31A-23a-807(4) For at least 10 years after expiration of each contract of reinsurance transacted by the reinsurance intermediary-manager, he shall keep a complete record for each transactions showing:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(a): the type of contract, limits, underwriting restrictions, classes of risks, and territory;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(b): period of coverage, including effective and expiration dates, cancellation provisions and notice required of cancellation, and disposition of outstanding reserves on covered risks;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(c): reporting and settlement requirements of balances;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(d): rates used to compute the reinsurance premium;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(e): names and addresses of reinsurers;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(f): rates of all reinsurance commissions, including the commissions on any retrocessions handled by the reinsurance intermediary-manager;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(g): related correspondence and memoranda;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(h): proof of placement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(i): 31A-23a-807(4) details regarding retrocessions handled by the reinsurance intermediary-manager, as permitted by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(j): financial records, including premium and loss accounts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(k): when the reinsurance intermediary-manager places a reinsurance contract on behalf of a ceding insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(k)(i): directly from any assuming reinsurer, written evidence that the assuming reinsurer has agreed to assume the risk; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(4)(k)(ii): if placed through a representative of the assuming reinsurer, other than an employee, written evidence that the reinsurer has delegated binding authority to the representative.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(5): The reinsurer will have access and the right to copy all accounts and records maintained by the reinsurance intermediary-manager which are related to its business, in a form usable by the reinsurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(6): The contract cannot be assigned in whole or in part by the reinsurance intermediary-manager.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(7): The reinsurance intermediary-manager will comply with the written underwriting and rating standards established by the insurer for the acceptance, rejection, or cession of all risks.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(8): The contract shall set forth the rates, terms, and purposes of commissions, charges, and other fees which the reinsurance intermediary-manager may levy against the reinsurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(9): If the contract permits the reinsurance intermediary-manager to settle claims on behalf of the reinsurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(9)(a): All claims will be reported to the reinsurer in a timely manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(9)(b): A copy of the claim file will be sent to the reinsurer at its request or as soon as it becomes known that the claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(9)(b)(i): has the potential to exceed the lesser of an amount determined by the commissioner or the limit set by the reinsurer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(9)(b)(ii): involves a coverage dispute;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(9)(b)(iii): may exceed the reinsurance intermediary-manager claims settlement authority;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(9)(b)(iv): is open for more than six months; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(9)(b)(v): is closed by payment of the lesser of an amount set by the commissioner or an amount set by the reinsurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(9)(c): All claim files will be the joint property of the reinsurer and reinsurance intermediary-manager.  However, upon an order of liquidation of the reinsurer the files shall become the sole property of the reinsurer or its estate.  The reinsurance intermediary-manager shall have reasonable access to and the right to copy the files on a timely basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(9)(d): Any settlement authority granted to the reinsurance intermediary-manager may be terminated for cause upon the reinsurer's written notice to the reinsurance intermediary-manager, or upon the termination of the contract.  The reinsurer may suspend the settlement authority during the pendency of the dispute regarding the cause of termination.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(10): 31A-23a-807(3) If the contract provides for a sharing of interim profits by the reinsurance intermediary-manager, that the contract shall provide interim profits will not be paid until one year after the end of each underwriting period for property business and five years after the end of each underwriting period for casualty business, or a later time period set by the commissioner for specified lines of insurance, and not until the adequacy of reserves on remaining claims has been verified pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(11): The reinsurance intermediary-manager will annually provide the reinsurer with a statement of its financial condition prepared by an independent certified public accountant.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(12): The reinsurer shall at least semi-annually conduct an on-site review of the underwriting and claims processing operations of the reinsurance intermediary-manager.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(13): The reinsurance intermediary-manager will disclose to the reinsurer any relationship it has with any insurer prior to ceding or assuming any business with the insurer pursuant to this contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-805(14): Within the scope of its actual or apparent authority the acts of the reinsurance intermediary-manager shall be considered to be the acts of the reinsurer on whose behalf it is acting.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-806 Prohibited acts.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-806(1): The reinsurance intermediary-manager may not cede retrocessions on behalf of the reinsurer, except that the reinsurance intermediary-manager may cede facultative retrocessions pursuant to obligatory facultative agreements if the contract with the reinsurer contains reinsurance underwriting guidelines for facultative retrocessions.  The guidelines shall include a list of reinsurers with which automatic agreements are in effect, and for each listed reinsurer, the coverages and amounts or percentages that may be reinsured, and commission schedules.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-806(2): The reinsurance intermediary-manager may not commit the reinsurer to participate in reinsurance syndicates.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-806(3): The reinsurance intermediary-manager may not appoint any producer without assuring that the producer is lawfully licensed to transact the type of reinsurance for which the producer is appointed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-806(4): The reinsurance intermediary-manager may not, without prior approval of the reinsurer, pay or commit the reinsurer to pay a claim, net of retrocessions, that exceeds the lesser of an amount specified by the reinsurer or 1% of the reinsurer's policyholder's surplus as of December 31 of the last complete calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-806(5): The reinsurance intermediary-manager may not collect any payment from a retrocessionaire or commit the reinsurer to any claim settlement with a retrocessionaire, without prior approval of the reinsurer.  If prior approval is given, a report shall be promptly forwarded to the reinsurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-806(6): Title 31A, Chapter 16, Insurance Holding Companies The reinsurance intermediary-manager may not jointly employ an individual who is employed by the reinsurer unless the reinsurance intermediary-manager is under common control with the reinsurer subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-806(7): The reinsurance intermediary-manager may not appoint a subreinsurance intermediary-manager.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-807 Duties of reinsurers utilizing the services of reinsurance.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-807(1): 31A-23a-801(2) A reinsurer may not engage the services of any person, firm, association, or corporation to act as a reinsurance intermediary-manager on its behalf unless the person is licensed as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-807(2): The reinsurer shall annually obtain a copy of statements of the financial condition of each reinsurance intermediary-manager which the reinsurer has engaged, which shall be prepared by an independent certified public accountant in a form acceptable to the commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-807(3): If a reinsurance intermediary-manager establishes loss reserves, the reinsurer shall annually obtain the opinion of an actuary attesting to the adequacy of loss reserves established for losses incurred and outstanding on business produced by the reinsurance intermediary-manager. The actuary's opinion shall be in addition to any other required loss reserve certification.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-807(4): Binding authority for all retrocessional contracts or participation in reinsurance syndicates shall rest with an officer of the reinsurer, who may not be affiliated with the reinsurance intermediary-manager.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-807(5): Within 30 days of termination of a contract with a reinsurance intermediary-manager, the reinsurer shall provide written notification of the termination to the commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-807(6): Title 31A, Chapter 16, Insurance Holding Companies; Chapter 23a, Part 7, Producer Controlled Insurers A reinsurer may not appoint to its board of directors, any officer, director, employee, controlling shareholder, or subproducer of its reinsurance intermediary-manager.  This subsection does not apply to relationships governed by


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-808 Examination authority.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-808(1): A reinsurance intermediary shall be subject to examination by the commissioner.  The commissioner shall have access to all books, bank accounts, and records of the reinsurance intermediary, which shall be kept in a form usable to the commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-808(2): A reinsurance intermediary-manager may be examined as if it were the reinsurer.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-809 Penalties and liabilities.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-809(1): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act A reinsurance intermediary, insurer, or reinsurer found by the commissioner, after a hearing conducted in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-809(1)(a): for each separate violation, pay a civil penalty in an amount not exceeding $5,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-809(1)(b): be subject to revocation or suspension of its license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-809(1)(c): if a violation was committed by the reinsurance intermediary, the reinsurance intermediary shall make restitution to the insurer, reinsurer, rehabilitator, or liquidator of the insurer or reinsurer for the net losses incurred by the insurer or reinsurer attributable to the violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-809(2): Nothing contained in this section affects the right of the commissioner to impose any other penalties provided in this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-809(3): Nothing contained in this part is intended to, or in any manner limits or restricts the rights of policyholders, claimants, creditors, or other third parties; nor does it confer any rights to such persons.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-901 Title.
----------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Travel Insurance Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this part, unless the context requires otherwise:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(1): "Aggregator site" means a website that provides access to information regarding insurance products from more than one insurer, including product and insurer information, for use in comparison shopping.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(2): "Blanket travel insurance" means a travel insurance policy that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(2)(a): an insurer issues to an eligible group; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(2)(b): covers:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(2)(b)(i): a specific class of persons defined in the policy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(2)(b)(ii): all members of the eligible group without a separate charge to an individual member of the eligible group.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(3): "Cancellation fee waiver" means a contractual agreement that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(3)(a): is between a supplier of a travel assistance service and the supplier's customer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(3)(b): waives a non-refundable cancellation fee provision of the supplier's underlying travel contract, with or without regard to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(3)(b)(i): the reason for the cancellation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(3)(b)(ii): the form of reimbursement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4): (4)(b)(i); (xi)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(a): "Eligible group" means a group of two or more persons who:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(a)(i): are engaged in a common enterprise; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(a)(ii): have an economic, educational, or social affinity or relationship.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b): (4)(b)(i); (xi) "Eligible group" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(i): an entity engaged in the business of providing travel or a travel service in which, with regard to the particular travel or travel service or type of travel or travelers, all members or customers of the group have common exposure to risk attendant to that travel, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(i)(A): a tour operator;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(i)(B): a lodging provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(i)(C): a vacation property owner;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(i)(D): a hotel or resort;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(i)(E): a travel club;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(i)(F): a travel agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(i)(G): a property manager;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(i)(H): a cultural exchange program;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(i)(I): a common carrier; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(i)(J): the operator, owner, or lessor of a means of transportation of passengers, including an airline, a cruise line, a railroad, a steamship company, and a public bus carrier;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(ii): a college, school, or other institution of learning, covering students, teachers, employees, or volunteers;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(iii): an employer covering employees, volunteers, contractors, a board of directors, dependents, or guests;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(iv): a sports team, camp, or a sponsor of a sports team or camp, covering participants, members, campers, employees, officials, supervisors, or volunteers;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(v): a religious, charitable, recreational, educational, or civic organization, or a branch of a religious, charitable, recreational, educational, or civic organization, covering members, participants, or volunteers;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(vi): a financial institution, a financial institution vendor, or a parent holding company, trustee, or agent of or designated by a financial institution or a financial institution vendor, covering accountholders, credit card holders, debtors, guarantors, or purchasers;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(vii): an incorporated or unincorporated association, including a labor union, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(vii)(A): has a common interest, constitution, and bylaws;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(vii)(B): is organized and maintained in good faith for a purpose other than to cover members or participants of the association; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(vii)(C): covers members of the association;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(viii): an entertainment production company covering participants, volunteers, audience members, contestants, or workers;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(ix): a volunteer fire department, ambulance, rescue, police, or court or a volunteer first aid, civil defense, or other volunteer group similar to first aid or civil defense, covering members, participants, or volunteers;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(x): a preschool, a daycare institution for children or adults, or a senior citizen club, covering attendees or participants;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(xi): an automobile or truck rental or leasing company:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(xi)(A): covering individuals who may become renters, lessees, or passengers depending on the travel status of the individual on a rented or leased vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(xi)(B): if the common carrier, operator, owner or lessor of the means of transportation, or the automobile or truck rental or leasing company is the policyholder; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(xii): (4)(b)(i); (xi) a group not described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(xii)(A): the members of the group are engaged in a common enterprise, or have an economic, educational, or social affinity or relationship; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(4)(b)(xii)(B): issuance of the policy would not be contrary to the public interest.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(5): "Fulfillment material" means documentation that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(5)(a): is sent to the purchaser of a travel protection plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(5)(b): confirms the purchase of the travel protection plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(5)(c): provides the travel protection plan's coverage and assistance details.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(6): "Group travel insurance" means travel insurance issued to an eligible group, covering each certificate holder in the eligible group.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(7): 31A-23a-905(4) "Limited lines travel insurance producer" means one of the following designated by an insurer as the travel insurance supervising entity as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(7)(a): a licensed managing general agent or third party administrator; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(7)(b): a licensed insurance producer, including a limited lines producer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(8): "Offer and disseminate" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(8)(a): providing general information, including a description of the coverage and price;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(8)(b): processing an application;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(8)(c): collecting a premium; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(8)(d): performing activities that the state permits to be done by a person who is not licensed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(a): "Travel administrator" means a person who, in connection with travel insurance, directly or indirectly:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(a)(i): underwrites;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(a)(ii): collects a charge, collateral, or a premium from a resident of this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(a)(iii): adjusts or settles a claim on a resident of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(b): "Travel administrator" does not include a person whose action that would otherwise cause the person to be considered a travel administrator is among the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(b)(i): a person working for a travel administrator to the extent that the person's activities are subject to the supervision and control of the travel administrator;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(b)(ii): a travel retailer that, in accordance with this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(b)(ii)(A): offers and disseminates travel insurance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(b)(ii)(B): is registered under the license of a limited lines travel insurance producer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(b)(iii): an individual adjusting or settling claims:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(b)(iii)(A): in the normal course of that individual's practice or employment as an attorney; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(b)(iii)(B): who does not collect a charge or premium in connection with insurance coverage; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(9)(b)(iv): a business entity that is affiliated with a licensed insurer while acting as a travel administrator for the direct and assumed insurance business of an affiliated insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(a): "Travel assistance service" means a service:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(a)(i): for which the consumer is not indemnified based on a fortuitous event;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(a)(ii): where providing the service does not result in transfer or shifting of risk that would constitute the business of insurance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(a)(iii): that is furnished in connection with planned travel.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b): "Travel assistance service" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(i): a security advisory;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(ii): destination information;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(iii): a vaccination and immunization information service;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(iv): a travel reservation service;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(v): entertainment;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(vi): activity and event planning;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(vii): translation assistance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(viii): emergency messaging;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(ix): an international legal or medical referral;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(x): medical case monitoring;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(xi): coordination of transportation arrangements;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(xii): emergency cash transfer assistance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(xiii): medical prescription replacement assistance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(xiv): passport and travel document replacement assistance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(xv): lost luggage assistance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(10)(b)(xvi): a concierge service.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(11)(a): "Travel insurance" means insurance coverage for personal risks incident to planned travel, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(11)(a)(i): interruption or cancellation of a trip or event;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(11)(a)(ii): loss of baggage or personal effects;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(11)(a)(iii): damages to accommodations or rental vehicles;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(11)(a)(iv): sickness, accident, disability, or death during travel;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(11)(a)(v): emergency evacuation;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(11)(a)(vi): repatriation of remains; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(11)(a)(vii): a contractual obligation that indemnifies or pays a specified amount to the traveler upon a determinable contingency related to travel.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(11)(b): "Travel insurance" does not include a major medical plan that provides comprehensive medical protection for a traveler with a trip lasting six months or longer, including an individual working overseas or military personnel being deployed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(12): "Travel protection plan" means a plan that provides:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(12)(a): travel insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(12)(b): a travel assistance service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(12)(c): a cancellation fee waiver.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(13): "Travel retailer" means a business entity that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(13)(a): makes, arranges, or offers a travel service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902(13)(b): may offer and disseminate travel insurance as a service to the entity's customers on behalf of and under the direction of a limited lines travel insurance producer.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902.1 Scope.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902.1(1): The requirements under this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902.1(1)(a): apply to travel insurance:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902.1(1)(a)(i): that covers a resident of this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902.1(1)(a)(ii): that is sold, solicited, negotiated, or offered in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902.1(1)(a)(iii): for which policies and certificates are delivered or issued for delivery in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902.1(1)(b): do not apply, except as expressly provided, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902.1(1)(b)(i): a cancellation fee waiver; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902.1(1)(b)(ii): a travel assistance service.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-902.1(2): If there is a conflict between a provision of this part and another provision under this title, this part governs.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-903 Issuance of limited lines travel insurance producer license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-903(1): The commissioner may issue to an individual or business entity that has filed with the commissioner an application in a form and manner prescribed by the commissioner a limited lines travel insurance producer license that authorizes the limited lines travel insurance producer to sell, solicit, or negotiate travel insurance through a licensed insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-903(2): 31A-23a-108; 31A-23a-202 A limited lines travel insurance producer, and those registered under the license of the limited lines travel producer, are exempt from:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-903(2)(a): 31A-23a-108 the examination requirements under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-903(2)(b): 31A-23a-202 the continuing education requirements under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904 Travel retailers.
---------------------------------------------------
Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, a travel retailer may offer and disseminate travel insurance under a limited lines travel insurance producer business entity license only if the following conditions are met:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(1): The limited lines travel insurance producer or travel retailer shall provide to a purchaser of travel insurance:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(1)(a): a description of the material terms or the actual material terms of the insurance coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(1)(b): a description of the process for filing a claim;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(1)(c): a description of the review or cancellation process for the travel insurance policy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(1)(d): the identity and contact information of the insurer and limited lines travel insurance producer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(2)(a): At the time of licensure, the limited lines travel insurance producer shall establish and maintain a register on a form prescribed by the commissioner of each travel retailer that offers travel insurance on the limited lines travel insurance producer's behalf.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(2)(b): The limited lines travel insurance producer shall maintain and update the register annually and include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(2)(b)(i): the name, address, and contact information of the travel retailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(2)(b)(ii): the name, address, and contact information of an officer or person who directs or controls the travel retailer's operations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(2)(b)(iii): the travel retailer's federal tax identification number.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(2)(c): The limited lines travel insurance producer shall submit the register to the department upon reasonable request by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(2)(d): The limited lines travel insurance producer shall certify that the travel retailer registered with the limited lines travel insurance producer has not violated 18 U.S.C. Sec. 1033.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(3): The limited lines travel insurance producer shall designate one of its employees who is a licensed individual travel insurance producer as the designated responsible producer who is responsible for the limited lines travel insurance producer's compliance with the travel insurance laws and rules of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(4): The designated responsible producer, president, secretary, treasurer, and any other officer or person who directs or controls the limited lines travel insurance producer's insurance operations shall comply with the fingerprinting requirements applicable to insurance producers in the resident state of the limited lines travel insurance producer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(5): 31A-3-103 The limited lines travel insurance producer shall pay all applicable insurance producer licensing fees imposed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-904(6): The limited lines travel insurance producer shall require an employee or authorized representative of a travel retailer whose duties include offering and disseminating travel insurance to receive a program of instruction or training that may be subject to review by the commissioner.  The training materials shall, at a minimum, contain instructions on the types of insurance offered, ethical sales practices, and required disclosures to prospective customers.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905 Offering or disseminating travel insurance.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(1): A travel retailer offering or disseminating travel insurance shall make available to a prospective purchaser a brochure or other written material that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(1)(a): provides the identity and contact information of the insurer and the limited lines travel insurance producer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(1)(b): explains that the purchase of travel insurance is not required to purchase any other product or service from the travel retailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(1)(c): explains that an unlicensed travel retailer is permitted to provide general information about the insurance offered by the travel retailer, including a description of the coverage and price, but is not qualified or authorized to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(1)(c)(i): answer a technical question about the terms and conditions of the insurance the travel retailer offers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(1)(c)(ii): evaluate the adequacy of the prospective purchaser's existing insurance coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(2): A travel retailer's employee or authorized representative who is not licensed as an insurance producer may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(2)(a): evaluate or interpret the technical terms, benefits, and conditions of the offered travel insurance coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(2)(b): evaluate or provide advice concerning a prospective purchaser's existing insurance coverage; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(2)(c): hold the person out as a licensed insurer, licensed producer, or insurance expert.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(3): 31A-23a-904(2) Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, a travel retailer whose insurance-related activities, and the activities of the travel retailer's employees and authorized representatives, are limited to offering and disseminating travel insurance on behalf of and under the direction of a limited lines travel insurance producer meeting the conditions stated in this part, is authorized to do so and receive related compensation for services, upon registration of the limited lines travel insurance producer as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(4): As the insurer designee, the limited lines travel insurance producer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(4)(a): is responsible for the acts of the travel retailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(4)(b): shall use responsible means to ensure compliance by the travel retailer under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-905(5): A person licensed in a general line of authority as an insurance producer is authorized to sell, solicit, and negotiate travel insurance.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-906 Travel insurance.
---------------------------------------------------
Travel insurance may be provided under an individual policy or under a group or master policy.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908 Travel protection plans.
----------------------------------------------------------
A person may offer a travel protection plan for one price for the combined features that the travel protection plan offers, if:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(1): the person ensures the travel protection plan:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(1)(a): clearly discloses to the consumer, at or before the time of purchase, that the plan includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(1)(a)(i): travel insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(1)(a)(ii): a travel assistance service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(1)(a)(iii): a cancellation fee waiver; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(1)(b): provides information and an opportunity, at or before the time of purchase, for the consumer to obtain additional information regarding the features and pricing of the travel insurance, travel assistance service, and cancellation fee waiver, as applicable; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(2): the fulfillment material for the travel protection plan:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(2)(a): describes and delineates the travel insurance, travel assistance services, and cancellation fee waiver in the travel protection plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(2)(b): includes each travel insurance disclosure required under state law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(2)(c): includes the contact information for each person providing a:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(2)(c)(i): travel assistance service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-908(2)(c)(ii): cancellation fee waiver.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-911 Classification of travel insurance -- Standards -- Status.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-911(1): An insurer shall classify and file travel insurance under an inland marine line of insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-911(2): An insurer may:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-911(2)(a): issue travel insurance as an individual, group, or blanket policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-911(2)(b): develop eligibility and underwriting standards for travel insurance based on travel protection plans designed for individual or identified marketing or distribution channels, if the standards also meet underwriting standards for inland marine insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-911(3): Under this part, the following are not insurance:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-911(3)(a): a cancellation fee waiver; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-911(3)(b): a travel assistance service.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001 Definitions.
-----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(1): "Affiliated business" means the gross transaction revenue of a title entity's title insurance business in the state that is the result of an affiliated business arrangement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(2): "Affiliated business arrangement" means the same as that term is defined in 12 U.S.C. Sec. 2602, except the services that are the subject of the arrangement do not need to involve a federally related mortgage loan.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(3): "Applicable percentage" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(3)(a): on February 1, 2020, through January 31, 2021, 0.5%;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(3)(b): on February 1, 2021, through January 31, 2022, 1%;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(3)(c): on February 1, 2022, through January 31, 2023, 1.5%;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(3)(d): on February 1, 2023, through January 31, 2024, 2%;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(3)(e): on February 1, 2024, through January 31, 2025, 2.5%;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(3)(f): on February 1, 2025, through January 31, 2026, 3%;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(3)(g): on February 1, 2026, through January 31, 2027, 3.5%;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(3)(h): on February 1, 2027, through January 31, 2028, 4%; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(3)(i): on February 1, 2028, through January 31, 2029, 4.5%.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(4): "Associate" means the same as that term is defined in 12 U.S.C. Sec. 2602.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(5): 61-2-201 "Division" means the Division of Real Estate created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(6): (6)(b)(ii) "Essential function" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(6)(a): examining and evaluating, based on relevant law and title insurance underwriting principles and guidelines, title evidence to determine the insurability of a title and which items to include or exclude in a title commitment or title insurance policy to be issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(6)(b): (6)(b)(ii) preparing and issuing a title commitment or other document that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(6)(b)(i): discloses the status of the title as the title is proposed to be insured;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(6)(b)(ii): identifies the conditions that must be met before a title insurance policy will be issued; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(6)(b)(iii): (6)(b)(ii) obligates the insurer to issue a title insurance policy if the conditions described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(6)(d): preparing the issuance of a title insurance policy; or

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(7): "New or newly affiliated title entity" means a title entity that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(7)(a): is licensed as a title entity for the first time on or after May 14, 2019; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(7)(b):

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(10): "Section 8 of RESPA" means 12 U.S.C. Sec. 2607 and any rules promulgated thereunder.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11): "Sufficient capital and net worth" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(a): for a new or newly affiliated title entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(a)(i): $100,000 for the first five years after becoming a new or newly affiliated title entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(a)(ii): after the first five years after becoming a new or newly affiliated title entity, the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(a)(ii)(A): $50,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(a)(ii)(B): on February 1 of each year, an amount equal to 5% of the title entity's average annual gross revenue over the preceding two calendar years, up to $150,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(b): for a title entity licensed before May 14, 2019, who is not a new or newly affiliated title entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(b)(i): for the time period beginning on February 1, 2020, and ending on January 31, 2029, the lesser of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(b)(i)(A): an amount equal to the applicable percentage of the title entity's average annual gross revenue over the two calendar years immediately preceding the February 1 on which the applicable percentage first applies; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(b)(i)(B): $150,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(b)(ii): beginning on February 1, 2029, the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(b)(ii)(A): $50,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1001(11)(b)(ii)(B): an amount equal to 5% of the title entity's average annual gross revenue over the preceding two calendar years, up to $150,000.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003 Affiliated business arrangements.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(1): An affiliated business arrangement between a person and a title entity violates Section 8 of RESPA for purposes of state law if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(1)(a): the title entity does not have sufficient capital and net worth in a reserve account in the title entity's name; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(1)(b): more than 70% of the title entity's annual title insurance business is affiliated business on or after the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(1)(b)(i): two years after the title entity begins an affiliated business arrangement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(1)(b)(ii): June 1, 2021.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(2): (1) In addition to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(2)(a): whether the title entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(2)(a)(i): is staffed with the title entity's own employees to conduct title insurance business;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(2)(a)(ii): manages the title entity's own business affairs;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(2)(a)(iii): has a physical office for business that is separate from any producer's or associate's office and pays market rent;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(2)(a)(iv): provides the essential functions of title insurance business for a fee, including incurring the risks and receiving the rewards of any comparable title entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(2)(a)(v): performs the essential functions of title insurance business itself;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(2)(b): if the title entity contracts with another person to perform a portion of the title entity's title insurance business, whether the contract:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(2)(b)(i): is with an independent third party; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(2)(b)(ii): provides payment for the services that bears a reasonable relationship to the value of the services or goods received; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23a-1003(2)(c): whether the person from whom the title entity receives referrals under the affiliated business arrangement also sends title insurance business to other title entities.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 23b - Navigator License Act
*********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-101 Title.
----------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Navigator License Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(1): "Enroll" and "enrollment" mean to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(1)(a)(i): obtain personally identifiable information about an individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(1)(a)(ii): inform an individual about accident and health insurance plans or public programs offered on an exchange;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(1)(b): solicit insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(1)(c): submit to the exchange:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(1)(c)(i): personally identifiable information about an individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(1)(c)(ii): an individual's selection of a particular accident and health insurance plan or public program offered on the exchange.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(2): "Navigator":
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(2)(a): means a person who facilitates enrollment in an exchange by offering to assist, or who advertises any services to assist, with:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(2)(a)(i): the selection of and enrollment in a qualified health plan or a public program offered on an exchange; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(2)(a)(ii): applying for premium subsidies through an exchange; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(2)(b): includes a person who is an in-person assister or a certified application counselor as described in federal regulations or guidance issued under PPACA.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(3): "Personally identifiable information" is as defined in 45 C.F.R. Sec. 155.260.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(4): Title 26B, Chapter 3, Health Care - Administration and Assistance; Title 26B, Chapter 3, Part 9, Utah Children's Health Insurance Program "Public programs" means the state Medicaid program in
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(5): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act "Resident" is as defined by rule made by the commissioner in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-102(6): 31A-23a-102 "Solicit" means the same as that term is defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204 Character requirements.
---------------------------------------------------------
An applicant for a license under this chapter shall demonstrate to the commissioner that:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204(1): the applicant has the intent, in good faith, to engage in the practice of a navigator as the license would permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204(2): Chapter 23a, Insurance Marketing - Licensing Producers, Consultants, and Reinsurance Intermediaries
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204(2)(a): if a natural person, the applicant is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204(2)(a)(i): competent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204(2)(a)(ii): trustworthy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204(2)(b): Chapter 23a, Insurance Marketing - Licensing Producers, Consultants, and Reinsurance Intermediaries if the applicant is an agency:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204(2)(b)(i): the partners, directors, or principal officers or persons having comparable powers are trustworthy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204(2)(b)(ii): Chapter 23a, Insurance Marketing - Licensing Producers, Consultants, and Reinsurance Intermediaries that it will transact business in a way that the acts that may only be performed by a licensed navigator are performed only by a natural person who is licensed under this chapter, or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204(3): 31A-23b-207 the applicant intends to comply with the surety bond requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204(4): if a natural person, the applicant is at least 18 years of age; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-204(5): the applicant does not have a conflict of interest as defined by regulations issued under PPACA.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301 Unfair practices -- Compensation -- Limit of scope of practice.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(1): As used in this section, "false or misleading information" includes, with intent to deceive a person examining it:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(1)(a): filing a report;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(1)(b): making a false entry in a record; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(1)(c): willfully refraining from making a proper entry in a record.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2): (2)(a)(i); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(a): (2)(a)(i); (2)(a) Communication that contains false or misleading information relating to enrollment in an insurance plan or a public program, including information that is false or misleading because it is incomplete, may not be made by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(a)(i): a person who is or should be licensed under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(a)(ii): (2)(a)(i) an employee of a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(a)(iii): a person whose primary interest is as a competitor of a person licensed under this title; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(a)(iv): (2)(a) a person on behalf of a person listed in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(b): A licensee under this chapter may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(b)(i): use a business name, slogan, emblem, or related device that is misleading or likely to cause the exchange, insurer, or other licensee to be mistaken for another governmental agency, a PPACA exchange, insurer, or other licensee already in business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(b)(ii): use an advertisement or other insurance promotional material that would cause a reasonable person to mistakenly believe that a state or federal government agency, public program, or insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(b)(ii)(A): is responsible for the insurance or public program enrollment assistance activities of the person;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(b)(ii)(B): stands behind the credit of the person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(b)(ii)(C): is a source of payment of an insurance obligation of or sold by the person.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(2)(c): A person who is not an insurer may not assume or use a name that deceptively implies or suggests that person is an insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(3): A person may not engage in an unfair method of competition or any other unfair or deceptive act or practice in the business of insurance, as defined by the commissioner by rule, after a finding that the method of competition, the act, or the practice:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(3)(a): is misleading;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(3)(b): is deceptive;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(3)(c): is unfairly discriminatory;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(3)(d): provides an unfair inducement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-301(3)(e): unreasonably restrains competition.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-404 Penalties.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-404(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-404(1)(a): If, after notice and opportunity to be heard, the commissioner finds that the navigator or any other person has not materially complied with this part, or any rule made or order issued under this chapter, the commissioner may order the navigator or other person to cease doing business in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-404(1)(b): If the commissioner finds that because of the material noncompliance an insurer, any policyholder of an insurer, or a recipient of a public program who used the services of the navigator or other person has suffered any loss or damage due to the material noncompliance, the commissioner may:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-404(1)(b)(i): maintain a civil action or may intervene in an action brought by or on behalf of the insurer, policyholder, or the recipient of the public program, for recovery of compensatory damages for the benefit of the insurer, policyholder, or recipient of a public program; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-404(1)(b)(ii): seek other appropriate relief.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-404(2): Nothing in this section affects the right of the commissioner to impose any other penalties provided for in this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-23b-404(3): Nothing contained in this section is intended to or shall in any manner alter or affect the rights of policyholders, claimants, creditors, or other third parties.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 25 - Third Party Administrators
*************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-102 Scope and purposes.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-102(1): This chapter applies to all third party administrators.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-102(2): The purposes of this chapter include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-102(2)(a): encouraging disclosure of contracts between insurers and third party administrators, both to potential insureds and to the commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-102(2)(b): promoting the financial responsibility of third party administrators;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-102(2)(c): subjecting persons administering insurance in Utah to the jurisdiction of the Utah commissioner and courts;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-102(2)(d): regulating third party administrators' practices in conformity with the general purposes of this title; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-102(2)(e): governing the qualifications and procedures for the licensing of third party administrators.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-201 License and authority from insurers required.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-201(1): 31A-25-203 A person may not perform, offer to perform, or advertise any service as a third party administrator in Utah, without a valid license under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-201(2): (1) The commissioner may by rule exempt certain persons or classes of persons from the license requirement of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-201(3): A contract is not invalid as a result of a violation of this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-204 Character requirements.
--------------------------------------------------------
Each applicant for a license under this chapter shall show to the commissioner all of the following:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-204(1): that the applicant has the good faith intent to engage in the type of business the license applied for would permit;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-204(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-204(2)(a): if a natural person, that the applicant is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-204(2)(a)(i): competent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-204(2)(a)(ii): trustworthy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-204(2)(b): if a partnership or corporation, that all the partners, directors, principal officers, or persons having comparable powers are trustworthy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-204(3): if a natural person, that the applicant is at least 18 years of age.
