Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-301 Written agreements required.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-301(1): Every third party administrator shall have a written agreement with each insurer and with each group policyholder represented.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-301(2): (1) The agreements required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-301(3): If a policy is issued to a trustee, a copy of the trust agreement and its amendments shall be furnished to the third party administrator and kept on file in the offices of the third party administrator.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302 Books and records required -- Access.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302(1): Any insurer contracting with an administrator for administrator services has the right of continuing access to those records maintained by the third party administrator which permit the insurer to fulfill all of its contractual obligations to insured persons.  The proprietary rights of the parties in the records are governed by the written agreement between the insurer and third party administrator.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302(2): Every administrator shall maintain at a location accessible to the commissioner, for at least three years, the administrator's written agreements, and complete books and records of all transactions among the administrator, insurers, and insured persons.  The books and records shall be maintained in accordance with prudent standards of insurance recordkeeping. The administrator shall provide copies of the books and records to any successor administrator upon request.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302(3): The commissioner shall have access to the books and records maintained by the administrator for the purpose of audit and inspection.  Any trade secrets contained in the books and records, including the identity and addresses of policyholders and certificate holders, are confidential, except the commissioner may use that information in any proceeding instituted against the administrator.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302.5 Place of business and residence address.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302.5(1): A third-party administrator licensed under this chapter shall register and maintain with the commissioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302.5(1)(a): the address and one or more telephone numbers of the licensee's principal place of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302.5(1)(b): a valid business email address at which the commissioner may contact the licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302.5(1)(c): if the licensee is an individual, the licensee's residence address and telephone number.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302.5(2): A licensee shall notify the commissioner within 30 days of a change of any of the following required to be registered with the commissioner under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302.5(2)(a): an address;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302.5(2)(b): a telephone number; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-302.5(2)(c): a business email address.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-303 Standards pertaining to advertising and underwriting.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-303(1): A third party administrator may use advertising pertaining to the business underwritten by the insurer only to the extent it has been approved in writing by the insurer in advance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-303(2): 31A-25-301(1) The agreement required under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-304 Liability of the insurer if administrator receives premium.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If an insurer utilizes the services of a third party administrator under the terms of a written agreement, as required under this chapter, the payment to the third party administrator of any premiums for insurance by or on behalf of the insured is considered as having been received by the insurer.  However, the payment of return premiums or claims by the insurer to the third party administrator is not payment to the insured or claimant.  This chapter does not limit any right of the insurer against a third party administrator resulting from the third party administrator's failure to make payments to the insurer, insureds, or claimants.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-305 Fiduciary requirements for third party administrators.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-305(1): All money received by a third party administrator in that capacity shall be held by the third party administrator as a fiduciary.  The money shall be paid in a timely manner to the persons entitled to it.  While any money is being held by the third party administrator, it shall be deposited promptly in one or more fiduciary bank accounts maintained by the third party administrator pursuant to any rules the commissioner adopts to protect the integrity of the funds.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-305(2): If premiums deposited in a fiduciary account have been collected on behalf of more than one insurer or more than one class of insureds, the third party administrator shall keep records clearly recording the deposits and withdrawals from the account by or for the benefit of persons beneficially entitled to them, if there are not separate accounts for that purpose.  The third party administrator shall furnish the insurer or policyholder with copies of the records pertaining to deposits and withdrawals on behalf of the insurer or policyholder.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-305(3): 31A-25-306 The third party administrator may not pay any claim by withdrawals from a fiduciary account.  Withdrawals from the account may be made as provided in the written agreement between the third party administrator and the insurer, or between the third party administrator and the policyholders, as required under this chapter, for the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-305(3)(a): remittance to an insurer entitled to the remittance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-305(3)(b): deposit in an account maintained in the name of the insurer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-305(3)(c): 31A-25-306 transfer to and deposit in a claims-paying account, with claims to be paid as provided by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-305(3)(d): payment to a group policyholder for remittance to the insurer entitled to the remittance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-305(3)(e): payment to the third party administrator of its commission, fees, or charges; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-305(3)(f): remittance of return premiums to the persons entitled to them.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-306 Payments by administrator.
-----------------------------------------------------------
An administrator shall pay a claim from money collected on behalf of the insurer on drafts or checks as authorized by the insurer.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-307 Delivery by administrator of policies and communications from insurer.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any policies, certificates, booklets, termination notices, or other written communications delivered by the insurer to the administrator for delivery to its policyholders shall be delivered by the administrator promptly after receipt of instructions from the insurer to do so.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-401 Compensation not to be contingent on claims expense.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The compensation paid to a third party administrator for any policies under which the third party administrator adjusts or settles claims may be contingent on claims experience only if the third party administrator discloses to the person whose plan is being administered any conflicts of interest which are present on account of the compensation arrangement.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-402 Notice to insureds regarding administration of policies.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-402(1): If the services of a third party administrator are utilized, the third party administrator shall provide a written notice to the insureds, advising them of the identity of and relationship among the third party administrator, the policyholder, and  any insurer issuing the policy.  This notice shall be approved by the policyholder and by the insurer, if any.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-25-402(2): If a third party administrator collects funds, the third party administrator shall identify and state separately in writing to the person paying the administrator the amount of the third party administrator's charge and the premium specified by the insurer for the insurance coverage.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 26 - Insurance Adjusters
******************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-101 Purposes.
------------------------------------------
The purposes of this chapter are:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-101(1): to promote the professional competence of those engaged in claims adjusting;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-101(2): to encourage fair and rapid settlement of claims;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-101(3): to protect claimants under insurance policies from unfair claims adjustment practices;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-101(4): to prevent compensation arrangements for insurance adjusters that endanger the fairness of claim settlements; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-101(5): to govern the qualifications and procedures for the licensing of insurance adjusters.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter, unless expressly provided otherwise:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(1): "Company adjuster" means a person employed by an insurer who negotiates or settles claims on behalf of the insurer or an affiliated insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(2): (2)(a) "Designated home state" means the state or territory of the United States or the District of Columbia:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(2)(a): in which an insurance adjuster does not maintain the adjuster's principal:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(2)(a)(i): place of residence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(2)(a)(ii): place of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(2)(b): (2)(a) if the resident state, territory, or District of Columbia of the adjuster does not license adjusters for the line of authority sought, the adjuster has qualified for the license as if the person were a resident in the state, territory, or District of Columbia described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(2)(b)(i): examination requirement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(2)(b)(ii): fingerprint background check requirement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(2)(b)(iii): continuing education requirement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(2)(c): that the adjuster has designated as the insurance adjuster's designated home state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(3): (3)(a) "Home state" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(3)(a): a state or territory of the United States or the District of Columbia in which an insurance adjuster:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(3)(a)(i): maintains the adjuster's principal:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(3)(a)(i)(A): place of residence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(3)(a)(i)(B): place of business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(3)(a)(ii): is licensed to act as a resident adjuster; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(3)(b): (3)(a) if the resident state, territory, or the District of Columbia described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(3)(b)(i): in which the adjuster is licensed;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(3)(b)(ii): in which the adjuster is in good standing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(3)(b)(iii): that the adjuster has designated as the adjuster's designated home state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(4): 31A-26-201 "Independent adjuster" means an insurance adjuster required to be licensed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(5): "Insurance adjusting" or "adjusting" means directing or conducting the investigation, negotiation, or settlement of a claim under an insurance policy, on behalf of an insurer, policyholder, or a claimant under an insurance policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(6)(a): "Organization" means a person other than a natural person.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(6)(b): "Organization" includes a sole proprietorship by which a natural person does business under an assumed name.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(7): 31A-22-1802 "Portable electronics insurance" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-102(8): 31A-26-201 "Public adjuster" means a person required to be licensed under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-103 Workers' compensation claims.
--------------------------------------------------------------
In addition to being subject to this and other chapters of this title, insurers writing workers' compensation insurance in this state are subject to the Labor Commission with respect to claims for and payment of compensation and benefits.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-211 Claims liaison.
------------------------------------------------
Authorized insurers with employees engaged in insurance adjusting may be required by the commissioner to designate one or more natural persons to whom the commissioner or his staff may direct inquiries concerning the insurer's claims adjustments. Insurers shall report to the commissioner the name, title, business address, telephone number of, and any changes in its designees under this section.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-212 Emergency license.
---------------------------------------------------
In the event of a catastrophe or emergency which arises out of a disaster, act of God, riot, civil commotion, conflagration, or other similar occurrence, the commissioner shall, upon application, issue emergency licenses to persons who are not licensed adjusters.  An emergency license shall be applied for within a week of beginning claims adjustment.  It may remain in force for not more than 90 days, unless extended by the commissioner before it expires for an additional period of not more than 90 additional days.  The insurer who contracts with an independent adjuster who is so licensed is responsible for all his claims practices while so engaged, as if he were a regular salaried employee.  The fee for an emergency license is the same as the fee required of other licensed adjusters, unless the commissioner waives the fee.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301 Timely payment of claims.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(1)(a): Unless otherwise provided by law, an insurer shall timely pay every valid insurance claim made by an insured.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(1)(b): By rule the commissioner may prescribe:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(1)(b)(i): the kinds of notice and proof of loss that will establish validity;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(1)(b)(ii): the manner in which an insurer may make a bona fide denial of a claim;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(1)(b)(iii): the periods of time within which payment is required to be made to be timely; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(1)(b)(iv): the reasonable interest rates to be charged upon late claim payments.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(2): (1); (2)(b); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(2)(a): (1); (2)(b) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(2)(a)(i): the insurer is unable to pay the claim because there is no recipient legally able to give a valid release for the payment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(2)(a)(ii): the insurer is unable to determine who is entitled to receive the payment.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(2)(b): (2)(a) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(2)(b)(i): promptly notifies the claimant of the inability to pay the claim; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(2)(b)(ii): offers in good faith to pay the claim promptly when the inability to pay the claim is removed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3): 31A-1-301 This section applies only to a claim for first party benefits made by a person who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3)(a): named or defined as an insured under the terms of an insurance policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3)(b): 31A-1-301 described as a covered person under the terms of a policy of health care insurance as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3)(c): named, defined, or described:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3)(c)(i): as:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3)(c)(i)(A): an insured;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3)(c)(i)(B): a beneficiary;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3)(c)(i)(C): a policyholder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3)(c)(i)(D): otherwise covered person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3)(c)(ii): under the terms of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3)(c)(ii)(A): a life insurance policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301(3)(c)(ii)(B): an annuity.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5 Health care claims practices.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(1): 31A-8-407
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(1)(a): 31A-8-407 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(1)(b): If a health care service is covered by one or more individual or group health insurance policies, all insurers covering the insured have the responsibility to pay valid health care claims in a timely manner according to the terms and limits specified in the policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(2): 31A-22-610.1 A health care provider may:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(2)(a): 31A-22-610.1 except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(2)(b): bill an insured for services covered by health insurance policies or otherwise notify the insured of the expenses covered by the policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(3): Beginning October 31, 1992, all  insurers covering the insured shall notify the insured of payment and the amount of payment made to the health care provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(4): A health care provider shall return to an insured any amount the insured overpaid, including interest that begins accruing 90 days after the date of the overpayment, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(4)(a): the insured has multiple insurers with whom the health care provider has contracts that cover the insured; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(4)(b): the health care provider becomes aware that the health care provider has received, for any reason, payment for a claim in an amount greater than the health care provider's contracted rate allows.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(5)(a): The commissioner shall make rules consistent with this chapter governing disclosure to the insured of customary charges by health care providers on the explanation of benefits as part of the claims payment process.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(5)(b): These rules shall be limited to the form and content of the disclosures on the explanation of benefits, and shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(5)(b)(i): a requirement that the method of determination of any specifically referenced customary charges and the range of the customary charges be disclosed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(5)(b)(ii): a prohibition against an implication that the health care provider is charging excessively if the health care provider is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(5)(b)(ii)(A): a participating provider; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.5(5)(b)(ii)(B): prohibited from balance billing.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6 Health care claims practices.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(1): 31A-1-301 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(1)(a): "Health care provider" means a person licensed to provide health care under:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(1)(a)(i): Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 2, Health Care Facility Licensing and Inspection; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(1)(a)(ii): Title 58, Occupations and Professions.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(1)(b): 31A-1-301 "Insurer" means an admitted or authorized insurer, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(1)(b)(i): a health maintenance organization; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(1)(b)(ii): a third party administrator that is subject to this title, provided that nothing in this section may be construed as requiring a third party administrator to use its own funds to pay claims that have not been funded by the entity for which the third party administrator is paying claims.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(1)(c): "Provider" means a health care provider to whom an insurer is obligated to pay directly in connection with a claim by virtue of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(1)(c)(i): an agreement between the insurer and the provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(1)(c)(ii): an accident and health insurance policy or contract of the insurer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(1)(c)(iii): state or federal law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(2): An insurer shall timely pay every valid insurance claim submitted by a provider in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (4), within 30 days of the day on which the insurer receives a written claim, an insurer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(a)(i): pay the claim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(a)(ii): deny the claim and provide a written explanation for the denial.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(b)(i): Subject to Subsection (3)(b)(ii), the time period described in Subsection (3)(a) may be extended by 15 days if the insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(b)(i)(A): determines that the extension is necessary due to matters beyond the control of the insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(b)(i)(B): before the end of the 30-day period described in Subsection (3)(a), notifies the provider and insured in writing of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(b)(i)(B)(I): the circumstances requiring the extension of time; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(b)(i)(B)(II): the date by which the insurer expects to pay the claim or deny the claim with a written explanation for the denial.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(b)(ii): If an extension is necessary due to a failure of the provider or insured to submit the information necessary to decide the claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(b)(ii)(A): the notice of extension required by this Subsection (3)(b) shall specifically describe the required information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(3)(b)(ii)(B): the insurer shall give the provider or insured at least 45 days from the day on which the provider or insured receives the notice before the insurer denies the claim for failure to provide the information requested in Subsection (3)(b)(ii)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(a): In the case of a claim for income replacement benefits, within 45 days of the day on which the insurer receives a written claim, an insurer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(a)(i): pay the claim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(a)(ii): deny the claim and provide a written explanation of the denial.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(b): Subject to Subsections (4)(d) and (e), the time period described in Subsection (4)(a) may be extended for 30 days if the insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(b)(i): determines that the extension is necessary due to matters beyond the control of the insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(b)(ii): before the expiration of the 45-day period described in Subsection (4)(a), notifies the insured of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(b)(ii)(A): the circumstances requiring the extension of time; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(b)(ii)(B): the date by which the insurer expects to pay the claim or deny the claim with a written explanation for the denial.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(c): Subject to Subsections (4)(d) and (e), the time period for complying with Subsection (4)(a) may be extended for up to an additional 30 days from the day on which the 30-day extension period provided in Subsection (4)(b) ends if before the day on which the 30-day extension period ends, the insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(c)(i): determines that due to matters beyond the control of the insurer a decision cannot be rendered within the 30-day extension period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(c)(ii): notifies the insured of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(c)(ii)(A): the circumstances requiring the extension; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(c)(ii)(B): the date as of which the insurer expects to pay the claim or deny the claim with a written explanation for the denial.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(d): A notice of extension under this Subsection (4) shall specifically explain:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(d)(i): the standards on which entitlement to a benefit is based; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(d)(ii): the unresolved issues that prevent a decision on the claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(e): If an extension allowed by Subsection (4)(b) or (c) is necessary due to a failure of the insured to submit the information necessary to decide the claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(e)(i): the notice of extension required by Subsection (4)(b) or (c) shall specifically describe the necessary information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(4)(e)(ii): the insurer shall give the insured at least 45 days from the day on which the insured receives the notice before the insurer denies the claim for failure to provide the information requested in Subsection (4)(b) or (c).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(5): If a period of time is extended as permitted under Subsection (3)(b), (4)(b), or (4)(c), due to an insured or provider failing to submit information necessary to decide a claim, the period for making the benefit determination shall be tolled from the date on which the notification of the extension is sent to the insured or provider until the date on which the insured or provider responds to the request for additional information.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(6): An insurer shall pay all sums to the provider or insured that the insurer is obligated to pay on the claim, and provide a written explanation of the insurer's decision regarding any part of the claim that is denied within 20 days of receiving the information requested under Subsection (3)(b), (4)(b), or (4)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(7): 31A-22-629; 26B-3-101
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(7)(a): Whenever an insurer makes a payment to a provider on any part of a claim under this section, the insurer shall also send to the insured an explanation of benefits paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(7)(b): 31A-22-629 Whenever an insurer denies any part of a claim under this section, the insurer shall also send to the insured:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(7)(b)(i): a written explanation of the part of the claim that was denied; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(7)(b)(ii): 31A-22-629 notice of the adverse benefit determination review process established under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(7)(c): 26B-3-101 This Subsection (7) does not apply to a person receiving benefits under the state Medicaid program as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(8)(a): A late fee shall be imposed on:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(8)(a)(i): an insurer that fails to timely pay a claim in accordance with this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(8)(a)(ii): a provider that fails to timely provide information on a claim in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(8)(b): The late fee described in Subsection (8)(a) shall be determined by multiplying together:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(8)(b)(i): the total amount of the claim the insurer is obliged to pay;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(8)(b)(ii): the total number of days the response or the payment is late; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(8)(b)(iii): 0.033%  daily interest rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(8)(c): Any late fee paid or collected under this Subsection (8) shall be separately identified on the documentation used by the insurer to pay the claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(8)(d): For purposes of this Subsection (8), "late fee" does not include an amount that is less than $1.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(9): Each insurer shall establish a review process to resolve claims-related disputes between the insurer and providers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10): An insurer or person representing an insurer may not engage in any unfair claim settlement practice with respect to a provider.  Unfair claim settlement practices include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10)(a): knowingly misrepresenting a material fact or the contents of an insurance policy in connection with a claim;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10)(b): failing to acknowledge and substantively respond within 15 days to any written communication from a provider relating to a pending claim;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10)(c): denying or threatening to deny the payment of a claim for any reason that is not clearly described in the insured's policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10)(d): failing to maintain a payment process sufficient to comply with this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10)(e): failing to maintain claims documentation sufficient to demonstrate compliance with this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10)(f): failing, upon request, to give to the provider written information regarding the specific rate and terms under which the provider will be paid for health care services;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10)(g): failing to timely pay a valid claim in accordance with this section as a means of influencing, intimidating, retaliating, or gaining an advantage over the provider with respect to an unrelated claim, an undisputed part of a pending claim, or some other aspect of the contractual relationship;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10)(h): failing to pay the sum when required and as required under Subsection (8) when a violation has occurred;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10)(i): threatening to retaliate or actual retaliation against a provider for the provider applying this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10)(j): any material violation of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(10)(k): any other unfair claim settlement practice established in rule or law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(11)(a): The provisions of this section shall apply to each contract between an insurer and a provider for the duration of the contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(11)(b): Notwithstanding Subsection (11)(a), this section may not be the basis for a bad faith insurance claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(11)(c): Nothing in Subsection (11)(a) may be construed as limiting the ability of an insurer and a provider from including provisions in their contract that are more stringent than the provisions of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(12): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(12)(a): Pursuant to Chapter 2, Part 2, Duties and Powers of Commissioner, the commissioner may conduct examinations to determine an insurer's level of compliance with this section and impose sanctions for each violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(12)(b): The commissioner may adopt rules only as necessary to implement this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(12)(c): The commissioner may establish rules to facilitate the exchange of electronic confirmations when claims-related information has been received.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(12)(d): Notwithstanding Subsection (12)(b), the commissioner may not adopt rules regarding the review process required by Subsection (9).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(13): 31A-26-301.5 Nothing in this section may be construed as limiting the collection rights of a provider under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(14): 31A-31-103 Nothing in this section may be construed as limiting the ability of an insurer to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(14)(a): 31A-31-103 recover any amount improperly paid to a provider or an insured:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(14)(a)(i): 31A-31-103 in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(14)(a)(ii): within 24 months of the amount improperly paid for a coordination of benefits error;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(14)(a)(iii): within 12 months of the amount improperly paid for any other reason not identified in Subsection (14)(a)(i) or (ii); or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(14)(a)(iv): within 36 months of the amount improperly paid when the improper payment was due to a recovery by Medicaid, Medicare, the Children's Health Insurance Program, or any other state or federal health care program;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(14)(b): take any action against a provider that is permitted under the terms of the provider contract and not prohibited by this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(14)(c): report the provider to a state or federal agency with regulatory authority over the provider for unprofessional, unlawful, or fraudulent conduct; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(14)(d): enter into a mutual agreement with a provider to resolve alleged violations of this section through mediation or binding arbitration.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(15): A provider may only seek recovery from the insurer for an amount improperly paid by the insurer within the same time frames as Subsections (14)(a) and (b).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(16): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(16)(a): An insurer may offer the remittance of payment through a credit card or other similar arrangement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(16)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(16)(b)(i): A provider may elect not to receive remittance through a credit card or other similar arrangement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(16)(b)(ii): An insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(16)(b)(ii)(A): shall permit a provider's election described in Subsection (16)(b)(i) to apply to the provider's entire practice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(16)(b)(ii)(B): may not require a provider's election described in Subsection (16)(b)(i) to be made on a patient-by-patient basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.6(16)(c): An insurer may not require a provider or insured to accept remittance through a credit card or other similar arrangement.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7 Dental claim transparency.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(1): 31A-22-646; 31A-22-646 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(1)(a): "Bundling" means the practice of combining distinct dental procedures into one procedure for billing purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(1)(b): 31A-22-646 "Dental plan" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(1)(c): "Downcoding" means the adjustment of a claim submitted to a dental plan to a less complex or lower cost procedure code.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(1)(d): 31A-22-646 "Covered services" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(1)(e): "Material change" means a change to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(1)(e)(i): a dental plan's rules, guidelines, policies, or procedures concerning payment for dental services;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(1)(e)(ii): the general policies of the dental plan that affect a reimbursement paid to providers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(1)(e)(iii): the manner by which a dental plan adjudicates and pays a claim for services.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(2): An insurer that contracts or renews a contract with a dental provider shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(2)(a): make a copy of the insurer's current dental plan policies available online; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(2)(b): if requested by a provider, send a copy of the policies to the provider through mail or electronic mail.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(3): (2); 31A-22-629; (3)(c)(i) Dental policies described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(3)(a): a summary of all material changes made to a dental plan since the policies were last updated;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(3)(b): the downcoding and bundling policies that the insurer reasonably expects to be applied to the dental provider or provider's services as a matter of policy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(3)(c): 31A-22-629; (3)(c)(i) a description of the dental plan's utilization review procedures, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(3)(c)(i): 31A-22-629 a procedure for an enrollee of the dental plan to obtain review of an adverse determination in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(3)(c)(ii): (3)(c)(i) a statement of a provider's rights and responsibilities regarding the procedures described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(4): An insurer may not maintain a dental plan that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(4)(a): based on the provider's contracted fee for covered services, uses downcoding in a manner that prevents a dental provider from collecting the fee for the actual service performed from either the plan or the patient; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(4)(b): uses bundling in a manner where a procedure code is labeled as nonbillable to the patient unless, under generally accepted practice standards, the procedure code is for a procedure that may be provided in conjunction with another procedure.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-301.7(5): An insurer shall ensure that an explanation of benefits for a dental plan includes the reason for any downcoding or bundling result.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-302 Settlement of claims in credit life and accident and health insurance.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-302(1): The creditor shall promptly report all claims to the insurer or its designated claim representative.  The insurer shall maintain adequate claims files.  All claims shall be settled as soon as possible in accordance with the terms of the insurance contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-302(2): The insurer shall pay all claims either by draft drawn upon the insurer or by check of the insurer to the order of the claimant to whom payment of the claim is due pursuant to the policy provisions, or upon direction of that claimant to another.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-302(3): A person other than the insurer or its designated claim representative may not settle or adjust claims.  The creditor may not be designated as a claims representative.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303 Unfair claim settlement practices.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(1): (2); (3); (4) No insurer or person representing an insurer may engage in any unfair claim settlement practice under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(2): (2)(c) Each of the following acts is an unfair claim settlement practice:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(2)(a): knowingly misrepresenting material facts or the contents of insurance policy provisions at issue in connection with a claim under an insurance contract; however, this provision does not include the failure to disclose information;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(2)(b): attempting to use a policy application which was altered by the insurer without notice to, or knowledge, or consent of, the insured as the basis for settling or refusing to settle a claim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(2)(c): (2)(c) failing to settle a claim promptly under one portion of the insurance policy coverage, where liability and the amount of loss are reasonably clear, in order to influence settlements under other portions of the insurance policy coverage, but this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(3): Each of the following is an unfair claim settlement practice if committed or performed with such frequency as to indicate a general business practice by an insurer or persons representing an insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(3)(a): failing to acknowledge and act promptly upon communications about claims under insurance policies;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(3)(b): failing to adopt and implement reasonable standards for the prompt investigation and processing of claims under insurance policies;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(3)(c): compelling insureds to institute litigation to recover amounts due under an insurance policy by offering substantially less than the amounts ultimately recovered in actions brought by those insureds when the amounts claimed were reasonably near to the amounts recovered;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(3)(d): failing, after payment of a claim, to inform insureds or beneficiaries, upon request by them, of the coverage under which payment was made;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(3)(e): failing to promptly provide to the insured a reasonable explanation of the basis for denial of a claim or for the offer of a compromise settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(3)(f): appealing from substantially all arbitration awards in favor of insureds for the purpose of compelling them to accept settlements or compromises for less than the amount awarded in arbitration;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(3)(g): delaying the investigation or payment of claims by requiring an insured, claimant, or the physician of either to submit a preliminary claim report and then requiring the subsequent submission of formal proof of loss forms which contain substantially the same information; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(3)(h): not attempting in good faith to effectuate a prompt, fair, and equitable settlement of claims in which liability is reasonably clear.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(4): The commissioner may define by rule, acts or general business practices which are unfair claim settlement practices, after a finding that those practices are misleading, deceptive, unfairly discriminatory, overreaching, or an unreasonable restraint on competition.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-303(5): This section does not create any private cause of action.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-304 Prohibition of conflicting roles.
------------------------------------------------------------------
A person licensed concurrently as both an independent and a public adjuster may not represent both the insurer and the insured in the same transaction.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-305 Request for accepted check.
------------------------------------------------------------
If an insurance policy claimant entitled to receive money in settlement of a claim makes a timely request to the insurer for payment by accepted check, the insurer shall make payment to the claimant with a check accepted by the drawee under Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-306 Place of business -- Records.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-306(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-306(1)(a): An insurance adjuster licensed under this chapter shall register and maintain with the commissioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-306(1)(a)(i): the address and telephone number of the licensee's principal place of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-306(1)(a)(ii): a valid business email address at which the commissioner may contact the licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-306(1)(a)(iii): if the licensee is an individual, the licensee's residence address and telephone number.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-307 Claim reports to commissioner.
---------------------------------------------------------------
On the commissioner's request, any insurer or licensed adjuster connected with a loss or claim shall report to the commissioner all facts relative to the loss or claim arising under any insurance contract covering a subject of insurance that is resident, located, or to be performed in this state.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-26-308 Settlement of liability insurance claim not admission of liability.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
No settlement or partial settlement of a claim against any insured under a liability insurance policy is an admission, by either the insured or the insurer, of the liability of the insured on any claim arising from the same event or set of facts, whether the settlement is made by the insured, the insurer, or any other person on behalf of the insured or the insurer.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 27 - Delinquency Administrative Action Provisions
*******************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501 Title -- Construction -- Commissioner's powers.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(1): This chapter is known as the "Delinquency Administrative Action Provisions."
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(2): The proceedings authorized by this part may be applied to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(2)(a): all insurers and reinsurers:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(2)(a)(i): who are doing, or have done, an insurance business in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(2)(a)(ii): against whom claims arising from that business may exist;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(2)(b): all insurers who have the appearance of or claim they do an insurance business in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(2)(c): all insurers who have insureds resident in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(2)(d): all other persons organized or in the process of organizing to do an insurance business as an insurer in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(3): This part shall be liberally construed to protect the interests of insureds, creditors, and the public generally, with minimum interference with the normal prerogatives of owners, through:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(3)(a): early detection of any potentially dangerous condition in an insurer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(3)(b): prompt application of appropriate regulatory corrective measures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(3)(c): regulation of the insurance business by law relating to insolvency of insurers and by substantive rules on the entire insurance business.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27-501(4): This part does not limit the powers granted the commissioner by other provisions of law.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105 Jurisdiction.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105(1)(a): A delinquency proceeding under this chapter may not be commenced by a person other than the commissioner of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105(1)(b): No court has jurisdiction to entertain, hear, or determine a delinquency proceeding commenced by any person other than the commissioner of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105(2): Other than in accordance with this chapter, a court of this state has no jurisdiction to entertain, hear, or determine any complaint:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105(2)(a): requesting the liquidation, rehabilitation, seizure, sequestration, or receivership of an insurer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105(2)(b): requesting a stay, an injunction, a restraining order, or other relief preliminary to, incidental to, or relating to a delinquency proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105(3)(a): The receivership court, as of the commencement of a delinquency proceeding under this chapter, has exclusive jurisdiction of all property of the insurer, wherever located, including property located outside the territorial limits of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105(3)(b): The receivership court has original but not exclusive jurisdiction of all civil proceedings arising:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105(3)(b)(i): under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-105(3)(b)(ii): in or related to a delinquency proceeding under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-106 Exemption from fees.
------------------------------------------------------
The receiver may not be required to pay any of the following fees to a public officer of this state:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-106(1): filing fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-106(2): recording fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-106(3): transcript fees;

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-106(5): certification fees; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-106(6): authentication fees.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1 Injunctions and orders applicable to a federal home loan bank.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(1)(a): "Federal home loan bank" means the same as that term is defined in 12 U.S.C.  Sec. 1422.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(1)(b): "Insurer-member" means an insurer that is a member as defined in 12 U.S.C. Sec. 1422.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(a): Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, after the seventh day following the filing of a delinquency proceeding, a state court may not stay or prohibit a federal home loan bank from exercising its rights regarding collateral pledged by an insurer-member.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(b): A federal home loan bank may repurchase any outstanding capital stock that is in excess of the amount of federal home loan bank stock that the federal loan bank requires the insurer-member to hold as a minimum investment if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(b)(i): the insurer-member is subject to a delinquency proceeding;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(b)(ii): the federal home loan bank exercises the federal home loan bank's rights regarding collateral pledged by the insurer-member;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(b)(iii): the federal home loan bank, in good faith, determines the repurchase is permissible under applicable laws, regulations, regulatory obligations, and the federal home loan bank's capital plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(b)(iv): the repurchase is consistent with the federal home loan bank's current capital stock practices that apply to the federal home loan bank's entire membership.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(c): Subject to Subsection (2)(d), after a court appoints a receiver for an insurer-member, a federal home loan bank shall provide the receiver a process, and establish a timeline, for the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(c)(i): the release of collateral that exceeds the amount required to support secured obligations remaining after any repayment of loans as determined in accordance with the applicable agreements between the federal home loan bank and the insurer-member;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(c)(ii): the release of any of the insurer-member's collateral remaining in the federal home loan bank's possession following full repayment of all outstanding secured obligations of the insurer-member;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(c)(iii): the payment of fees owed by the insurer-member and the operation of deposits and other accounts of the insurer-member with the federal home loan bank; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(c)(iv): the possible redemption or repurchase of federal home loan bank stock or excess stock of any class that an insurer-member is required to own.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(d): An insurer-member shall provide the information described in Subsection (2)(c) within 10 business days after the day on which the receiver requests the information.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(e): Upon request from a receiver, a federal home loan bank shall provide any available options for an insurer-member subject to a delinquency proceeding to renew or restructure a loan to defer associated prepayment fees, subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(e)(i): market conditions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(e)(ii): the terms of any loan outstanding to the insurer-member;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(e)(iii): the applicable policies of the federal home loan bank; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(2)(e)(iv): the federal home loan bank's compliance with federal laws and regulations.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(3)(a): Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, the receiver for an insurer-member may not void any transfer of, or any obligation to transfer, money or any other property arising under or in connection with:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(3)(a)(i): any federal home loan bank security agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(3)(a)(ii): any pledge, security, collateral, or guarantee agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(3)(a)(iii): any other similar arrangement or credit enhancement relating to a federal home loan bank security agreement made in the ordinary course of business and in compliance with the applicable federal home loan bank agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(3)(b): Notwithstanding Subsection (3)(a), an insurer-member may avoid a transfer if a party to the transfer made the transfer with intent to hinder, delay, or defraud the insurer-member, the receiver for the insurer-member, or an existing or future creditor.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-108.1(3)(c): This subsection shall not affect a receiver's rights regarding advances to an insurer-member in a delinquency proceeding pursuant to 12 C.F.R. Sec. 1266.4.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-109(1)(a): the end of the period, including any suspension of the period occurring on or after the day on which the initial petition in a delinquency proceeding is filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-109(1)(b): six years after the day on which the most recent receivership order is entered.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-109(2)(a)(ii): 60 days after the day on which the most recent receivership order is entered.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-109(2)(b): (2); (2)(b)(i); (ii) This Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-110(3)(a): a delinquency proceeding; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-110(3)(b): an investigation preliminary or incidental to a delinquency proceeding.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113 Executory contracts.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(1): Subject to the other provisions of this section, the receiver may assume or reject an executory contract or unexpired lease of the insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(2): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(2)(a): If there is a default in an executory contract or unexpired lease of the insurer, the receiver may not assume the contract or lease unless, at the time of the assumption of the contract or lease, the receiver:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(2)(a)(i): cures or provides adequate assurance that the receiver will promptly cure the default; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(2)(a)(ii): provides adequate assurance of future performance under the contract or lease.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(2)(b): (2) This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(2)(b)(i): the insolvency or financial condition of the insurer at any time before the closing of the delinquency proceeding;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(2)(b)(ii): the appointment of or taking possession by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(2)(b)(ii)(A): a receiver in a case under this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(2)(b)(ii)(B): a custodian before the commencement of the delinquency proceeding; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(2)(b)(iii): the satisfaction of a penalty rate or provision relating to a default arising from a failure of the insurer to perform a nonmonetary obligation under the executory contract or unexpired lease.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-113(3): A claim arising from a rejection under this section or under a plan of rehabilitation or liquidation of an executory contract or unexpired lease of the insurer that is not assumed shall be determined, and shall be treated and classified as though the claim arose before the day on which a successful petition commencing the delinquency proceeding is filed.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114 Immunity and indemnification.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1): (1)(b) For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(a): "Receiver's assistant" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(a)(i): a present or former special deputy or assistant special deputy engaged by contract or otherwise;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(a)(ii): a person whom the receiver, a special deputy, or an assistant special deputy employs to assist in a delinquency proceeding under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(a)(iii): a state employee acting with respect to a delinquency proceeding under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(b): (1)(b) "Receiver's contractor" includes a person with whom the receiver, a special deputy, or an assistant special deputy contracts to assist in a delinquency proceeding under this chapter such as:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(b)(i): an attorney;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(b)(ii): an accountant;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(b)(iii): an auditor;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(b)(iv): an actuary;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(b)(v): an investment banker;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(b)(vi): a financial advisor;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(b)(vii): any other professional or firm who is retained or contracted with by the receiver as an independent contractor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(1)(b)(viii): (1)(b) an employee of a person described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(2): For the purposes of this section, the following persons are entitled to immunity and indemnification, or only immunity, as applicable:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(2)(a): a present or former receiver responsible for the conduct of a delinquency proceeding under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(2)(b): a present or former receiver's assistant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(2)(c): a present or former receiver's contractor.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(3): The receiver, a receiver's assistant, and a receiver's contractor have immunity under this chapter, as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(3)(a): the receiver, a receiver's assistant, and a receiver's contractor have official immunity and are immune from suit and liability, both personally and in their official capacities, for any claim for damage to or loss of property, personal injury, or other civil liability caused by or resulting from an alleged act, error, or omission of the receiver, a receiver's assistant, or a receiver's contractor arising out of or by reason of the receiver's, receiver's assistant's, or receiver's contractor's duties or employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(3)(b): the receiver, a receiver's assistant, and a receiver's contractor have absolute judicial immunity and are immune from suit and liability, both personally and in their official capacities, for any claim for damage to or loss of property, personal injury, or other civil liability caused by or resulting from any alleged act, error, or omission of the receiver, a receiver's assistant, or a receiver's contractor arising out of or by reason of any matter that is subject to review by the receivership court after notice and opportunity to be heard, if the alleged act, error, or omission is not disapproved or disallowed by the receivership court; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(3)(c): this chapter may not be construed to provide official immunity, to provide judicial immunity, or to otherwise hold the receiver, a receiver's assistant, or a receiver's contractor immune from suit and liability for any damage, loss, injury, or liability caused by the intentional or willful and wanton misconduct of the receiver, a receiver's assistant, or a receiver's contractor.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4): The receiver or a receiver's assistant is entitled to indemnification under this chapter, as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(a): the receiver and a receiver's assistant shall be indemnified from the assets of the insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(a)(i): if any legal action is commenced against the receiver or a receiver's assistant:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(a)(i)(A): whether against the receiver or receiver's assistant personally or in the official capacity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(a)(i)(B): alleging property damage, property loss, personal injury, or other civil liability caused by or resulting from any alleged act, error, or omission of the receiver or a receiver's assistant arising out of or by reason of the receiver's or receiver's assistant's duties or employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(a)(ii): for all expenses, attorney fees, judgments, settlements, decrees, or amounts due and owing or paid in satisfaction of or incurred in the defense of the legal action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(a)(iii): unless it is determined upon a final adjudication on the merits that the alleged act, error, or omission of the receiver or receiver's assistant giving rise to the claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(a)(iii)(A): does not arise out of or by reason of the receiver's or receiver's assistant's duties or employment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(a)(iii)(B): is caused by intentional or willful and wanton misconduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(b): attorney fees and related expenses incurred in defending a legal action for which immunity or indemnity is available under this section shall be paid from the assets of the insurer as they are incurred, in advance of the final disposition of the action upon receipt of an agreement by or on behalf of the receiver or receiver's assistant to repay the attorney fees and expenses if it is ultimately determined upon a final adjudication on the merits that the receiver or receiver's assistant is not entitled to immunity or indemnity under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(c): the following paid pursuant to this section are an administrative expense of the insurer, an indemnification for:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(c)(i): an expense payment;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(c)(ii): a judgment;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(c)(iii): a settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(c)(iv): a decree;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(c)(v): attorney fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(c)(vi): a surety bond premium; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(c)(vii): other amounts paid or to be paid from the insurer's assets pursuant to this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(d): in the event of actual or threatened litigation against a receiver or a receiver's assistant for which immunity or indemnity may be available under this section, a reasonable amount of funds which in the judgment of the receiver may be needed to provide immunity or indemnity shall be segregated and reserved from the assets of the insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(d)(i): as security for the payment of indemnity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(d)(ii): until:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(d)(ii)(A): all applicable statutes of limitations run;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(d)(ii)(B): all actual or threatened actions against the receiver or a receiver's assistant are completely and finally resolved; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(d)(ii)(C): all obligations under this section are satisfied;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(e): in lieu of segregation and reserving of funds, the receiver may, in the receiver's discretion, obtain a surety bond or make other arrangements that will enable the receiver to fully secure the payment of all obligations under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(f): if a legal action against a receiver's assistant for which indemnity may be available under this section is settled before final adjudication on the merits, the receiver shall pay the settlement amount on behalf of the receiver's assistant, or indemnify the receiver's assistant for the settlement amount, unless the receiver determines that the claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(f)(i): does not arise out of or by reason of the receiver's assistant's duties or employment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(f)(ii): is caused by the intentional or willful and wanton misconduct of the receiver's assistant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(g): in a legal action in which a claim is asserted against the receiver:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(g)(i): that portion of any settlement relating to the alleged act, error, or omission of the receiver is subject to the approval of the receivership court; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(g)(ii): the receivership court may not approve that portion of the settlement if the receivership court determines that the claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(g)(ii)(A): does not arise out of or by reason of the receiver's duties or employment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(4)(g)(ii)(B): is caused by the intentional or willful and wanton misconduct of the receiver.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(5): Nothing contained or implied in this section shall operate, or be construed or applied to deprive the receiver, a receiver's assistant, or a receiver's contractor of any immunity, indemnity, benefits of law, rights, or any defense otherwise available.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(6): The immunity and indemnification provided to a receiver's assistant and the immunity provided to a receiver's contractor under this section does not apply to an action by the receiver against the receiver's assistant or receiver's contractor.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(7): (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(7)(a): (3) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-114(7)(b): A legal action may not lie against the receiver or a receiver's assistant based in whole or in part on an alleged act, error, or omission that takes place before April 30, 2007, unless suit is filed and valid service of process is obtained on or after April 30, 2007, but on or before April 30, 2008.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117 Records.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(a): Upon entry of an order of rehabilitation or liquidation, the receiver is vested with title to all of the records of the insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(a)(i): of whatever nature;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(a)(ii): in whatever medium;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(a)(iii): wherever located; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(a)(iv): regardless of whether the item is in the custody and control of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(a)(iv)(A): a third party administrator;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(a)(iv)(B): a managing general agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(a)(iv)(C): an attorney; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(a)(iv)(D): other representatives of the insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(b): The receiver may immediately take possession and control of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(b)(i): all of the records of the insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(b)(ii): the premises where the records are located.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(c): At the request of the receiver, a third party administrator, managing general agent, attorney, or other representatives of the insurer shall release all records of the insurer to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(c)(i): the receiver; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(c)(ii): the receiver's designee.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(1)(d): With the receiver's approval, an affected guaranty association with an obligation under a policy issued by the insurer may take actions necessary to obtain directly from a third party administrator, managing general agent, attorney, or other representative of the insurer all records pertaining to the insurer's business that are appropriate or necessary for the affected guaranty association to fulfill its statutory obligations.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(2): (1) The receiver may certify a record of a delinquent insurer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(2)(a): a record of a delinquent insurer may be certified by the receiver in an affidavit stating that the record is a true and correct copy of the record of the insurer that is received from the custody of the insurer, or found among the insurer's effects; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(2)(b): a record created by or filed with the receiver's office in connection with a delinquent insurer may be certified by the receiver's affidavit stating that the record is a true and correct copy of the record maintained by the receiver's office.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(3): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(3)(a): (2) An original record or copy of a record certified under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(3)(a)(i): when admitted in evidence is prima facie evidence of the facts disclosed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(3)(a)(ii): is admissible in evidence in the same manner as a document described in Utah Rules of Evidence, Rule 902(1).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(3)(b): The receivership court may consider the certification of a record by the receiver pursuant to this section as satisfying the requirements of Utah Rules of Evidence, Rule 803(6).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-117(4): Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act A record of a delinquent insurer held by the receiver:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-119 Delinquency proceeding commenced before April 30, 2007.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This chapter does not apply to a delinquency proceeding ongoing on April 30, 2007.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-120 Severability.
-----------------------------------------------
If any provision of this chapter or the application of this chapter to any person or circumstance is for any reason held invalid, the remainder of the chapter and the application of the provision to other persons or circumstances shall be given effect without the invalid provision or application.  The provisions of this chapter are severable.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201 Receivership court's seizure order.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(1): Title 78A, Judiciary and Judicial Administration; 31A-27a-901 The commissioner may petition a court with jurisdiction under
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(1)(a): 31A-27a-901 with respect to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(1)(a)(i): an insurer domiciled in this state;

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(1)(a)(iii): 31A-27a-901 pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(1)(b): alleging that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(1)(b)(i): there exists grounds that would justify a court order for a formal delinquency proceeding against the insurer under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(1)(b)(ii): the interests of policyholders, creditors, or the public will be endangered by delay; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(1)(c): setting forth the contents of a seizure order considered necessary by the commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(2): (1); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(2)(a): (1) Upon a filing under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(2)(a)(i): immediately, ex parte, and without notice or hearing;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(2)(a)(ii): that directs the commissioner to take possession and control of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(2)(a)(ii)(A): all or a part of the property, accounts, and records of an insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(2)(a)(ii)(B): the premises occupied by the insurer for transaction of the insurer's business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(2)(a)(iii): that until further order of the receivership court, enjoins the insurer and its officers, managers, agents, and employees from disposition of its property and from the transaction of its business except with the written consent of the commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(2)(b): (2) A person having possession or control of and refusing to deliver any of the records or assets of a person against whom a seizure order is issued under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(3)(a): A petition that requests injunctive relief:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(3)(a)(i): shall be verified by the commissioner or the commissioner's designee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(3)(a)(ii): is not required to plead or prove irreparable harm or inadequate remedy at law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(3)(b): The commissioner shall provide only the notice that the receivership court may require.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(4):

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(4)(b)(i)(A)(II): on motion of the insurer; or

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(4)(b)(i)(B): after the notice the receivership court considers appropriate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(4)(b)(ii): extend, shorten, or modify the terms of the seizure order.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(4)(c): The receivership court shall vacate the seizure order if the commissioner fails to commence a formal proceeding under this chapter after having had a reasonable opportunity to commence a formal proceeding under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(4)(d): An order of the receivership court pursuant to a formal proceeding under this chapter vacates the seizure order.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(5): Entry of a seizure order under this section does not constitute a breach or an anticipatory breach of a contract of the insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-201(6): (6); (6)
