Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202 Commencement of formal delinquency proceeding.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(1): A formal delinquency proceeding against a person shall be commenced by filing a petition in the name of the commissioner or department.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(2): (1); 31A-27a-108
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(2)(a): (1); 31A-27a-108 The petition required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(2)(a)(i): shall state:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(2)(a)(i)(A): the grounds upon which the proceeding is based; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(2)(a)(i)(B): the relief requested; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(2)(a)(ii): 31A-27a-108 may include a request for restraining orders and injunctive relief as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(2)(b): Upon the filing of a petition, the commissioner shall forward a notice of the petition by first-class mail or electronic communication, as permitted by the receivership court, to the commissioners and guaranty associations in states in which the insurer did business.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(3)(a): A petition that requests injunctive relief:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(3)(a)(i): shall be verified by the commissioner or the commissioner's designee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(3)(a)(ii): is not required to plead or prove irreparable harm or inadequate remedy at law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(3)(b): The commissioner shall provide only the notice the receivership court requires.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(4): If a temporary restraining order is requested:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(4)(a): the receivership court may issue an initial order containing the relief requested;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(4)(b): the order shall state the time and date of its issuance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(4)(c): the receivership court shall set a time and date for the return of summons:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(4)(c)(i): not more than 10 days from the time and date the initial order is issued; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(4)(c)(ii): at which time the person proceeded against may appear before the receivership court for a summary hearing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(4)(d): the order may not continue in effect beyond the time and date set for the return of summons, unless the receivership court expressly enters one or more orders extending the restraining order.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(5)(a): If no temporary restraining order is requested, the receivership court shall cause summons to be issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(5)(b): The summons shall specify:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(5)(b)(i): a return date not more than 30 days after the day on which the summons is issued; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-202(5)(b)(ii): that an answer shall be filed at or before the return date.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203 Return of summons and summary hearing.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(1): The receivership court shall hold a summary hearing at the time and date for the return of summons on a petition to commence a formal delinquency proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(2): If a person is not served with summons on a petition to commence a formal delinquency proceeding and fails to appear for the summary hearing, the receivership court shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(2)(a): continue the summary hearing not more than 10 days;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(2)(b): provide for alternative service of summons upon the person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(2)(c): extend any restraining order.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(3): Upon a showing of good faith efforts to effect personal service upon a person who fails to appear for a continued summary hearing, the receivership court shall order notice of the petition to commence a formal delinquency proceeding to be published.  The order and notice shall specify:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(3)(a): a return date not less than 10 nor more than 20 days after the day on which notice is published; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(3)(b): that the restraining order is extended to the continued hearing date.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(4): If a person fails to appear for a summary hearing on a petition to commence a formal delinquency proceeding after service of summons, the receivership court shall enter judgment in favor of the commissioner against that person.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(5)(a): A person who appears for the summary hearing on a petition to commence a formal delinquency proceeding shall file its answer at the hearing and the receivership court shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(5)(a)(i): determine whether to extend any temporary restraining order pending final judgment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(5)(a)(ii): set the case for trial on a date not more than 10 days from the day on which the summary hearing is held.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-203(5)(b): The receivership court may not grant a continuance for filing an answer.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204 Proceedings for expedited trial -- Continuance -- Evidence -- Discovery.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(1)(a): The receivership court shall proceed to hear the case on the petition to commence a formal delinquency proceeding:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(1)(a)(i): at the time and date set forth for trial;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(1)(a)(ii): without a jury; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(1)(a)(iii): without unnecessary delay.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(1)(b): To the extent practicable, the receivership court shall give precedence to the matter over all other matters.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(1)(c): To the extent authorized by law, the receivership court may assign the matter to another judge if necessary to comply with the need for expedited proceedings under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(2): A continuance for trial shall be granted only in extreme circumstances.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(3): The receivership court shall admit as self authenticated a certified copy of the following when offered by the commissioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(3)(a): a financial statement made by the insurer or an affiliate;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(3)(b): an examination report of the insurer or an affiliate made by or on behalf of the commissioner; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(3)(c): any other document filed with any insurance department by the insurer or an affiliate.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(4): The facts contained in an examination report of the insurer or an affiliate made by or on behalf of the commissioner is presumed to be true as of the date of the hearing if the examination is made as of a date not more than 270 days before the day on which the petition is filed.  The presumption:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(4)(a): is rebuttable; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(4)(b): shifts the burden of production and persuasion to the insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(5): Discovery:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(5)(a): is limited to grounds alleged in the petition; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-204(5)(b): shall be concluded on an expedited basis.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-205(4): (1); (1); (1); (4)

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-206 Confidentiality.
--------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-208 Entry of order.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-208(1): 31A-27a-207 If the commissioner establishes any of the grounds provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-208(1)(a): grant the petition; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-208(1)(b): issue the order of rehabilitation or liquidation requested in the petition.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-208(2): Upon the issuance of the order, the commissioner shall forward a copy of the order by first-class mail or electronic communication as permitted by the receivership court to the commissioners and guaranty associations in states in which the insurer did business.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209 Effect of order of rehabilitation or liquidation.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(1): The filing or recording of an order of receivership with the following imparts the same notice as a deed, bill of sale, or other evidence of title filed or recorded would have imparted:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(1)(a): the court;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(1)(b): the recorder of deeds of the county in which the principal business of the insurer is conducted; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(1)(c): in the case of real estate, with the recorder of deeds of the county where the property is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(2): The filing of a petition commencing delinquency proceedings under this chapter or the entry of an order of seizure, rehabilitation, or liquidation does not constitute a breach or an anticipatory breach of any contract or lease of the insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3): (3); 31A-27a-115; (3)(g)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(a): The receiver may appoint one or more special deputies.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(b)(i): has the powers and responsibilities of the receiver granted under this section, unless specifically limited by the receiver; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(b)(ii): serves at the pleasure of the receiver.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(c): The receiver may employ or contract with:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(c)(ii): one or more actuaries;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(c)(iii): one or more accountants;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(c)(iv): one or more appraisers;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(c)(v): one or more consultants;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(c)(vi): one or more clerks;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(c)(vii): one or more assistants; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(c)(viii): other personnel as may be considered necessary.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(g)(ii): (3)(g) The committee described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(g)(ii)(A): at the pleasure of the receiver; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(g)(ii)(B): without compensation and without reimbursement for expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-209(3)(g)(iii): The receiver or the receivership court in proceedings conducted under this chapter may not appoint any other committee of any nature.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301 Rehabilitation orders.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(1): 31A-27a-303; (1)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(1)(a): An order to rehabilitate the business of an insurer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(1)(a)(i): appoint the commissioner and the commissioner's successors in office as the rehabilitator;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(1)(a)(ii): direct the rehabilitator to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(1)(a)(ii)(A): take possession and title of the assets of the insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(1)(a)(ii)(B): administer the assets of the insurer under the general supervision of the court; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(1)(a)(iii): require accountings to the receivership court by the rehabilitator.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(1)(b): Accountings shall be at the intervals the receivership court specifies in its order, but no less frequently than semiannually.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(1)(c): 31A-27a-303; (1)(c)(i) Each accounting shall include a report concerning the rehabilitator's opinion as to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(1)(c)(i): 31A-27a-303 the likelihood that a plan under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(1)(c)(ii): (1)(c)(i) the timetable for preparing the plan described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(2)(a): In recognition of the need for a prompt and final resolution for all persons affected by a plan of rehabilitation, any appeal from an order of rehabilitation or an order approving a plan of rehabilitation shall be heard on an expedited basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(2)(b): A stay of an order of rehabilitation or an order approving a plan of rehabilitation may not be granted unless the appellant demonstrates that extraordinary circumstances warrant delaying the recovery under the plan of rehabilitation of all other persons, including policyholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-301(2)(c): If a plan of rehabilitation provides an appropriate mechanism for adjustment in the event of an adverse ruling from an appeal, a stay may not be granted.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302 Powers and duties of the rehabilitator.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(a): With court approval, the rehabilitator may take an action the rehabilitator considers necessary or appropriate to reform and revitalize the insurer, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(a)(i): canceling:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(a)(i)(A): a policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(a)(i)(B): an insurance or reinsurance contract, other than life insurance, health insurance, or an annuity;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(a)(i)(C): a surety bond; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(a)(i)(D): a surety undertaking; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(a)(ii): transferring to a solvent assuming insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(a)(ii)(A): a policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(a)(ii)(B): an insurance or reinsurance contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(a)(ii)(C): a surety bond; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(a)(ii)(D): a surety undertaking.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(b): The rehabilitator has all the powers of the directors, officers, and managers of the insurer, whose authority is suspended, except as redelegated by the rehabilitator.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(c): The rehabilitator has full power to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(c)(i): direct and manage the insurer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(c)(ii): hire and discharge employees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(c)(iii): deal with the property and business of the insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(1)(d): The rehabilitator is not liable as the result of good faith issuance or renewal of a policy while in rehabilitation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(2): The rehabilitator may pursue all appropriate legal remedies on behalf of the insurer if it appears to the rehabilitator that there is or has been criminal or tortious conduct, or breach of a contractual or fiduciary obligation detrimental to the insurer by an officer, a manager, an agent, a broker, an employee, an affiliate, or other person.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(3): 31A-27a-201; 31A-27a-207
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(3)(a): The rehabilitator may assert all defenses available to the insurer as against a third person, including statutes of limitations, statutes of frauds, and the defense of usury.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(3)(b): 31A-27a-201; 31A-27a-207 A waiver of a defense by the insurer after a petition pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(4): The enumeration of the powers and authority of the rehabilitator in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(4)(a): may not be construed as a limitation upon the rehabilitator; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(4)(b): does not exclude in any manner the right to do other acts:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(4)(b)(i): not specifically enumerated or otherwise provided for; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-302(4)(b)(ii): as may be necessary or appropriate for the accomplishment of or in aid of the purpose of rehabilitation.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303 Filing of rehabilitation plans.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1): (1)(c); (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(a): The rehabilitator shall prepare and file a plan to effect rehabilitation with the receivership court within:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(a)(i): one year after the day on which the rehabilitation order is entered; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(a)(ii): such further time as the receivership court may allow.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(b): (1)(c) The receivership court may take an action described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(b)(i): upon application of the rehabilitator for approval of a plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(b)(ii): after the notice and hearings the receivership court may prescribe.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(c): (1)(b) If the conditions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(c)(i): approve the plan proposed;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(c)(ii): disapprove the plan proposed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(c)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(c)(iii)(A): modify the plan proposed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(c)(iii)(B): approve the plan as modified.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(d): If the plan is approved, the rehabilitator shall carry out the plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(e): In the case of a life insurer, the plan proposed may:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(e)(i): include the imposition of a lien upon a policy of the insurer, if all rights of shareholders are relinquished; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(1)(e)(ii): propose imposition of a moratorium upon loan and cash surrender rights under a policy for a period not to exceed one year from the day on which the order approving the rehabilitation plan is entered, unless the receivership court, for good cause shown, extends the moratorium.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(2): Once a plan is filed, any party in interest may object to the plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(3): (5) A plan shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(3)(a): (5) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(3)(b): provide adequate means for the plan's implementation;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(3)(c): contain information concerning the financial condition of the insurer and the operation and effect of the plan, as far as is reasonably practicable in light of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-303(3)(c)(i): the nature and history of the insurer;

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-305(2):

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-305(2)(b): An orderly transition to liquidation requires, among other things, that the rehabilitator:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-305(2)(b)(i): to the fullest extent possible, reserve sufficient assets to continue to meet obligations under insurance policies of the insolvent insurer until guaranty associations are triggered; and

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-305(2)(b)(ii)(A)(III): a reasonable period of time to plan and organize; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-305(2)(b)(ii)(B): so that affected guaranty associations are able to properly discharge statutory responsibilities upon being triggered.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-403(2)(f)(i): A rehabilitator or liquidator may transfer, through sale or otherwise, the group and individual health care obligations of the insolvent managed care organization to one or more other managed care organizations or other insurers, if those other managed care organizations and other insurers:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-403(2)(f)(i)(A): are licensed to provide the same health care services in this state that are held by the insolvent managed care organization; or

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404 Sale or dissolution of the insurer's corporate entity.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(1): Notwithstanding the entry of a liquidation order, the liquidator may apply for an order to sell or dissolve the corporate entity or charter of a domestic insurer, or the United States branch of an alien insurer domiciled in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(1)(a): at any time after an order of liquidation of the insurer is granted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(1)(b): consistent with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(2): Upon an application to sell the corporate entity or charter, with notice as prescribed in this chapter, the receivership court may enter an order:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(2)(a): separating the corporate entity or charter, together with any of its licenses to do business and the assets the liquidator considers appropriate to the transaction, from:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(2)(a)(i): the remaining estate in liquidation;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(2)(a)(ii): all of the remaining estate's assets; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(2)(a)(iii): the claims or interests of all claimants, creditors, policyholders, and stockholders;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(2)(b): canceling all outstanding stock and other securities of, and other equity interests in, the corporate entity or charter, except that the cancellation may not affect any claim against the estate by holders of the equity interests;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(2)(c): authorizing the issuance and sale of new stock or other securities for the purpose of transferring to one or more buyers control and ownership of the corporate entity or charter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(2)(d): authorizing the sale of the corporate entity or charter, together with any of its licenses to do business and the general assets the liquidator considers appropriate to the transaction, free and clear from the claims or interests of all claimants, creditors, policyholders, and stockholders.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(3): Chapter 16, Insurance Holding Companies
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(3)(a): The sale of the corporate entity or charter may be made in the manner and on the terms and conditions:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(3)(a)(i): applied for by the liquidator; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(3)(a)(ii): ordered by the receivership court.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(3)(b): Chapter 16, Insurance Holding Companies A sale is subject to the domiciliary state's laws regarding acquisition of an insurer under
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(3)(c): Upon the sale of a corporate entity or chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(3)(c)(i): the proceeds from the sale become a part of the property of the estate in liquidation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(3)(c)(ii): the then separate corporate entity or charter, together with any of its licenses to do business and the assets the liquidator considers appropriate to the transaction, is free and clear from the claims or interests of all claimants, creditors, policyholders, and stockholders of the insurer in liquidation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(3)(d): The court has broad powers to effect the disposition of a corporate entity and its charter including, without limiting the statement of broad powers, a reorganization or conversion of the corporate entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(4): This section shall be liberally construed to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(4)(a): accomplish its purposes to provide an expeditious and effective procedure to realize the maximum proceeds possible from the sale of a corporate entity or charter separated from an estate in liquidation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(4)(b): ensure that a purchaser receives clear and marketable title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(5): If permission to sell the corporate entity or charter is not granted before discharge of the liquidator, in accordance with this section or otherwise with receivership court approval:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(5)(a): the receivership court may order dissolution of the corporate entity or charter;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(5)(b): dissolution is considered complete by operation of law upon the discharge of the liquidator if the insurer is insolvent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-404(5)(c): dissolution may be ordered by the receivership court upon the discharge of the liquidator if the insurer is under a liquidation order for some other reason.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406 Notice to creditors and others.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1): 45-1-101 Unless the receivership court otherwise directs, the liquidator shall give or cause to be given notice of the liquidation order as soon as possible:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(a): by first-class mail or electronic communication as permitted by the receivership court to the following at their last-known address:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(a)(i): all of the insurer's agents, brokers, or producers of record with a current appointment or current license to represent the insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(a)(ii): all other agents, brokers, or producers that the liquidator considers appropriate;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(b): by first-class mail or electronic communication as permitted by the receivership court to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(b)(i): all current policyholders;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(b)(ii): all pending claimants; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(b)(iii): as determined by the receivership court, former policyholders and other creditors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(c): 45-1-101 by publication:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(c)(i): once in a newspaper of general circulation in:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(c)(i)(A): the county in which the insurer has its principal place of business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(c)(i)(B): other locations that the liquidator considers appropriate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(1)(c)(ii): 45-1-101 as required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2): 31A-27a-108; 31A-27a-601 The notice of the entry of an order of liquidation shall contain or provide directions for obtaining the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(a): a statement that the insurer has been placed in liquidation;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(b): 31A-27a-108 a statement:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(b)(i): 31A-27a-108 explaining that certain acts are stayed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(b)(ii): describing any additional injunctive relief ordered by the receivership court;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(c): a statement whether, and to what extent, the insurer's policies continue in effect;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(d): to the extent applicable, a statement that coverage by guaranty associations may be available for all or part of policy benefits in accordance with applicable state guaranty laws;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(e): 31A-27a-601 a statement of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(e)(i): the deadline for filing claims, if established; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(e)(ii): 31A-27a-601 the requirements for filing a proof of claim pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(f): a statement of the date, time, and location of any initial status hearing scheduled at the time the notice is sent;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(g): a description of the process for obtaining notice of matters before the receivership court; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(2)(h): other information as the liquidator or the receivership court considers appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(3): If notice is given in accordance with this section, the distribution of property of the insurer under this chapter is conclusive with respect to all claimants, whether or not the claimant received notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(4)(a): Notwithstanding the other provisions of this section, the liquidator has no duty to locate any person if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(4)(a)(i): no address is found in the records of the insurer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(4)(a)(ii): a mailing is returned to the liquidator because of inability to deliver at the address shown in the insurer's records.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(4)(d): A claimant has a duty to keep the liquidator informed of any change of address.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(5): (1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-406(5)(a): upon application of the liquidator, the receivership court may find that notice by publication as required in this section is sufficient notice to those persons holding an occurrence policy:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-407 Duties of agents.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-407(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-407(1)(a): At the request of the liquidator, an agent receiving notice of the entry of the liquidation order shall provide notice of that order:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-407(1)(a)(i): on a form prescribed by the liquidator;

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-407(4): Notwithstanding an agent's property interest, if any, in the expiration of a policy, the liquidator has the exclusive power to determine whether, and under what terms, to cancel or transfer the policy.

-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-501(1): (1)(b)(i); (1)(b)(ii)

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-501(1)(b)(iii)(C): what action has been taken by the person to preserve any funds or to preserve and protect the property pending determination of the dispute.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-501(1)(c): The relinquishment of possession of funds or property by a person who receives a demand pursuant to this section is not a waiver of a right to make a claim in the receivership.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-501(2): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-501(2)(a): (1) If requested by the receiver, the receivership court shall hold a hearing to determine where and under what conditions the funds or property shall be held by a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-501(2)(b): The receivership court may impose the conditions the receivership court considers necessary or appropriate for the preservation of the funds or property until the receivership court can determine the validity of the person's claim to the funds or property.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-501(2)(c): If funds or property are allowed to remain in the possession of the person after demand made by the receiver, that person is strictly liable to the estate for any waste, loss, or damage to or diminution of value of the funds or property retained.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-501(4)(c): finding that the person waived all claims of right to the funds or property.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-501(5): The liquidator shall reduce the assets to a degree of liquidity that is consistent with the effective execution of the liquidation.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502 Recovery from affiliates.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(1): 31A-1-301(5); (2); (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(1)(a): 31A-1-301(5) If a receivership order is entered under this chapter, the receiver appointed under the receivership order may recover on behalf of the insurer from an affiliate as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(1)(b): A person disputing that person's status as an affiliate shall prove by clear and convincing evidence the person's nonaffiliate status.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(1)(c): (2); (6) Recovery from an affiliate is subject to the limitations of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(2): If the insurer is a stock corporation, a stock dividend distribution to an affiliate is not recoverable if the recipient shows by a preponderance of the evidence that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(2)(a): when paid, the stock dividend distribution to an affiliate is lawful and reasonable;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(2)(b): the department had notice to and approved the stock dividend; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(2)(c): the insurer did not know and could not reasonably have known that the stock dividend distribution to the affiliate might adversely affect the solvency of the insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(3): The maximum amount recoverable under this section is the amount needed to pay all claims under the receivership:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(3)(a): in excess of all other available recoverable assets; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(3)(b): reduced for each recipient affiliate by any amount that the recipient affiliate pays to any receiver under similar laws of other states.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(4)(a): A person who is an affiliate at the time value is received is liable up to the amount of value received by the affiliate.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(4)(b): If two or more affiliates are liable regarding the same value received, they are jointly and severally liable.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(5): (4) If any affiliate liable under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(6): This section does not enlarge the personal liability of a director under existing law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(7): An action or proceeding under this section may not be commenced after the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(7)(a): six years after the day on which a receiver is appointed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-502(7)(b): the day on which the receivership is terminated.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-503 Unauthorized postpetition transfers.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-503(1): Except as otherwise provided in this section, the receiver may avoid a transfer of an interest of the insurer in property, or an obligation incurred by the insurer, that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-503(1)(a): made or incurred after the day on which a petition for receivership is filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-503(1)(b): not authorized by the receiver and approved by the receivership court.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-503(2): (1) Except to the extent that a transfer or obligation voidable under this section is otherwise voidable under this chapter, a transferee or obligee of a transfer or obligation described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-503(2)(a): if the transferee or obligee takes it for value and in good faith; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-503(2)(b): to the extent that the transferee or obligee gave value to the insurer in exchange for the transfer or obligation.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512 Reinsurer's liability.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512(1)(a): Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, the amount recoverable by the receiver from a reinsurer may not be reduced as a result of a delinquency proceeding with a finding of insolvency, regardless of any provision in the reinsurance contract or other agreement.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1 Indemnitor liability.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(1)(a): Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, the amount recoverable by the receiver from an indemnitor may not be reduced as a result of a delinquency proceeding with a finding of insolvency, regardless of any provision in the indemnity contract or other agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(1)(b): To the extent an agreement, written or oral, conflicts with or is not in strict compliance with this section, the agreement is unenforceable.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(1)(c): Except as expressly provided in this section, a person who is not the receiver, including a creditor or third-party beneficiary, does not have a right to indemnity proceeds from any indemnitor of the insolvent insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(1)(c)(i): on the basis of any agreement, written or oral; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(1)(c)(ii): pursuant to an action or cause of action seeking any equitable or legal remedy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(1)(d): This section applies to all the insurer's indemnity contracts.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(2): 31A-27a-608 The amount recoverable by the liquidator from an indemnitor is payable under one or more contract of indemnity on the basis of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(2)(a): proof of payment of the insured claim by an affected guaranty association, the insurer, or the receiver, to the extent of payment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(2)(b): 31A-27a-608 the allowance of the claim pursuant to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(2)(b)(i): 31A-27a-608 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(2)(b)(ii): an order of the receivership court; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(2)(b)(iii): a plan of rehabilitation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(3): If an insurer takes credit for an indemnity contract in a filing or submission made to the commissioner and the indemnity contract does not contain the provisions required with respect to the obligations of indemnitor in the event of insolvency of the principal, the indemnity contract is considered to contain the provisions required with respect to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(3)(a): the obligations of indemnitors in the event of insolvency of the principal in order to obtain indemnity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(3)(b): other applicable statutes.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(4): (3); 31A-27a-608; 15-1-1 An indemnity contract that under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(4)(a): in the event of insolvency and the appointment of a receiver, the indemnity obligation is payable to the indemnified insurer or to its receiver without diminution because of the insolvency or because the receiver fails to pay all or a portion of the claim;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(4)(b): 31A-27a-608 payment shall be made upon:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(4)(b)(i): to the extent of the payment, proof of payment of the insured claim by an affected guaranty association, the insurer, or the receiver; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(4)(b)(ii): 31A-27a-608 the allowance of the claim pursuant to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(4)(b)(ii)(A): 31A-27a-608 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(4)(b)(ii)(B): an order of the receivership court; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(4)(b)(ii)(C): a plan of rehabilitation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(4)(c): 15-1-1 if an indemnitor does not pay the amount billed by the receiver within 60 days after the mailing by the receiver, interest on the unpaid billed amount will begin to accrue at the statutory legal rate described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(5)(a): The receiver shall notify in writing, in accordance with the terms of the indemnity contract, each indemnitor obligated in relation to an indemnified claim or the pendency of an indemnified claim against the indemnified company.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(5)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(5)(b)(i): The receiver's failure to give notice of a pending claim does not excuse the obligation of the indemnitor, unless the indemnitor is prejudiced by the receiver's failure.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(5)(b)(ii): If the indemnitor is prejudiced by the receiver's failure, the indemnitor's obligation is reduced only to the extent of the prejudice.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(5)(c): In a proceeding in which an indemnified claim is to be adjudicated, an indemnitor may interpose, at its own expense, any one or more defenses that the indemnitor considers available to the indemnified company or its receiver.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(6): The entry of an order of rehabilitation or liquidation is not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(6)(a): a breach or an anticipatory breach of an indemnity contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-512.1(6)(b): grounds for retroactive revocation or retroactive cancellation of an indemnity contract by the indemnifier.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-606 Special provisions for third party claims.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-606(1): Whenever a third party asserts a cause of action against an insured of an insurer in liquidation, the third party may file a claim with the liquidator on or before the last day for filing claims.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-606(2): Whether or not the third party files a claim, the insured may file a claim on the insured's own behalf in the liquidation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-606(3): 31A-27a-603(10)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-606(3)(a): The liquidator may make recommendations to the receivership court for the allowance of an insured's claim after consideration of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-606(3)(a)(i): the probable outcome of any pending action against the insured on which the claim is based;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-606(3)(a)(ii): the probable damages recoverable in the action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-606(3)(a)(iii): the probable costs and expenses of defense.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-606(3)(b): After allowance by the receivership court, the liquidator shall withhold any distribution payable on the claim, pending the outcome of litigation and negotiation between the insured and the third party.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-611(7)(b): Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, a claim of a counterparty against the estate arising from the receiver's disaffirmance or repudiation of a netting agreement or qualified financial contract that has not been previously affirmed in the liquidation or immediately preceding rehabilitation case shall be determined and shall be allowed or disallowed:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-611(7)(b)(i): as if the claim arose before the day on which the petition for liquidation is filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-611(7)(b)(ii): if a rehabilitation proceeding is converted to a liquidation proceeding, as if the claim had arisen before the day on which the petition for rehabilitation is filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-611(7)(c): The amount of a claim shall be the actual direct compensatory damages determined as of the date of the disaffirmance or repudiation of the netting agreement or qualified financial contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-611(8): This section does not apply to a person who is an affiliate of the insurer that is the subject of the proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-611(9): All rights of a counterparty under this chapter apply to a netting agreement or qualified financial contract entered into on behalf of the general account or separate accounts if the assets of each separate account are available only to counterparties to netting agreements and qualified financial contracts entered into on behalf of that separate account.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612 Administration of deductible policies and insured collateral.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(a): "Collateral" means any of the following that secures an insured's obligation to pay or to reimburse the insurer for deductible claim payments and to reimburse or pay to the insurer other secured obligations:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(a)(i): cash;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(a)(ii): a letter of credit of the insured;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(a)(iii): a surety bond posted by the insured; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(a)(iv): any other form of security posted by the insured.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(b): "Deductible claim" means a claim, including a loss or allocated loss adjustment expense, under a deductible policy within the insured's obligation to pay a portion of a claim or claim expense that the insurer is obligated to pay to a person other than the insured by the deductible policy or by operation of law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(c)(i): "Deductible limit" means a limit on an amount to be paid or reimbursed by the insured under a deductible policy that is equal to or greater than $5,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(c)(ii): A deductible limit may be any amount of the risk exposure before the insurer agrees to become liable for the insurance risk without a right of recoupment from the insured for the insurer's payment of claims or expenses related to a claim under the deductible policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(i): "Deductible policy" means any combination of one or more policies, endorsements, contracts, or security agreements in which the insured agrees with the insurer to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(i)(A): pay directly:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(i)(A)(I): the initial portion of a claim under the policy, endorsement, contract, or agreement up to a specified dollar amount; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(i)(A)(II): the expenses related to a claim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(i)(B): reimburse the insurer for the insurer's payment of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(i)(B)(I): a claim under the policy, endorsement, contract, or agreement up to a specified dollar amount; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(i)(B)(II): the expenses related to a claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(ii): "Deductible policy" includes a policy, endorsement, contract, or agreement that contains an aggregate limit on the insured's liability for all deductible claims in addition to a deductible limit for each claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(iii): "Deductible policy" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(iii)(A): a policy, endorsement, contract, or agreement that provides that the initial portion of a covered claim shall be self-insured and the insurer has no payment obligation within the self-insured retention;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(iii)(B): a policy, endorsement, contract, or agreement that provides for retrospectively rated premium payments by the insured; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(d)(iii)(C): a reinsurance arrangement or agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(e): "Other secured obligation" means an obligation, such as a reinsurance or retrospective premium obligation, that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(e)(i): payable by the insured to the insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(e)(ii): secured by collateral that also secures a deductible obligation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(f): "Uncovered claim" means a deductible claim that is secured by collateral but that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(f)(i): is not defined as a covered claim under any relevant guaranty association statute;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(f)(ii): the insured fails to fund or pay; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(1)(f)(iii): is filed with the receiver pursuant to the receivership proof of claim process.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2): (6)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2)(a): If an insurer agrees to allow an insured to fund or pay deductible claims directly or through a third party administrator, except as prohibited by applicable workers' compensation insurance law:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2)(a)(i): the insured shall fulfill the insured's obligations notwithstanding a delinquency proceeding; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2)(a)(ii): the receiver shall allow the funding or payment agreements to continue notwithstanding a delinquency proceeding.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2)(b): To the extent the insured funds or pays a deductible claim, the insured's funding or payment of a deductible claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2)(b)(i): bars any deductible claim in a delinquency proceeding including a claim by the insured or third party claimant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2)(b)(ii): extinguishes the obligation, if any, of the receiver or an affected guaranty association to pay the deductible claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2)(c): The insured is responsible for providing timely notice to the receiver and to all affected guaranty associations for any claim that may exceed the deductible limit.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2)(d): A charge of any kind may not be made against a receiver or an affected guaranty association on the basis of an insured's funding or payment of a deductible claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2)(e): (6)(b) The failure of an insured to fulfill the insured's obligation pursuant to a funding agreement entitles the following to the full benefit of all collateral and other rights of recovery and reimbursement under the other provisions of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2)(e)(i): the receiver that pays a deductible claim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(2)(e)(ii): (6)(b) pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(3): (3)(d)(iii)(A); (C) Any reimbursement owed to an insurer under a deductible policy issued by an insurer subject to a delinquency proceeding shall be administered as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-612(3)(a):

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-803 Reopening liquidation.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-803(1): After a liquidation proceeding is terminated and the liquidator discharged, the commissioner may at any time petition the court that was the receivership court to reopen the proceedings for good cause, including the discovery of additional property.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-803(2): If the court is satisfied that there is justification for reopening the proceedings, the court shall order the proceedings reopened.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-804 Disposition of records during and after termination of liquidation.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-804(1): Whenever it appears to the receiver that records of the insurer in receivership are no longer useful, the receiver may recommend to the receivership court, and the receivership court shall direct what records shall be destroyed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-27a-804(2): (2); 31A-27a-701(2)(a); (2); Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Utah Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-102 Purpose.
-----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-102(1): 31A-28-103(1); (5); 31A-28-103(6); (7) The purpose of this part is to protect, subject to certain limitations, the persons specified in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-102(2): (1) To provide the protection described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-102(2)(a): the Utah Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association, which currently exists, is continued to pay benefits and to continue coverages as limited by this part; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-102(2)(b): members of the association are subject to assessment to provide funds to carry out the purpose of this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-108(19): If the association arranges or offers to provide the benefits of this part to a covered person under a plan or arrangement that fulfills the association's obligations under this part, the person is not entitled to benefits from the association in addition to or other than those provided under the plan or arrangement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-108(20): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-108(20)(a): Venue in a suit against the association arising under this part is Salt Lake County.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-108(20)(b): The association may not be required to give an appeal bond in an appeal that relates to a cause of action arising under this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-113 Credit for assessments paid.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-113(1): 31A-28-109
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-113(1)(a): 31A-28-109 A member insurer may offset against its premium tax, income tax, or franchise tax liability to this state an assessment described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-113(1)(b): To the extent that the offsets described in Subsection (1)(a) exceed tax liability, the offsets may be carried forward and used to offset tax liability in future years.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-113(1)(c): If a member insurer ceases doing business, all uncredited assessments may be credited against its tax liability for the year it ceases doing business.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-113(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-113(2)(a): A member insurer that is exempt from taxes described in Subsection (1) may recoup the member insurer's assessment by a surcharge on premiums in a sum reasonably calculated to recoup the assessments over a reasonable period of time, as approved by the commissioner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-113(2)(b): Amounts recouped shall not be considered premiums for any other purpose, including the computation of gross premium tax, income tax, franchise tax, producer commission, or, to the extent allowed under federal law, medical loss ratio.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-113(2)(c): If a member insurer collects excess surcharges, the member insurer shall remit the excess amount to the association, and the excess amount shall be applied to reduce future assessments in the appropriate account.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-113(3): 31A-28-109

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-116 Tax exemptions.
------------------------------------------------
The association is exempt from payment of all fees and all taxes levied by this state or any of its subdivisions, except taxes levied on real property.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-118 Stay of proceedings -- Reopening default judgments.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-118(1): A proceeding in which the insolvent insurer is a party in any court in this state shall be stayed 180 days from the date an order of liquidation, rehabilitation, or conservation is final to permit proper legal action by the association on any matters germane to its powers or duties.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-118(2): The association may apply to have a judgment under any decision, order, verdict, or finding based on default set aside by the same court that made the judgment.  The association shall be permitted to defend against the suit on the merits.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-120 Prospective application.
---------------------------------------------------------
Notwithstanding any prior or subsequent law, the provisions of this part that are in effect on the date on which the association first becomes obligated for the policies or contracts of an insolvent or impaired insurer govern the association's rights and obligations to the policy owners, contract owners, certificate holders, and enrollees of the insolvent or impaired insurer.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202 Scope.
---------------------------------------
This part applies to protect resident policyowners and insureds under all types of direct insurance, except:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(1): life insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(2): annuity;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(3): health insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(4): disability insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(5): mortgage guaranty insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(6): financial guaranty, or other forms of insurance offering protection against investment risks;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(7): fidelity or surety bonds, or any other bonding obligation;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(8): credit insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(9): vendor's single interest insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(10): collateral protection insurance, or any similar insurance protecting the interests of a creditor in a creditor-debtor transaction;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(11): 31A-6a-101 mechanical breakdown insurance, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(12): 31A-6a-101 insurance of a warranty or service contract as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(13): title insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(14): ocean marine insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(15): any transaction between a person and an insurer, or an affiliate of a person or insurer, that involves the transfer of investment or credit risk unaccompanied by transfer of insurance risk; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-202(16): any insurance provided by or guaranteed by government.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(1): 31A-1-301 "Affiliate" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(2): 31A-28-205 "Association account" means the Utah Property and Casualty Insurance Guaranty Association Account created by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(3)(a): "Claimant" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(3)(a)(i): an insured making a first-party claim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(3)(a)(ii): a person instituting a liability claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(3)(b): A person who is an affiliate of the insolvent insurer may not be a claimant.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(a): "Covered claim" means an unpaid claim, including an unpaid claim under a personal lines policy for unearned premiums submitted by a claimant, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(a)(i): the claim arises out of the coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(a)(ii): the claim is within the coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(a)(iii): the claim is not in excess of the applicable limits of an insurance policy to which this part applies;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(a)(iv): the insurer who issued the policy becomes an insolvent insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(a)(v): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(a)(v)(A): the claimant or insured is a resident of this state at the time of the insured event; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(a)(v)(B): the claim is a first-party claim for damage to property that is permanently located in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(b): "Covered claim" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(b)(i): any amount awarded as punitive or exemplary damages or any amount due any reinsurer, insurer, insurance pool, or underwriting association, as subrogation recoveries or otherwise, nor does it include any supplementary payment obligation, including adjustment fees and expenses, attorneys' fees and expenses, court costs, interest, and bond premiums, prior to the appointment of a liquidator;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(b)(ii): any amount sought as a return of premium under a retrospective rating plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(b)(iii): any first-party claim by an insured if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(b)(iii)(A): the insured's net worth exceeds $25,000,000 on December 31 of the year preceding the date the insurer becomes an insolvent insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(b)(iii)(B): the insured's net worth includes the aggregate net worth of the insured and all of its subsidiaries as calculated on a consolidated basis; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(4)(b)(iv): any first-party claims by an insured that is an affiliate of the insolvent insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(5): "Insolvent insurer" means a member insurer that is placed under an order of liquidation by a court of competent jurisdiction with a finding of insolvency.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(6): 31A-28-202 "Member insurer" means any person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(6)(a): 31A-28-202 writes any kind of insurance to which this part applies under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(6)(b): is licensed to transact insurance in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(7)(a): "Net direct written premiums" means direct gross premiums written in this state on insurance policies that this part applies to, less return premiums and dividends paid or credited to policyholders on the direct business.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(7)(b): "Net direct written premiums" does not include premiums on contracts between insurers or reinsurers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(8): "Personal lines policy" means an insurance policy issued to an individual that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(8)(a): insures a motor vehicle used for personal purposes and not used in trade or business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(8)(b): insures a residential dwelling.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-203(9): "Residence" means, for entities other than a natural person, the state where the principal place of business of a claimant, insured, or policyholder is located at the time of the insured event.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-204 Unlawful statements.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-204(1): It is unlawful to make any statement, written or oral, regarding the coverages and protections provided by the association for the purpose of promoting the purchase of any form of insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-204(2): It is unlawful to indicate or imply that the association is an agency of the state or that the existence of the association is in any way a guarantee by the state or any of its instrumentalities to insure the payment of claims.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-204(3): The commissioner shall prescribe rules to prevent:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-204(3)(a): use of the association as an inducement for the sale of insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-204(3)(b): the dissemination of false or misleading information regarding the association and its limited guarantees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-204(3)(c): the dissemination of information implying that the association is an agency of the state and that the state in any way insures the payment of claims.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-204(4): (1); (2); (3) Any person who violates Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205 Creation of the association.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(1): 31A-28-209; 31A-28-206
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(1)(a): The Utah Property and Casualty Insurance Guaranty Association shall continue as a nonprofit legal entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(1)(b): All member insurers of the association are, and remain, members of the association as a condition of their authority to transact insurance business in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(1)(c): 31A-28-209; 31A-28-206 The association shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(1)(c)(i): 31A-28-209 perform its functions under the plan of operation established and approved under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(1)(d): For the purposes of administration and assessment, the association shall maintain an account known as the Property and Casualty Insurance Guaranty Association Account.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(1)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(1)(e)(i): If as of May 6, 2002, the association has more than one account, the association shall consolidate all accounts into the Property and Casualty Insurance Guaranty Association Account.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(1)(e)(ii)(B): is subject to any liability or obligation attributable to an account of the association existing on May 6, 2002.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(2)(a): An insurer shall cease to be a member insurer on the day following the termination or expiration of the insurer's license to transact the kinds of insurance to which this part applies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(2)(b): (2)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(2)(b)(i): before the termination or expiration of the insurer's license; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(2)(b)(ii): after the termination or expiration of the insurer's license but that relate to an insurer that became an insolvent insurer before the termination or expiration of the insurer's license.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(3): Meetings or records of the association shall be open to the public upon a majority vote of the board of directors of the association.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-205(4): The association is not an agency of the state.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-206 Board of directors.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-206(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-206(1)(a): The board of directors of the association consists of not less than five nor more than nine members, serving terms of four years each.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-206(1)(b): The members of the board shall be selected by member insurers, subject to the commissioner's approval.  When a vacancy occurs in the membership for any reason, the replacement shall be elected for the unexpired term by a majority vote of the remaining board members, subject to the commissioner's approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-206(1)(c): In approving selections or in appointing members to the board, the commissioner shall consider whether all member insurers are fairly represented.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-206(1)(d): (1)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-206(2): A member of the board of directors may be reimbursed from the assets of the association for expenses the member incurs as a member of the board of directors.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207 Powers and duties of the association.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1): (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(e); (g); 31A-28-214
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(a): The association is obligated on the amount of the covered claims:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(a)(i): existing prior to the order of liquidation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(a)(ii): arising:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(a)(ii)(A): within 30 days after the order of liquidation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(a)(ii)(B): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(a)(ii)(B)(I): before the policy expiration date if it is less than 30 days after the order of liquidation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(a)(ii)(B)(II): before the insured replaces the policy or causes its cancellation, if the insured does so within 30 days of the order of liquidation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(b): (1)(a) The obligation under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(c): A claim under a personal lines policy for unearned premiums shall include only those claims that exceed $100 in amount, subject to a maximum of $10,000 per policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(d): The association shall pay the full amount of any covered claim arising out of a workers' compensation policy. The association is not obligated to a policyholder or claimant in an amount in excess of the obligation of the insolvent insurer under the policy from which the claim arises.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(e): Any obligation of the association to defend an insured on a covered claim shall cease:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(e)(i): upon payment by the association, as part of a settlement releasing the insured; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(e)(ii): on a judgment, of the lesser of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(e)(ii)(A): the association's covered claim obligation limit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(e)(ii)(B): the applicable policy limit.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(f): The association:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(f)(i): is considered as the insurer only to the extent of its obligation on the covered claims, subject to the limitations provided in this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(f)(ii): has all the rights, duties, and obligations of the insolvent insurer as if the insurer had not yet become insolvent, including the right to pursue and retain salvage and subrogation recoverable on paid covered claim obligations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(f)(iii): may not be considered the insolvent insurer for any purpose relating to whether the association is subject to personal jurisdiction in the courts of any state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(g): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(g)(i): Notwithstanding any other provisions of this part, except in the case of a claim for benefits under workers' compensation coverage, any obligation of the association to or on behalf of a particular insured and its affiliates on covered claims shall cease when:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-207(1)(g)(i)(A): a total amount of $10,000,000 has been paid to or on behalf of the insured and its affiliates on covered claims by the association or a similar association; and

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208 Assessments.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(1): 15-1-1
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(1)(a): To provide the funds necessary to carry out the powers and duties of the association, the board of directors shall assess the member insurers at the time and in the amount the board finds necessary.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(1)(b): 15-1-1 An assessment under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(1)(b)(i): is due not less than 30 days after written notice to the member insurers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(1)(b)(ii): 15-1-1 accrues interest to the extent unpaid after the due date at the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(1)(b)(ii)(A): 10% per annum; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(1)(b)(ii)(B): 15-1-1 the then legal rate of interest provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(2): 31A-28-207 An assessment is to be made in the amount necessary to carry out the powers and duties of the association under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(3): An assessment against a member insurer is in the proportion that the net direct written premiums of the member insurer for the preceding calendar year on the kinds of insurance for which this part applies bears to the net direct written premiums of all member insurers for the preceding calendar year on the kinds of insurance for which this part applies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(4): A member insurer may not be assessed in any year for an amount greater than 2% of that member insurer's net direct written premiums for the preceding calendar year on the kinds of insurance for which this part applies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(5): If the maximum assessment, together with the other assets of the association in the association account, do not provide in any one year an amount sufficient to make all necessary payments, the funds available shall be prorated and the unpaid portion shall be paid as soon as funds become available.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(6): The association may exempt or defer, in whole or in part, the assessment of any member insurer, if the assessment would cause the member insurer's financial statement to reflect amounts of capital or surplus less than the minimum amounts required for a certificate of authority by any jurisdiction in which the member insurer is authorized to transact insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-208(7): Each member insurer may set off against any assessment authorized payments made on covered claims and expenses incurred in the payment of the claims by the member insurer, if they are chargeable to the association account.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-215 Tax exemptions.
------------------------------------------------
The association is exempt from payment of all fees and taxes levied by this state or any of its subdivisions, except taxes levied on real property.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-217 Immunity.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-217(1): There is no liability on the part of and no cause of action of any nature shall arise against any member insurer or its agents or employees, the association or its agents or employees, members of the board of directors, or the commissioner or his representatives, for any action or omission by them in effecting this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-217(2): The state does not waive any defense under this part, including the defense of governmental immunity.  The state is not liable for any action or omission of the association, its members, or their respective agents or employees.  The state is not liable for any failure of the association to perform its duties or to fulfill its stated purpose under this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-218 Stay of proceedings -- Reopening default judgments.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-218(1): Except for specific cases involving covered claims that are subject to waiver by the association, all proceedings in which the insolvent insurer is a party or is obligated to defend a party in any court in this state shall be stayed until the last day fixed by the court for the filing of claims to permit proper defense by the association of all pending causes of action.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-218(2): For any covered claim arising from a judgment under any decision, order, verdict, or finding based on the default of the insolvent insurer or its failure to defend an insured, the association either on its own behalf or on behalf of the insured:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-218(2)(a): may apply to have the judgment set aside by the issuing court or administrator; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-28-218(2)(b): shall be permitted to defend against the claim on the merits.
