Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 30 - Individual, Small Employer, and Group Health Insurance Act
*********************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Individual, Small Employer, and Group Health Insurance Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-102 Purpose statement.
---------------------------------------------------
The purpose of this chapter is to:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-102(1): prevent abusive rating practices;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-102(2): require disclosure of rating practices to purchasers;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-102(3): establish rules regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-102(3)(a): a universal individual and small group application; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-102(3)(b): renewability of coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-102(4): improve the overall fairness and efficiency of the individual and small group insurance market; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-102(5): provide increased access for individuals and small employers to health insurance.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(1): "Actuarial certification" means a written statement by a member of the American Academy of Actuaries or other individual approved by the commissioner that a covered carrier is in compliance with this chapter, based upon the examination of the covered carrier, including review of the appropriate records and of the actuarial assumptions and methods used by the covered carrier in establishing premium rates for applicable health benefit plans.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(2): "Affiliate" or "affiliated" means a person who directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls or is controlled by, or is under common control with, a specified person.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(3): "Base premium rate" means, for each class of business as to a rating period, the lowest premium rate charged or that could have been charged under a rating system for that class of business by the covered carrier to covered insureds with similar case characteristics for health benefit plans with the same or similar coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4): 31A-22-505; (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(a): 31A-22-505 "Bona fide employer association" means an association of employers:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(a)(i): 31A-22-505 that meets the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(a)(ii): in which the employers of the association, either directly or indirectly, exercise control over the plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(a)(iii): that is organized:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(a)(iii)(A): based on a commonality of interest between the employers and their employees that participate in the plan by some common economic or representation interest or genuine organizational relationship unrelated to the provision of benefits; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(a)(iii)(B): to act in the best interests of its employers to provide benefits for the employer's employees and their spouses and dependents, and other benefits relating to employment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(a)(iv): whose association sponsored health plan complies with 45 C.F.R. 146.121.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(b): (4)(a) The commissioner shall consider the following with regard to determining whether an association of employers is a bona fide employer association under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(b)(i): how association members are solicited;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(b)(ii): who participates in the association;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(b)(iii): the process by which the association was formed;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(b)(iv): the purposes for which the association was formed, and what, if any, were the pre-existing relationships of its members;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(b)(v): the powers, rights and privileges of employer members; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(4)(b)(vi): who actually controls and directs the activities and operations of the benefit programs.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(5): "Carrier" means a person that provides health insurance in this state including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(5)(a): an insurance company;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(5)(b): a prepaid hospital or medical care plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(5)(c): a health maintenance organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(5)(d): a multiple employer welfare arrangement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(5)(e): another person providing a health insurance plan under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(6): (6)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(6)(a): (6)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(6)(b): "Case characteristics" do not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(6)(b)(i): duration of coverage since the policy was issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(6)(b)(ii): claim experience; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(6)(b)(iii): health status.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(7): 31A-30-105 "Class of business" means all or a separate grouping of covered insureds that is permitted by the commissioner in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(8): "Covered carrier" means an individual carrier or small employer carrier subject to this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(9): "Covered individual" means an individual who is covered under a health benefit plan subject to this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(10): "Covered insureds" means small employers and individuals who are issued a health benefit plan that is subject to this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(11): Chapter 22, Part 6, Accident and Health Insurance "Dependent" means an individual to the extent that the individual is defined to be a dependent by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(11)(a): the health benefit plan covering the covered individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(11)(b): Chapter 22, Part 6, Accident and Health Insurance
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(12): "Established geographic service area" means a geographical area approved by the commissioner within which the carrier is authorized to provide coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(13): "Index rate" means, for each class of business as to a rating period for covered insureds with similar case characteristics, the arithmetic average of the applicable base premium rate and the corresponding highest premium rate.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(14): "Individual carrier" means a carrier that provides coverage on an individual basis through a health benefit plan regardless of whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(14)(a): coverage is offered through:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(14)(a)(i): an association;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(14)(a)(ii): a trust;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(14)(a)(iii): a discretionary group; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(14)(a)(iv): other similar groups; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(14)(b): the policy or contract is situated out-of-state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(15): "Individual conversion policy" means a conversion policy issued to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(15)(a): an individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(15)(b): an individual with a family.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(16): "New business premium rate" means, for each class of business as to a rating period, the lowest premium rate charged or offered, or that could have been charged or offered, by the carrier to covered insureds with similar case characteristics for newly issued health benefit plans with the same or similar coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(17): "Premium" means money paid by covered insureds and covered individuals as a condition of receiving coverage from a covered carrier, including fees or other contributions associated with the health benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(18): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(18)(a): "Rating period" means the calendar period for which premium rates established by a covered carrier are assumed to be in effect, as determined by the carrier.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(18)(b): A covered carrier may not have:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(18)(b)(i): more than one rating period in any calendar month; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(18)(b)(ii): no more than 12 rating periods in any calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(19): "Small employer carrier" means a carrier that provides health benefit plans covering eligible employees of one or more small employers in this state, regardless of whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(19)(a): coverage is offered through:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(19)(a)(i): an association;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(19)(a)(ii): a trust;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(19)(a)(iii): a discretionary group; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(19)(a)(iv): other similar grouping; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-103(19)(b): the policy or contract is situated out-of-state.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-105 Establishment of classes of business.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Effective January 1, 2014, a covered carrier may establish up to four separate classes of business:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-105(1): one class of business for individual health benefit plans that are not grandfathered under PPACA;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-105(2): one class of business for small employer health benefit plans that are not grandfathered under PPACA;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-105(3): one class of business for individual health benefit plans that are grandfathered under PPACA; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-105(4): one class of business for small employer health benefit plans that are grandfathered under PPACA.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-30-106(1)(c)(iii): any adjustment due to change in coverage or change in the case characteristics of the covered insured as determined from the rate manual for the class of business of the carrier offering an individual health benefit plan.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 31 - Insurance Fraud Act

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter may be cited as the "Insurance Fraud Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-102(1): "Authorized agency" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-102(1)(a): the attorney general;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-102(1)(b): the state fire marshal;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-102(1)(c): any state law enforcement agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-102(1)(d): any criminal investigative department or agency of the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-102(1)(e): a district attorney;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-102(1)(f): the prosecuting attorney of any municipality or county;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-102(1)(g): the department; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-102(1)(h): the disciplinary section of an agency licensing a service provider.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103 Fraudulent insurance act.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1): 31A-23a-411.1 A person commits a fraudulent insurance act if that person with intent to deceive or defraud:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(a): knowingly presents or causes to be presented to an insurer any oral or written statement or representation knowing that the statement or representation contains false, incomplete, or misleading information concerning any fact material to an application for the issuance or renewal of an insurance policy, certificate, or contract, as part of or in support of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(a)(i): obtaining an insurance policy the insurer would otherwise not issue on the basis of underwriting criteria applicable to the person;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(a)(ii): a scheme or artifice to avoid paying the premium that an insurer charges on the basis of underwriting criteria applicable to the person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(a)(iii): a scheme or artifice to file an insurance claim for a loss that has already occurred;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(b): presents or causes to be presented to an insurer any oral or written statement or representation:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(b)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(b)(i)(A): as part of, or in support of, a claim for payment or other benefit pursuant to an insurance policy, certificate, or contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(b)(i)(B): in connection with any civil claim asserted for recovery of damages for personal or bodily injuries or property damage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(b)(ii): knowing that the statement or representation contains false, incomplete, or misleading information concerning any fact or thing material to the claim;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(c): knowingly accepts a benefit from the proceeds derived from a fraudulent insurance act;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(d): intentionally, knowingly, or recklessly devises a scheme or artifice to obtain fees for anything of value, including professional services, by means of false or fraudulent pretenses, representations, promises, or material omissions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(e): knowingly assists, abets, solicits, or conspires with another to commit a fraudulent insurance act;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(f): knowingly supplies false or fraudulent material information in any document or statement required by the department;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(g): 31A-23a-411.1 knowingly fails to forward a premium to an insurer in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(1)(h): knowingly employs, uses, or acts as a runner for the purpose of committing a fraudulent insurance act.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(2): A service provider commits a fraudulent insurance act if that service provider with intent to deceive or defraud:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(2)(a): knowingly submits or causes to be submitted a bill or request for payment:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(2)(a)(i): containing charges or costs for an item or service that are substantially in excess of customary charges or costs for the item or service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(2)(a)(ii): containing itemized or delineated fees for what would customarily be considered a single procedure or service;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(2)(b): knowingly furnishes or causes to be furnished an item or service to a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(2)(b)(i): substantially in excess of the needs of the person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(2)(b)(ii): of a quality that fails to meet professionally recognized standards;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(2)(c): knowingly accepts a benefit from the proceeds derived from a fraudulent insurance act; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(2)(d): assists, abets, solicits, or conspires with another to commit a fraudulent insurance act.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(3): An insurer commits a fraudulent insurance act if that insurer with intent to deceive or defraud:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(3)(a): knowingly withholds information or provides false or misleading information with respect to an application, coverage, benefits, or claims under a policy or certificate;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(3)(b): assists, abets, solicits, or conspires with another to commit a fraudulent insurance act;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(3)(c): knowingly accepts a benefit from the proceeds derived from a fraudulent insurance act; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(3)(d): knowingly supplies false or fraudulent material information in any document or statement required by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-103(4): An insurer or service provider is not liable for any fraudulent insurance act committed by an employee without the authority of the insurer or service provider unless the insurer or service provider knew or should have known of the fraudulent insurance act.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-104 Disclosure of information.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-104(1): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-104(1)(a): (2) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-104(1)(b): Upon written request by an authorized agency to an insurer, the insurer or an agent authorized by the insurer to act on the insurer's behalf shall release to the authorized agency information or evidence that is relevant to any suspected insurance fraud.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-104(2): 63G-2-305(10)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-104(2)(a): 63G-2-305(10) Any information or evidence furnished to an authorized agency under this section may be classified as a protected record in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-104(2)(b): Any information or evidence furnished to an insurer under this section is not subject to discovery in a civil proceeding unless, after reasonable notice to any insurer, agent, or any authorized agency that has an interest in the information and subsequent hearing, a court determines that the public interest and any ongoing criminal investigation will not be jeopardized by the disclosure.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-110 Mandatory reporting of fraudulent insurance acts.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-110(1): (1); (1); (1)(a); (1)(b)(iv)(A); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-110(1)(a): A person shall report a fraudulent insurance act to the department if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-110(1)(a)(i): the person has a good faith belief on the basis of a preponderance of the evidence that a fraudulent insurance act is being, will be, or has been committed by a person other than the person making the report; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-110(1)(a)(ii): the person is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-110(1)(a)(ii)(A): an insurer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-110(1)(a)(ii)(B): in relation to the business of title insurance, an auditor that is employed by a title insurer.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-110(1)(b)(ii)(C): (1) email using an email address established by the department for the purpose of submitting the report required by this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-110(1)(b)(iii): provide information in detail relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-110(1)(b)(iii)(A): the fraudulent insurance act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-110(1)(b)(iii)(B): the perpetrator of the fraudulent insurance act; and

---------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-111(1)(b): 31A-8a-201 operates a health discount program without complying with the provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-31-111(2): In addition to any other civil penalties or remedies provided by law, a person who violates this section is guilty of a third degree felony.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 32a - Medical Care Savings Account Act
********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-101 Title.
----------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Medical Care Savings Account Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(1): 7-1-103; 7-1-103; 31A-25-203 "Account administrator" means any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(1)(a): 7-1-103 a depository institution as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(1)(b): 7-1-103 a trust company as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(1)(c): an insurance company authorized to do business in this state under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(1)(d): 31A-25-203 a third party administrator licensed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(1)(e): an employer if the employer has a self-insured health plan under ERISA.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(2): "Account holder" means the resident individual who establishes a medical care savings account or for whose benefit a medical care savings account is established.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(3): "Deductible" means the total deductible for an employee and all the dependents of that employee for a calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(4): 31A-30-103 "Dependent" means the same as "dependent" under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(5): 31A-1-301 "Eligible medical expense" means an expense paid by the taxpayer for:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(5)(a): medical care described in Section 213(d), Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(5)(b): the purchase of a health coverage policy, certificate, or contract, including a qualified higher deductible health plan; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(5)(c): 31A-1-301 premiums on long-term care insurance policies as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(6): "Employee" means the individual for whose benefit or for the benefit of whose dependents a medical care savings account is established.  Employee includes a self-employed individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(7): "ERISA" means the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, Public Law 93-406, 88 Stat. 829.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(8): "Higher deductible" means a deductible of not less than $1,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(9): "Medical care savings account" or "account" means a trust account established at a depository institution in this state pursuant to a medical care savings account program to pay the eligible medical expenses of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(9)(a): an employee or account holder; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(9)(b): the dependents of the employee or account holder.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(10): "Medical care savings account program" or "program" means one of the following programs:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(10)(a): a program established by an employer in which the employer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(10)(a)(i): purchases a qualified higher deductible health plan for the benefit of an employee and the employee's dependents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(10)(a)(ii): contributes on behalf of an employee into a medical care savings account; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(10)(b): a program established by an account holder in which the account holder:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(10)(b)(i): purchases a qualified higher deductible health plan for the benefit of the account holder and the account holder's dependents; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(10)(b)(ii): contributes an amount to the medical care savings account.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(11): "Qualified higher deductible health plan" means a health coverage policy, certificate, or contract that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(11)(a): provides for payments for covered benefits that exceed the higher deductible; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(11)(b): is purchased by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(11)(b)(i): an employer for the benefit of an employee for whom the employer makes deposits into a medical care savings account; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-102(11)(b)(ii): an account holder.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103 Establishing medical care savings accounts.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(1): For a taxable year beginning on or after January 1, 1995:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(1)(a): an employer, except as otherwise provided by contract or a collective bargaining agreement, may offer a medical care savings account program to the employer's employees; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(1)(b): a resident individual may establish a medical care savings account program for the individual or for the individual's dependents.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(2): (2)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(2)(a): A contribution into an account made by an employer on behalf of an employee, or made by an individual account holder may not exceed the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(2)(a)(i): $2,000 in any taxable year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(2)(a)(ii): an amount of money equal to the sum of all eligible medical expenses paid by the employee or account holder for that taxable year on behalf of the employee, account holder, or the employee's or account holder's spouse or dependents.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(2)(b): (2)(a)(ii) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(3): An employer that offers a medical care savings account program shall, before making any contributions:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(3)(a): inform all employees in writing of the fact that these contributions may not be deductible under the federal tax laws; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(3)(b): obtain from the employee a written election to participate in the medical care savings account program.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(4): 31A-32a-105; 59-10-114 Except as provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(5)(a): An employer may select a single account administrator for all of the employer's employee's medical care savings accounts.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-103(5)(b): If a single account administrator is not selected, an employer may contribute directly to the account holder's individual medical care savings account.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-104 Administration of medical care savings account.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-104(1): An account administrator shall administer the medical care savings account from which the payment of claims is made and has a fiduciary duty to the person for whose benefit the account administrator administers an account.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-104(2): 31A-32a-105(1)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-104(2)(a): 31A-32a-105(1) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-104(2)(b): The commissioner shall adopt rules concerning the coordination of benefits between a medical care savings account and medical expenses payable from automobile insurance policies, workers' compensation insurance policies, or other health care insurance policies or contracts.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-104(3): The employee or account holder may submit documentation of eligible medical expenses paid by the employee or account holder in the taxable year to the account administrator, and the account administrator shall reimburse the employee or account holder from the employee's or account holder's account for eligible medical expenses.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-32a-104(4): If an employer makes contributions to a medical care savings account program on a periodic installment basis, the employer may advance to an employee an amount necessary to cover eligible medical expenses incurred that exceed the amount in the employee's medical care savings account at the time the expense is incurred if the employee agrees to repay the advance.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Bail Bond Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(1): 31A-35-401 "Bail bond" means a bail bond insurance product for a specified monetary amount that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(1)(a): 31A-35-401 executed by a bail bond producer licensed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(1)(b): issued to a court, magistrate, or authorized officer to secure:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(1)(b)(i): the release of a person from incarceration; and

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(2): 31A-35-404(1); (2); (2)(b) "Bail bond agency" means any sole proprietor or entity that:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(2)(b)(i): is the agent of a surety insurer that sells a bail bond in connection with judicial proceedings;

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(2)(b)(iii): pledges personal or real property, or both, as security for a bail bond in connection with judicial proceedings; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(2)(c): (2)(b) receives or is promised money or other things of value for a service described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(3)(a)(ii): a bail bond agency licensed under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(3)(b): is appointed to execute or countersign undertakings of bail in connection with judicial proceedings; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(3)(c): (3)(b) receives or is promised money or other things of value for engaging in an act described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(8): "Liquid assets" means financial holdings that can be converted into cash in a timely manner without the loss of principal.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(10)(a): guarantees the performance of a bail bond; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-102(10)(b): owns not less than 10% of the bail bond agency.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-402 Authority related to bail bonds.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-402(1): A bail bond agency may only sell bail bonds.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-402(2): 31A-23a-205 In accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-402(3): A bail bond agency or surety insurer may not allow any person who is not a bail bond producer to engage in the bail bond insurance business on the bail bond agency's or surety insurer's behalf, except for individuals:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-402(3)(a)(i): a bail bond agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-402(3)(a)(ii): a bail bond producer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-402(3)(b): whose compensation is not related to or contingent upon the number of bail bonds written.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-403 Exemptions to licensing requirements.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
This chapter does not affect the negotiation through a licensed producer for, or the execution or delivery of, an undertaking of bail executed by an insurer for its insured under a policy of automobile insurance or of liability insurance upon the automobile of the insured.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-407 Restricted account.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-407(1): There is created within the General Fund a restricted account known as the "Bail Bond Administration Account."
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-407(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-407(2)(a): The account shall be funded from the fees imposed under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-407(2)(b): The department shall deposit all fees collected under this part into the account.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-407(2)(c): The funds in the account shall be used by the department to administer this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-407(2)(d): The account shall earn interest, which shall be deposited into the account.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-407(3): The department shall, at the end of each quarter, provide to the board an itemized accounting that includes the balances at the beginning and the end of the quarter. The department shall provide the report no later than the 30th day of the month subsequent to the last month of the required quarterly report.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-501 Emergency action regarding a license.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-501(1): If the commissioner determines, based on an investigation, that the public health, safety, or welfare requires emergency action, the commissioner may order a summary suspension of a bail bond agency license pending proceedings for revocation or other action.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-501(2): (1) The order described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-501(2)(a): state the grounds upon which the summary suspension is issued, including the charges made against the licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-501(2)(b): advise the licensee of the right to an administrative hearing before the commissioner within 60 days after the summary suspension is ordered.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-601 Acts of producer or agent.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-601(1): The acts or conduct of any bail bond producer who acts within the scope of the authority delegated to the producer by the bail bond agency or surety insurer are considered to be the acts or conduct of the bail bond agency or surety insurer for which the bail bond producer is acting as agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-601(2): The acts or conduct of any bail bond agency that acts within the scope of the authority delegated to the bail bond agency by the surety insurer are considered to be the acts or conduct of the surety insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-601(3): 53-11-102
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-601(3)(a): Bail bond agencies and surety insurers are not liable for the actions of bail enforcement agents, bail recovery agents, or bail recovery apprentices.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-601(3)(b): 53-11-102 Bail enforcement agent, bail recovery agent, and bail recovery apprentice mean the same as those terms are defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603 Collateral security.
-----------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(2)(a): (1) The collateral security described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(2)(b): Before any judgment of forfeiture of bail, the bail bond producer shall keep the collateral separate and apart from any other funds or assets of the licensee.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(2)(c): All cash collateral shall be recorded and deposited into the bail bond agency's trust account within three business days after receipt of the cash.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(2)(d): All personal property and merchandise collateral shall be recorded in the bail bond agency's merchandise log within three business days after receipt of the merchandise.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(3)(a): Any collateral that is deposited with a bail bond producer or bail bond agency shall be returned to the person who deposited it within 10 days after the return is requested by the person who deposited it if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(3)(a)(i): the bail bond has been exonerated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(3)(a)(ii): all fees owed to the bail bond producer or bail bond agency have been paid.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(3)(b): A certified copy of the minute order from the court stating the bail or undertaking was ordered exonerated is prima facie evidence of exoneration or termination of liability.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(4)(a): If a bail bond producer accepts collateral, the bail bond producer shall give a written receipt for the collateral.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(4)(b): (4)(a) The receipt required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(5): (5)(a) Upon return of collateral to the person who posted it, if any amount has been deducted by the bail bond agency or bail bond producer as expense, the bail bond agency or bail bond producer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(5)(a): include with the returned collateral an itemized statement of all expenses deducted from the collateral; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(5)(b): (5)(a) maintain a copy of the statement required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(6): If the bail bond secured by the collateral is forfeited and the bail bond producer or bail bond agency retains possession of the collateral in payment of the forfeiture or otherwise disposes of the collateral, the person retaining possession or disposing of the property shall maintain a written record of the collateral, including any disposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(7): (7)(a); (7)(b)(ii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(7)(a): If a document that conveys title to real property is used as collateral in a bail bond transaction, the document shall state on its face that it is executed as part of a security transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(7)(b): (7)(a); (7)(b)(ii)(A) If the document described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(7)(b)(i): execute a reconveyance of the property, executed so that the reconveyance can be recorded; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(7)(b)(ii): (7)(b)(ii)(A) promptly deliver the reconveyance document to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(7)(b)(ii)(A): the person executing the original conveyance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(7)(b)(ii)(B): (7)(b)(ii)(A) the heirs, legal representative, or successor in interest of the person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(8): The bail bond agency shall maintain an itemized list of all merchandise collateral, which shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(8)(a): the date of the bail bond;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(8)(b): the full name of the defendant;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(8)(c): the full name of each cosigner;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(8)(d): a detailed description of the collateral;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(8)(e): the amount of bail;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(8)(f): the approximate value of the merchandise; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-603(8)(g): the final disposition of the merchandise.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-604 Records.
-----------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-604(1): A bail bond producer shall maintain at the bail bond producer's place of business:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-604(1)(a): records of all bail bonds the bail bond producer executes or countersigns, so the public may obtain all necessary information concerning those bail bonds for not less than the current calendar year plus the three prior years after the liability of the bail bond agency or surety insurer has been terminated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-604(1)(b): any additional information the commissioner may reasonably require by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-604(2): (1) Records required to be maintained under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-604(3): The bail bond agency shall maintain for not less than the current calendar year and the three years after receipt all records of any bail bond executed or countersigned by a bail bond producer appointed by the bail bond agency.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-605 Guarantors -- Agreement and enforcement.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-605(1): All agreements of persons to act as guarantor for a bail bond shall be in writing or reduced to writing as soon as possible after completion.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-605(2): When a person executes an agreement to act as a guarantor, the bail bond agency or the bail bond producer shall deliver to that person a copy of the agreement promptly upon that person's execution of the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-605(3): A bail bond producer may not enforce any guarantor agreement without disclosing to the guarantor all collateral held by the bail bond producer indemnifying the bail bond to which the agreement relates, and the identity of each other guarantor.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-606 Bail agreement prior to commission of offense prohibited.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A bail bond agency or bail bond producer may not enter into an agreement or arrangement with any person, guaranteeing or assuring in advance of the commission of any offense that bail will be furnished to that person or any other party if arrested.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607 Filing of forms -- Commissioner maintains files.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1): 31A-21-201
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(a): 31A-21-201 In accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(b): A surety insurer filing shall comply with the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(b)(i): a form shall be identified by a unique form number;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(b)(ii): a form shall include the address, telephone number, and business email address of the bail bond agency and the surety insurer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(b)(iii): the surety insurer shall file a form on behalf of each bail bond agency appointed to write on behalf of the surety insurer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(b)(iv): once a filing is filed with the commissioner, it is the responsibility of the surety insurer to verify that the bail bond agency and its producers are using the correct form;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(b)(v): a bail bond agency and its bail bond producers are prohibited from using a form that has not been filed by the surety insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(b)(vi): a bail bond agency and its bail bond producers are prohibited from making changes to a form that is filed by the surety insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(c): A bail bond agency filing, for a bail bond agency that meets the financial capacity requirements through the use of a letter of credit, personal property, or real estate, shall comply with the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(c)(i): a form shall be identified by a unique form number;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(c)(ii): a form shall include the address, telephone number, and business email address of the bail bond agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(c)(iii): once a filing is filed with the commissioner, it is the responsibility of the bail bond agency to verify that its bail bond producers are using the correct form;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(c)(iv): a bail bond producer is prohibited from using a form that has not been filed by the bail bond agency; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(1)(c)(v): a bail bond producer is prohibited from making changes to a form that is filed by the bail bond agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(2): (1); (2)(a) A form described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(2)(a): is first used by the bail bond agency or surety insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(2)(b): (2)(a) is changed after it is filed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(3)(a): The commissioner shall maintain and make available for public inspection a file regarding each bail bond agency and each surety insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-607(3)(b): A bail bond agency and surety insurer shall maintain a form required to be filed under this section in the office of the bail bond agency or surety insurer.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608 Premiums and authorized charges.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(1): (2) A bail bond agency or bail bond producer may not, in any bail transaction or in connection with that transaction, directly or indirectly, charge or collect money or other valuable consideration from any person except to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(1)(a): pay the premium on the bail at the rates established by the bail bond agency or surety insurer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(1)(b): provide collateral;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(1)(c): (2) reimburse the bail bond agency or bail bond producer for actual expenses, as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(1)(d): reimburse the bail bond agency or bail bond producer, or to establish a right of action against the principal or any indemnitor, for actual expenses the bail bond agency or bail bond producer incurred:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(1)(d)(i): in good faith; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(1)(d)(ii): which were by reason of breach by the defendant of any of the terms of the written agreement under which the undertaking of bail or bail bond was written.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(2): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(2)(a): A bail bond agency or surety insurer may bring an action in a court of law to enforce its equitable rights against the principal and the principal's indemnitors in exoneration if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(2)(a)(i): a bail bond producer did not establish a written agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(2)(a)(ii): there is only an incomplete writing.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(2)(b): (2) Reimbursement claimed under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(2)(b)(i): the principal sum of the bail bond or undertaking; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(2)(b)(ii): any reasonable expenses that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(2)(b)(ii)(A): are verified by receipt;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(2)(b)(ii)(B): in total do not amount to more than the principal sum of the bail bond or undertaking; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(2)(b)(ii)(C): are incurred in good faith by the bail bond agency, its bail bond producers, and the bail bond agency's employees by reason of the principal's breach.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(3): This section does not affect or impede the right of a bail bond producer to execute undertaking of bail on behalf of a nonresident producer of the bail bond agency or surety insurer the bail bond producer represents.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(4): A bail bond agency or surety insurer shall maintain complete records of all current and closed accounts receivable regarding financed premiums for the current calendar year and the three prior years.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-608(5): If the bail amount on the original charge is increased by the court, the bail premium paid on the original bond may be applied to the bail premium due on the increased bail amount for that charge.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701 Prohibited acts.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(1): A bail bond producer or bail bond agency may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(1)(a): solicit business in or about:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(1)(a)(i): any place where persons in the custody of the state or any local law enforcement or correctional agency are confined; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(1)(a)(ii): any court;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(1)(b): pay a fee or rebate or give or promise anything of value to any person in order to secure a settlement, compromise, remission, or reduction of the amount of any undertaking or bail bond;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(1)(c): pay a fee or rebate or give anything of value to an attorney in regard to any bail bond matter, except payment for legal services actually rendered for the bail bond producer or bail bond agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(1)(d): pay a fee or rebate or give or promise anything of value to the principal or anyone in the principal's behalf; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(1)(e): engage in any other act prohibited by the commissioner by rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(2): The following persons may not act as bail bond producers and may not, directly or indirectly, receive any benefits from the execution of any bail bond:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(2)(a): a person employed at any jail, correctional facility, or other facility used for the incarceration of persons;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(2)(b): a peace officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(2)(c): a judge; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(2)(d): an inmate incarcerated in any jail, correctional facility, or other facility used for the incarceration of persons.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(3): A bail bond producer may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(3)(a): sign or countersign in blank any bail bond;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(3)(b): give the power of attorney to, or otherwise authorize anyone to, countersign in the bail bond producer's name to a bail bond; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(3)(c): submit a bail bond to a jail or court in Utah without having completed a written agreement that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(3)(c)(i): states the terms of the bail agreement, contract, or undertaking;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(3)(c)(ii): is signed by the bail bond producer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(3)(c)(iii): is filed with the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(4): A bail bond producer may not advertise or hold himself or herself out to be a bail bond agency or surety insurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(5): The following persons or members of their immediate families may not solicit business on behalf of a bail bond agency or bail bond producer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(5)(a): a person employed at any jail, correctional facility, or other facility used for the incarceration of persons;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(5)(b): a peace officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(5)(c): a judge; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-701(5)(d): an inmate incarcerated in any jail, correctional facility, or other facility used for the incarceration of persons.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702 Early surrender without cause.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(1): The bail or bail bond premium shall be returned in full if a bail bond producer without good cause surrenders a defendant to custody before:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(1)(a): the time specified in the undertaking of bail or the bail bond for the appearance of the defendant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(1)(b): any other occasion where the presence of the defendant in court is lawfully required.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2): As used in this section, "good cause" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(a): the defendant providing materially false information on the application for bail or a bail bond;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(b): the court's increasing the amount of bail beyond sound underwriting criteria employed by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(b)(i): the bail bond producer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(b)(ii): the bail bond agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(c): a material and detrimental change in the collateral posted by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(c)(i): the defendant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(c)(ii): a person acting on the defendant's behalf;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(d): the defendant changing the defendant's address or telephone number without giving reasonable notice to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(d)(i): the bail bond producer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(d)(ii): the bail bond agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(e): the defendant commits another crime, other than a minor traffic violation, as defined by department rule, while on bail;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(f): failure by the defendant to appear in court at the appointed time; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-702(2)(g): a finding of guilt against the defendant by a court of competent jurisdiction.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-703 Disciplinary action.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-703(1): Title 31A, Chapter 2, Administration of the Insurance Laws A person found to be in violation of the statutes or rules governing the conduct of bail bond producers and bail bond agencies under this chapter is subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-703(1)(a): disciplinary action by the commissioner against that person's:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-703(1)(a)(i): license, if the person is a bail bond agency or bail bond producer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-703(1)(a)(ii): certificate, if the person is a surety insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-703(1)(b): Title 31A, Chapter 2, Administration of the Insurance Laws imposition of civil penalties, as authorized under
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-703(2): 31A-35-407 Penalties collected under this section shall be deposited in the restricted account created in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-704 Submission of bail bond agencies and producers to jurisdiction of court.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
By applying for and receiving a license or certificate to engage in the bail bond insurance business in accordance with this chapter, a bail bond agency or bail bond producer:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-704(1): submits to the jurisdiction of the court;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-704(2): irrevocably appoints the clerk of the court as agent upon whom any papers affecting the bail bond agency's or bail bond producer's liability on the undertaking may be served; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-35-704(3): acknowledges that liability may be enforced on motion and upon notice as the court may require, without the necessity of an independent action.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 36 - Life Settlements Act
*******************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Life Settlements Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(1)(a): "Advertising" means a communication placed before the public to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(1)(a)(i): create an interest in a life settlement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(1)(a)(ii): induce a person pursuant to a life settlement to sell, assign, devise, bequest, or transfer the death benefit or ownership of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(1)(a)(ii)(A): a policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(1)(a)(ii)(B): an interest in a policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(1)(b): (1)(a) "Advertising" includes the following, if the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(1)(b)(i): a written, electronic, or printed communication;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(1)(b)(ii): a communication by means of a recorded telephone message;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(1)(b)(iii): a communication transmitted on radio, television, the Internet, or similar communications media; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(1)(b)(iv): a film strip, motion picture, or video.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2): "Business of life settlements" includes the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(a): offering a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(b): soliciting a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(c): negotiating a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(d): procuring a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(e): effectuating a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(f): purchasing a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(g): investing in a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(h): financing a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(i): monitoring a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(j): tracking a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(k): underwriting a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(l): selling a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(m): transferring a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(n): assigning a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(o): pledging a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(p): hypothecating a life settlement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(2)(q): in any other manner acquiring an interest in an insurance policy by means of a life settlement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(3): (3)(a) "Chronically ill" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(3)(a): being unable to perform at least two activities of daily living, such as eating, toileting, moving from one place to another, bathing, dressing, or continence;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(3)(b): requiring substantial supervision for protection from threats to health and safety because of severe cognitive impairment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(3)(c): (3)(a) having a level of disability similar to that described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(4): 7-1-103 "Depository institution" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(a): "Financing entity" means a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(a)(i): who has direct ownership in a policy that is the subject of a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(a)(ii): whose principal activity related to a life settlement is providing money to effect the life settlement or the purchase of one or more settled policies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(a)(iii): who has an agreement in writing with one or more licensed life settlement providers to finance the acquisition of one or more life settlements.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(b): (5)(a) "Financing entity" includes, if the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(b)(i): an underwriter;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(b)(ii): a placement agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(b)(iii): an enhancer of credit;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(b)(iv): a lender;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(b)(v): a purchaser of securities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(b)(vi): a purchaser of a policy from a life settlement provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(c): "Financing entity" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(c)(i): a nonaccredited investor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(5)(c)(ii): a life settlement purchaser.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(6): 31A-1-301 "Form" means, in addition to a form as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(6)(a): a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(6)(b): a disclosure to an owner;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(6)(c): a notice of intent to settle; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(6)(d): a verification of coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(7): "Life expectancy" means the mean number of months an individual insured under a policy to be settled can be expected to live considering medical records and appropriate experiential data.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8): (8)(a); (8)(d)(iii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(a): "Life settlement" means a written agreement:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(a)(i): between an owner and a life settlement provider; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(a)(ii): that establishes the terms for the payment of anything of value in exchange for the owner assigning, selling, transferring, devising, releasing, or bequeathing, at the time of or after the exchange, the death benefit or ownership of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(a)(ii)(A): any portion of a policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(a)(ii)(B): a beneficial interest in the policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(b): "Life settlement" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(b)(i): the transfer for compensation or value of ownership or beneficial interest in a trust or other entity that owns a policy if the trust or other entity is formed or operated for the principal purpose of acquiring one or more policies; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(b)(ii): a premium finance loan made for a policy by a lender to an owner on, before, or after the date of issuance of the policy if the owner:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(b)(ii)(A): receives on the date of the premium finance loan a guarantee of a future life settlement value of the policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(b)(ii)(B): agrees on the date of the premium finance loan to sell the policy or any portion of the policy's death benefit on a date following the issuance of the policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(c): (8)(a) An agreement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(c)(i): a "viatical settlement"; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(c)(ii): a "senior settlement."
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(d): (8)(d)(iii)(A) "Life settlement" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(d)(i): a loan or accelerated death benefit by an insurer pursuant to the terms of a policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(d)(ii): loan proceeds that are used solely to pay:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(d)(ii)(A): premiums for a policy; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(d)(ii)(B): the loan costs or other expenses incurred by the lender, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(d)(ii)(B)(I): interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(d)(ii)(B)(II): an arrangement fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(d)(ii)(B)(III): a use fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(d)(ii)(B)(IV): closing costs;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-102(8)(d)(ii)(B)(V): attorney fees and expenses;

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-103 Law governing.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-103(1): If there is more than one owner on a single policy and the owners are residents of different states, the law of the state in which the owner having the largest percentage ownership resides governs the life settlement.  If the owners own equal fractions of a policy, the owners may agree in writing that the law of the state in which one resides governs the life settlement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-103(2): A life settlement that is subject to this chapter may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-103(2)(a): require that the life settlement be construed according to the laws of another jurisdiction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-103(2)(b): deprive a court of competent jurisdiction in Utah to have jurisdiction over an action.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109 General requirements.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(1): If a life settlement provider transfers ownership or changes the beneficiary of a settled policy, the life settlement provider shall inform the insured of the transfer or change within 20 calendar days.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(2): A life settlement provider that enters a life settlement shall first obtain:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(2)(a): if the owner is the insured, a written statement from a licensed attending physician that the owner is of sound mind and under no constraint or undue influence to enter a life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(2)(b): a witnessed document in which the owner represents that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(2)(b)(i): the owner has a full and complete understanding of the life settlement and the benefits of the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(2)(b)(ii): the owner has entered the life settlement freely and voluntarily; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(2)(b)(iii): if applicable, the insured is terminally ill or chronically ill and that the illness was diagnosed after the policy was issued; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(2)(c): a document in which the insured consents to the release of the insured's medical records to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(2)(c)(i): a life settlement provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(2)(c)(ii): a life settlement producer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(2)(c)(iii): the insurer that issued the policy covering the insured.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(3): (4) Within 20 calendar days after an owner executes documents necessary to transfer rights under a policy, or enters into an agreement in any form, express or implied, to settle the policy, the life settlement provider shall give written notice to the issuer of the policy that the policy has or will become settled.  The notice shall be accompanied by a copy of the documents required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(4): (2)(c); (3) The life settlement provider shall deliver a copy of the following to the insurer that issued the policy that is the subject of the life settlement:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(4)(a): (2)(c) the medical release required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(4)(b): a copy of the owner's application for the life settlement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(4)(c): (3) the notice required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(5): (5)(a); (5)(a); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (5)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(5)(a): An insurer shall complete and return a request for verification of coverage not later than 30 calendar days after the day on which the request is received.  In its response, the insurer shall indicate whether the insurer intends to pursue an investigation regarding the validity of the insurance contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(5)(b): (5)(a); (5)(a); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; (5)(b)(i) An insurer may not require that a person making a request under Subsection
