Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(6): Medical information solicited or obtained by a life settlement provider or life settlement producer is subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(6)(a): other laws of this state relating to the confidentiality of the information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(6)(b): a rule relating to privacy of medical or personal information promulgated by the commissioner under Title V, Section 505 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act of 1999, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 6805.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(7): (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(7)(a): (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(7)(a)(i): (7) A life settlement entered into in this state shall reserve to the owner an unconditional right to rescind the life settlement within the rescission period provided for in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(7)(a)(ii): The rescission period ends 15 calendar days after the day on which the owner receives the proceeds of the life settlement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(7)(a)(iii): Rescission by an owner may be conditioned on the owner giving notice and repaying to the life settlement provider within the rescission period all proceeds of the life settlement and any premium, loan, or loan interest paid by or on behalf of the life settlement provider in connection with or as a consequence of the life settlement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(7)(b): If the insured dies during the rescission period, the life settlement is considered to be rescinded if the proceeds, premiums, loans, and loan interest paid by the life settlement provider or life settlement purchaser are repaid within 60 calendar days of the day on which the insured dies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(8): (8); (8); (8)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(8)(a): Contact with an insured to determine the health status of the insured after a life settlement may be made only by a life settlement provider or life settlement producer that is licensed in this state, or its authorized representative, and no more than:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(8)(a)(i): once every three months if the insured has a life expectancy of one year or more; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(8)(a)(ii): once every month if the insured has a life expectancy of less than one year.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(8)(b): (8) A life settlement provider or life settlement producer shall explain the procedure for the contacts allowed under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(8)(c): (8) The limitations of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(8)(d): (8) A life settlement provider or life settlement producer is responsible for the acts of its authorized representative in violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(9): The trustee of a related provider trust shall agree in writing with the life settlement provider that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(9)(a): the life settlement provider is responsible for ensuring compliance with all statutory and regulatory requirements; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(9)(b): the trustee will make all records and files related to life settlements available to the commissioner as if those records and files were maintained directly by the life settlement provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(10): Regardless of the method of compensation, a life settlement producer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(10)(a): represents only the owner; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-109(10)(b): owes a fiduciary duty to the owner to act according to the owner's instructions and in the best interest of the owner.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-110 Payment and document requirements.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-110(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-110(1)(a): A life settlement provider shall instruct the owner to send the executed documents required to effect the change in ownership or assignment or change of beneficiary of the affected policy to a designated independent escrow agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-110(1)(b): Within three business days after the day on which the escrow agent receives the documents, or within three business days after the day on which the life settlement provider receives the documents if by mistake they are sent directly to the life settlement provider, the life settlement provider shall deposit the proceeds of the life settlement into an escrow or trust account of the escrow agent in a federally insured depository institution.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-110(2): (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-110(2)(a): (1) Upon completion of the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-110(2)(a)(i): the life settlement provider; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-110(2)(a)(ii): a related provider trust or other designated representative of the life settlement provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-110(2)(b): Upon the life settlement provider's receipt from the insurer of an acknowledgment of the change in ownership or assignment or change of beneficiary of the affected policy, the life settlement provider shall instruct the escrow agent to pay the proceeds of the life settlement to the owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-110(3): Payment to the owner shall be made within three business days after the day on which the life settlement provider receives the acknowledgment from the insurer.  Failure to make the payment within that time makes the life settlement voidable by the owner for lack of consideration until payment is tendered to and accepted by the owner.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111 Prohibited acts.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(1): An owner may not enter into a life settlement at any time before the application or issuance of a policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2): An owner may not enter into a life settlement within two years after the date of issuance of the policy to which the life settlement relates unless the owner certifies to the life settlement provider that one of the following is satisfied:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(a): the policy was issued upon the owner's exercise of conversion rights arising out of a group or individual policy if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(a)(i): the total time covered under the conversion policy plus the time covered under the prior policy is at least 24 months; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(a)(ii): the time covered under a group policy, calculated without regard to any change in insurance carriers, is continuous and under the same group sponsorship; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b): the owner submits to the life settlement provider independent evidence that within the two-year period:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(i): the owner or insured is terminally ill;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(ii): the owner or insured is chronically ill;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(iii): the spouse of the owner dies;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(iv): the owner divorces the owner's spouse;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(v): the owner retires from full-time employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(vi): the owner acquires a physical or mental disability and a physician determines that the disability precludes the owner from maintaining full-time employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(vii): a final judgment or order is entered or issued by a court of competent jurisdiction, on the application of a creditor of the owner:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(vii)(A): adjudging the owner bankrupt or insolvent;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(vii)(B): approving a petition for reorganization of the owner; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(vii)(C): appointing a receiver, trustee, or liquidator for all or a substantial part of the owner's assets;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(viii): the owner experiences a significant decrease in income that is unexpected and impairs the owner's reasonable ability to pay the policy premium; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(2)(b)(ix): the owner or insured disposes of ownership interests in a closely held corporation, pursuant to the terms of a buyout or other similar agreement in effect at the time the policy is initially issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(3): An insurer may not, as a condition of responding to a request for verification of coverage or effecting the transfer of a policy pursuant to a life settlement, require any of the following to sign a form, disclosure, consent, or waiver that is not filed with the commissioner for use in connection with a life settlement in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(3)(a): an owner;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(3)(b): an insured;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(3)(c): a life settlement provider; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(3)(d): a life settlement producer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(4)(a): Upon receipt of a properly completed request for change of ownership or beneficiary of a policy, an insurer shall respond in writing within 30 calendar days of the day of receipt with written acknowledgment:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(4)(a)(i): confirming that the change is effective; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(4)(a)(ii): specifying the reasons why the requested change cannot be processed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(4)(b): An insurer may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(4)(b)(i): unreasonably delay effecting a change of ownership or beneficiary; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(4)(b)(ii): otherwise seek to interfere with a life settlement lawfully entered into in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(5): A person may not issue, solicit, or market the purchase of a policy for the primary purpose of or with a primary emphasis on settling the policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(6)(a): Unless disclosed to an owner before the execution of a life settlement by the owner, a life settlement producer may not knowingly with respect to the life settlement solicit an offer from, effectuate the life settlement with, or make a sale to any of the following that is controlling, controlled by, or under common control with the life settlement producer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(6)(a)(i): a life settlement provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(6)(a)(ii): a life settlement purchaser;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(6)(a)(iii): a financing entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(6)(a)(iv): a related provider trust.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(6)(b): Unless disclosed to an owner before the execution of a life settlement by the owner, with respect to the life settlement, a life settlement provider may not knowingly enter into the life settlement with the owner, if, in connection with the life settlement, anything of value will be paid to a life settlement producer that is controlling, controlled by, or under common control with:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(6)(b)(i): the life settlement provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(6)(b)(ii): the life settlement purchaser;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(6)(b)(iii): a financing entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-111(6)(b)(iv): a related provider trust.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-112 Advertising regulations.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-112(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-112(1)(a): A life settlement provider or life settlement producer shall establish and continuously maintain a system of control over the content, form, and method of dissemination of advertisements of the life settlement provider's or life settlement producer's contracts and services.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-112(1)(b): An advertisement is the responsibility of the life settlement provider or life settlement producer as well as the person that creates or presents the advertisement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-112(1)(c): A system of control shall include at least annual notification to persons authorized by the life settlement provider or life settlement producer that disseminate advertisements of the requirements and procedures for approval before use of any advertisements not furnished by the life settlement provider or life settlement producer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-112(2): An advertisement shall be truthful and not misleading in fact or by implication, as determined by the commissioner from the overall impression it may reasonably be expected to create upon a person of average education or intelligence in the segment of the public to which it is directed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-112(3): 31A-36-109(7) A false or misleading statement is not remedied by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-112(3)(a): making a life settlement available for inspection before it is consummated; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-112(3)(b): 31A-36-109(7) offering to refund payment if the owner is not satisfied within the period prescribed in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113 Fraud.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(1): As used in this section, "recklessly" means engaging in conduct:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(1)(a): when a person knows or should have known of a substantial likelihood of the existence of the relevant facts or risks; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(1)(b): involving a significant deviation from acceptable standards of conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2): 31A-21-104; (2) A person may not, knowingly or with intent to defraud, to deprive another of property or for pecuniary gain, do or permit its employees or agents to engage in any of the following acts:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a): 31A-21-104
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(i): present, cause to be presented or prepare with knowledge or belief that it will be presented, false information to or by a life settlement provider or life settlement producer, a financing entity, an insurer, a provider of insurance or any other person, or to conceal information, as part of, in support of or concerning a fact material to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(i)(A): an application for the issuance of a policy or life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(i)(B): the underwriting of a policy or life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(i)(C): a claim for payment or other benefit under a policy or life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(i)(D): a premium paid on a policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(i)(E): a payment or change of beneficiary or ownership pursuant to a policy or life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(i)(F): the reinstatement or conversion of a policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(i)(G): the solicitation, offer, effectuation, or sale of a policy or life settlement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(i)(H): the issuance of written evidence of a policy or life settlement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(i)(I): a financing transaction;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(ii): employ a device, scheme, or artifice to defraud in the business of life settlements;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(iii): enter into any plan or practice that involves stranger-originated life insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(a)(iv): 31A-21-104 employ a device, scheme, or artifice resulting in a violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(b): in furtherance of a fraud or to prevent detection of a fraud:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(b)(i): remove, conceal, alter, destroy, or sequester from the commissioner assets or records of a person engaged in the business of life settlements;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(b)(ii): misrepresent or conceal the financial condition of a licensee, a financing entity, an insurer, or other person;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(b)(iii): transact the business of life settlements in violation of this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(b)(iv): file with the commissioner or analogous officer of another jurisdiction a document containing false information or otherwise conceal information about a material fact from the commissioner or analogous officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(c): embezzle, steal, misappropriate, or convert money, premiums, credits, or other property of a life settlement provider, an owner, an insurer, an insured, an owner of a policy, or other person engaged in the business of life settlements or insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(d): recklessly enter into, negotiate, or otherwise deal in a life settlement, the subject of which is a policy obtained when one or more persons intend to defraud the policy's issuer, the life settlement provider, or the owner by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(d)(i): presenting false information concerning a fact material to the policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(d)(ii): concealing, to mislead another, information concerning a fact material to the policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(e): facilitate a change of the state or jurisdiction of ownership of a policy or the state of residency of an owner to a state or jurisdiction that does not have a law similar to this chapter for the express purpose of evading or avoiding this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(2)(f): (2) attempt to commit, assist, aid, abet, or conspire to commit an act or omission described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(3): A person may not knowingly or intentionally interfere with the enforcement of this chapter or an investigation of a possible violation of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(4): A person engaged in the business of life settlements may not knowingly or intentionally permit a person convicted of a felony involving dishonesty or breach of trust to participate in the business of life settlements.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(5)(a): An application or contract for a life settlement, however transmitted, shall contain the following or a substantially similar statement: "A person that knowingly presents false information in an application for insurance or a life settlement is guilty of a crime and may be subject to fines and confinement in prison."
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-36-113(5)(b): (5)(a) The lack of the statement described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 37 - Captive Insurance Companies Act
******************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Captive Insurance Companies Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102(1)(a): "Affiliated company" means a business entity that because of common ownership, control, operation, or management is in the same corporate or limited liability company system as:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102(1)(a)(i): a parent;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102(1)(a)(ii): an industrial insured; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102(1)(a)(iii): a member organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102(1)(b): "Affiliated company" does not include a business entity for which the commissioner issues an order finding that the business entity is not an affiliated company.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102(2): "Alien captive insurance company" means an insurer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102(2)(a): formed to write insurance business for a parent or affiliate of the insurer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102(2)(b): licensed pursuant to the laws of an alien or foreign jurisdiction that imposes statutory or regulatory standards:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102(2)(b)(i): on a business entity transacting the business of insurance in the alien or foreign jurisdiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-102(2)(b)(ii): in a form acceptable to the commissioner.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-201(6)(a)(iii): a certificate of authority renewal fee, assessed annually.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-201(6)(b): (6)(a); 31A-37-502; (6)(b)(i) The commissioner may:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-201(6)(b)(i): (6)(a); 31A-37-502 assign a department employee or retain legal, financial, or examination services from outside the department to perform the services described in:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-201(6)(b)(i)(A): (6)(a) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-201(6)(b)(i)(B): 31A-37-502 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-201(6)(b)(ii): (6)(b)(i) charge the reasonable cost of services described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-201(7): If the commissioner is satisfied that the documents and statements filed by the applicant captive insurance company comply with this chapter, the commissioner may grant a certificate of authority authorizing the company to do insurance business in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-201(8): A certificate of authority granted under this section expires annually and shall be renewed by July 1 of each year.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202 Permissive areas of insurance.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(1): Except as provided in Subsections (2) and (3), a captive insurance company may not directly insure a risk other than the risk of the captive insurance company's parent or affiliated company.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(2): In addition to the risks described in Subsection (1), an association captive insurance company may insure the risk of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(2)(a): a member organization of the association captive insurance company's association; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(2)(b): an affiliate of a member organization of the association captive insurance company's association.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(3): The following may insure a risk of a controlled unaffiliated business:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(3)(a): an industrial insured captive insurance company;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(3)(b): a protected cell;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(3)(c): a pure captive insurance company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(3)(d): a sponsored captive insurance company.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(4): To the extent allowed by a captive insurance company's organizational charter, a captive insurance company may provide any type of insurance described in this title, except:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(4)(a): workers' compensation insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(4)(b): personal motor vehicle insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(4)(c): homeowners' insurance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(4)(d): any component of the types of insurance described in Subsections (4)(a) through (c).
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(5): A captive insurance company may not provide coverage for:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(5)(a): a wager or gaming risk;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(5)(b): loss of an election; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(5)(c): the penal consequences of a crime.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(6): Unless the punitive damages award arises out of a criminal act of an insured, a captive insurance company may provide coverage for punitive damages awarded, including through adjudication or compromise, against the captive insurance company's:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(6)(a): parent; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(6)(b): affiliated company.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(7): Notwithstanding Subsection (4), if approved by the commissioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(7)(a): a captive insurance company may insure as a reimbursement a limited layer or deductible of workers' compensation coverage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-202(7)(b): an association captive insurance company that satisfies the requirements of this chapter may provide homeowners' insurance.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-203 Deceptive name prohibited.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-203(1): A captive insurance company may not adopt a name that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-203(1)(a): the same as any other existing business name registered in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-203(1)(b): deceptively similar to any other existing business name registered in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-203(1)(c): likely to be:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-203(1)(c)(i): confused with any other existing business name registered in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-203(1)(c)(ii): mistaken for any other existing business name registered in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-203(2): An applicant captive insurance company that submits an application for a certificate of authority on or after May 14, 2019, or a captive insurance company that changes its name on or after May 14, 2019, shall include the word "insurance" or a term of equivalent meaning in its name.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204 Paid-in capital -- Other capital.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204(1)(a): The commissioner may not issue a certificate of authority to a company described in Subsection (1)(c) unless the company possesses and thereafter maintains unimpaired paid-in capital and unimpaired paid-in surplus of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204(1)(a)(i): in the case of a pure captive insurance company:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204(1)(a)(i)(A): except as provided in Subsection (1)(a)(i)(B), not less than $250,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204(1)(a)(i)(B): if the pure captive insurance company is not acting as a pool that facilitates risk distribution for other captive insurers, an amount that is the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204(1)(a)(i)(B)(I): not less than 20% of the company's total aggregate risk; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204(1)(a)(i)(B)(II): $50,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204(1)(a)(ii): in the case of an association captive insurance company, not less than $750,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204(1)(a)(iii): in the case of an industrial insured captive insurance company incorporated as a stock insurer, not less than $700,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204(1)(a)(iv): in the case of a sponsored captive insurance company, not less than $250,000 of which a minimum of $50,000 is provided by the sponsor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-204(1)(a)(v): in the case of a special purpose captive insurance company, an amount determined by the commissioner after giving due consideration to the company's business plan, feasibility study, and pro-formas, including the nature of the risks to be insured.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-304 Rating organization.
-----------------------------------------------------
A captive insurance company is not required to join a rating organization.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305 Contributions to guaranty or insolvency fund prohibited.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(1): A captive insurance company may not join or contribute financially to any of the following in this state:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(1)(a): a plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(1)(b): a pool;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(1)(c): an association;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(1)(d): a guaranty fund; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(1)(e): an insolvency fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(2): A captive insurance company, the insured of a captive insurance company, the parent of a captive insurance company, an affiliate of a captive insurance company, or a member organization of an association captive insurance company may not receive a benefit from:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(2)(a): a plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(2)(b): a pool;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(2)(c): an association;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(2)(d): a guaranty fund for claims arising out of the operations of the captive insurance company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-305(2)(e): an insolvency fund for claims arising out of the operations of the captive insurance company.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401 Sponsored captive insurance companies -- Formation.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(1): One or more sponsors may form a sponsored captive insurance company under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2): 31A-37-106; 31A-3-103; 31A-3-304; 63J-1-504 A sponsored captive insurance company formed under this chapter may establish and maintain a protected cell to insure risks of a participant if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(a): the interest holders of a sponsored captive insurance company are limited to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(a)(i): the participants of the sponsored captive insurance company; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(a)(ii): the sponsors of the sponsored captive insurance company;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(b): each protected cell is accounted for separately on the books and records of the sponsored cell captive insurance company to reflect:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(b)(i): the financial condition of each individual protected cell;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(b)(ii): the results of operations of each individual protected cell;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(b)(iii): the net income or loss of each individual protected cell;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(b)(iv): the dividends or other distributions to participants of each individual protected cell; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(b)(v): other factors that may be:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(b)(v)(A): provided in the participant contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(b)(v)(B): required by the commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(c): the assets of a protected cell are not chargeable with liabilities arising out of any other insurance business the sponsored captive insurance company may conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(d): a sale, exchange, or other transfer of assets is not made by the sponsored captive insurance company between or among any of the protected cells of the sponsored captive insurance company without the consent of the protected cells;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(e): a sale, exchange, transfer of assets, dividend, or distribution is not made from a protected cell to a sponsor or participant without the commissioner's approval, which may not be given if the sale, exchange, transfer, dividend, or distribution would result in insolvency or impairment with respect to a protected cell;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(f): 31A-37-106 a sponsored captive insurance company annually files with the commissioner financial reports the commissioner requires under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(g): a sponsored captive insurance company notifies the commissioner in writing within 10 business days of a protected cell that is insolvent or otherwise unable to meet the claim or expense obligations of the protected cell;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-401(2)(h): a participant contract does not take effect without the commissioner's prior written approval;

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-403(1)(f): any other business entity.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-403(3)(a): a shareholder of the sponsored captive insurance company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-403(3)(b): an affiliate of the sponsored captive insurance company.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-403(4): A participant shall insure only the participant's own risks through a sponsored captive insurance company unless otherwise approved by the commissioner.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-404(2)(b)(i): the company filing the actuarial opinion; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-404(2)(b)(ii): an affiliate of the company filing the actuarial opinion.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-404(3): The commissioner may disallow the discounting of reserves by a sponsored captive insurance company if the sponsored captive insurance company violates this title.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-502 Examination.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-502(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-502(1)(a): As provided in this section, the commissioner, or a person appointed by the commissioner, may examine each captive insurance company at least once every five years, or more frequently if the commissioner determines a more frequent examination is prudent.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-502(1)(b): The five-year period described in Subsection (1)(a) shall be determined on the basis of five full annual accounting periods of operation.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-502(1)(c): The examination is to be made as of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-502(1)(c)(i): December 31 of the full five-year period; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-502(1)(c)(ii): the last day of the month of an annual accounting period authorized for a captive insurance company under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-502(2): During an examination under this section the commissioner, or a person appointed by the commissioner, shall thoroughly inspect and examine the affairs of the captive insurance company to ascertain all or any combination of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-502(2)(a): the financial condition of the captive insurance company;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-502(2)(b): the ability of the captive insurance company to fulfill the insurance policy obligations of the captive insurance company; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-502(2)(c): whether the captive insurance company has complied with this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-504 Examinations for branch and alien captive insurance companies.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-504(1): The examination for a branch captive insurance company shall be of branch business and branch operations only, if the branch captive insurance company:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-504(1)(a): provides annually to the commissioner a certificate of compliance, or an equivalent, issued by or filed with the licensing authority of the jurisdiction in which the branch captive insurance company is formed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-504(1)(b): demonstrates to the commissioner's satisfaction that the branch captive insurance company is operating in sound financial condition in accordance with the applicable laws and regulations of the jurisdiction in which the branch captive insurance company is formed.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-504(2): As a condition of obtaining a certificate of authority, an alien captive insurance company shall grant authority to the commissioner to examine the affairs of the alien captive insurance company in the jurisdiction in which the alien captive insurance company is formed.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701 Certificate of dormancy.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(1): In accordance with the provisions of this section, a captive insurance company, other than a risk retention group, may apply, without fee, to the commissioner for a certificate of dormancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(2): (2)(a)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(2)(a): A captive insurance company, other than a risk retention group, is eligible for a certificate of dormancy if the captive insurance company:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(2)(a)(i): has ceased transacting the business of insurance, including the issuance of insurance policies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(2)(a)(ii): has no remaining insurance liabilities or obligations associated with insurance business transactions or insurance policies.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(2)(b): (2)(a)(ii) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(3): (4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(4): (5) A captive insurance company that holds a certificate of dormancy:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(4)(a): shall possess and maintain unimpaired paid-in capital and unimpaired paid-in surplus of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(4)(a)(i): in the case of a pure captive insurance company or a special purpose captive insurance company, not less than $25,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(4)(a)(ii): in the case of an association captive insurance company, not less than $75,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(4)(a)(iii): in the case of a sponsored captive insurance company, not less than $50,000, of which the sponsor provides at least $20,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(4)(b): (5) is not required to:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(4)(b)(i): (5) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(4)(b)(ii): maintain an active agreement with an independent auditor or actuary; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(4)(b)(iii): hold an annual meeting of the captive insurance company in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(5): The commissioner may require a captive insurance company that holds a certificate of dormancy to submit an annual audit if the commissioner determines that there are concerns regarding the captive insurance company's solvency or liquidity.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(6): To maintain a certificate of dormancy and in lieu of a certificate of authority renewal fee, no later than July 1 of each year, a captive insurance company shall pay an annual dormancy renewal fee that is equal to 50% of the captive insurance's company's certificate of authority renewal fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37-701(7): A captive insurance company may consecutively renew a certificate of dormancy no more than five times.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 37a - Special Purpose Financial Captive Insurance Company Act
*******************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-101 Title.
----------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Special Purpose Financial Captive Insurance Company Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1): 31A-27a-102; Chapter 27a, Insurer Receivership Act; (1)(c); 31A-37a-302; 31A-1-301 For purposes of this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1)(a): "Ceding insurer" means an insurer that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1)(a)(i): is approved by the commissioner;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1)(a)(ii): is licensed or otherwise authorized to transact the business of insurance or reinsurance in the insurer's state or country of domicile; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1)(a)(iii): cedes risk to a special purpose financial captive insurance company pursuant to a reinsurance contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1)(b): 31A-27a-102; Chapter 27a, Insurer Receivership Act Notwithstanding Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1)(b)(i): is unable to pay an obligation when the obligation is due, unless the obligation is the subject of a bona fide dispute; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1)(b)(ii): fails to meet the criteria and conditions for solvency of the special purpose financial captive insurance company established by the commissioner by rule or order.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1)(c): (1)(c); 31A-37a-302

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1)(c)(i)(E): (1)(c) if all or a part of the proceeds, a letter of credit, or asset described in this Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1)(i)(ii): a security issued by a third party, the proceeds of which are obtained directly or indirectly by a special purpose financial captive insurance company.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-102(1)(j): "Surplus note" means an unsecured subordinated debt obligation that has one or more characteristics that are consistent with paragraph 3 of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners Statement of Statutory Accounting Principles No. 41, as amended from time to time and as modified or supplemented by rule or order of the commissioner.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-301 Formation.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-301(1): A special purpose financial captive insurance company may be:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-301(1)(a): incorporated as a stock insurer with its capital divided into shares and held by its stockholders; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-301(1)(b): organized as a manager-managed limited liability company.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-302 Minimum capital and surplus.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-302(1): The commissioner may not issue a special purpose financial captive insurance company a certificate of authority under this chapter unless it possesses unimpaired paid-in capital and surplus of not less than $250,000 on the day on which the certificate of authority is issued.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-37a-302(2): A special purpose financial captive insurance company shall maintain unimpaired paid-in capital and surplus of not less than $250,000 at all times when having a certificate of authority under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 38 - Federal Health Care Tax Credit Program Act
*****************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Federal Health Care Tax Credit Program Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(1): "Bridge program" means the program established by the Department of Workforce Services on July 1, 2003:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(1)(a): to implement the federal health coverage tax credit program;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(1)(b): with federal funds; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(1)(c): for qualified participants.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(2): "Federal health coverage tax credit program" means the health care tax credit program authorized by the Trade Reform Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(3): 31A-38-103 "Qualified participant" means an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(3)(a): 31A-38-103 eligible for coverage under the state program in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(3)(b): qualified by the Internal Revenue Service and the Department of the United States Treasury to participate in the federal health coverage tax credit program.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(4): "State program" means the program established under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(4)(a): to implement the federal health coverage tax credit program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(4)(b): for qualified participants.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-102(5): "Trade Reform Act" means the Trade Adjustment Assistance Reform Act of 2002, 107 P.L. 210.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-103 Implementation of the federal health coverage tax credit program.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-103(1): An employee is considered to be an employee of the employee's last employer for purposes of participating in the federal health coverage tax credit program if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-103(1)(a): the employee is or was an employee of the employer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-103(1)(b): the employer is or was doing business in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-103(1)(c): the employee requires health care services from a licensed health care provider doing business in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-103(1)(d): the health insurance benefit plan covering the employee is terminated by the employer or former employer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-103(1)(e): the employee is a qualified participant.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-103(2): (2)

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-38-103(2)(a)(iii)(A): implementing the federal health coverage tax credit program; and

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 39 - Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Compact
**********************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-39-101 Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Compact.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Pursuant to the terms and conditions of this Act, the State of Utah seeks to join with other States and establish the Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Compact, and thus become a member of the Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Commission.  Utah's insurance commissioner is hereby designated to serve as the representative of this State to the Commission.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 40 - Professional Employer Organization Licensing Act

This chapter is known as the "Professional Employer Organization Licensing Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201 Enforceable rights and obligations.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(1): In a coemployment relationship under a professional employer agreement:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(1)(a): a professional employer organization:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(1)(a)(i): may only enforce a right of an employer that is specifically allocated to the professional employer organization under the professional employer agreement or this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(1)(a)(ii): is subject only to an obligation of an employer specifically allocated to the professional employer organization by the professional employer agreement or this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(1)(b): a client:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(1)(b)(i): may enforce a right of an employer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(1)(b)(i)(A): allocated to the client in the professional employer agreement or this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(1)(b)(i)(B): not specifically allocated to the professional employer organization under the professional employer agreement or this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(1)(b)(ii): is subject to an obligation of an employer:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(1)(b)(ii)(A): allocated to the client by the professional employer agreement or this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(1)(b)(ii)(B): not specifically allocated to a professional employer organization by the professional employer agreement or this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-201(2): A right or obligation of a professional employer organization as a coemployer of a covered employee is limited to a right or obligation arising pursuant to the professional employer agreement and this chapter during the term of coemployment of the covered employee by the professional employer organization.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-203 Covered employee.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-203(1): 31A-40-202(3)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-203(1)(a): An individual is a covered employee of a professional employer organization if the individual is coemployed pursuant to a professional employer agreement subject to this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-203(1)(b): 31A-40-202(3) An individual who is a covered employee under a professional employer agreement is a covered employee, whether or not the professional employer organization provides the notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-203(1)(b)(i): the employee is first compensated by the professional employer organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-203(1)(b)(ii): the client notifies the professional employer organization of a new hire.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-203(2): (1) An individual who is an officer, director, shareholder, partner, or manager of a client is a covered employee:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-203(2)(a): to the extent that the client and the professional employer organization expressly agree in the professional employer agreement that the individual is a covered employee;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-203(2)(b): (1) if the conditions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-203(2)(c): if the individual acts as an operational manager or performs day-to-day an operational service for the client.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(a)(ii): be responsible in the controlling person's finances; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(a)(iii): not have a history of or be engaged in unlawful activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(b): has a history that is verifiable that the professional employer organization:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(b)(i): complies with regulatory requirements; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(b)(ii): engages in financially responsible conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(c): has or is able to obtain audited financial statements;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(d): has an adjusted net worth equal to or in excess of the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(d)(i): $100,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(d)(ii): 5% of total adjusted liabilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(e): has liquid assets that are sufficient to pay short-term liabilities as demonstrated by a ratio determined by dividing current assets by current liabilities or a similar formula;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(f): has on its books adequate financial reserves for all local, state, and federal self-insurance and any insurance policy or plan in which the final cost of coverage is affected by claim losses;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(g): operates in conformity with all applicable laws and regulations including those laws and regulations in addition to this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(h): does not engage in deceptive trade practices or misrepresentations of an employer's obligation or liability;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(i): has a written professional employer agreement with each client;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(j): has or is willing to obtain a written acknowledgment, as part of an existing form or separately, from each covered employee stating that the covered employee understands and accepts the nature, terms, and conditions of the coemployment relationship;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(k): establishes and maintains a coemployment relationship by assuming key employer attributes with respect to covered employees as demonstrated by the professional employer agreement and employment forms, policies, and procedures;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(l): provides all covered employees with a written copy of the professional employer organization's employment policies and procedures;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(m): ensures that all covered employees are covered in a regulatory compliant manner by workers' compensation insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(n): does not knowingly use the coemployment relationship to assist a client to evade or avoid the client's obligations under:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(n)(i): the National Labor Relations Act, 29 U.S.C. Sec. 151 et seq.;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(n)(ii): the federal Railway Labor Act, 45 U.S.C. Sec. 151 et seq.; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(n)(iii): any collective bargaining agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(o): except through a licensed insurance agent, does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(o)(i): represent or imply that it can sell insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(o)(ii): attempt to sell insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(o)(iii): sell insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(p): markets and provides, or is willing to market and provide professional employer service under a separate and distinct trade name from any affiliated professional employer organization that is not certified by the assurance organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(q): does not allow any person not certified by the assurance organization to use the professional employer organization's trade name in the sale or delivery of the professional employer organization's professional employer service;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(r): does not guarantee, participate in, transfer between, or otherwise share liabilities with any other professional employer organization that is not certified by the assurance organization:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(r)(i): in the employment of covered employees; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(r)(ii): in any employee benefit or insurance policy or plan that is not fully insured and fully funded; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s): has the ability to provide a regulatory agency or insurance carrier upon request with:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s)(i): a client's name, address, and federal tax identification number;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s)(ii): payroll data by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s)(ii)(A): client;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s)(ii)(B): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s)(ii)(B)(I): client SIC Code of the 1987 Standard Industrial Classification Manual of the federal Executive Office of the President, Office of Management and Budget; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s)(ii)(B)(II): client classification under the 2002 North American Industry Classification System of the federal Executive Office of the President, Office of Management and Budget; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s)(ii)(C): workers' compensation classification;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s)(iii): the names of covered employees by:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s)(iii)(A): the worksite of a client; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s)(iii)(B): workers' compensation classification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(3)(s)(iv): workers' compensation certificates of insurance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-40-303(4): This section does not modify the commissioner's authority or responsibility to accept, renew, or terminate a license.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 41 - Title Insurance Recovery, Education, and Research Fund Act
*********************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Title Insurance Recovery, Education, and Research Fund Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-102(1): 31A-2-403 "Commission" means the Title and Escrow Commission created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-102(2): 31A-41-201 "Fund" means the Title Insurance Recovery, Education, and Research Fund created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-102(3): "Title insurance licensee" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-102(3)(a): an agency title insurance producer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-102(3)(b): an individual title insurance producer.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-103 Authority to take disciplinary action not limited.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-103(1): This chapter does not limit the authority of the commissioner or the commission to take disciplinary action against a title insurance licensee for a violation of this title or rules made by the department or commission under this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-103(2): The repayment in full of obligations to the fund by a title insurance licensee does not nullify or modify the effect of another disciplinary proceeding brought pursuant to this title or rules and regulations made by the department or commission under this title.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-201 Creation of Title Insurance Recovery, Education, and Research Fund.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-201(1): There is created an expendable special revenue fund to be known as the "Title Insurance Recovery, Education, and Research Fund."
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-201(2): 31A-41-305 The fund shall consist of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-201(2)(a): assessments on individual title insurance producers and agency title insurance producers made under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-201(2)(b): 31A-41-305 amounts collected under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-201(2)(c): interest earned on the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-201(3): Interest on fund money shall be deposited into the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-201(4): The department shall administer the fund.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-301(2)(d): the applicant has had a writ of execution issued under the judgment, and the officer executing the writ has returned showing that:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-301(2)(d)(i): no property subject to execution in satisfaction of the judgment could be found; or

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-301(2)(f): the applicant has exercised reasonable diligence to secure payment of the judgment from the assets of the judgment debtor.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-302 Department may defend action in which title insurance licensee does not appear or defend.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-302(1): In a lawsuit alleging that fraud, misrepresentation, or deceit by a title insurance licensee in a real estate transaction proximately caused economic harm, if grounds arise for the entry of a default judgment against the title insurance licensee, the plaintiff may petition the court to join the department as a defendant in the lawsuit.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-302(2): (2) After being served, the department may appear, conduct discovery, and otherwise defend against any claim asserted against the title insurance licensee for which the fund may be liable under this part.  A judgment under this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-303 Determination and amount of fund liability.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-303(1): Subject to the requirements of this part, if the department determines that a claim should be levied against the fund, the department shall enter an order that the fund pay that portion of the petitioner's judgment that is eligible for payment from the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-303(2): A payment from the fund may not compensate for punitive damages, attorney fees, interest, or court costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-303(3): Regardless of the number of claimants or parcels of real estate involved in a single transaction, the liability of the fund may not exceed:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-303(3)(a): $15,000 for a single real estate transaction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-303(3)(b): $50,000 for all transactions of a title insurance licensee.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-304 Insufficient funds to satisfy judgment.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
If the money in the fund is insufficient to satisfy a claim ordered to be paid under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 31A-41-304(1): in the order that petitions related to unpaid claims are originally served on the department; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-304(2): an amount equal to the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-304(2)(a): the unpaid claim; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-304(2)(b): interest on the unpaid claim at a rate of 5% per annum from the date the court orders payment from the fund until the day on which the claim is paid.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-305 Department subrogated -- Authority to revoke license.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-305(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-305(1)(a): If the department makes payment from the fund, the department is subrogated to all the rights of the person who received money from the fund for the amounts paid out of the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-305(1)(b): Any amounts recovered by the department under the subrogated rights shall be deposited in the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-305(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-305(2)(a): The license of a title insurance licensee for whom payment from the fund is made under this chapter is automatically revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-305(2)(b): Before a title insurance licensee whose license is revoked under this section may apply for a new license under this title, the title insurance licensee shall pay to the department for deposit in the fund:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-305(2)(b)(i): the amounts paid by the fund because of an action brought against the title insurance licensee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-305(2)(b)(ii): interest at a rate determined by the commissioner with the concurrence of the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-41-306 Failure to comply constitutes a waiver.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
The failure of a person to comply with this chapter constitutes a waiver of any right provided under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 43 - Small Employer Stop-Loss Insurance Act
*************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Small Employer Stop-Loss Insurance Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
For purposes of this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(1): "Actuarial certification" means a written statement by a member of the American Academy of Actuaries, or by another individual acceptable to the commissioner, that an insurer is in compliance with this chapter, based upon the individual's examination and including a review of the appropriate records and the actuarial assumptions and methods used by the stop-loss insurer in establishing attachment points and other applicable determinations in conjunction with the provision of stop-loss insurance coverage.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(2): "Aggregate attachment point" means the dollar amount of covered claims incurred by a small employer plan beyond which the stop-loss insurer incurs liability for losses incurred by the small employer plan, subject to limitations included in the contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(3): "Coverage" means the combination of the employer plan design and the stop-loss contract design.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(4): "Expected claims" means the amount of claims that, in the absence of aggregate stop-loss insurance, are projected to be incurred by a small employer health plan using reasonable and accepted actuarial principles.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(5): "Lasering":
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(5)(a): means increasing or removing stop-loss coverage for a specific individual within an employer group; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(5)(b): includes other practices that are prohibited by the commissioner by administrative rule that result in lowering the stop-loss premium for the employer by transferring the risk for an individual's claims back to the employer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(6): "Small employer" means an employer who, with respect to a calendar year and to a plan year:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(6)(a): employed an average of at least two employees but not more than 50 eligible employees on each business day during the preceding calendar year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(6)(b): employs at least two employees on the first day of the plan year.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(7): "Specific attachment point" means the dollar amount of covered claims attributable to a single individual covered by a small employer plan in a contract year beyond which the stop-loss insurer assumes the liability for losses incurred by the small employer plan, subject to limitations included in the contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-102(8): "Stop-loss insurance" means insurance purchased by a small employer for which the stop-loss insurer assumes all loss amounts of the small employer's plan in excess of a stated amount, subject to the policy limit.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-201 Scope of chapter.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-201(1): This chapter establishes criteria for the issuance of stop-loss insurance contracts or re-insurance contracts for small employers that establish self-funded or partially self-funded health plans for the small employer's employees.  This chapter does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-201(1)(a): impose any requirement or duty on any person other than a stop-loss insurer or re-insurer who issues a stop-loss insurance contract to a small employer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-201(1)(b): treat any stop-loss insurance contract as a direct policy of health insurance; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-201(1)(c): constitute an attempt to exercise authority over self-funded or partially self-funded health benefit plans sponsored by a small employer.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-201(2): This chapter applies to a small employer stop-loss contract issued or renewed on or after July 1, 2013.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-202 Laws applicable to stop-loss insurance.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
A stop-loss insurance contract or a re-insurance contract issued to a small employer that establishes a self-funded or partially self-funded health plan:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-202(1): is not reinsurance under this title, and is not subject to the regulations for reinsurance under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-202(2): is subject to regulation as stop-loss insurance under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-202(3): is subject to the contract provisions of this title in the same manner as insurance contracts issued by any other insurer.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301 Stop-loss insurance coverage standards.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(1): A small employer stop-loss insurance contract shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(1)(a): be issued to the small employer to provide insurance to the group health benefit plan, not the employees of the small employer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(1)(b): have a contract term with guaranteed rates for at least 12 months, without adjustment, unless there is a change in the benefits provided under the small employer's health plan during the contract period;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(1)(c): include both a specific attachment point and an aggregate attachment point in a contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(1)(d): align stop-loss plan benefit limitations and exclusions with a small employer's health plan benefit limitations and exclusions, including any annual or lifetime limits in the employer's health plan;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(1)(e): have an annual specific attachment point that is at least $10,000;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(1)(f): have an annual aggregate attachment point that may not be less than 85% of expected claims;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(1)(g): pay stop-loss claims:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(1)(g)(i): incurred during the contract period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(1)(g)(ii): paid within 12 months after the expiration date of the contract; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(1)(h): include provisions to cover incurred and unpaid stop-loss claims when the small employer's stop-loss plan terminates.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(2): A small employer stop-loss contract shall not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(2)(a): include lasering; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-301(2)(b): pay claims directly to an individual employee, member, or participant.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-302 Stop-loss restrictions -- Filing requirements.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-302(1): 31A-2-201; 31A-2-201.1 A stop-loss insurer shall file the stop-loss insurance contract form and rate methodology with the commissioner pursuant to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-302(2): A stop-loss insurer shall file with the commissioner, annually on or before April 1, in a form and manner required by the commissioner by administrative rule adopted by the commissioner:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-302(2)(a): an actuarial memorandum and certification which demonstrates that the insurer is in compliance with this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-302(2)(b): the stop-loss insurer's stop-loss experience.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-302(3): (2) An insurer shall maintain at its principal place of business:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-302(3)(a): a complete and detailed description of its rating practices and renewal underwriting practices, including information and documentation that demonstrate the rating methods and practices are:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-302(3)(a)(i): based upon commonly accepted actuarial assumptions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-302(3)(a)(ii): in accordance with sound actuarial principles; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-302(3)(b): (2) a copy of the annual filing required by Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-303 Stop-loss insurance disclosure.
----------------------------------------------------------------
A stop-loss insurance contract delivered, issued for delivery, or entered into shall include the disclosure exhibit required by the commissioner through administrative rule, which shall include at least the following information:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-303(1): the complete costs for the stop-loss contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-303(2): the date on which the insurance takes effect and terminates, including renewability provisions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-303(3): the aggregate attachment point and the specific attachment point;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-303(4): limitations on coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-303(5): an explanation of monthly accommodation and disclosure about any monthly accommodation features included in the stop-loss contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-303(6): a description of terminal liability funding, including the cost of processing claims before and after the termination of the contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-303(7): maximum claims liability to the employer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-303(8): a summary of the policy.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-304 Administrative rules.
------------------------------------------------------
The commissioner may adopt administrative rules in accordance withUtah Code Annotated § 31A-43-304(1): implement this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-304(2): define lasering practices that are prohibited by this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-304(3): 31A-43-302 establish the form and manner of the actuarial certification and the annual report on stop-loss experience required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-304(4): 31A-43-303 establish the form and manner of the disclosure required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-304(5): assure the rates associated with the specific attachment points and aggregate attachment points are actuarially sound and are not against the public interest; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-43-304(6): assure that stop-loss contracts include provisions to cover incurred and unpaid claims if a small employer plan terminates.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 44 - Continuing Care Provider Act
***************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(1): "Continuing care" means furnishing or providing access to an individual, other than by an individual related to the individual by blood, marriage, or adoption, of lodging together with nursing services, medical services, or other related services pursuant to a contract requiring an entrance fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(2): "Continuing care contract" means a contract under which a provider provides continuing care to a resident.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(3)(a): "Entrance fee" means an initial or deferred transfer to a provider of a sum of money or property made or promised to be made as full or partial consideration for acceptance of a specified individual as a resident in a facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(3)(b): "Entrance fee" includes a monthly fee, assessed at a rate that is greater than the value of the provider's monthly services, that a resident agrees to pay in exchange for acceptance into a facility or a promise of future monthly fees assessed at a rate that is less than the value of the services rendered.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(3)(c): "Entrance fee" does not include an amount less than the sum of the regular period charges for three months of residency in a facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(3)(d): "Entrance fee" does not include a deposit of less than $1,000 made under a reservation agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(4): "Facility" means a place in which a person provides continuing care pursuant to a continuing care contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(5): "Ground lease" means a lease to a provider of the land and infrastructure improvements to the land on which a facility is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(6): "Ground lessor" means, for a facility subject to a ground lease, the owner and lessor of the land and infrastructure improvements to the land on which the facility is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(7): "Insolvent" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(7)(a): having generally ceased to pay debts in the ordinary course of business other than as a result of a bona fide dispute;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(7)(b): being unable to pay debts as they become due; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(7)(c): being insolvent within the meaning of federal bankruptcy law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(8): "Living unit" means a room, apartment, cottage, or other area within a facility set aside for the exclusive use or control of one or more identified individuals.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(9)(a): "Provider" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(9)(a)(i): the owner of a facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(9)(a)(ii): a person, other than a resident, that claims a possessory interest in a facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(9)(a)(iii): a person who enters into a continuing care contract with a resident or potential resident.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(9)(b): "Provider" does not include a person who is solely a ground lessor.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(10): 31A-44-301 "Provider disclosure statement" means, for a given provider, the disclosure statement described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(11): "Reservation agreement" means an agreement that requires the payment of a deposit to reserve a living unit for a prospective resident.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-102(12): "Resident" means an individual entitled to receive continuing care in a facility pursuant to a continuing care contract.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103 Advisory committee.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(1): The commissioner may convene a continuing care advisory committee to advise the department on issues related to the continuing care industry, continuing care facility residents, and the department's duties under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(2): (1) The committee described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(2)(a): a representative from an organization that advocates for the elderly;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(2)(b): a representative of nursing homes;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(2)(c): a representative from the continuing care industry;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(2)(d): a representative from the insurance community; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(2)(e): a member of the general public who is a resident of a continuing care facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(3): (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(3)(a): (3)(b) Except as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(3)(b): The commissioner shall, at the time of appointment or reappointment, adjust the length of terms to ensure that the terms of members are staggered so that approximately half of the committee is appointed every two years.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(4): A member of the committee shall serve until the member's successor is appointed and qualified.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(5): When a vacancy occurs in the committee's membership, the department shall appoint a replacement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(6): The department may dismiss and replace members of the committee at the department's discretion.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(7): The department may designate a chair of the committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(8): The committee shall meet when called by the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(9): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107; 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 A member may not receive compensation or benefits for the member's service, but may receive per diem and travel expenses in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(9)(a): 63A-3-106 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(9)(b): 63A-3-107 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(9)(c): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 rules made by the Division of Finance pursuant to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-103(10): The department shall staff the committee.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-104 Scope of regulation -- When compliance is required.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-104(1): The regulation of providers under this chapter does not limit or replace regulation by any other governmental entity of continuing care facilities or providers.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-104(2): The department may not regulate, or in any manner inquire into, the quality of care provided in a facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-104(3): Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act A record that the department receives from a provider that is not required to be part of a disclosure statement under this chapter is a protected record under
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-104(4): 63J-1-504 The department shall determine the amount of any fee required under this chapter, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-104(5): A provider that begins marketing a continuing care facility project on or before May 10, 2016, is not required to comply with this chapter until May 10, 2017.

-------------------------------------------------------
