Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-204 Actuarial review.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-204(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-204(1)(a): This section applies only to a provider that directly or indirectly offers a future guarantee of continuing care that the department determines develops current actuarial liabilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-204(1)(b): This section does not apply to a provider that offers continuing care under a fee-for-service model with a required entrance fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-204(2): A provider subject to this section shall file, with the department, an actuarial review:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-204(2)(a): upon being notified of the department's determination; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-204(2)(b): on a day designated by the department in the year five years after the day on which the department last received an actuarial review from the provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-204(3): (2) The department may require an actuarial review in addition to the actuarial reviews required by Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-205 Suspension or revocation of registration. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
The department may suspend or revoke a provider's registration if the provider intentionally violates this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-206 Management by others. 
-------------------------------------------------------
A provider may not contract for total management of a facility unless the provider notifies the department.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-301 Precontractual recording requirements. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-301(1): A provider shall file with the department a current disclosure statement that meets the requirements of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-301(2): (1) A provider shall comply with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-301(2)(a): contracts to provide continuing care to a resident in this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-301(2)(b): extends the term of an existing continuing care contract with a resident in this state that requires a person to pay an entrance fee, regardless of whether the extended continuing care contract requires an entrance fee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-301(2)(c): solicits or offers, or directs another person to solicit or offer, a continuing care contract to a resident of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-301(3): (2)(c) A provider solicits or offers a contract under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-301(3)(a): in a direct communication to an individual in the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-301(3)(b): in a paid advertisement published in or broadcast from the state, except for a paid advertisement in a publication with more than two-thirds of the publication's circulation outside of the state.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-302 Delivery of disclosure statement.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-302(1): A provider shall deliver a disclosure statement to an individual before the earlier of the date:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-302(1)(a): the provider executes a continuing care contract with the individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-302(1)(b): the individual transfers an entrance fee or a nonrefundable deposit to the provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-302(2): (1) The most recently filed disclosure statement:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-302(2)(a): is current for the purpose of this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-302(2)(b): (1) is the only disclosure statement that satisfies the requirements described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-303 Cover page of disclosure statement.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
The cover page of a disclosure statement shall state:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-303(1): the disclosure statement's date in a prominent location and in type that is boldfaced, capitalized, underlined, or otherwise set out from the surrounding written material so as to be conspicuous;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-303(2): that the provider is required to deliver a disclosure statement to an individual before the provider executes a continuing care contract with the individual or accepts payment of an entrance fee or a nonrefundable deposit from the individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-303(3): that the disclosure statement has not been approved by a government agency to ensure the disclosure statement's accuracy.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-304 Disclosure statement -- Contents -- Provider characteristics.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A provider disclosure statement shall contain:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-304(1): the name and business address of each provider officer, director, trustee, and managing or general partner of the provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-304(2): the name and business address of each person who has at least a 10% interest in the provider and a description of the person's interest in or occupation with the provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-304(3): a statement of whether the continuing care provider is a for-profit or not-for-profit entity, and a statement of the provider's tax-exempt status, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-304(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-304(4)(a): the location and a description of the proposed or existing physical property of the facility; and

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305 Disclosure statement -- Contents -- Contract.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A provider disclosure statement shall include a description of the following provisions contained in the provider's continuing care contract:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(1): a description of the services provided under the provider's proposed continuing care contract, including a description of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(1)(a): the extent to which the provider will offer or provide medical care to a resident; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(1)(b): the services the provider includes under the contract, and the services the provider offers at an extra charge;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(2): the fees the provider requires a resident to pay, including any entrance fees or periodic charges;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(3): a description of the conditions, in the provider's continuing care contract, under which:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(3)(a): a provider or a resident may cancel the continuing care contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(3)(b): a provider will refund all or part of an entrance fee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(3)(c): a provider may adjust a fee the provider charges a resident and any limitations on those adjustments;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(4): any health or financial criteria that a resident is required to meet under the continuing care contract for acceptance to the facility or for the resident to continue living in the facility, including the effect of any change in the health or financial condition of an individual between the date of the continuing care contract and the date on which the individual initially occupies a living unit;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(5): the provider's policy for the spouse of a resident, regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(5)(a): the conditions under which the spouse is allowed to live in the resident's unit; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(5)(b): the financial or other consequences to the resident if the spouse does not meet the requirements for admission;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(6): the provider's policy regarding changes in the number of people residing in a living unit because of marriage or other relationships;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(7): the conditions under which a living unit occupied by a resident may be made available by the provider to a different resident other than on the death of the previous resident; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-305(8): the number of continuing care contracts terminated, other than by the resident's death, at the provider's facility in the state during the three most recent calendar years.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-306 Disclosure statement -- Contents -- Health care information.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The provider disclosure statement shall include:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-306(1): a description of the facility as an independent living, assisted living, or nursing care facility, or a combination of facility types;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-306(2): a general description of medical services provided at the facility in addition to assisted living services and nursing care services;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-306(3): a statement as to whether the facility accepts Medicare and Medicaid reimbursements; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-306(4): notice of the online federal nursing care facility database and the online federal nursing care facility database's Internet address.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-307 Disclosure statement -- Contents -- Financial information. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The provider disclosure statement shall:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-307(1): describe any provisions the provider made or will make to provide reserve funding or security to enable the provider to fully perform the provider's obligations under a continuing care contract, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-307(1)(a): the establishment of an escrow account, trust, or reserve fund, and the manner in which the provider will invest the account, trust, or reserve funds; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-307(1)(b): the name and experience of an individual in the provider's direct employment who will make the investment decisions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-307(2): contain a provider financial statement, prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and audited by an independent certified public account, that includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-307(2)(a): a balance sheet as of the end of the most recent fiscal year;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-307(2)(b): an income statement for each of the three most recent fiscal years; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-307(2)(c): a cash flow statement for each of the three most recent fiscal years.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-308 Anticipated source and application of funds. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If a provider's facility is not in operation, the provider disclosure statement shall include a statement of the provider's anticipated source and application of funds to be used in the purchase or construction of the facility, including:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-308(1): an estimate of the cost of purchasing or constructing and of equipping the facility, including financing expenses, legal expenses, land costs, occupancy development costs, and any other costs that the provider expects to incur or to become obligated to pay before the facility begins operating;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-308(2): a description of any mortgage loan or other long-term financing arrangement for the facility, including the anticipated terms and costs of the financing;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-308(3): an estimate of the total entrance fees to be received from, or on behalf of, residents before the facility begins operation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-308(4): an estimate of any funds the provider anticipates are necessary to cover the facility's initial losses.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-310 Annual disclosure statement revision. 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-310(1): A provider shall file a revised disclosure statement with the department before 120 days after the day on which the provider's fiscal year ends.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-310(2): The revised disclosure statement shall revise, as of the end of the provider's fiscal year, the information required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-310(3): 31A-44-307 The revised disclosure statement shall describe any material differences between:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-310(3)(a): 31A-44-307 the estimated income statements filed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-310(3)(b): the actual result of operations during that fiscal year with the revised estimated income statements filed as a part of the revised disclosure statement.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-310(4): A provider may revise the provider's disclosure statement and may file a revised disclosure statement at any time if, in the provider's opinion, a revision is necessary to prevent a disclosure statement from containing a material misstatement of fact or omitting a material fact required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-310(5): The department:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-310(5)(a): shall review the disclosure statement for completeness; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-310(5)(b): is not required to review the disclosure statement for accuracy.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-311 Advertisement in conflict with disclosures. 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
A provider may not engage in any type of advertisement for a continuing care contract or facility if the advertisement contains a statement or representation in conflict with the disclosures required under this part.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-313 Cancellation of contract -- Death or incapacity before occupancy. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-313(1): A continuing care contract to provide continuing care in a living unit in a facility is cancelled if the resident:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-313(1)(a): dies before occupying a living unit in the facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-313(1)(b): is precluded under the terms of the contract from occupying a living unit in the facility because of illness, injury, or incapacity.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-313(2): If a continuing care contract is cancelled under this section, the resident or the resident's legal representative is entitled to a refund of all money or property transferred to the provider, minus:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-313(2)(a): any nonstandard costs specifically incurred by the provider or facility at the request of the resident that are described in the contract or in an addendum to the contract signed by the resident; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-313(2)(b): a reasonable service charge, if set out in the contract, that may not exceed the greater of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-313(2)(b)(i): $1,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-313(2)(b)(ii): 2% of the entrance fee.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-315 Financial assessment.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-315(1): The department shall assess the financial condition of a provider no less than once per year.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-315(2): The department may consider any relevant documents and information in performing an assessment.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-315(3): A provider shall prepare and timely provide to the department documents and information requested by the department in connection with an assessment.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-315(4): Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act Department work papers created or relied upon in connection with an assessment are protected under
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-315(5): The department may conduct any portion of an assessment at the provider's facility during regular business hours if the department notifies the provider of the anticipated visit and assessment at least seven calendar days in advance.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-315(6): The department shall prepare a written report of the assessment and provide a copy of the report to the provider within 28 days after the day on which the department completes the gathering of information necessary to complete the assessment.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401 Continuing care contract requirements -- No waiver.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(1): A continuing care contract shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(1)(a): provide that the provider shall refund the portion of a departing resident's entrance fee that the provider has agreed to refund, if any, no later than the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(1)(a)(i): if the departing resident ceased occupancy of the departing resident's unit before any other departing resident who has not received an entrance fee refund, 30 days after the day on which the provider accumulates an amount of money, from sales of living units previously occupied by departing residents, that is equal to the departing resident's entrance fee refund; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(1)(a)(ii): one year after the day on which the departing resident ceases to occupy the departing resident's living unit, unless the provider proves that the provider has made and is making a good faith effort to find an occupant for a living unit that was previously occupied by a departing resident;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(1)(b): provide that the resident may terminate the continuing care contract upon giving notice of termination:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(1)(b)(i): with or without cause; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(1)(b)(ii): clearly stating what portion of the entrance fee the provider will refund and the date by which the provider will make the refund; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(1)(c): provide that a continuing care contract is terminated by the resident's death and clearly state:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(1)(c)(i): what portion of the entrance fee the provider will refund in the event of the resident's death;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(1)(c)(ii): the date before which the provider will make the refund; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(1)(c)(iii): to whom the provider will make the refund.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(2): A continuing care contract may permit involuntary dismissal of a resident from a continuing care facility upon a reasonable determination by the provider that the resident's health and well-being require termination of the continuing care contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(3): (2); Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act If a resident is dismissed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(3)(a): in an amount provided in the continuing care contract; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(3)(b): before the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(3)(b)(i): a time provided in the continuing care contract; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(3)(b)(ii): 60 days after the day on which the provider dismisses the resident from the facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-401(4): A resident may not waive a provision of this chapter by agreement.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-501.1 Receivership.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-501.1(1): The department may, by petition or motion, request that a court appoint the commissioner as receiver for a provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-501.1(2): The court may appoint the commissioner as receiver if, as determined by the commissioner, the provider:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-501.1(2)(a): is insolvent or at material risk of becoming insolvent within the next 12 months;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-501.1(2)(b): is materially unable to meet the income or available cash projections described in the provider's disclosure statement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-501.1(2)(c): is unable or at risk of being unable to perform a material obligation under a continuing care contract within the next 12 months.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-501.1(3): 31A-44-601 In evaluating whether a receiver is appropriate under this section, the court:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-501.1(3)(a): shall evaluate and promote the best interests of the residents that have contracted with the provider; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-501.1(3)(b): 31A-44-601 may require the proceeds of a lien imposed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-501.1(4): The commissioner may not file an independent proceeding or action described in this section if another judicial proceeding or action based on the provider's financial condition is pending, but may move to intervene in a pending proceeding or action that is based on the provider's financial condition.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-504 Bond.
--------------------------------------
A court may refuse to make or vacate an order to rehabilitate a provider's facility under this part if the provider posts a bond that is:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-504(1): in an amount that the court determines is equal to the reserve funding the provider needs to fulfill the provider's obligations under all of the continuing care contracts for the facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-504(2): issued by a recognized surety authorized to do business in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-504(3): executed in favor of the state on behalf of any individual entitled to an entrance fee refund or other damages from the provider.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-505 Termination of receivership.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-505(1): A court may terminate a receivership of a provider's facility and order the return of the facility and the facility's assets to the provider if the court determines:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-505(1)(a): the objectives of the receivership orders have been accomplished; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-505(1)(b): termination of the receivership will not jeopardize the interests of the facility's residents, creditors, owners, or the public.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-505(2): A court may enter an order under this section after the court enters:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-505(2)(a): a full report and accounting of the conduct of the facility's affairs during the rehabilitation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-505(2)(b): a report on the facility's financial condition.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-506 Payment of receiver. 
------------------------------------------------------
A receiver's and any deputy receiver's reasonable costs, expenses, and fees are payable from a provider's or facility's assets.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603 Examinations. 
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603(1): The department may conduct periodic on-site examinations of a provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603(2): In conducting an examination, the department or the department's staff:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603(2)(a): shall have full and free access to all the provider's records; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603(2)(b): may summon and qualify as a witness, under oath, and examine, any director, officer, member, agent, or employee of the provider, and any other person, concerning the condition and affairs of the provider or a facility.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603(3): Books and records shall be kept for not less than three calendar years in addition to the current calendar year.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603(4): The provider shall pay the reasonable costs of an examination under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603(5): The department may conduct an on-site examination in conjunction with an examination performed by a representative of an agency of another state.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603(6): (6)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603(6)(a): The department, in lieu of an on-site examination, may accept the examination report of an agency of another state that has regulatory oversight of the provider, or a report prepared by an independent accounting firm.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603(6)(b): (6)(a) A report accepted under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-603(7): Upon reasonable cause, the department may conduct an on-site examination of an unlicensed person to determine whether a violation of this chapter has occurred.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-604 Criminal and civil penalties. 
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-604(1): A person who knowingly violates this chapter or files materially false information with a registration application or renewal under this chapter is:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-604(1)(a): guilty of a class B misdemeanor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-604(1)(b): subject to revocation of the person's registration under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-604(2): Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; (2) Subject to
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-604(2)(a): suspend, revoke, or refuse to renew the person's registration under this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-604(2)(b): issue a cease and desist order from committing any further violation;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-604(2)(c): prohibit the person from continuing to engage in the business of being a continuing care provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-604(2)(d): impose an administrative fine not greater than $1,000 per violation, except that the aggregate total of fines imposed under this chapter against a person in a calendar year may not exceed $30,000 for that calendar year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-604(2)(e): (2) take any combination of actions listed under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-604(3): If the department revokes a registration, the department is not required to refund any portion of the provider's filing or renewal fee for the remainder of the period for which the fee is paid.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605 Civil liability. 
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(1): A provider who enters into a continuing care contract with an individual without complying with the disclosure statement requirement described in this chapter, or who makes a continuing care contract with an individual who relies on a disclosure statement that misstates or omits a material fact, is liable to the individual for:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(1)(a): actual damages;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(1)(b): repayment of all fees the individual paid to the provider, minus the reasonable value of care and lodging provided to the individual before the violation, misstatement, or omission was discovered or reasonably should have been discovered;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(1)(c): interest at the legal rate for judgments;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(1)(d): court costs; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(1)(e): reasonable attorney fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(2): A provider is liable under this section unless the provider proves by a preponderance of evidence that the provider and the provider's agents and employees did not know and should not have known of the misstatement or omission.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(3): (3)(a) An individual may not maintain an action under this section if:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(3)(a): the individual receives a written offer from the provider for refund of all amounts paid to the provider or the provider's facility plus reasonable interest from the date of payment, minus the reasonable value of care and lodging provided before the receipt of the offer;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(3)(b): (3)(a) the individual receives the offer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(3)(b)(i): the day on which the individual submits a written request to the provider for repayment under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(3)(b)(ii): the day on which the individual files an action under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(3)(c): the offer includes a description of the provisions of this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(3)(d): the recipient of the offer fails to accept the offer within 30 days after the date the offer is received.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(4): An individual shall bring an action under this section before the day three years after:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(4)(a): the day on which the individual enters into the continuing care contract; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(4)(b): the individual discovers, or reasonably should have discovered, the provider's violation, misstatement, or omission.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(5): A person does not have a cause of action under this chapter except as expressly provided by this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(6): This chapter does not limit the liability that exists under any other statute or common law.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-44-605(7): The provisions of this chapter are not exclusive and the remedies provided by this chapter are in addition to any other remedies provided by any other law.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 45 - Managed Care Organizations
*************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as "Managed Care Organizations."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-102(1): "Covered benefit" or "benefit" means the health care services to which a covered person is entitled under the terms of a health care insurance plan offered by a managed care organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-102(2): 31A-1-301; 31A-1-301 "Managed care organization" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-102(2)(a): 31A-1-301 a managed care organization as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-102(2)(b): 31A-1-301 a third party administrator as that term is defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-103 Managed care contract standards.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
The commissioner shall adopt rules relating to standards for the manner and content of policy provisions, and disclosures to be made in connection with the sale of policies covered by this chapter, dealing with at least the following matters:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-103(1): terms of renewability;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-103(2): initial and subsequent conditions of eligibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-103(3): nonduplication of coverage provisions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-103(4): coverage of dependents;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-103(5): termination of insurance;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-103(6): limitations;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-103(7): exceptions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-103(8): reductions;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-103(9): definition of terms; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-103(10): rating practices.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-201 Applicability to other provisions of law -- Commissioner discretion.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-201(1): Except for exemptions specifically granted under this title, a managed care organization is subject to regulation under all of the provisions of this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-201(2): The commissioner may by rule waive other specific provisions of this title that the commissioner considers inapplicable to managed care organizations, upon a finding that the waiver will not endanger the interests of:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-201(2)(a): enrollees;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-201(2)(b): investors;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-201(2)(c): the public; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-201(2)(d): health care providers.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-45-304 Objective criteria for adding or terminating network providers -- Termination of contracts -- Review process.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 31A - Chapter 46 - Pharmacy Benefits Act
********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as "Pharmacy Benefits Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(1): "340B drug" means a drug purchased through the 340B drug discount program by a 340B entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(2): "340B drug discount program" means the 340B drug discount program described in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 256b.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(3): "340B entity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(3)(a): an entity participating in the 340B drug discount program;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(3)(b): a pharmacy of an entity participating in the 340B drug discount program; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(3)(c): a pharmacy contracting with an entity participating in the 340B drug discount program to dispense drugs purchased through the 340B drug discount program.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(4): "Administrative fee" means any payment, other than a rebate, that a pharmaceutical manufacturer makes directly or indirectly to a pharmacy benefit manager.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(5): "Allowable claim amount" means the amount paid by an insurer under the customer's health benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(6): "Contracting insurer" means an insurer with whom a pharmacy benefit manager contracts to provide a pharmacy benefit management service.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(7): "Cost share" means the amount paid by an insured customer under the customer's health benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(8): 58-17b-102 "Device" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(9): "Direct or indirect remuneration" means any adjustment in the total compensation:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(9)(a): received by a pharmacy from a pharmacy benefit manager for the sale of a drug, device, or other product or service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(9)(b): that is determined after the sale of the product or service.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(10): 58-17b-102 "Dispense" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(11): 58-17b-102 "Drug" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(12): 31A-22-636 "Insurer" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(13): "Maximum allowable cost" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(13)(a): a maximum reimbursement amount for a group of pharmaceutically and therapeutically equivalent drugs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(13)(b): any similar reimbursement amount that is used by a pharmacy benefit manager to reimburse pharmacies for multiple source drugs.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(14): 26B-3-101 "Medicaid program" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(15): "Obsolete" means a product that may be listed in national drug pricing compendia but is no longer available to be dispensed based on the expiration date of the last lot manufactured.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(16): 58-17b-102 "Patient counseling" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(17): 58-17b-102 "Pharmaceutical facility" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(18): "Pharmaceutical manufacturer" means a pharmaceutical facility that manufactures prescription drugs.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(19): 58-17b-102 "Pharmacist" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(20): 58-17b-102 "Pharmacy" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(21): (21)(a); (21)(b)(i); (xii) "Pharmacy benefits management service" means any of the following services provided to a health benefit plan, or to a participant of a health benefit plan:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(22): "Pharmacy benefit manager" means a person licensed under this chapter to provide a pharmacy benefits management service.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(23): "Pharmacy service" means a product, good, or service provided to an individual by a pharmacy or pharmacist.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(24): "Pharmacy services administration organization" means an entity that contracts with a pharmacy to assist with third-party payer interactions and administrative services related to third-party payer interactions, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(24)(a): contracting with a pharmacy benefit manager on behalf of the pharmacy; and

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(28): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(28)(a): "Rebate" means a refund, discount, or other price concession that is paid by a pharmaceutical manufacturer to a pharmacy benefit manager based on a prescription drug's utilization or effectiveness.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(28)(b): "Rebate" does not include an administrative fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(29): 
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(29)(a): "Reimbursement report" means a report on the adjustment in total compensation for a claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(29)(b): "Reimbursement report" does not include a report on adjustments made pursuant to a pharmacy audit or reprocessing.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(30): 58-17b-102 "Retail pharmacy" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(31): "Sale" means a prescription drug or prescription device claim covered by a health benefit plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-102(32): "Wholesale acquisition cost" means the same as that term is defined in 42 U.S.C. Sec. 1395w-3a.


Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-201 License required.
--------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-201(1): A person may not perform, offer to perform, or advertise any pharmacy benefits management service in the state unless the person is licensed as a pharmacy benefit manager under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-201(2): A person may not utilize the services of another person as a pharmacy benefit manager if the person knows or has reason to know that the other person does not have a license under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-302(2)(b)(iii): within 120 days after the day on which the pharmacy benefit manager receives a report of a sale of a product or service by the pharmacy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-302(3): (3)(a) A pharmacy service entity shall, upon a pharmacy's request, provide the pharmacy with:

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-302(4)(a)(iii): alternative methods of paying for the prescription medication or prescription device, including paying the cash price, that are less expensive than the cost share of the prescription drug.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-304 Claims practices.
--------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-304(2)(c): the pharmacy service was not rendered by the pharmacy or pharmacist.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-305 Pharmacy reimbursement.
--------------------------------------------------------
A pharmacy benefit manager shall reimburse a network pharmacy, in the aggregate, in an amount no less than the amount that the pharmacy benefit manager reimburses an affiliate of the pharmacy benefit manager in the same network, in the aggregate, for providing the same or equivalent pharmacy service.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-306 Mailing or delivering prescription drugs.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-306(1): (1)(a) prohibit an in-network retail pharmacy from:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-306(1)(a): mailing or delivering a prescription drug to an enrollee as an ancillary service of the in-network retail pharmacy;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-306(1)(b): charging a shipping or handling fee to an enrollee who requests that the in-network retail pharmacy mail or deliver a prescription drug to the enrollee, as an ancillary service; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-306(1)(c): (1)(a) offering or soliciting the ancillary services described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-306(2): charge an enrollee who uses an in-network retail pharmacy that offers to mail or deliver a prescription drug to an enrollee as an ancillary service a fee or copayment that is higher than the fee or copayment the enrollee would pay if the enrollee used an in-network retail pharmacy that does not offer to mail or deliver a prescription drug to an enrollee as an ancillary service.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309 Reimbursement -- Prohibitions.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(1): This section applies to a contract entered into or renewed on or after January 1, 2021, between a pharmacy benefit manager and a pharmacy.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(2): A pharmacy benefit manager may not vary the amount it reimburses a pharmacy for a drug on the basis of whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(2)(a): the drug is a 340B drug; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(2)(b): the pharmacy is a 340B entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(3): (2) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(4): A pharmacy benefit manager may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(4)(a): on the basis that a 340B entity participates, directly or indirectly, in the 340B drug discount program:
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(4)(a)(i): assess a fee, charge-back, or other adjustment on the 340B entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(4)(a)(ii): restrict access to the pharmacy benefit manager's pharmacy network;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(4)(a)(iii): require the 340B entity to enter into a contract with a specific pharmacy to participate in the pharmacy benefit manager's pharmacy network;
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(4)(a)(iv): create a restriction or an additional charge on a patient who chooses to receive drugs from a 340B entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(4)(a)(v): create any additional requirements or restrictions on the 340B entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-309(4)(b): require a claim for a drug to include a modifier to indicate that the drug is a 340B drug unless the claim is for payment, directly or indirectly, by the Medicaid program.

Utah Code Annotated § 31A-46-402 Severability.
----------------------------------------------
If any provision of this chapter or the application of any provision of this chapter is found invalid, the remainder of this chapter shall be given effect without the invalid provision or application.
